Summary: I previously stayed at this property a few years ago before covid, when it was a IHG brand hotel. I really enjoyed my previous stay but the hotel is not as good as it used to be.   To start with, the booking process through the Sonesta website was not easy and a little frustrating. The cheapest rates shown as available would not let me book. I had to book a more expensive rate. I proceeded with the booking as I remember the hotel and liked location and the 2 bedroom suites. I did contact customer services about this issue, they were unwilling to help.  The first impression at the hotel was very good, little had changed since my last visit, essentially the same as the old IHG hotel with the odd Sonesta logo. The lady on reception was very friendly and accommodating, as were all

Awesome stay! Very clean. Rooms are comfortable, no noise can be heard through the walls, safe area, staff is very courteous. Will definitely choose and stay here again  on any future Disney stays. Pet friendly.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback regarding your experience with Sonesta Anaheim Resort Area. We are pleased to hear you enjoyed your stay and look forward to welcoming you back.

Summary: We've just stayed a week at this hotel, and thoroughly enjoyed every aspect of our stay! A highlight of our trip was Salvador, at the front desk. He went out of his way to be friendly and helpful, engaging my kids and taking time to make us all feel welcome and valued. After our first interaction, my children said we need to come back here because "that guy is so nice!". Our last night, they even went down specifically to say goodbye to him!   Aside from that- our room was spacious, clean, comfortable. The location was extremely convenient for Disney- the ART bus stop is just outside the doors and runs right to and from the park. Breakfast is included, and was a great variety each day. We never started our day hungry! The pool is heated and clean, and all the other staff was
Room tip: Check out the ART bus system for easy Disney travel! Front desk super accommodating for any...

Summary: After paying $700 for 2 nights, she charged us an additional $150 refundable deposit.  We were hardly in the room, left it very clean and never recieved the refund.  When I called, he said he would look into it and let me know- I never heard anything back.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us.    The hotel releases the deposit upon check out.  Once we release the hold, it will drop off, generally within 5-10 business days. You will not see a credit reversal, as the amount just drops off and returns to your account.

Summary: Thank you for leading such a great team and for your hospitality while staying with you all !! My father and I loved it!! We even extended an additional 3 weeks !! Would highly recommend this place!! wanted to also shout out to  Jasmine , and Salavador the night auditor  . And  behalf of my dad he wanted to say thank you to HK department they were great service !   Veronica Gee.
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind words about Roger.   We are happy to have him on our team and I will be sure to pass on your kind words.

Summary: We stayed here for a six night stay Oct 2022. We rented a car and were pleasantly surprised that they didn’t charge us the $25/night fee for parking! We were able to get parking each day/night no issues.  The rooms are older but they’ve done some upgrading to them, they were clean and nicely presented.  The bed and pillows were comfortable! They gave us one room cleaning during our stay, we requested when we wanted it. Otherwise just ask for towels when you need more.  The kitchen in the room is great, we ate out most of this trip, but the kitchen has a full fridge, hot plates, microwave, sink and dishwasher.  The breakfast is super basic and not great quality (scrambled eggs, sausages, hasbrowns, yogurt and canned fruit, oatmeal and toast/bagels, some cereals, juice and coffee
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and for taking time to provide feedback of your stay.  We are pleased to hear you enjoyed your stay and hope to see you again soon.

Summary: We just spent 8 days in a 2 bedroom suite and the room set-up was perfect for our family. We had a bedroom with 2 queen beds and a bathroom, plus a bedroom with a king bed and bathroom. There was a small kitchen (with dishwasher!) and a little living room. The room was clean, the beds comfortable, and we had plenty of space. The rooms aren’t brand new and show their age a bit, but this was fine by us. The Anaheim Rapid Transit bus to Disneyland picks up just across the parking lot. If you want to walk, it takes about 25 minutes. The continental breakfast was the same every day, but it was ok. As others have mentioned, there isn’t daily housekeeping, which they don’t tell you when you check in (but we knew from other reviews). We needed to change out a few linens and that just
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us. We are pleased to hear you enjoyed your stay We hope to welcome you back the next time you visit the Anaheim area.

Summary Heading: Take a pass on this one.
Summary: Firstly I'll say that the staff were very friendly and accommodating! 4 stars for sure. A decent breakfast buffet and nice pool area.   The room - a studio 'suite', on the other hand was really neglected. Tired and old, from the 80s - even a VCR! The issues we noticed:  - Kitchenette - didn't have enough cutlery for 2  people; no cloths to wipe or clean/dry dishes, no dish soap, only dishwasher soap. We were given hand towels for the kitchen. Coffee packs weren't made for the coffee maker, so coffee was weak at best.   - On second night, found a vape unit lodged between the mattress and the headboard which made me question whether the bedding had been changed prior to us arriving. Not sure how you'd not notice this if the bedding was changed! Told front desk staff.   - Bathroom
Room tip: Read the reviews - the rooms are not how they are represented.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and for providing feedback on your stay.  I apologize for the lack of attention given to your room and will review this with my Housekeeping Manager and her team, to ensure this does not occur in the future.  We hope to have another opportunity to earn back your trust.

Summary: I stayed here with family for three days and I thoroughly enjoyed my stay. We had a two room suite and a sofa sleeper. All of the rooms had a TV. The kitchenette was adjacent to the sofa bed area. The hotel was in sort of a secluded area and was quiet. The breakfast had eggs/sausage, cereal, fresh fruit and  drinks (orange juice, milk etc. The bathrooms had plenty of towels and tissue. There is a restaurant next door called the Burger Place that I wanted to check out but didn't have time because they didn't open until 5pm. Needed a late checkout and was pleasantly surprised by Sue at the front desk who made it possible. Thank you for a wonderful stay.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and for letting us know how much you enjoyed your stay. We hope to see you again soon.

Summary Heading: Sonesta plus Disney equals great time!!!
Summary: Great place for value!! I booked a few room here and next door at the Sonesta. I was glad to see that the rooms were clean and up to standards. While the hotel doesn’t do daily cleaning, it is expected as this is a extended stay hotel and my families stay wasn’t long enough to warrant daily cleaning. However, they do offer you extra linen so that you are comfortable.
Room tip: This is an extended stay hotel so rooms are larger. However, some amenities you see in typical...
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us.  We hope to see you again soon.

Summary Heading: Not a deluxe hotel no cleaning service
Summary: Booked a room for a family Disneyland vacation August 2022. At check in I was surprised when I was told there would be no cleaning service during our stay even if we ask. Their reason was 'for our safety and their staff safety.' In my opinion the owners have found a way to increase profit margin by minimizing the number of cleaning staff they hire yet continue to charge rates equivalent to a deluxe hotel. You can do better at a budget hotel or go to a deluxe for the same price and get cleaning service

Summary Heading: Would stay again. Wish they would clean more.
Summary: This hotel would have gotten a 5 if it was cleaner. I would stay again due to the amazing pool area, the quite room, the overall sleep quality, and the staff. The room was very dirty with balled up hair on the floor, smudges, and garbage overflowing by our 5th night because they don’t do turn down until 7 nights. However, the pool is huge, tons of space to sit. The staff are fabulous. The sleep quality is 5 star.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and for providing feedback on your stay.  I apologize for the lack of attention given to your room and will review this with my Housekeeping Manager and her team, to ensure this does not occur in the future.  We hope to have another opportunity to earn back your trust.

Summary Heading: Quiet Room. Very filthy. Nothing to use in kitchenette.
Summary: I’ll start with the positives. The staff at the front upon check in were lovely.  Love having a suite.  Pool and hot tub were good.  Rooms were quiet.  Beds were pretty comfortable.  Close to Disney.   Now for the negatives.  This hotel is absolutely filthy. I should have expected it when we were told they would only lightly clean rooms with stays 7 days or less.  I never saw cleaning staff except maybe once and I know they did not come into my room. The floors had disgusting hair balls everywhere. There were old fries and chips under our bedroom table. There were random water bottles shoved between the beds. The touch surfaces had brown finger prints. The bedding was stained. There were bags of garbage from what I’m assuming were cleaning staff left in hallways for days. Just

Summary Heading: Great location but something was missing..
Summary: This Sonesta is located near Disneyland and Angels stadium. The staff seemed friendly but confused. It took me three tries to geta chair in my room. Arking was Ok but it was confusing as well. Our room was clean enough but not very comfortable, especially the chair. The bed was just OK and not a lot of water pressure in the bathroom. No free breakfast and the price was pretty high even for the great location. Compare other hotels before setting on this Sonesta.

The hotel is disgustingly filthy.  The room was not clean and there was pubic hair all over the bathroom floor at check-in.  A dank and rotting stench in the hallways.  Cockroaches where breakfast foods are stored and prepared.  Trash in bags in the hallways.  The laundry room was filthy with trash overflowing and on the floor.  The freeway noise is so loud the room that I literally checked whether the windows were left open (they were closed).

Family and I stayed  for six nights. I knew it was the wrong place for us at check-in. The front desk clerk told us “no partying, as we like to keep the environment comfortable for all guests.” I was visiting with my wife and two children.    A positive is that the hotel is close to Disney, and a walk away from near by restaurants. I love the kitchenette. Room was pretty clean upon entrance besides the sofa. The sofa is more likely a couple years old, and I’m positive that it’s never been cleaned, the smell confirmed my belief.    Negatives are that guests must request EVERYTHING, and I do mean EVERYTHING. Coffee pot in room had no lid. Had to request a lid. Need clean towels, soap, shampoo/ conditioner refills, toiletries, etc. Guests have to call the front desk to request.

I chose es suits because it got really great reviews for family stays and cleanliness. The staff at the hotel was great but overall very disappointed with the up keep throughout the day of this place. When we checked in the place was messy children’s greasy hand prints on everything that could be touched they still go by “COVID” guidelines but that’s bs because this place was gross! I got a suit on the 7th floor. Soon as you exit the elevators the whole floor smelled like weed! The floors had food or crumbs just everywhere!!This is supposed to be a non smoking hotel so I don’t know why this was just not taken seriously I even mentioned it to the front desk and they said all they could do was leave no smoking letters to the  rooms but that was never done. I stayed for two nights.

We stayed 2 nights here during our recent trip to Disneyland.  Upon checking in we were greeted so nicely by Jimmy. Customer service was A+ Jimmy was very welcoming and gave detailed and thorough information regarding our stay. Once we arrived to our room it kinda went downhill from there, it was so noisy and sounded like we were at the races. We were facing the 5 freeway and it was 24/7 super loud cars racing by. I noticed another really loud humming noise coming from the bathroom. When I brought it to Jimmy's attention he knew what it was right away and had someone come up to remedy the situation. Apparently there is a huge fan that everyone that works there is aware of and runs continuously from the ground floor all the way to the roof and all the rooms ending in 15 get the

Unfortunately I wanted to enjoy my stay.. it is a nice property, but it is poorly run. First off I NEVER found one hand sanitizer that was filled. The elevator, the main floor, the bathroom.. not anywhere. The pool area had signs to wipe down and clean tables and chairs before you sit. There were NO cleaning supplies at all. The pool bathroom had feces everywhere, no soap.. a mess. When I called over at 2 pm to clean it, they were not cleaned until the night shift after 11 pm. There were no pool towels available. You would go inside to get a towel and they would send you outside and then repeat to get your towels inside again. Even after the pool bathrooms were cleaned, no one came out to wipe down tables or chairs. They were still disgusting the next day. It was really not
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay at the Sonesta ES Anaheim Resort Area and providing your honest feedback on the Guest Satisfaction Survey.  As we pride ourselves on delivering a memorable hotel experience during your travels, we have unfortunately fallen short of our goal during your recent stay. Please accept our sincere apology for your overall dissatisfaction with the hotel.  Our leadership team is fully committed to improving the overall experience, so our guests are not inconvenienced on future stays.   We have shared your feedback with the appropriate hotel team leaders to ensure these are isolated issues that are corrected moving forward.

Summary Heading: Well-kept, homey, friendly, comfortable--the whole package!
Summary: I came to this area several months ago to start a new job, and chose this property to be my base until I got established and moved to a more permanent home. It has been absolutely wonderful for that purpose, but would also be appropriate for short stays. I'm in a one-bedroom unit, and it's plenty of room for living, cooking, relaxing, and remote work. The kitchen has a two-burner cooktop, full-size fridge, full-size dishwasher, and full-size microwave. The quartz-topped kitchen table/island provides ample space for meal prep and for multiple people to sit and eat. The beds and couch are very comfy. The high-speed wifi has been a reliable workhorse for work, streaming and gaming.  As for the staff, they couldn't be more welcoming! I've been treated like family since I got here,
Manager Response: Dear Kathy,   On behalf of the entire hotel team, we want to thank you for sharing your most memorable experiences with us during your recent stay at the Sonesta ES Anaheim Resort Area.  It is always encouraging to hear positive feedback from our valued guests!   Please note your feedback has been shared with the hotel team as a critical way of understanding how we can continue to deliver great experiences.   Sincerely,  Roger Trujillo Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: Excellent Hotel!!Travel Nurses waiting for rooms it’s so nice!!
Summary: I am a first time travel RN from Florida. I was staying at another (Famous) hotel, and it was twice the cost with no microwave or refrigerator.  This plus Amazing!! The front desk is always helpful, Ms. Pam is my favorite, not only does she take care of the room & fees & booking, she actually cares how my day was, knows my family is in Florida & it’s just comforting to know she’s there when I pass through.  The room is awesome! Full kitchen, dishwasher, stove, microwave, refrigerator!! (No stove, but I won’t use it much anyway). Nice big comfy bed. Very nice bathroom and sink area. A desk to do my work at from the room.  There are computers to use downstairs. Free hot breakfast in the mornings. A gym! A nice laundry room! Oh, and a huge Mickey Mouse shaped HEATED swimming pool.
Manager Response: On behalf of the entire hotel team, we want to thank you for sharing your most memorable experiences with us during your recent stay at the Sonesta ES Anaheim Resort Area.  It is always encouraging to hear positive feedback from our valued guests!   Please note your feedback has been shared with the hotel team as a critical way of understanding how we can continue to deliver great experiences.   Again, thank you for choosing Sonesta ES, and if I can be of assistance to you, please contact me directly at 714-748-7700 or roger.trujillo@sonesta.com.   Sincerely,   Roger Trujillo

Summary: I have been a guest at this hotel since July, it is now September, & I was going to extend my stay until December, now I am rethinking that. Every weekend since I have been here & all through the pandemic, there have been parties. I have had to walk through clouds of weed smoke to get to my room. Tonight, I’m sitting outside, by myself, having a glass of wine after working an exhausting 12 hour shift & security walks up to me and tells me I cannot be there. I cannot sit outside, after working a 12 hour shift & unwind. I went inside to talk to Jula at the desk & she says “I told him that we are encouraging guests to not be outside.” WHAT??? After months of parties every damned weekend you want to single me out and not the other two people that are outside?  Just last weekend the
Manager Response: Hello Waslerl,   Thank you for your recent stay and for sharing your feedback. Although we have limited service hospitality, we strive to be your dependable choice for your extended stays. It is a disappointing setback that we missed the mark in ensuring the level of satisfaction and convenience every guest should expect from an IHG hotel.   We take feedback seriously and would like to gather more details to communicate this with the relevant teams. I sent you a separate email and hope you respond soon.  As we enhance our services, I do hope to have the opportunity to welcome you back and ensure that next time around your stay with us is memorable for all the right reasons.  Warm Regards,  Alice P     Case Manager     IHGService

Summary: A really nice family-friendly hotel. The front desk staff were always friendly and happy to help. The two bedroom suite was very roomy, clean and a comfortable base for our time at Disney. Having a kitchen with microwave, dishwasher and full sized fridge was handy. The laundry had three washers and dryers, and the gym looked good although we never used it. The location was good, a quick uber ride to anywhere we wanted to go although it’s right next to the freeway so expect some traffic noises but otherwise it was really quiet in our room. We didn’t use the breakfast or evening reception, but they looked nice enough. We’d definitely stay here again.

This was a very nice hotel.  Very family friendly. Front desk staff always greeted us whether we were walking in or leaving.   “Pam” front desk person you are the best, thank you for being so helpful with all our many questions.   Rooms were clean, we spent 4 days at this hotel and always came back from the park with a tidy room.  Breakfast consisted of eggs (scrambled or boiled) bacon or sausage, breads of many kinds, cereal, pancakes, waffles, yogurt and fruit.  Juice, tea or coffee.  All very good with a roomy dinning area with plenty of seating.   Thanks Staybridge for a very nice stay.

This was our first time at the Staybridge Suites. Our room was very quiet (5th floor) and large. We had a 1 bedroom, 1 bath with a small kitchen and living room. The staff was always friendly asking if we were enjoying ourselves and if there was anything they could do for us. The entire resort outside and in was always clean and well kept. Great stay for my wife and our adult daughter and her family in the adjacent room.

Summary Heading: Large suites, good value for the money
Summary: I booked a two-bedroom suite with some friends. The rooms were spacious and could definitely accommodate eight people. Living room furnishings seemed a bit worn but they were decent.  Parking is $12 per day, which is the price for the entire reservation, and there is a limit of two vehicles per reservation. This frustrated us because many of us came in our own cars and we originally thought it was $12 per vehicle with no limit on the number of cars. I ask the management to please clarify the parking policies on the hotel's website.  The kitchen had most of what you would expect in a home kitchen: stove, microwave, toaster, refrigerator, cookware, tableware, soap, and dishwasher (we hand-washed all our dishes though). However, the counter space was a bit tight and the electric

Nice hotel with kitchen in each room.  Parking is only $12/nite, which is way more reasonable than closer to Disneyland.  Little ways to walk, but worth the $$.  Friendly, helpful staff! Good breakfast, compared to some, but could be better.  Eggs are from a container, so after a few days kinda get sick of them.

We have just began our stay at this hotel but it is already off to a great start thanks to Mario! It’s nice to see a smiling face after you’ve been traveling for hours. Mario was very informative and helpful. And we very much enjoyed the social hour. Vacation is off to a very nice start.

My 12 days stay at Staybridge Suites Anaheim was such a beautiful one. The suite was spacious with all the amenities i needed. The staff  at the front office were super super super friendly and helpful. it was always a joy to see the cheerful lady by the reception! They made you feel very welcome and made the place feel so much like home.  Keep up the excellent service Staybridge! Yours is a place I will visit again and again  Best

Arrangement: Family of 7 that included 1 bedroom apartment for Mum and Dad and 12 year old, Studio each for 2 eldest children and their partners. 3 Rooms total. Pros:  Pool area: incl a disability crane to assist people in and out, considering I was wheelchair bound due to accident just before trip, this was a great addition to have Building: Clean, I couldnt fault anything. Service: Reception staff were always helpful and friendly, we were there 2 weeks, so got good service from all who were on reception. Arrived after midnight and had a good helpful sign in. Other things: Was good to be able to use the dining room for all of us to eat together with food we may have cooked on BBQ or take-in, very helpful when there are 7 of you Free breakfast was good, but 2nd week got tierd of

Rooms were updated and comfy as well as pool area nice and breakfast had lots of great choices Location was close to our attractions and it was also nice to have the kitchenettes. Only downside is we had 4 rooms and all weren't ready right away and we were in a hurry to get kids in and showered after beach. We made it work though and all was good.

Summary Heading: Great hotel, 18 years later and still as good as when we opened it in 2001!
Summary: I have been at this hotel along with the adjacent Holiday Inn for a long time and highly recommend a stay for any family or solo business traveler, you see I spent 14 months designing and constructing these two hotels 19 years ago back in 2000-2001 and matter-of-fact we had a key turn-over of the Staybridge Suites hotel on Sept. 11, 2001, yes everyone knows exactly where they were that day and my mind instantly takes me back to the front of the hotel walking with the hotel ownership who just flew in from Atlanta and well the rest is history.  Just a shout out to the 260 construction workers who were with us, side by side, when we built these 2 hotels. I was on-site for 14 months and can attest to the hard work and timeless hours that went into the design, layout, safety and

My fiance and I gifted my 17 and 19-year-old sons tickets for the E3 Conference in Los Angeles.  Because they are not experienced travelers we made it a family vacation and brought my 14-year-old daughter and 13-year-old niece.  The hotel was the perfect setup - providing everyone with the perfect amount of space.  The room was very clean, the beds were comfortable and the breakfast was convenient with a nice selection of items to choose from.  The pool and spa areas were great for relaxing.  And the kids enjoyed playing foosball.  The hotel staff was extremely courteous and pleasant.  There was also an area for smokers.  The grounds were well-kept which provided a nice backdrop for several lovely vacation photos.   I would definitely recommend this hotel for a large family or

Summary Heading: Great place to stay to visit Disney
Summary: The rooms are like condo's with a separate living room and kitchen. The breakfast buffet was huge and amazing! The hotel offers a shuttle to and from Disney every half hour of only 6 dollars for use all day and it only takes 10 min to get back and forth. I didn't get her name , but the girl that checked my in at 11pm and worked at night is fabulous at her job! She is great! So friendly and helpful. The pool and hot tub is great.

The kids and I stayed at this hotel for a week. The hotel was well kept, updated and clean. Good breakfast every morning and loved having a kitchen in the room. Nice pool and hot tub. The shuttle picks up in the parking lot for Disney.

We stayed here for 5 nights in early Sept. As the other reviews mentioned,  the staff are very friendly and helpful.  The kids enjoyed the waffle and pancake makers for breakfast and the breakfast itself for the adults was fine. This is 3 star accommodation and as such met our expectations. The BART shuttle to Disneyland leaves from the Holiday Inn next door every half hour. The pool is shared with the Holiday Inn and is great.  Would definitely stay again and happy to recommend.

Summary Heading: Extremely Disappointed--Left for Another Hotel after One Night
Summary: I wish I could give zero stars for this review. I had booked 7 nights at the Staybridge Suites in the Anahaim Resort Area, so we could have a 2-bedroom, 2-bathroom suite for a family of 4. However, the quality and cleanliness of the room were so poor, we checked out after the first night and moved to a Hampton Inn & Suites hotel. While the front desk staff was friendly, the room was in terrible condition with smashed/melted candy in the carpet, food spilled on the walls, wet carpet outside one of the bathrooms, stained carpet, dilapidated furniture, etc. Even my teenagers were grossed out by the room. The hide-a-bed was really terrible with large stains on the mattress. That mattress was so uncomfortable--it was all metal springs--that it was unusable.  The hotel we moved to was
Manager Response: Hi HLC237,  We appreciate the candid feedback you gave for your stay at the Staybridge Suites Anaheim-resort Area.   We want you to enjoy the best of home and hotel. I’m sorry that we didn’t strike the balance this time because of the uncleanliness of your suite and the noise from the hallways. I sent you a private message to discuss this further and alerted our hotel.  On the other hand,  thank you for the high ratings under the service bucket.   I hope this matter will not deter you from keeping us as your dependable choice for your future travels. We promise to keep the balance of your home to make the value of your experience worth for all the right reasons.  Sincerely,   Jeraldine R. Case Manager IHGService

Summary: We found the hotel clean, and comfortable. The staff friendly. The hotel is slightly away from the main resort area but this probably makes it better in some ways. We weren't disturbed by any external noise. The pool area was well kept and clean. Breakfast was plentiful, standard American style with a good selection of drinks. The occasional afternoon food was also very welcome when we were in. The afternoon food was of a theme and included beer and wine what more could you ask for!  The ART bus is handy for Disneyland, with a service every half hour. The bus picks up outside of the Holiday Inn just next door, and took 15 minutes to get to Disney. A day pass worked out a lot cheaper than parking at Disney.

just one night here. large room with a near full kitchen. room was clean, would stay again. a 15 min walk to the disney shuttle, so its fairly easy to get in the park. did hear a dog barking so it must be pet friendly.

First time staying at this hotel, experience was great, easy to access from LAX airport and to/from Disneyland by the ART system, bus stop is few steps from hotel door,  rooms were very confortable and perfect for 2 adults and 3 children, pool area was very nice and breakfast was really good.  A very special thanks to Pam and Mario, they were very supportive with questions and special request, they made a big difference in our wonderful experience. Kids wanted to live there forever!

I visited as my boyfriend was attending the AACC at the conference centre. As a part of a trip around California I had low expectations of Anaheim but this hotel exceeded everything! I expected a crowded pool due to Disney and many families staying but it was hardly busy and I spend most days around the pool. Staff were ALL so friendly and helpful. An excellent unexpected mid week happy hour from 5.30-7.30 was fantastic. The two bedroom suite was brilliant - spacious, modern and super clean. Everything I needed and more, after a small Airbnb the previous few days I loved the space! Front desk were so helpful as I spent majority of time on my own as my boyfriend worked and they helped with shopping and Disneyland plans (for anyone considering going to Disneyland on your own... do

Lovely clean spacious room with kitchenette. The staff were very helpful. The hotel includes a very good free breakfast and is located very close to Disney. I would highly recommend as a base for visiting Disney.

Summary Heading: Two Bedroom Suites with Two Bathrooms!
Summary: This hotel is perfect for larger families or a group of up to eight people. The two bedroom suite has a king in one bedroom and two double/queen beds in the other bedroom. Each bedroom has a bathroom. I think the living room sofa is a sleeper. There was a kitchenette with a microwave, two burner stove top, regular size fridge, and basic cooking supplies. Very convenient for perishable snacks or late night food, if you spent all day/night at the Disneyland. The two bedroom suites are like apartments. Each bedroom also has drawers and small closets.  The bed is firm. The toiletries are J.R. Watkins.   There is an ART shuttle that runs from the hotels (neighbor hotel is Holiday Inn Express) to Disneyland. I think it was $6pp per day. It picks up/drops off in front of Holiday Inn

My main complaint: one working elevator during our 3 day stay. This is a busy hotel and it should have been a priority. Sleep was fine. Location about a mile walk from Disney. Breakfast was excellent!

After booking a room through Hotwire that was guaranteed to sleep 4 people, we were given a room with 1 queen bed and a foldout couch that was a tiny bit larger than a twin-sized fold out couch. When I approached the front desk about the matter, I was “informed” by the lady that our room slept 4 “comfortably” and that I should feel lucky that we had been “upgraded” at check in the night before. The “upgrade” she was referring to was from a room with no bathtub to a room with a bathtub after I told them our special needs son could only take baths. I politely asked for a rollaway bed which they provided. Look on their website and you will not find a single room for “4” guests; only 3 guests, 5 guests and above. Please don’t lie to your guests. We are smarter than you think. A room
Manager Response: Hello there, Casey D.!  We appreciate you choosing Staybridge Suites and taking the time to share your thoughts. The comforts of home is what we hope to provide, and I'm sorry that didn't happen due to the underwhelming service received from our Reception staff. I've shared your thoughts with management, and I know improvements will happen to achieve complete guest satisfaction.  I hope this incident doesn't hinder you from choosing IHG again for your future travels!  Best,  Pam G Case Manager IHGService

Summary: This place was an amazing place.  Loved everything about it.  The front staff goes over the top to help you out. The pool was perfect. The bbq outside for customer use was great. The breakfast buffet had everything you needed.  Mon - Wed night they have free appetizers and beer or wine. Rooms were great. Clean and perfect for what we needed.  Everyone needs to stay here.

The hotel itself is clean and the free breakfast was perfect. Hotel staff was wonderful and very helpful. But the beds were lousy. My back was still hurting two days later, and I don't have back problems. The shuttle picks you up out front and takes you directly to Disneyland...this was exceptional. 3 stars only because I couldn't sleep in that lumpy bed.
Manager Response: Hello Passenger79456,  Thank you for your feedback regarding your stay at StayBridge Suites Anaheim-Resort Area, CA. We want you to enjoy the best of home and hotel. I’m sorry that we didn’t strike the balance this time because of the bed firmness. We will look into this concern. I have made the hotel's management aware of your comment for review and for service improvement.  On the brighter side, I appreciate that you find our location to be convenient and for your high rating in service. I hope you give us a chance in the future to show you how great our hotel is.   Sincerely,   Orlando   Case Manager  IHGService

Summary: We are platinum members so right away we were upgraded to a 2 bedroom room!  It was amazing!  Room was clean and everything was comfortable, beds, pillows, A/C.  Beautiful pool that seemed to be shaped like Mickey Mouse ears!  The kids seemed to love it!!  The breakfast was good!  It had all the typical fare, eggs, bacon, fruit, yogurt, cereal, juices, coffee, tea, bagels etc.  They even had a free evening meal certain nights. One night they had nachos with all the fixings. They were really good and that saved us some money. They have a little area by the front desk that you can buy snacks etc. they even have Disney postcards that you can purchase cheaper than at Disneyland!  I believe you can get a free Disney shuttle from the Holiday Inn next door, like 100 yards away. Check

We booked this hotel for a family reunion at Disneyland.  We received a complimentary upgrade to a two-bedroom suite, which was a pleasant surprise, and the staff worked to get our family members' rooms as close together as possible.  The kitchenette was convenient, as well as the full size fridge and two bathrooms.  We did not use the dishes, silverware or dishwasher which were provided, but they were a nice option to have.  A nightlight built into the bathroom wall sockets would have been helpful, as it was pitch black if one didn't leave the blackout curtains open a crack (which I prefer not to do for privacy, as well as it letting in too much light in the mornings).  Our kids are gluten and dairy intolerant, so there weren't many breakfast options that they could have, but

8 of us stayed here on a recent trip to Disneyland. We really like this hotel and would come back. Great breakfast! And a surprise "snack time" in the evenings that was enough to satisfy us for dinner!  It is not close enough to walk to Disney, but the bus shuttle is great-- it only stops at one other place so it is a short ride. Last year the shuttle we had at another hotel sometimes took an hour to get to our hotel!! I would definitely recommend this hotel. Also has a nice large pool and hot tub.

From check-in to checkout the service from everyone employee encountered was amazing. The rooms where more than enough space, clean, and comfortable. Two amazing perks of this hotel though was free parking and free breakfast. The breakfast bar had eggs, sausage, potatoes, toast, pancake machines, and more. We opted to take the bus from the hotel which was $5.50/person round trip which ended up being cheaper than Uber and definitely cheaper than the parking prices at Disney. The bus was direct from the hotel straight to Disney. This hotel is highly recommended and I will be back.

The shuttle to Disneyland is nearby and convenient plus runs twice an hour.  The staff is welcoming and awesome!  Rooms are comfy and nice too.  The breakfast has a full spread buffet including a pancake making machine and we love the Monday to Wednesday reception dinner too!  The resort style pool is fun with music playing on speakers nearby.   We have stayed there lots of times and this is our top choice place to stay!

Summary Heading: Always excellent service.  Always friendly people. Always best deal around
Summary: Went here two years in a row for about a week each time. Before I go I check all hotels in the area and all prices and benefits almost daily. I always end up with this being the best deal. With FREE parking and a Hot buffet breakfast, you can choose no other. It is located right at an ART(anaheim resort transit) stop. For less than $5 a day the ART bus system takes you just about anywhere you may want to go.All the Rooms we have had have been clean and well maintained. Its also in a safe area as well as close to the freeway but quiet. I really hated leaving. Thats the toughest part.

Summary Heading: Our favorite place to stay - Jimmy is the best!
Summary: Our family loves the Staybridge!  The staff is amazing, the rooms are very nice, and there is a shuttle available that goes straight to Disneyland and other convenient locations.  We stayed there a couple of years ago, my wife returned last year, and we'll be back this summer!  Be sure to say 'hi' to Jimmy at the front desk - he is the best!

The staff was very nice, for the most part. However, after a very long drive to the hotel from my home, my room had been “upgraded for free,” which means, “we messed up your reservation, so we’re gonna cover it up by giving you a better room.” Nonetheless, it was appreciated. What was not appreciated was the fact that we had to wait 3 hours before our room was ready, and did not receive house keeping service on Monday (there is no house keeping on the weekends) after being out of my room for 12+ hours. When I arrived back to my hotel at 11pm and discovered this hadn’t been done, I called the front desk to let them know, and ask for towels, and was told not to leave the No Service Needed sign on the door. Obviously. Which I told the representative I did not do. Instead of
Manager Response: Hi Ririjanae,  Thank you for your review and for staying with us. We only want our guests to leave with wonderful memories of their stay with us and can see that we have fallen short of our goal. I am sorry for any inconvenience you experienced, particularly with housekeeping and the poor interaction with our staff. I have alerted our management about this and have sent you a private message to obtain additional information about your stay.  Again, thanks for staying with us. I look forward to your response and being of further assistance.  Sincerely,  Connie D Case Manager IHGService

Summary: We stayed here as a family of four. The choice was predominantly due to locality to  Disney and it’s seemingly family-sized rooms, which didn’t disappoint.  We found the rooms and inside communal areas a little tired. The outside of the hotel/pool looked much smarter though.   The breakfast range was amazing, though we were glad to move on else we may have gained much more holiday weight :) I agree with some of the other reviews; the polystyrene crockery and plastic cutlery was a little off-putting though. We were able to benefit from a couple of the ‘social’ evenings where you receive a complimentary supper and drinks such as wine and beer. The food offer was basic here but was a great bonus.  We purchased a bus pass to travel to and from Disney, which was very easy and

I have stayed at many hotels (over 400) over the last 30 years and found this to be the best choice in this class and area.  This hands down beats Disneyland Hotel for value and quality.  The 2 bedroom/2 bathroom suite with kitchen and living room with the space for 8 people is clean, modern and well stocked.  The bathrooms are great and I enjoyed the large well stocked showers complete with quality bath wash, shampoo and conditioner.  The hotel itself is very nice inside and has great views, a beautiful pool area and outdoor patio areas.  Inside is a large wonderful lodge area complete with fireplace and couches.  The complimentary breakfast is wonderful.  The scrambled eggs were light and fluffy.  They offered quite the assortment of complimentary beverages, breads, cereals,

stayed here for a volleyball tournament. nice staff nice location clean room at a good price. wish they would serve breakfast a little bit earlier on the weekends we werent able to take part in it since we left around 7am. overall i like this place

Stayed here drove up from Sacramento that morning let us drop our bags and go to Disneyland came back and our room was ready.  It was clean no smell and the staff was very friendly we are definitely staying here again

I have stayed at this hotel on two separate occasions. Both times I have experienced wonderful, friendly staff in all areas of the hotel. Room was clean and spacious. Will look into staying here again in the future.

We stayed in room 716 from Sunday March 10th until Wednesday March 13th for our trip to Disneyland. We had a 2 bedroom suite and loved it! The kitchen area was wonderful and having a larger fridge(rather than a mini) for my big family was a definite plus! The master bathroom only has a shower, no tub. However the second bedroom bathroom does have a tub.   There is a decent sitting chair in the master bedroom and it’s a nice option to have. The door to the master bathroom is slightly to big and gets stuck but not a big deal to us. For some reason the master bedroom tv did not have signal to a good portion of cable channels but since we were only in the room at minimum, again, not a big deal to us. We loved the breakfast options and the Mon- Wed evening social(Tuesday’s are nacho

We had a very nice time at the hotel arrived a little earlier than check in time but we're lucky got our room was ready but had to wait for their suite but put all the suitcases in our room and went out for a little walk.  The fellow at the desk was very pleasant and informed us about the shuddle bus to Disneyland The room was very clean and lots of room.they supplied a buffet breakfast in the morning and in the evening they had a appies and wine and beer which was very nice surprise the hotel staff there very helpful.will return there again.

You know it’s decent, but still everything is wrong. Rooms are cramped and quite worn out. AC is descent, sofa is very dirty and I believe the dishwasher is bought 2nd hand. If you want to go swimming, the pool and recreational areas are literally at the parking lot.  Breakfast is all industrial food in it’s all served on plastic. On 3 nights a week there is evening receptions with really sub standard foods. It you stay longer than a week I can guarantee a heart attack. We wanted something better for my birthday and decided to BBQ at the hotel. BBQs are also at the car park. The hotel provides not a lot of plates, so we asked to get som plastic. Staff strictly and repeatedly rejected to hand out plates worth cents, and we had to run to the room to get the little we got.

Recently stayed for a week in a 2 bedroom 2 bath suite here and it worked out well for us. This hotel is a basic 2.5/3 star hotel so if youre looking for luxury you aren't going to get it here. What you are going to get, or what we got, was a decent sized room that was clean and comfortable. Full size refrig, micro wave and stove top along with all the utensils plates etc that you need. Free breakfast buffet had all the basics, nothing outstanding but decent and plentiful which we enjoyed and allowed us to get going in the morning. Managers reception every Mon-Weds from 530-730 with free beer and wine and snacks was also welcomed. Snacks weren't great but enjoyed a couple cold beers after a long day so nice touch there. Bus shuttle stops at Holiday Inn next door and you can ride

Stayed 2 nights in a 2 bedroom suite with 3 adults and 2 children. The 2 bedrooms were slightly larger than average hotel rooms while the main room and kitchen area were large enough to accommodate all of us comfortably.   The beds were very comfortable and the linens were of high quality.  All of the staff were very attentive. When ever we made a request the response was immediate.  Really tried to find something negative to say about this property but just can't. Will definitely be my go to property in the Anaheim area. No need to think about it, just book it.

We have been very happy with Staybridge hotels in the past, and this one did not disappoint either. Hotel is very clean, comfortable and quiet. I love having a separate bedroom. I am a night owl and am up later than the rest of my family. So it is nice to be able to close the bedroom door and have the living room to myself. Our room was very clean, and the new beds were so comfy. Staff were very pleasant and accommodating. Breakfast had plenty of options to make everyone happy.   The hotel is close to Disneyland and has a bus that goes straight from the hotel to Disney (with only one other stop in between). The bus runs every half hour, and your ticket lets you ride back and forth for the entire day. You can purchase bus tickets and Disneyland tickets right at the hotel.   If we

Pam, Gabby, Alex, and Mario were all awesome! They made me feel like my business was important. Location is great near the 5 freeway. Clean inside and out. Felt very safe. Plenty of towels and hot water. Lighting was good ... plenty of outlets. There was no odor in room. I would definitely stay again! : -)

I normally veer away from these “suite” hotels, but the price and location were perfect, so I jumped, and was glad I did...from check in to check out, it was a pleasant experience.  All the staff, including housekeeping, seemed very upbeat and friendly.  Very quiet, The place was clean, everywhere...even the breakfast buffet area...our room was clean and spotless...quality linens, pillows...I really can’t say enough, and I’m not easily pleased...I wonder if all the Staybridges are like this one?  And just a tip here, if you’re planning on a Disneyland visit...the ART shuttle is 5.50 per person, and a pain to use especially if bus is full and you have to wait another 30 minutes - take a Lyft or Uber...WAY faster and more convenient

Summary Heading: Clean, quiet, convenient and close to Disneyland.
Summary: My family and I were at the hotel for four nights.  We had a quiet two bedroom suite, with a full kitchen.  Our daughters room had two queen beds with a pillow top mattress and options for either a firm or soft pillow for your head.  The second room had a king size bed, without the pillow top mattress, and two pillow options.  There was a pull out couch and t.v.'s in every room.  The hotel itself had a heated pool, a fitness facility and laundry room.  The fitness facility had a large piece of equipment that was broken as did the laundry room (two out of four washers down).  However, I was able to wash clothing, I just had to time it right.  The staff were extremely friendly and helpful.  They had a small market located to the right of the front desk where you could pick up pop,

We are in the midst of a 7 day trip to Disneyland for the first time. The hotel is exactly as it was pictured online, all the amenities are adequate, pool is tiny but warm. There is a 7/11 2 minutes down the road for quick groceries/snacks. Disneyland is a bit further from this hotel (20-25 minute walk) but the saving compared to the hotels on Harbor are worth it. Very happy with this choice!

Stayed here for four nights with family. We were in a triple room which had a double bed and fold out couch as well as a kitchen and fridge. The room was clean and bed was comfy. There is a shuttle to Disneyland which leaves every 30 mins and is the easiest way to get there in the mornings. The staff at the front desk were lovely and helpful.  The free breakfast each morning was similar to other hotels of this style with bacon, eggs, waffles, pastries, cereal and fruit. The most disappointing part was the huge amounts of plastic and styrofoam used for the breakfasts! Everything was disposable which is highly disappointing these days and a big juxtaposition to the signs in the bathroom that ask you to reuse your towels to help the environment. Please consider reusable plates and
Manager Response: Hi Rachel B,  While I'm glad about your nice words on our rooms and staff, I'm sorry to hear that your experience didn't go well due to the issues you had with our breakfast amenities. Our goal is to provide a trouble-free stay, and what you described certainly fell short of that. I've noted your feedback and shared this with the hotel. They will make sure that actions will be taken so similar situations won't happen again.  Thank you for being our guest and for choosing to stay us. We look forward to hosting you once more for a chance to provide you with a much better experience.  Regards,  Joel A Case Manager IHGService

Summary: Love having a kitchen, living room, and large bedroom.  Breakfasts are pretty good as well.  Very close to Disney Land, just need to purchase a bus pass.  The bus comes by about every 30 mins in the morning.

Nice hotel, great staff always friendly. Rooms were great size and the bonus is the kitchen and a FULL fridge. The hotel was about a 7min drive from Disney and the other fun stuff off that strip and the convention center.  Would stay here again. Hot breakfast in the morning. (only thing was for fresh fruits I wish they had more than just apples, add orange and banana to the mix).

We stayed at this location for 2 days while we were enjoying Disneyland. They have great customer service mario helped us with all our needs shuttle passes etc . The staff here was very nice and they would greet you and asking if you needed anything to make sure your and you enjoyed your stay. breakfast was awesome so much to choose from sometimes your eyes are bigger than your stomach. My grandkids went swimming and they enjoy the swimming pool we had two rooms and both were great I will definitely be returning to this hotel in the summertime and I will definitely recommend this hotel

This place had friendly service, was clean and had free apples and wine on Sunday, Monday and Tuesday. Enough served  to be a meal. My only complaint would be the outside area could be a bit cleaner. Pool had leaves and locked gate around pool wasn’t working properly and didn’t get fixed while we were there. Now possible that in nov. not many people use the outside area unless snowbirds. Not an issue just an observation.  Repair man there quickly when toilet plugged.

Hotel is awe full WiFi is horrible keeps fluctuating. TV channels keep going out always in the middle of a show I am watching and really into. I have asked maintenance to fix it they don’t. Housekeeping won’t clean with cats in room I have been at other hotels and they have asked for me to take dog out but catching my cat is very difficult I can’t do that every time. Breakfast has many options but we have been sick after eating it almost every time even the dog got sick after eating leftover eggs. So not eating breakfast anymore. Parking is also a problem. There are 4 washing machines and dryers both times we have stayed here more than one machine was out of order.
Manager Response: Hello Photofun88,  Thank you for taking the time to write a review of our hotel. I am sorry for the inconvenience you may have experienced due to issues with the WiFi, TV Channels and breakfast just to mention a few. I have sent you a private message in an effort to follow up on your concerns.  Rest assured that we will continuously do our best to always improve so we can accommodate you better in the future. I do hope that you will allow us to welcome you back and give us another opportunity to make it up to you.  Sincerely,  Dianne L. Case Manager IHGService

Summary: We were 3 adults in a 2 bedroom suite. Each room had a bathroom and were off of a central living room/kitchen. We had 3 tvs, but didn't turn any of them on. The room was over the pool and it was very quiet. The wifi was fast and reliable.  Check in was quick and we were in our room before check in time. The breakfast buffet was Mon-Fri 6:30-9:30 and Sat-Sun 7:30-10:30. There was lots to eat with 2 hot items plus fresh fruit, bagels, muffin, cereal and more.  The Anaheim Resort Transit picks up every 30 minutes throughout the day just outside Burger Theory restaurant located at the super close Holiday Inn. You can buy a ticket from the machine at the stop; adult 1 day=5.50, 3 day=14.00.  We enjoyed The Social which happens Mon, Tues and Wed 5:30-7:30. Wine, beer, soda and a light

Summary Heading: Incredible Value. Wonderful staff. Clean, large, comfortable rooms.
Summary: From the moment we walked in, we were treated amazingly well.   Front Desk: Deserves a medal for positive and can-do attitude. I felt like I was already at Disneyland because fellow at the front desk was so welcoming. Explained all of the amenities, how to use, where located, any important times. We didn't understand how the ART (Anaheim Resort Transit) Shuttle worked and he explained how to use it, how much it cost, times, etc. (What a deal!). Also made great recommendations about visiting Disneyland (times, locations, Magic Hours, etc.) Remembered our 14-year-old son so he could use the Market Pantry for snacks.   Welcoming Reception: Mon.-Wed. evening- free snacks (that were large/meaty enough to be a small dinner) with free drinks (sodas, beer, wine) and very nice staff

When traveling with 7 people it's never easy finding one room to accommodate everyone.  Staybridge offered a 2 room suite with 3 queen size beds and a sofa bed.  It was close to Disneyland and conveniently located, just off the I-5.  Our room had a kitchen, 2 bathrooms and plenty of room for us all.

Room was dirty/dusty when I went down to the lobby to request a different RM I was accommodated quickly but, when I got to the second RM it was just as dirty as the first. I called the travel agency I booked with to demand they find me a RM somewhere else. I was told everyone else was completely booked. At that point it was clear to me I would half to come up with my own solution. I drove a few minutes down the road to Target and purchased gloves and cleaning supplies. My wife and I spent 30 min cleaning the RM ourselves.  This was not ideal, but I had to do what I could to make the RM somewhat livable for my children.  The Air vents were filled with dust to the point that they looked like dryer lint traps. The fire alarm and sprinkler head were completely covered in a thick
Manager Response: Hello tina t,  Thank you for staying with us.  I apologize that we did not meet your expectations on the suite cleanliness.  I hope you had some fun while here.

Summary: Just got back from stay at Staybridge and had to write this review.  The hotel definitely deserves a 10/10 as they strive to make guests happy with the small touches.  We arrived early in the morning and the hotel was able to check us in early as our room was ready.  This saved us a lot of hassle as we were expecting our luggage would be stored until check-in time.  They gave us a spacious room with kitchenette, soap for the dishes, microwaveable popcorn, plenty of towels and brand name soap/shampoo.  Fast wi-fi.  Breakfast had good variety - coffee, tea, fresh fruit, cereals, eggs, waffles, etc.  Hotel is also fairly close to the outlets (driving distance wise) and of course Disney.  Would stay here again!!
Manager Response: Hello,  Thank you so much for staying with us and for sharing your wonderful review with us all.  It sounds like you and your family had a great stay with us.  Thanks so much for pointing out some of the things you liked most about your stay.  I really hope you guys will come and stay with us again soon.

Summary Heading: Nice Friendly Resort and large breakfast
Summary: The staff was very friendly and helpful.  Breakfast was hot and there was a wide selection.  The negative is that all of the TV's volumes only can be brought up to 25%.  We had to turn off the AC just to barely hear the TV.
Manager Response: Hello Scott M,  Thank you for staying with us and for sharing your comments with us all.  I really appreciate the nice mention of our caring staff members; we do work very hard and it is great when it is recognized.  I apologize that the television system was not loud enough.  We can usually extend the volume system somewhat through our maintenance team.  Please let us know in the future so that we can try and assist with any issues.  Please come back and stay with us any time you come into town.

Summary: This hotel is quite new, the rooms are spacious with a fully outfitted clean kitchen and a short distance from Disney Park.  The staff are exceptional and the breakfast is of great value, as well as a complimentary snack/refreshments on Mon, Tues and Wed 5:30 to 7:30.  The rates are very reasonable and a reduced rate for a 7 day stay.  Will definitely try the location in New York.
Manager Response: Hello T2348FC,  Thank you for staying with us and for sharing such a terrific review with us all.  It sounds like you guys really enjoyed everything.  I really appreciate you pointing out some of the things you liked best about your stay; especially mentioning our caring staff members.  I hope you and your family will come and stay with us again every time you come into town.

Summary: Tucked a little away from Disney but loved our two bedroom suite.  Super clean and comfortable.  Breakfast selection was good.  Parking was a little challenging at night and one elevator was down causing some lengthy lines to get to the lobby in the morning, walked down the stairs from the 7th floor to get breakfast.
Manager Response: Hello jamiewyz,  Thank you so much for staying with us and for sharing your review with us all.  I really appreciate all the nice comments about all the things you liked about your stay.  I wanted to apologized that one of our elevators were down during your stay.  The elevator company had to wait for a part... that was delayed.  We are all back up and running again, but I just want to say, "Well Done" to you guys for still having a great stay and not letting an elevator issue ruin your terrific stay.  Please come and stay with us again soon.

Summary Heading: Nice hotel Good value for the money.
Summary: Nice hotel.  At the far end away from Disney land. Close to the Angles stadium and Honda centre. Breakfast was ok. Few choices... waffles, crispy bacon and limited fruit.  Biggest issue was the house keeping. Only done once per week during our stay.  Had to several times ask for bathroom essentials.. toilet paper and soap.  Disney land transfer bus leaves from property next door maybe 50m away.
Manager Response: Hello Jamie R,  Thank you for staying with us and for sharing your review with us all.  I am glad that you liked our location and breakfast.  I do apologize that we did not give enough housekeeping services for you.  Please always let us know what you need at the front desk and we will make sure you get it.  Please come and stay with us any time you are in Anaheim.

Summary: Was difficult to locate at first but once we got a feel for the area it was fine. Booked this for a weekend stay to attend the Angels Game,Disney,and Packing District and it was the perfect location for all three! Breakfast was good but extremely busy. Pool was Great. Loved,loved,loved the All-Natural Body Products in the Bathroom. Great to have a full size fridge and kitchenette!! There was freeway noise, but earplugs took care of that. Would recommend for similar travel, the price was right!
Manager Response: Hello Janet,  Thank you for staying with us and for sharing your wonderful review with us all.  I also really appreciate all the nice comments that you made about the things you liked most.  I am so glad you guys did not let any freeway noise bother you.  Please come back and stay with us any time you are in town.

Summary: We stayed in a 2 bedroom family suite, plenty of room for our family of 7, breakfast was good and filling, kids loved the pool and hot tub, shuttle to Disneyland was great! We would stay here again. <3
Manager Response: Hello Stahr A,  Thank you for staying with us and for sharing your review with us all.  I am so glad that you and your family had such a great time.  We are so fortunate to have our large pool and family recreational area that our guests can enjoy year around.  I really hope we will see you all again very soon.

Summary: We booked this apartment as a group of 7 5 adults and 3 children ages 8 6 4  Arrival and check in are very efficient only thing that caught me out a bit was I don’t have a credit card but he hotel needed one to check in it’s lucky another member of my group had one else we couldn’t check in ! Hotel staff were lovely and welcoming she gave us an area map she circled food outlets and stores nearby so we could get what we wanted for our room. the hotel also has a mini shop near the reception desk with snacks and drinks but target is a lot cheaper as you can buy big packs. Hotel location is a brilliant and central location in Anaheim everything that we wanted to see in Anaheim was within a 10 min drive including downtown Disney. I was advised that walking at night around this area
Manager Response: Hello Stephanie B,  I thank you very much for staying with us and for sharing such a detailed review with us all.  I am thrilled that you and your family had such a great time wit us.  I appreciate you pointing out that all guests have to check in with a valid credit card or debit card; that is so important.  And also for reminding people that Anaheim as a tourist city, with those type of issues.  Of course, our hotel is a safe family type atmosphere...  You are so kind for pointing out our Breakfast/Kitchen staff; they work so hard and really appreciate the recognition.  Thanks again and please come and stay with us any time you are in town.

Summary: I was visiting anaheim to go to Disneyland with some friends and we are all either 19-20 and a lot of the times younger people are treated differently because of our age. I am pleased to say that was not the case and we were treated equally compared to everyone else staying at the hotel which made me appreciate this establishment even more. Very clean rooms and great customer service.
Manager Response: Hello Nick S,  Thank you for staying with us and for sharing your thoughts with us all.  I really appreciate the mention of our great customer service.  We definitely are an inclusive, family friendly hotel.  I am super glad that you guys had a good time with us I really hope you will come and stay with us again soon.

Summary: Let me begin with my only complaint. Fitness center was small and smelly.  Everything else about our stay was positive.  We had a 2 bedroom suite for us and our friends.  The suite was roomy and comfortable.  Like a home away from home.  The hot breakfast which was included with our stay was pretty good.  I especially liked the self serve waffle makers we could use.  Turned out some delicious waffles!  Even the social hour in the evenings was cool.  I enjoyed the beer, wine, and hot dogs.  Location was conveniently close to Disneyland.  Staff was professional and helpful.  The price was right.  Based on our 3 night stay, I can recommend Staybridge Suites for a pleasant experience.

Summary Heading: Family of six Disney and Newport Beach
Summary: Good things:  1. Super-hospitable staff throughout the hotel and exceptionally helpful and welcoming staff at the front desk; 2. Disney tickets are on sale at the front desk at the same price as at the Disneyland gate; 3. Excellent breakfast with a broad selection and plenty of seating; 4. Comfortable beds; 5. Clean rooms; 6. Two-bedroom suite layout designed to buffer any hallway noise from the two bedrooms. Not so good things: 1. During our stay, 50% of the laundry machines were out of order.  When I went down at 9 pm there was a line-up.  I estimated that I could get a load in around midnight; so, I returned to my room with my dirty laundry instead; 2. When the sofabed is opened, it is a tight fit in the living room.  The foot of the bed is about 2 inches from the TV cabinet;
Manager Response: Hello JocP,  Thank you for staying with us and for leaving such a detailed review.  I appreciate all of the positive response, and the feedback on areas where we may improve.  I am glad you and your family had a nice time with us and I hope you will come and stay with us again soon.

Summary Heading: Family of four Disney and Ball Game
Summary: Great hotel. we wanted to stay a bit away from the craziness of the close to Disney hotels and it was great. It was only a 5 minute drive to Disney still. Uber to the Baseball Game. Nice rooms. our room was a suite and it was plenty big. The Manager's Reception snacks and breakfast were both really good. huge selection at breakfast.Gorgeous pool area with lots of seating. We enjoyed the snacks and breakfast while sitting outside. Staff was very friendly. I would recommend.
Manager Response: Hello Cball5,  Thank you for staying with us and sharing such a wonderful story with us all.  It really sounds like you guys enjoyed the hotel, our family pool/recreation area, our location, and our caring staff.  I especially thank you for mentioning them; they work so hard and it is appreciated when noticed.  I hope you guys will come and stay with us again every time you come to Anaheim.

Summary: We have stayed at this resort 3 times and have always left feeling satisfied. We had 2 two bedroom suites this time around as there were 10 of us in total. It was a family celebration of life as my daughter-in-law recently finished her chemo and radiation treatments battling and beating lymphoma. Everything went fairly smooth after a hiccup at check-in.  I was going through my credit card statement and noticed an $80 charge from the resort, a day after checking out. I contacted the front desk to ask what this charge was and at first he could not explain it. After being on hold for a bit, he came back on the line to tell me that the charge was for 2 missing pillows. I was flabbergasted that we were being accused of theft....a first for me. I did not realize that this resort is
Manager Response: Hello Michelle L,  I do thank you for staying with us and apologize if you felt accused in any way.  I also apologize if the situation was not handled properly.  Please have a nice day.

Summary Heading: Great location, pool, breakfast and bbq area
Summary: With free parking and 20 mins walk to Disney we couldn't fault the hotel. Nice touches with cleaning products for the kitchen, popcorn and toiletries. Safety deposit box free of charge at hotel reception. Pool is lovely and big you can take your own drink, small bar open 2-5 Disney shuttle  but we used uber as worked out cheaper. Good location for beaches shopping outlet and Walmart. We loved our time there hope you do too.
Manager Response: Hello Sarah,  Thank you for staying with us and for sharing your fantastic story with us all.  I really appreciate the details in your review about our hotel and location.  I am thrilled that you and your family had a nice stay with us and I hope you will come and stay with us again soon.

Summary Heading: Average-with some TLC could easily be a 4 -4.5 star
Summary: Stayed 4 nights with my wife. Lobby Front desk area was sub par- not much going on ever.....  BREAK = EXCELLENT EVERYDAY. Staff - solid.  Room service(Burger Theory) were good.  Beds/Pillows=great.. very Comfy..... Rooms clean but nothing fancy.AC/Climate control-below average. toilet /shower/ sink = very average. Nice that the rooms are suites with kitchen and bedroom but once again the interior is average . Pool is shared with Holiday Inn connecting property... very average....... Pool bar was not opened that often (maybe 3 hours during the afternoon).   Exterior of property is the reason I give this property 3 stars. Ash trays tipped over, cigarettes  every where on ground in multiple locations near outdoor patio area.  Back wall area of parking lot a mess with litter. Pool
Manager Response: Hello Phil G,  Thank you for staying with us and for sharing your thoughts with us.  I appreciate the feedback and I hope that you had some fun while you were here.  Have a great day.

Summary: Got a great deal for this hotel. Booked a studio suite but got upgraded to a 1-BR. We were allowed to check in at 2pm, two hours earlier than their required 4pm check-in. Staff are very accommodating and nice. Good choices of food from their breakfast buffet, free parking, heated pool, so close to Disneyland. They are a "Good neighbor" hotel of Disney. Will definitely stay here again when we go back to Disneyland.
Manager Response: Hello joannenasol,  Thank you for staying with us and for sharing your comments with us all.  I am very happy we were able to upgrade you and get you checked in early on this stay.  I really appreciate the mention of our caring front office staff, and I hope you will come and stay with us again soon.

Summary: Place was clean & large. We had a king  suite.  Full fridge, microwave,  cook top and all dishes etc.  Even a dishwasher!!! Great free breakfast every morning.  Staff was pleasant.  Parking was 18 a day , BUT we walked to disneyland and did not have to be in the parking lot frenzy, worth it!.   BONUS of fireworks right outside our window.
Manager Response: Hello Mskittylitter,  I thank you for staying with Staybridge Suites and for your fantastic review.  But I think you stayed at the Staybridge at the Park.  And I am sure they have a great hotel.  Come and stay with us next time!

Summary: From arrival to check out was 5 stars. When we arrived they were able to check us in early which was great because we were traveling with a toddler. Rooms were clean and overall comfortable. Front desk clerks went out of their way for any of our needs. Special shout out to Pam for going above and beyond to arrange transportation for us to make it to Mickey’s breakfast. Daily breakfast was nice, enjoyed the variety of items each day. If your heading to the Anaheim area with large families this is the place to stay. We will be back!
Manager Response: Hello Melinda M,  Thank you for sharing your story with us all.  I appreciate all of the detailed comments.  I especially appreciate the "shout out" for Pam; she is fantastic and really cares about our guests.  I hope you guys have a great day and will come and stay with us any time you are in Anaheim.

Summary: My husband and I stayed here while taking my teenage sister to Disneyland. We stayed in a two-bedroom, two-bathroom suite, which was perfect for our needs, and a much better price than any 2 adjoining rooms at comparable hotels in the area. There is a kitchenette that has a small stovetop, full fridge, microwave, and toaster. One room had a king bed, while the other had two full beds, each room (with their respective bathrooms) on either side of the central living room/kitchenette area. There was central AC, but one control for all rooms, which makes it more difficult to be a comfortable for everyone.   The included breakfast was served in a large area, and had fruit, cereal, yogurt, breads/pastries, waffle makers (with decent lines if it was late), and hot foods of eggs, meat
Manager Response: Hello ERS719,  Thank you for staying with s and for leaving a detailed review.  I am so glad you guys enjoyed the 2 bedroom suite and our hotel.  I apologize that you had trouble with your phone, and that the noise from the other guests disturbed you.  I really hope you will stay with us any time you come into town.

Summary: We stayed here for 3 nights whilst visiting Disneyland. We had booked a 1 king bedroom with a sofa bed but were upgraded to a 2 bedroom / 2 bathroom suite with a living/kitchen area with sofa bed. One of the best suites we had on our 3 week trip to California. Great value for money & complimentary breakfast was very good. Nice restaurant - Burger Theory next door. Very impressed & would definitely recommend.
Manager Response: Hello Lynseydear,  Thank you for staying with us and for sharing your story with us all.  I really appreciate all of the nice comments that you left regarding your stay and our hotel.  I am so glad you and your family had such a great time.  Please come back and stay with us anytime you are in town.

Summary: Staybridge what a delight. family friendly and economical. The rooms were spacious and clean with every thing one needs for a family of four to sleep and just hangout comfortably. The staff was very professional and helpful in getting tickets to outside venues and special events in and around the resort. Will be staying here again.
Manager Response: Hello marlener755,  Thank you for staying with us and for sharing your review with us all.  It sounds like you guys had a great stay.  I appreciate you pointing out the we are "The" family hotel when you are coming into Anaheim.  Please come back and stay with us again soon.

Summary: We stayed for 5 days while I was attending a Convention and while we were also enjoying Disneyland. We stayed in a 2 bedroom suite as a family and we enjoyed a lot. The breakfast was very poor in terms of variety of food. THe staff were greatly helpful and friendly.
Manager Response: Hello samibarbaros,  Thank you for staying with us and for sharing your review with us all.  I appreciate the kind comments and the feedback on where we can improve.  I also thank you for the mention of our caring staff.  Please come and stay with us any time you are in town.

Summary: We had just a great time at this Staybridge Suites. Brian and Eric A. at the desk went out of their way to be helpful and were extremely professional.  The pool was great and the service at breakfast was very good.   We would recommend this hotel unreservedly.
Manager Response: Hello mntraveller1a,  Thank you for staying with us and for sharing your review with us all.  A special BIG THANKS for recognizing Brian and Eric for their great customer service.  I also see you liked the family recreational pool area and our breakfast.  And one last thanks for your recommendation and for your promise of a return trip.  We really hope we will see you again soon.

Summary Heading: Great Hote for families!! The best we have stayed at in Anaheim
Summary: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights in a 2 bedroom suite as a family of 4. Loved our stay, pool is great, breakfast wasn't the best we have had but it is defineltely nice to have every morning.   What we loved the most is the afternoon social that they provide everyday between 5,30-7.30pm, hot dogs, bottomless drinks, unlimited beer/wine ( I say unlimited because we seen many ppl go back many times in the 2hr timeframe for more and more.   Non the less we loved our stay, the staff were professional. room was comfy and clean, beds were like a cloud to sleep on and as a whole we will be back!
Manager Response: Hello SmEeEze M,  Thank you for sharing your fantastic story with us all.  It sounds like you guys really liked the family pool/hot tub area and the evening social the best.  I am so glad you guys had some great family, quality time together.  Please come back and stay with us any time you come into town.

Summary: We stopped in this hotel for a week to do Disneyland, the staff were extremely helpful and friendly always saying hello even late at night when we were ready to crash out from a day at the parks. The hotel was very nice and roomy, bed was comfy, all clean with a small kitchen for all your needs really. We had breakfast included which was perfect to fill up on in the morning. It was about 5/10 mins away from parks but there was a shuttle bus as you wouldn’t be able to walk to the park from here (not after a whole day in Disney!) you could buy tickets on the bus for however many days you need it for.  Was overall impressed by the hotel and would recommend it if your looking for a hotel just away from the parks.
Manager Response: Hello Disneyland trip,  Thank you for staying with us and for sharing your story.  It sounds like you guys had a great stay with us.  I really appreciate you pointing out some of the things you liked best about our hotel.  Please come and stay with us again whenever you are in town.

Summary: Great location to Disneyland and on the ART bus route, which was great for to & from Disney. Room was fine, lots of space for everyone. Are room came with breakfast and was very good with lots of choices. Had a great stay and would definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: Hello behr2017,  Thank you for staying with us and for sharing your review with us all.  I am so glad you and your family had such a good time.  Please come and stay with us again soon.

Summary Heading: Immaculate suite, friendly staff and wonderful breakfast!
Summary: We will stay here again and again, we had such a great experience!  We had 7 guests so had the two bedroom suite.  Both bedrooms had separate bathrooms/showers and in between them was a living area with a pull out couch/bed.  Also the kitchen was great, with a full size refrigerator, stove top, toaster, microwave and all the utensils we needed.  Not a bad walk to Disneyland, we did it once, then took the shuttle which is very inexpensive and you can go back and forth as many times as you need for just one price.  Breakfast was yummy, sausage, potatoes, eggs, waffles, yogurt, fruit, bagels and amazing coffee etc... it didn't vary every day, but hey, it was free! Swimming pool and jacuzzi were much appreciated after a long day on our feet.  Highly recommend!
Manager Response: Hello Marijo E,  Thank you for staying with us and sharing your wonderful story with us all.  I am so glad you and your family had a great visit and enjoyed a lot of our hotels features.  We are proud to be "The" hotel for families in Anaheim.  Please come and stay with us again any time you are in town.
