You had some good tips for us on how to make our services better and we appreciate it.  We are a great hotel for families and thanks for mentioning that.  Please come and stay with us again when you are in town.

Summary Heading: Excellent Family Resort for Disneyland & SoCal  Entertainment
Summary: Newly refurbished room with full kitchen was wonderful. Plenty of room for family of four. King bed room or two doubles suites are available at amazing prices. Includes full breakfast, hot and cold buffet. Pool and super convenient shuttle to Disney for $5 per person. Fantastic service and accommodations for family on a budget. Quiet.
Manager Response: Hello William H,  Thank you for taking your time to review our hotel and services.  It looks like you enjoyed the value, our food options, and the size and accommodations in our suites the most.  We are very happy you stayed with us, and we hope you and your family come and stay with us again soon.

Summary: We arrived on Wednesday, April 20th around 8am.  I had requested an early check in but never imagined they would check us in AND give us our room that early.  The check-in process was smooth and easy.  The front desk staff was great.  They even offered us breakfast when we arrived.  The room was perfect!  It was very clean and comfortable.  After a long first day at Disneyland, it was nice to come back to friendly staff and a comfortable room.  The beds were very comfortable.   The breakfast was awesome.  It was a great start to the day.  The hotel itself was very clean and quiet despite all the craziness of all the guests in and out all day.  I didn't get to experience the pool/hot tub but my family did and said it was very nice and relaxing.  When it was time to shut the pool
Manager Response: Hello Palemke,  Thank you very much for taking the time to make a detailed review of your last stay with us.  We really appreciate the kind words about our staff, our hotel, and our services.  We are proud to offer a great property and services for you and your family.  Please come and stay with us again soon!

Summary: We stayed for five nights while on a family trip to Disneyland. We arrived directly from a long haul flight. We could not have found the team more helpful. Shout out to Pam who assisted us in getting supplies, organising transfers and lending is a stroller for the day!! Accommodation was comfortable and suited to a family with a well fitted out kitchen. Perfect for trips to Disney were yoy are looking for some where comfortable. Thank you again to the team for a comfortable stay!
Manager Response: Hello Visiting from land downunder,  Thank you for the detailed review of your last stay with us.  It really looks like you and the family enjoyed the stay.  We appreciate all the kind words about our hotel, services, and our staff, especially Pam.  Please come and stay with us again the next time you are in town.

Summary Heading: One of my favorite Orange County hotels
Summary: Whenever I am in Orange or Anaheim this is a favorite hotel.  Now I wouldn't recommend it for those coming for Disneyland if they want something walking distance.  But if you are coming for a baseball game, conference, or other reason this is a great hotel.  It is conveniently located off the freeway but without the freeway noise.  The rooms are spacious and well designed, with comfortable furniture especially for those staying a few nights.  The breakfast is considerable though it can be chaotic with all the children. The staff is friendly and relatively knowledgeable on the area and the brand. There is plentiful parking and fast complimentary WiFi. They are pet friendly! Even though the hotel is almost always full, especially with families, the soundproofing is very good.
Manager Response: Hello vegaswithkids,  Thank you for taking the time to detail a great review of your last stay with us.  It really sounds like you enjoy our hotel, location, services, and staff.  We appreciate all the kind words and hope that you stay with us again soon.  Have a great day.

Summary: I found this hotel to be badly run, especially for a Staybridge.  My card key didn't work, night after night after night (and no, I wasn't putting my phone or anything magnetic in my pocket).  When we tried the pool, which was nice, there were no towels.  Rather than have any clue that maybe, just maybe, they should put a house phone out on the pool area, they scoffed at the idea.  So if there aren't any towels, you get to trek back to the very-busy front desk to ask for some.  The parking is horrible - they don't have enough spaces if you get in late at night.  There were many other little things done badly, too numerous to talk about here.  A plus was that our room faced Disneyland in the distance, so we could see the fireworks at night.  Given the array of hotels in Anaheim,
Manager Response: Hello Mr. Phil,  Thank you for giving us feedback on your recent stay at the hotel. I appreciate you letting us know about the pool towels and your key cards. I'm disappointed to hear that we fell short in your eyes, but will be taking your comments very seriously and addressing them with our team. I apologize that your suggestion for the house phone seemed ignored, but it is a great idea and I will look into  it. I am very sorry for the shortcomings and hope that you will consider giving us another chance in the future.

Summary: We stayed at Staybridge Suites Anaheim for 6 nights 2Adults 3Children. All of the staff were so helpful and friendly and more than happy to assist with our stay in Anaheim. Caught the A.R.T bus to Disneyland which is $5 for adults $2 for children from the Holiday Inn next door there is also a restaurant at the Holiday Inn called Burger Theory which had good food, yummy pizzas and amazing service. Free breakfast every morning included toast, fruit, cereal, make your own waffles juice, fizzy, coffee, yoghurt, muffins etc and also 2 hot foods each day eg: bacon and scrambled eggs or sausage and potatoes. They also had happy hour Mon, Tues, Wed nights (which was on for longer than an hour) which was hotdogs, potato chips or Nachos and pulled pork rolls while we were there and it
Manager Response: Hello Krystelle G,  Thank you very much for the detailed review of your last visit with us.  It really looks like you enjoyed the hotel, our staff, our services/breakfast, and our location.  We love hosting families like yours and are thrilled you had a great time.  Please come back and stay with us again when you are in town.

Summary: Stayed here March 2016.  We had a 1 bedroom suite for 5 nights.  Fabulous and roomy.  Staff were very friendly.  Monday-Wednesday there are social evenings where the hotel puts on wine and beer for the guests and snack food, which was really cool.  The hotel itself does not have a restaurant/bar, but right next door at the Holiday Inn they did and you could charge back to your room.  Bed was comfortable and rooms were lovely and clean.  We caught a Disneyland Resort bus from the Holiday Inn (1 min walk away) to Disneyland and California Adventure Park for $5/day.  Great to be away from all the other hotels close to Disneyland.  Fab place to stay.
Manager Response: Hello Trudy B,  Thank you for taking the time to review your recent stay with us.  It really sounds like you enjoyed the hotel, our staff, and our services.  It really is convenient having the Holiday Inn just next door for us, for alternative food options at night and room services.  It was our pleasure to put on the evening socials Monday, Tuesday, and Wednesday, and we are so happy you enjoyed them.  Please come and stay with us again soon.

Summary Heading: A Night in Anaheim for a Hockey Game
Summary: Very nice family suites hotel. Definitely catering to Disneyland but great location for any event near the Honda Center, ball park or Convention Center. Comfortable and completely set up for in suite living for families. Free social hour and extras for kids. Beds were very comfortable and the suite was extremely clean. Bathroom set up so that the sink area was outside. Shares a restaurant with the Holiday Inn next door and it's a drive to any other restaurant. Highly recommend and will stay again.
Manager Response: Hello webeenthere,  Thank you very much for taking your time to detail your recent stay with us.  It sounds like you really enjoyed the hotel, our services, and the location.  We really do cater to the families that stay with us and we hope you and your family come and stay with us again soon.

Summary: Very conveniently located close enough to disney with a nice pool and whirlpool and breakfast included. We rented a 2 bedroom suite which was nice and comfortable. In overall a good stay, the only but is that the midweek light touch is veeery light, they hardly do any cleaning and we had a problem with one of the showers and it took them 3 days to fix! So overall ok but for the price i paid for the room i expected better attention.  As a tip i recommend using uber to get to the park, use the XL and you can fit up to 6 people for 10 usd instead of paying 5 a head using the bus and with more freedom on schedule
Manager Response: Hello GuillermoJasso,  Thank you for taking the time to review your recent stay with us.  It looks like you did enjoy the value, the hotel, and the breakfast and services.  I would like to apologize that the Light Touch Cleaning was not what you were expecting.  I do hope that you will come and stay with us, next time you are in town.

Summary Heading: Just a perfect stay for our Disneyland trip!
Summary: We had three suites at Staybridge for our big annual family visit to the Disneyland parks.....  Everything was just fantastic.  Ease of check in, room condition (newly remodeled), early breakfast, location, value/price,  etc.   And the staff is top notch!    We had originally wanted to stay at one of the Disney hotels, but they were all sold out for the week of our visist ... So after a good ol' Tripadvisor investigation we ended up at Staybridge.    We couldn't have been happier and highly recommend Staybridge! I hope they keep up the good work, cause we'll be back.
Manager Response: Hello Josh C,  Wow...  what a great review!  I am very glad that you and your family decided to stay with us.  It sounds like you all had a great time.  I looks like you enjoyed the hotel, staff, and services.  Please come and stay with us again when you are in town.  We would love to see you and the whole family here again soon!

Summary: Tonight we checked in to Staybridge Suites after a long, long day and were delighted to see our old favorite place we've stayed at several times before has been updated beautifully. Since it was very late on a Tuesday night there was only one desk clerk and a sudden "rush" of 3 families checking in. Ana at the front desk handled it beautifully. She was patient, kind and efficient, and gave each customer top notch service as she checked them in (and was still able to answer the phone, and handle the  pantry sales too).  When we got into our room we found that they had been nicely updated since we had last stayed here. The room was so clean, welcoming and spacious. Perfect place for our "home away from home" while we are vacationing at Disneyland.
Manager Response: Hello under-the-sea33,  Thank you for taking your time to review your recent stay with us.  It sounds like you folks really enjoy our property and our services... especially Ana.  Thank you for the kind words.  We hope you will come and stay with us again soon!

Summary: Great place to stay and the employees here are amazing. Always smiling, knowledgeable and helpful. Had a great tip off on places to eat locally by the fantastic Laura and I cannot recommend this place enough of you want to feel like a welcome guest.
Manager Response: Hello Donavan E,  Thank you for taking the time to review your recent stay with us.  It looks like you and Laura really enjoyed the hotel, services, and staff.  I really appreciate the kind words about the staff.  Please come and stay with us again soon!

Summary: The hotel has a nice staff and a good complimentary breakfast.  The beds are comfortable but some of the furniture is showing wear.  The ART shuttle is located between the Staybridge and Holiday Inn which share a parking lot.  It takes about 15 minutes to get to Disneyland on the shuttle.  The shuttle cost $5.00 per day for adult $3.00 for children.  In my opinion it is not in walking distance to Disneyland or any restaurants.  We took the ART shuttle to Disneyland and UBER or LYFT to restaurants.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review of your stay with us. We appreciate the feedback on the furniture and will be looking into it. It was a pleasure having you here and hope to see you again soon.

Summary: The hotel is close to Disney and with a ART stop next to the hotel you don't have to walk far. The staff as many reviews mention are very friendly and welcoming and even when busy which they often are they will acknowledge you as you take a sit down on the handy stools at reception which are always found at Staybridge.   The hotel has had a recent refit which shows almost everywhere from the breakfast seating era, public toilets, hallways and rooms. In the rooms the kitchen worktops and doors have been replaced along with carpets, wall art, and the shower walking. Everything feels fresh and it's nice to see unlike so many hotels even the bathroom was done. Even the towels and bedding seemed new which was nice.   The only issues I had were the fridge noise as I am a light sleeper
Manager Response: Hello Dlrow Traveler,  Thank you for taking the time to make such a detailed review of your recent stay with us.  It sounds like you really liked the location and the property upgrades; and thanks again for the kind words about our staff.  We appreciate your recount of the problems you faced and I will get with our Engineering staff to check on those issues.  Please come and stay with us again when you are in town.

Summary: Stayed here for two nights on business.  Nicely appointed hotel and easy access.  The hospitality sessions on Monday through Wednesday provide nice options for light food, soft drinks and beer/wine - all free,  Breakfast is robust and even offers a freshly ground coffee machine.  The rooms (suites) are very nice and clean.  They have a kitchen that facilitates preparing food instead of going out.  If one is placed in an upper level courtyard room, you can view the nightly Disneyland fireworks very nicely.  The elevators are quick - don't have to wait long for a seven story building.  The fitness room is nice - offers a weight machine.  Some negatives are that since the property is located near Disneyland, you have yelling/screaming kids running the floors and in the
Manager Response: Hello Michael F,  Thank you very much for taking the time to really review your recent stay with us.  Thank you also for the great comments about the property and our breakfast/evening social offerings.  It is concerning to hear that your suite was not cleaned thoroughly as promised; I do apologize and will check into it.  I hope that you will come and stay with us again whenever you are in the area.  Happy New Year!

Summary: A great stay. We loved the free breakfast and the social hour in the evenings. The room was spacious and clean. Beds were very comfortable.  It was a short drive from the parks. We wpuld definitely stay at this hotel again.
Manager Response: Hello Shannon F,  Thank you for taking the time to review your recent stay with us.  I am very happy that you and your family enjoyed the hotel and our services.  We would love to have you come and stay with us again soon.  Happy New Year!

Summary Heading: One night stay for Disneyland. But VERY pleased
Summary: I couldn't find anything wrong with this place! And when I write my reviews, trust me I look for faults lol  Very friendly staff. They were able to help accommodate me last minute, after an incorrect booking with another hotel near Disneyland. They found me a room, gave me a little discount, and very very courteous. They even upgraded my room for the night.   Free WiFi! Free buffet breakfast in the morning until 1030a with a wide variety  of foods, juice, coffee, etc.   Free parking for guests, which is awesome! Lots of space to park  The room itself was in tip-top shape! New furniture, everything was spotless. The bathrooms came with toiletries and a hair dryer (huge plus for me since lugging a hair dryer is a pain lol). The shower was clean, lots of towels.  The kitchen area
Manager Response: Hello Erica P,  Thank you for taking the time to review your recent stay with us.  We appreciate all the great description of our hotel and services.  I also appreciate the kind words about our staff and customer service.  Please come and stay with us again soon.  Happy New Year!

Summary: The hotel is in a great spot right off the freeway and next door to Disney. The room was in great condition and clean. The hotels grounds are beautiful. The breakfast in the morning is a huge plus along with the evening "social". Rachel at check in was a happy and friendly face at arrival.
Manager Response: Hello Oscar R,  Thank you for taking a few moments to let us know about your recent stay.  It sounds like the location and services were perfect for you.  Also, thank you for the kind words about Rachel, we do strive for excellent customer service and I will pass those on to her.  We would love to have you come and stay with us again.  Happy New Year!

Summary: We arrived very tired after a thirteen hour flight and the receptionist was wonderful- so friendly and sent us straight in for breakfast and then to our rooms which were ready even though it was only morning. This was wonderful and really helped us have a wonderful first day at Disneyland.  This hotel is very good value - we have stayed before and will stay again.
Manager Response: Thank you for the great comments about your stay and the kind words about our front desk staff at reception.  We are thrilled you and your family enjoyed everything.  Please come and bring the family again soon.  Happy New Year!

Summary Heading: Good place to stay while visiting Disneyland with family
Summary: It's an ideal place to stay if you are visiting Disneyland with family. We were five. Stay was comfortable and affordable. All kitchen amenities are available in the suite. Breakfast spread is impressive. Only glitch is we were finding it little tough to explain our requirements to attending kitchen staff of the hotel. Also the microwave in the suite was not functioning.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking a your valuable time to tell us about your recent stay.  We are glad you and your family had a good stay.  I apologize about the microwave that was not working, and for the difficulty in communication with the breakfast staff.  We do strive for excellent customer service and hope you and your family will come and stay with us again soon.  Happy New Year!

Summary Heading: Affordable and Great Base to visit Disneyland
Summary: We visited the Disneyland parks in October for my husband's birthday and stayed at the Staybridge Suites Anaheim for two nights. The rooms were spacious, quiet, and had all the amenities we needed to make our stay pleasant. The bed was very comfortable and I slept like a baby. The free breakfast buffet had very good selections of hot and cold food and beverages, and by having breakfast at the hotel, we didn't have to eat again at the park (which is pricey). The bus that takes you to the park stops at the hotel next door, and it's just a matter of walking across the parking lot. Location wise, it's a bit farther from the park than I expected but would stay here again.
Manager Response: Hello Rick C,  Thank you for taking the time to review your most recent stay.  I am very happy that you enjoyed the property and services.  Please come again soon.  Happy Holidays!

Summary: Its ok if you are there to sleep as the rooms are tiny especially if you are 5 with large suitcases.  Breakfast is basic. Location is a good 20 minutes walk to eat or get to Disneyland where most hotel's are much closer. There is a bus at the hotel next door or get a cab. Pam on the front desk is extremely helpful she made our stay very easy.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying reviewing your stay with us....I apologize that the rooms were not what you expected. I'm not sure what room type you booked, but next time for added space I would recommend our two-bedroom suite. The room is 750sq ft and has two separate bedrooms with a restroom in each room.   I'm glad that Pam made your stay! She is great and I will let her know of your kind words! Thank you for your valued business!

Summary: My family has stayed at this hotel many times over the years as it is near Disneyland and other theme parks in addition to several malls. It is near the interstate and has a fantastic view of the valley or palm lined courtyard. The hot breakfast is included and now offers bean-to-cup coffee in addition to their regular coffee service. On this trip it was just my husband and I traveling and then our older son joined us. The hotel upgraded our room and we found it very comfortable. Nice full size refrigerator and dishwasher make for a great kitchen area. The front desk staff was friendly and really made guests feel welcome. I noticed the upgrade and installation of new flooring and paint in the hallways. What I really appreciated was the onsite and ongoing refinishing of the
Manager Response: Hello,  Thank you for really taking the time to review your recent stay with us.  It is a pleasure to have returning guests feel so at home and welcomed by the staff and accommodations.  We truly hope you and your family continue staying with us for generations.  Please come again soon and have a lovely, peace filled holiday.  Jimmy Raynor Front Office Manager

Summary: This hotel was perfect for our vacation. We had 5 adults, 1 child and 1 infant. The two bedroom suite was a perfect size for the family. The staff was very friendly and were quick to help with whatever we needed. We were able to check in a little early, the room was VERY clean. We had requested a crib, which was already in the room. The suite has 2 bathrooms, a living space with a sleeper sofa and a kitchen with plates and silverware, coffee maker etc. We went to the store and loaded up on snacks and water for the parks. Speaking of that, the ART stops at this hotel property every 20 mins. Hot breakfast every morning (eggs, potatoes, bacon and sausage) and a managers happy hour on week nights. We didn't get to take advantage of the BBQ night since we were at Disney, but I talked
Manager Response: Hello Lis_Naj13,  Thank you for the detailed review of your most recent stay.  It sounds like you and the family had a great time.  I agree, that our hotel, staff, and services are perfect for families.  We really hope to see you and your family again next year.  Have a wonderful holiday season!  Jimmy Raynor Front Office Manager

Summary: Stayed here with my wife, our 2 children and the in-laws for a 4-day Disney weekend.  The room was clean, and for the most part the hotel's recent updates were apparent and things were in good shape. Only complaint we had as far as cleanliness, was the curtains, they were very stained.  Breakfast had a good variety of hot and cold items. However, one morning we ate later and towards the end of breakfast hours, it seemed as if the entire hotel staff filed in for "leftovers". I'd have no problem with it, and would actually appreciate that nothing goes to waste...but they should wait until other guests are done, or close up the area and have employees grab the extras from the back. It was a little uncomfortable at one point, with one in our group feeling that employees felt guests
Manager Response: Hello Chris T,  Thank you for taking the time to review our property from your previous stay.  We do appreciate the honest feedback and will look into several issues.  It does concern me about the breakfast atmosphere and the inclination of employees not to wait until all guests have been served.  I will look into this to ensure guest satisfaction.  We are glad you and your family had a great stay and we hope to see you again really soon.  Happy Holidays!  Jimmy Raynor Front Office Manager

Summary: Nice place, convenient (and FAST) bus route to Disney. Friendly staff. Breakfast wasn't so great in terms of quality. Also, expect there to be lots of families and kids. Had kid prank knocking on our door the first night, but this was not the hotel's fault. Just be aware. Overall, very nice for the price and location. Oh...and our room had a view of the Disney fireworks at night. Awesome. Would likely stay here if we find a good deal again.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We appreciate the wonderful comments you wrote and look forward to having your family here again soon!

Summary Heading: Spacious suite for a good price!
Summary: Pros: - Super Friendly front of house staff that detailed me on all of the amenities right away. - Convenient shuttle too and from Disney - Spacious rooms. I had a double bed suite and it would be perfect for a small family (a bit much for solo traveller) - kitchenette would be appealing to family/extended stay. - Rooms were very clean and quiet. - lots of seating in lobby for breakfast - small convenience  - fairly priced rooms  Cons: - Hallways could use better lighting and some Air freshener. - Bus to Disney is convenient however prone to traffic.  Definitely would stay again (maybe once I have my own family)
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to weight out the "Pros and Cons" of your most recent stay.  I am most appreciative of the comments about the staff.  We try really hard to be welcoming and genuine; thanks for noticing.  We hope you (and eventually your family) come again soon.  Happy Holidays!  Jimmy Raynor Front Office Manager

Summary: I just came back from Disneyland...where a couple co-workers and I stayed at Staybridge.  We only stayed 1 night as we had other plans at a different resort...but Staybridge will stay in my mind.  FIRST...I have Food Allergies and called the resort a few weeks prior asking about the FREE breakfast.  I found many items to not fit my needs and the lady on the phone offered to do some light shopping for me so that I was able to eat breakfast with my co-workers.  This offer was above and beyond amazing...and sure enough...she DID.  I walked up the front desk and she was waiting for me with Apples, Oranges and Bananas.  She even got me Soy Milk for the oatmeal.  This level of service is OUTSTANDING.  To add...even though I couldn't partake in much of the buffet...it looked fantastic
Manager Response: Thank you for the wonderful comments and glowing recommendation for our PAM.  We are thrilled you and your family had a great stay.  And we hope to see you again really soon!  Jimmy Raynor Front Office Manager

Summary: Service was excellent. The man at the front desk who checked us in was above and beyond friendly and helpful. Had the 2 bedroom suite. Great layout, modern fixtures, quartz countertops. Would have given this stay a 2 thumbs up had it not been for the faulty air conditioning which we had the second night. Luckily, the windows opened slightly which cooled us enough to be comfortable. Some additional issues--a door knob that came off and a leaking dishwasher. My sister's family had a 1 bedroom suite with no issues. Hot breakfast was decent--eggs, potatoes, bacon, sausage, waffles with an assortment or bread, muffins, and fruit. Shuttle next door at the Holiday Inn going to/from Disneyland was very convenient--about a 10 minute transfer each way ($5 for adults and $2 per child
Manager Response: Hello,  Thank you for taking the time to review your recent stay with us.  I am thrilled that you felt so welcomed and that the staff treated you and your family well.  I am concerned about the minor issues in your suite and appreciate the honest feedback so we can improve our suites and property.  It would be our pleasure to have you and your family back again soon.  Happy Holidays.  Jimmy Raynor Front Office Manager

Summary: The wife and I visited Disneyland (first time in many years) for the 60-year anniversary of the Park opening in 1955.  Stayed for 4 nights in early November.  GREAT place to stay.  Excellent marks for quietness (place was full of families; but never heard any kids while in our room), nice two-room suite with full kitchen, 2 TVs and room to "move around", free fast Wi-Fi, HVAC worked great, good hot breakfast in the mornings, great evening social time with free snacks/food and free beer (especially nice after a long day at the Resort), plenty of restaurants within a 10 minute drive, an efficient resort shuttle system that picked us up right next door and within a 10 minute ride dropped us at the Disney Resort front entrance (and picked up back up at the same spot), shuttle
Manager Response: Hello William S,  I am very happy that you and your wife found the hotel and services exceptional.  We really appreciate the kind words about the staff and services.  I remember helping with the ice for your wife's ice packs; and it was my pleasure.  We hope to see you again soon!  Jimmy Raynor Front Office Manager

Summary: Recently stayed here on a family vacation for three nights. Overall it was a decent stay, but the cleanliness of the property was surprisingly bad. The elevators are very scratched up and looked very old; poorly maintained and poorly cleaned. Everywhere seemed to need a good vacuuming: the Lobby area, outside the elevators, and even inside the rooms looked like they'd never been touched. I remember seeing bits of paper on the 5th floor that stayed there for days. The entry floor of our room, behind the door was incredibly dusty and looked like it hadn't been touched for weeks. Every day we left wet, used towels and washcloths on the floor of the bathroom, and while they were generally (but not always) replaced, some wet items were left behind (still on the floor--not hung up).
Manager Response: Hello,  Thank you for your candid review of our hotel. There is no excuse for the cleanliness issues that you had encountered. I have scheduled a meeting with our team to review your comments. As for the elevator, due to us just completing renovations our elevators got pretty worn down from the construction, but we are going to be completely refinishing them soon.  I apologize for the inconvenience and want you to know that Staybridge Suites Anaheim prides its self on cleanliness and this is not the typical practice of our hotel. Thank you for bringing this to our attention.

Summary Heading: Great Place to stay for families with pets
Summary: Although the Staybridge was our back up plan, (had reservations at the new Holiday inn) I'm glad we ended up there, because we brought our dog with us. I've stayed at other Staybridge properties before and one thing they have in common, is the great staff! The day manager whom I spoke to for a moment, said he had been there only 5 months, but you couldn't tell. Very enthusiastic and helpful to a new employee in training. We got a free upgrade to a two bedroom suite. The new upgrades are beautiful. Modern and sleek. Breakfast variety is good (bacon or sausage, scrambled eggs, potatoes, make your own waffle, fresh fruit, yogurt, and a variety of pastries)  The 24 hour fresh ground coffee maker is awesome! I've seen a lot of complaints about the noise and water issues from other
Manager Response: Hello and thank you for the kind comments about our property, services, and staff.  I believe I remember speaking to you on your visit, and it is easy giving great service to great people and families; and that's what we love here at Staybridge.  I look forward to seeing you and your family again soon!  Jimmy Raynor, Front Office Manager

Summary Heading: Really poor food and breakfast area
Summary: Stayed here during renovations, which we weren't told of when booking. I have to say this was one of the worst places I have stayed when it comes to free breakfast and evening snack, it was horrid, poor quality and laughable!!! The holiday inn express is superior compared to this. It was like a cattle market at breakfast, so much so I wanted to leave. Pool area nice, younger lady at reception very helpful, older lady was rude,bed was comfortable but seems to be in a less desirable area of CA. Would I return...... Not even if you paid me to stay.. Be aware!!,
Manager Response: Thank you for your review of our hotel. I am sorry to hear you did not find our hotel to your liking. Your comments about breakfast and the social were helpful and we will look over our options. Also, customer service is our number one priority and I will address with the staff the service you encountered.   All of our reviews are evaluated by management and your review is no exception.Your feedback is very important to us as this assists us in continually improving the service and facilities we have to offer to our guests. Thank you again for your comments. Your business is valued and we hope your future travel plans will continue to include IHG properties.

Summary: Stayed here for 2 weeks recently on our holiday to California. From the moment of check in to checking out it was great. All the staff were fantastic. Our room was on the 7th floor which was spacious and very clean. The fridge in the kitchen area was great for storing cold drinks in. We was contacted before we flew to california to tell us about the hotel refurbishments and there was plenty of signs up in the hotel. This had no impact on us at all. The room was very spacious with a kitchen area, sofa, large double bed and lovely clean bathroom. It was perfect for our needs. Breakfast which was included was lovely. The waffles that you made fresh yourself were delicious and definetely a favourite with us. Its location was excellent especially being an easy walk to Disneyland. And
Manager Response: Hello,  Thank you very much for your thoughtful words about our property and our staff.  We strive to provide wonderful customer service and it is inspiring when you reveal how much that service and welcome feeling means to you and your family.  Thanks again, and we hope to see you and your family again soon!  Jimmy Raynor Front Office Manager

Summary: We had a great family stay here on a Disneyland trip. The hotel staff was great at check in and eager to assist with any needs. The night staff was a bit less helpful to answer questions and provide assistance on surrounding area info. The remodeled rooms were nice, beds comfy and clean. The hot tub is nice and large, but could be warmer. The breakfast was decent with a lot of choices. The only inconvenience was the water turn off from 11-3pm due to construction. There were notices posted and it is understandable due to remodeling and they picked the least busy times for most park goers. Overall, we had a nice stay and look forward to return next year for our annual trip.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your feedback! I appreciate you taking the time to review our hotel, because our guests experience is our top priority. I apologize that the night staff did not properly assist you with your questions and I will look into this.   We hope to see you again soon!

Summary: The Staybridge Hotel has great service and its breakfast is good.  It's clean and the employees very friendly.  However, the beds and pillows are absolutely terrible!!!!!  Couldn't sleep.  We stayed at a Staybridge in Tulsa last month and they had the same pillows!!  Couldn't sleep.
Manager Response: Hello,  Thank you for the time you took to review our property.  I also that you very much for the positive words about the staff and our service.  I apologize for the terrible time you had sleeping on the sofa bed.  I will see about replacements that may be in need.  We hope you have a great day and please come stay with us again.

Summary: What a horrible experience!! I booked a suite for one night in this hotel. Although I entered to book on the 25th for some reason the website kept reverting to the 24th. I finally got it to accept the 25th, but did think it was a bit high for a Sunday night ($193 with tax).  On the way to the hotel I checked my laptop for the email confirmation and was shocked to see it was booked for the prior night! I called the hotel and they were very rude and condescending. They said I would have to pay full price for the second night since they held the room for the wrong night.. They didn't even take the time to understand as I explained what happened.  I am a very tech savvy person and book 100% of my rooms online.  They didn't even offer a discount (beyond AAA- as I had for the previous
Manager Response: Thank you for providing us with your valued feedback. I will be in contact with you regarding your experience.

Summary: Motel is nice but reservations were made well In advance but we were not advised there would be construction of a remodel going on during our stay until we checked in after 9+ hour drive with small children.  This is a temporary thing BUT when there is no water for a few hours a day (11am to 3 pm)  and with a potty training child it is an inconvenience. As is the beeper on the construction trucks and the noise of the remodel at nap time. I'm assuming the work is scheduled while most people would be at Disneyland but they didn't take into account families with smaller kids that go early, come back for nap time then go back to the park.  The shuttle we were advised about when booking is not a hotel shuttle it is run by a different company. While is is great it is an additional
Manager Response: Thank you very much for your time in reviewing our property.  Although I know renovations are always an inconvenience to us, we have tried to schedule major items at the most un-intrusive times.  Please come back and stay with us and see the finished product!  We look forward to seeing you soon!

Summary: Right from stepping through the doors the check in staff made us feel so welcome. We stayed for 11 nights so they got to know us pretty well, they helped us book taxis, recommended where to eat and shop, and made sure we had everything sorted all the time. Special mention to Rachel who checked us in, so friendly and helpful! The Manager Eric was also really quite amazing but all the staff were so great. Breakfast buffet was great but pretty basic, had everything you wanted but mabey not so much variety as some people may be used to. Our room was clean, modern and comfortable it was a home away from home on our 2 week visit to Anaheim. The pool and hot tub area is shared with the Holiday Inn next door but it was hardly busy and is open until 11pm i think so late evening swims to
Manager Response: Thank you very much for taking your time to review our property.  And thank you for the king words about our staff and management.  We look forward to seeing you again soon!  Jimmy Raynor Front Office Manager

Summary Heading: Good place to stay at if traveling with pets and young kids
Summary: This is a good place to stay at if you are traveling with pets or with young children.  Every room has a full size fridge, a stovetop, a microwave and a dish washer.  Also, your reservation comes with free breakfast.  We chose this hotel because we had to travel with our dog, you are allowed to leave your pet in the room unattended as long as you leave a sign outside so the workers do not come in.  Their pet fees are very reasonable.  If you choose this hotel because you wish to go to Disneyland, they are not within walking distance so you will have to either drive or take the shuttle.  There are no restaurants in this hotel either so for your lunch or dinner you will have to either cook in your room or eat out.  Overall the room was clean, spacious, and the rates were

We stayed in your hotel September 21st through the 25th your front staff was amazing especially the blonde lady and I think his name was Eric both were absolutely lovely ... Wasn't impressed with the construction nor the fact they started at 7am What the Heck even on a Saturday. .. told housekeeping I didn't need my room cleaned to come back to my room to find some guy in there then on to the bedding I bring my own blankets and to my surprise I found nasty brown stains underneath the top two blankets it was like the mattress was dirty they flipped it then made the bed only they didn't realize it would bleed out onto the sheets (just my theory, because who would use dirty sheets) Anyways I'd love to come back again but seriously disappointed because your 2 bedroom suite was
Manager Response: Dear Chantay W,  Thank you so much for your review of our hotel. I am pleased to hear that you liked the outstanding front office staff. Guest comfort and satisfaction are of the utmost concern to us and our hotel is committed to making every possible effort to provide comfortable, clean and friendly accommodations. I am sorry our hotel fell below your expectations with regard to the untidy mattress and housekeeping services. Please accept our sincere apologies for any inconvenience these issues may have caused you. The feedback we receive from our valued guests, like you, enables us to target problem areas.  We welcome any opportunity to improve.  We know you have many choices when it comes to lodging and we hope you will continue to choose IHG for your travel needs.  Sincerely,   Lera P Case Manager  IHGCare

Summary: I spent hours looking for a nice yet affordable hotel for our visit to Anaheim and Staybridge Suites definitely was the perfect hotel. It was close and centrally located to the places we wanted to visit (Disneyland, Aquarium of the Pacific) yet away from the crowds.  A beautiful pool area for enjoying the sun and large enough to swim a few laps.  The rooms were very spacious, clean, nicely furnished with comfortable beds.  The front desk staff on every shift was so much more than a smile and friendly hello.  They truly went out of their way to make our stay an exceptional one. From directions to recommendations to providing information about the area.  Breakfast was hot, tasty and plentiful. No parking or resort fee makes this the best value in the Disneyland area.  You can't go

The stay here was alright. Good to just lay your head down. When we got to our room the a/c was not working, the maintenance guy just looked at it and said it's fine. The temp went up two degrees, called front desk they then moved us. The second room had a few ants, curtains in living area did not close.
Manager Response: Dear staz42002,  Thank you for taking the time out of your day to write your review of our hotel. We are glad to hear that your overall stay was to your satisfaction. However, we truly regret that the air conditioning system in your room did not work well during your stay with us. Rest assured that this will be shared to the team to better improve the services that we deliver.  Again, we thank you for your comments and for choosing us for your lodging needs.  Sincerely,  Christian C. Case Manager IHGCare

Summary Heading: The breakfast is what got me...my bad
Summary: We paid a little extra by staying here for a family trip to Disneyland for my birthday just because there was breakfast. We were trying to cut costs by doing so, but we ended up eating at the parks anyway because we couldn't choke down the food. It started in one room, moved into a little closet sized room the next. Food was cold or undercooked or service-ware was dirty. Not the way I wanted to start the day. I stay at IHG properties exclusively and I really expected better. Would have been a 5 rating if not for that. The room was incredibly comfortable and the staff very friendly! I'm sure it's better now that the renovations are done. I may try this place again.

We got the two bedroom suite. It was clean and very reasonable price. This included breakfast and midweek dinner snacks. That saves lots of money. Everyone was very helpful. Great staff. It was convenient to Disneyland and other great places.

Summary Heading: Always a pleasure to stay here!!
Summary: We stayed here initially a few years ago and come back every time.   This time we came to participate in the disneyland half marathon. Staff was attentive to our needs and requests everyone was super pleasant. They even helped us locate the restaurant we usually order from but never remember the name.   Always a pleasure staying here with  family and friends.

Our family of four (2 adult children) stayed 4 nights here recently and enjoyed the facilities and the sleep we got. Beds were comfortable and living spaces good to spread out in. The pool was good to refresh ourselves after pounding the streets in Disneyland and the laundry helpful too. We did not use the kitchen, but it would have been more than adequate for us. The gym was small and lacking a range of choices that we had seen in a previous Staybridge hotel  Breakfast was nothing special, the first day there was bacon, but never seen again, a very limited range of cereals and some fruits.  The shuttle to,Disneyland was good, but the return to the hotel was patchy at best, we just missed one shuttle to return and waited an hour for the next one. Overall we enjoyed our time

It's a good sign when you can pour yourself a cup of lemon-infused water while you check in.  We enjoyed our stay here.  Even though we had to pay to wash clothes, we didn't mind.  The hotel is so family friendly.  We enjoyed the breakfast daily.

This hotel is supposedly about to get renovated, so this review probably won't be current for too long. Friendly staff, nice pool area, spacious room and kitchen facilities convenient, though rooms were dated. We found it amusingly awkward that we had to sign a "no marijuana form" upon check-in. Once we were on our way to our room, we smelled the aforementioned substance quite well in the corridors. Not that we were bothered by it, it was just an ironic coincidence. Breakfast had enough options, only annoyance was styrofoam plates with plastic cutlery (what happened to the "green" concept, which they apply to requesting guests to reuse their towels etc.? Would return however, it was a comfortable stay.

Our nine-night stay at the Staybridge Suites in Anaheim was excellent; we were warmly welcomed upon our arrival, and the hospitality extended to us throughout the stay was consistent. The staff is friendly.  The location is a plus; the hotel is near Angel Stadium, Disneyland, the Anaheim Garden Complex, and a variety of restaurants.  The Orange Outlets are nearby also; you might try BJ's for dinner.  We ate there twice, and the food is excellent . . . particularly the deep dish pizza.  We used the ART (Anaheim Resort Transit) often . . . that is very easy to use and is not expensive.  The rooms in the hotel are spacious, the beds are comfortable, and the breakfast was consistently good throughout our stay.  We enjoyed the grilled hamburgers one evening as well.  The hotel is

Loved this place, stayed in a 2 bedroom and was large enough to accommodate 4 adults and 2 children, although going through renovations, free breakfast was a bonus. Outdoor entertainment area was superb with free bbq's

This was a great hotel, comfortable beds and nice rooms. It has all the practical things you need, like a fridge with freezer, TV,  Internett, a small kitchen with microwave, coffee maker and a stove, hairdryer, bath articles etc etc..  Friendly staff and a nice pool.  But it was one negative thing, we had problems with the water. One day it was just so warm water in the shower that I could not even take a shower. And the other day it was only cold, so I could not take a shower that day eather..

Firstly before the negative comments, I would say that there is a great team on the reception desk (special mention to Pam). The hotel is clearly going through so major renovation work at the moment which effects the minimum standards that people should expect. We were unfortunate as a group of six that 1. Hair dryer did not work, 2. Phone did not work and 3. door lock had to be repaired and broke again. I suppose things could happen to anyone, what was more concerning was that the building work started before 8:30am and on several occasions our sink and toilet were blocked. Unfortunately the inexperienced plumbers used could not correct things on the first attempt.
Manager Response: Dear Andy W,  We appreciate your time in writing this review. We regret that you did not fully enjoy your stay with us due to the ongoing renovations at the hotel. Please accept our sincere apologies for any inconvenience these issues may have caused you and your family. We value your feedback as they enable us to further improve the quality and services we offer and to surpass the very high standards our guests expect.   Again, thank you for your comments and hope that you will give us another chance to provide you with an exceptional stay in the future once our renovations are complete.   Sincerely,  Christian C. Case Manager IHGCare

Summary: we checked in and they had our room ready early.  they had a little bday package for my daughter who was turning 11.  the room was cute we called it our cottage.  it was a queen studio.  the little kitchenette was perfect, the bed was perfect and the shower was good.  #1 complaint was the tv channels.  NO DISNEY it was more geared towards adults and well we stayed there with kids.  The pool was fabulous nice and cold since it was 100 degrees and they served  alcohol and fresh made pizza and brought it to you.  the breakfast was little but good. the girls loved the fresh fruit and yogurt.  I will return

Summary Heading: Superb hospitality from a superb team.
Summary: Sadly this was the last property we stayed in on our vacation before heading back to LAX for the long journey to London, so none of us were exactly in the holiday mood. But from the moment we checked in to the moment we left we were cosseted and looked after by Jimmy and his wonderful team. I apologise for not knowing the other peoples names but the blond lady who checked us in was simply charming. This, honestly, is a little gem of a hotel ideally placed for Disney and other Anaheim attractions and shopping. The first thing that struck me was the willingness of the staff to engage the guests and involve them in the "events" taking place. On the evening we stayed, there was free beer and snacks in the reception area, which was very welcome indeed. Your stay will also include a

Summary Heading: Decent place close to - but not too close to - Disneyland
Summary: Stayed here because we were in town for a basketball tournament.  There is a breakfast buffet and a happy hour (beware, the wine at happy hour is two buck chuck :-) - Breakfast is OK - nothing to write home about, but decent enough.  There are also washer/dryers ($1.50 per load) but very welcome to wash out the teenage boys basketball uniforms!  Outdoor space is nice - we had a group dinner outside -  Rooms are fine - clean.  Staff is nice.  There is a shuttle nearby that will take you to Disneyland if you want to go - or to Downtown Disney for dinner if you don't want to do the park.  Anaheim is essentially about Disneyland or conferences etc - so we weren't expecting the proverbial Ritz, but the Staybridge was exactly what we needed for several families traveling together for

Summary Heading: Exceeded my expectations... a hidden gem
Summary: Jimmy at the front desk was absolutely delightful.  Ana impressed us with assistance to our room. Eric was helpful with a late checkout. This place is a hidden gem. Although,  not walking distance to the Disney parks, the ART (Anaheim Resort Transportation) picks up right next door at their sister hotel (Holiday Inn). It is worth buying a pass, especially if there over an extended stay. The breakfast was wonderful.  I honestly wished I had more room in my stomach to eat every item they had laid out. I'd even consider recommending this place just on the breakfast alone. This was one of the most well laid out setups I have seen throughout my travels. Very clean and inviting. Staff is wonderful and all very friendly.  This is definitely a place to consider when you have 4-8 people

Summary Heading: Great for large families and extended stays
Summary: We went we went with family and friends and got the two bedroom two bath suite. We split the cost and it was so reasonable. We had a full kitchen two full baths living area and two great size bedrooms.  The free breakfast in the morning was very good with lots of choices. Parking was free and there is plenty available. They have tennis courts and a nice pool area. We did not use the laundry facilities but they looked nice.  The resort is close to Disneyland and has good access to the freeway if you're visiting Knottsberry farm or Universal Studios is well.  They have an art shuttle pick up that is over at the holiday Inn resort which is right next-door.

We stayed in this hotel a year ago in May while on a vacation to Disneyland. I loved this hotel. We stayed in a 2 bedroom suite with 2 adults and 6 kids. The room was very nice, clean, and spacious. The beds were comfortable. The free breakfast buffet was better than most. There is a full sized fridge and stovetop and the cupboards are stocked with dishes. The pool was nice and big. You should not plan on walking to Disneyland. It is far and not easy to navigate. My kids absolutely loved it here. I want to say that the staff were very good to us. One of our kids got sick on the last night we were there and they came and took care of it, replaced our bedding very quickly even though it was 2 in the morning. But mostly I want to thank them for what happened the next day as we were

Summary Heading: Great place for a family stay
Summary: We stayed 8 nights in July, and loved it. I had been worried after reading negative reviews, but after our visit I guess there are just some very picky people doing reviews. We were upgraded from a one bedroom to a two bedroom suite, on the second floor, facing the pool. The staff were very friendly, there was no noise from the pool, and no hassles with the bill. The carpet was a little tired, but the room was great, microwave, dishwasher. The breakfast got old after a fee days, but that would be to expected, it was still there, and free. The free beer and snacks on Tues, Weds, and Thursday were great - all we needed after a day out and about. We loved our stay, and would certainly stay again.
Manager Response: Dear KiwiBobCambodia,  Thank you for taking time out of your busy day to leave us a candid review. I am very pleased that you enjoyed your stay. I also appreciate and wish to thank you for the kind words intended for the staff. On the other hand, I am sorry that you had some issues with breakfast. The feedback we receive from our valued guests, like you, enables us to target problem areas and take the necessary actions to ensure similar situations can be avoided in the future. We appreciate the candid feedback we receive and welcome any opportunity to improve.   Sincerely,  Karen G. Case Manager IHGCare

Summary: This was the first time our family stayed at this hotel. We had such a great time, that we have booked again for the summer. All of the staff were professional, friendly and welcoming. Any requests that we had (extra blankets etc) were handled immediately. There were some upgrades being done, but we didn't find them disruptive. Our room was the perfect size, and we were grateful to have a kitchen with a large fridge. It saves a lot of money on vacation to have a kitchen. The complimentary buffet breakfast and social (Tues to Thurs) were clean, and there was a nice variety. We would especially like to thank Kym for being extra helpful and kind to our family. It was nice to see the Manager, Kym interacting with her staff and customers in a friendly and welcoming manner. Thank you

My family and I stayed here recently during a visit to Disneyland. Rooms were comfortable and location was very convenient having a stop on the Anaheim Resort Transit buses. Good selections on their complimentary breakfast buffet. Pool needed some cleaning but not bad. Would stay here again and recommend.

My family stayed at the Staybridge Suites for 4 days while we visited Disney. When we first arrived,  I was initially disappointed that we were off to the side of the freeway and a bit isolated.  However,  we were able to walk to restaurants fairly quickly (15 mins). The hotel staff couldn't have been more helpful.  They made us feel right at home from the moment we entered. The kids loved the pool and heated whirlpool. Both very clean. The free breakfast buffet was an added bonus that we didn't know about previously that saved us a ton on breakfast. Excellent experience. Would definitely stay here again. Thanks to all of the staff for going the extra mile!

This was our base over spring break at D-land. Husband and I had one bedroom + bath, our 2 elementary-aged children chose to camp out in the sitting room at night, and their auntie stayed in the other bedroom + bath. Perfect for us. Not new but very, very clean. The pool and jacuzzi are large and shared with the neighboring property. Our children had as much fun in the pool area making new friends as they did at D-land and CA Adv.! A shuttle, also shared with the neighboring property, takes you straight to the park without any other stops. Outstanding! Definitely get a shuttle pass. So easy. We cooked a spaghetti dinner in the kitchenette one night. Everything we needed was provided (aside from food obvi). One burner didn't work, but it wasn't a big deal. I suspect most folks

We booked this hotel via "Priceline" so it was an unintentional gold mine.  Having never been there, we were a little nervous.  The hotel was nice, the room was very nice and had all the comforts of home.  The staff was friendly and helpful especially at the front desk, thank you Rachel!  The pool was nice as was the spa.  The entire experience was fantastic.  The only "issue" we had was the noise from the freeway- not much you can do about that but with the windows closed, we could barely hear the traffic.  Breakfast in the morning had everything you could want.  Overall this hotel is nice and we'll stay there again.

Summary Heading: Close enough to Disneyland; but it's an older hotel
Summary: Overall it was good value for what we paid -- cheaper than HJ or BW. But it's an older hotel and has that 80's feel. We were spending all day in Disneyland so it really does matter to us as long as we can sleep. It was so close to Disneyland; a few minutes bus ride with the bus stop right in front of the hotel.   The hotel was under construction at the time. It was pretty dusty as they are tiling the floors and fixing up common rooms. The breakfast was ok, mass production food with lining up like in the army, but it was good enough for us. The hotel workers were polite and very hard working.   However, i got to say something about people taking hotel food. A cup of coffee or a banana on-the-go i can understand; but i saw people loading food into their own containers and filling
Manager Response: Dear TellyJam,  We appreciate you taking the time to tell us what a positive experience you had in such a memorable moment. We are pleased to know that the location is convenient for you. We also thank you for commending our hardworking staff. Your kind recognition will be very well received. However, we apologize if the overall look of our property was not up to the standards you were expecting. We welcome any opportunity to improve thus your feedback is of great help.  We hope you will continue to choose IHG for your future travel needs.  Warm Regards,  Ingrid V Case Manager IHGCare

Summary: We stayed here with a toddler and baby for 5 days.  This is a family-oriented hotel - mostly because of Disneyland.  The hotel is currently under lots of construction; while there the lobby/hallway/elevator area were being retiled.  This means you will hear the tile cutter and smell the tile adhesive during breakfast and during the day.  The hotel kept all the hallway windows open to help alleviate the smell, but I did not like having my young children exposed to it while eating in the morning.   The breakfast area leaves a lot to be desired: quite crowded and messy.  I believe it is being served in a space that is not normally meant for breakfast buffets.  They served scrambled eggs, DIY waffles, toast, muffins, cereal, fruit, yogurt and either bacon/sausage daily. The rooms
Manager Response: Thank you for your review of the hotel. I apologize for the inconvenience it may have caused. We tried not to inconvenience our guest too much by only working on the renovations between certain hours so that it did not affect the guest experience too much. I do apologize for the issue with your room and will be looking into it and forwarding this onto the appropriate. We will be finishing our lobby renovations within the next few weeks and will be able to open up the breakfast area. Thank you once again for your review

Summary: Stayed here for a last minute business trip. Got in very late but head a wonderful experience with their reception desk. Low deposit and great room rate. Room was a kitchenette suite & was clean and nicely appointed. A/C worked very well. Even though there was remodeling going on in breakfast room adjacent to the check in desk the hotel & staff were great. We will recommend as well as stay again.

Summary Heading: Fastest INTERNET ever !!! Great hotel great staff
Summary: Finally a hotel the lets guests experience the full force of the internet. Hotel is under renovation so the breakfast was messy and uninviting the rooms are older and waiting for a renovation this year ..lots of parking easy to get to ..I enjoyed my stay

We just spent two nites here while visiting Disney.  The room was nice, clean and well appointed. Staff was helpful.  Mybonly complaint was the breakfast  …  crazy and kind of messy.  They are renovating the lobey and breakfast area so hopefully it will improve.

After much research to find the perfect hotel to stay in during our trip to Anaheim for the Tinkerbell Half Marathon, we found the Staybridge Suites.  We definitely got lucky.  The location was not perfect but the fact that the ART bus system picked up right outside the door made it great.  The staff made it even better.  I can not say enough about how friendly and helpful the staff was.  I would absolutely recommend this hotel to anyone as well as make reservations here again.

Stayed here a couple of years ago during spring break with the family.  I have no complaints what so ever.  And we are now currently planning another trip the Disney Land later this year and will be booking a room here. Last year stayed at the Grand California for an anniversary trip and wish we had went back to Stay bridge.  Much better value for your money.  Stayed in a 1 bedroom King suite. The bed was comfortable.  The kids stayed on the pull out couch.  The room size was not the biggest but is was adequate  for a family of 4. Bathroom was standard hotel bathroom. It was clean and everything worked.  The full sized fridge in the room was a real bonus.  We never did use the cook top or cook any meals in the room but it was definitely a plus.  To have that option at one of the

Summary Heading: Staybridge rooms, but hotel crowded with small kids
Summary: Staybridge suites... you know what to expect, but this one is near Disney area, and probably because of this is overcrowded with big families. Also, my bad lack was to be there during a reconstruction, which is not the best. Very poor disappointing food during 'Social". Staff is nice and helpful.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review of the hotel. I apologize if the hotel may seem overcrowded. The hotel is situated near the Disneyland Resort and a lot of travelers that are here are for Disneyland. Our breakfast area is currently under renovations and because of that the dining area may have seems smaller. We will be looking into new food options once the renovations of our breakfast area has been completed. Thank you once again for your review

Summary: Stayed here for 4 nights in April to visit the Disneyland resort. Check in was quick and easy and staff had a lot of info to hand for local restaurants, shops, Disney opening/show times, ART bus times etc.   Room was clean and comfortable, with free (fast) WiFi. Housekeeping carry out a "light touch" cleaning each day which included making the bed, cleaning the bathroom and fresh towels.     We traveled as a couple, but we could see how this hotel is perfect for families. Our room had a kitchen with all the crockery and cutlery you could need, including a full size refrigerator and dishwater. We also took advantage of the self-service laundry on the ground floor.  Hotel is undergoing a lot of renovation at the moment, but they have made adjustments wherever possible and didn't

We stayed here for two nights in April 2015 in a one bedroom suite. Location is right off the highway and there are some restaurants and convenience stores fairly close by.  Our room was nice - pretty standard - and comfortable.  The breakfast was decent. It seems like they are renovating the breakfast room (there were a few other renovations going on in the main hallway on the first floor - almost seemed like they had had water damage) because it seemed to be a makeshift table with the food on it but the dining area is spacious.  The pool is very nice and there is a hot tub, bathrooms and a small game room that is shared with the Holiday Inn next door. We used the pool/hot tub even though it was fairly cool out. Pool was heated just enough for the kids to spend some time in it.

Our family (Grandparents, parents, a three year old and a one year old) stayed here for one week and had a fantastic time! The staff was wonderful and very accommodating. We arrived a couple hours early and were able to check in with no problem. We had a two bedroom suite that was beyond our expectations. We didn't bring the porta crib figuring on baby co sleeping with mommy and daddy but we were very thrilled to find out they had cribs available for no charge. A very kind man brought it to our room all made up and ready for bed time.  Breakfast had something for everyone. Scrambled eggs and bacon with waffles were a hit with the adults and the three year old loved the fruit loops! There was plenty of sitting room and lots of families smiling as they got ready for their day at

Summary Heading: They did not follow my payment instruction.
Summary: We stayed for 3 nights. The room was ok. You can see that it is an old hotel with some renovations but it wasn't dirty or smelly. Breakfast is decent, although during our 3 days of stay the only variation was the alternating of one item (bacon or sausage) and by day 3 I already got tired of it. Pool area was nice. I used their laundry room which worked out fine.  My problem is that I made reservations for two rooms, one for my family and the other for relatives, and upon checking in, we presented two different credit cards. I remember they even took note of the card holder name and such. However when I got back from trip both rooms were charged to my credit card (the guaranteed card at the time of making reservations). I phoned them and to my surprise they did not even have the
Manager Response: Public acknowledgement:  Dear traceyleea,  First of all let me thank you for taking time to write your review. Your comments are highly valuable to us and will assist us in our continuous efforts to maintain and improve the service level we aim for. It is nice to know that the rooms received are up to your par. However, it is regrettable if the services received particularly the charges to your card fell below your expectations. Rest assured that your comments will be reviewed by our team and take actions accordingly. We value your feedback as this assists us in continually improving the services and facilities we offer to our guests and to avoid similar situations in the future.  Once again, thank you for staying with us and hope this experience will not deter you from giving us another opportunity to serve you better in the future.  Sincerely,  Divina P. Case Manager IHGCare

Summary Heading: Nice Hotel but they have security issues in the parking lot.
Summary: Our family chose this hotel to stay for our Disneyland trip.  Upon arriving the hotel was very nice outside and inside.  We chose a 3 room suite which fit our family great.  Some areas of the room are starting to get old such as carpet bumps and damaged furniture, but was still reasonably nice.  Each day our room was entered by the cleaning staff and the beds were made, garbage emptied and the towels replaced.  However, we had to call each day to have new soap bars brought up. Breakfast was nice but not wonderful.  They also were remodeling the food area the second day we were there, and the space was not large enough to accommodate the number of people trying to eat.  However, I do understand it was a temporary situation.  My biggest complaint and the biggest reason for the 2
Manager Response: Thank you for your review, I apologize for the issue during your stay. All of our reviews are evaluated by management and our review is no exception. We will be retraining our staff and making improvements to prevent this from happening again. Thank you once again for your review.

Summary: Hotel is perfect driving distance from Disney, Garden Walk, and I-5.  I have 2 kids who stayed in the Bedroom and I stayed on pullout.  All very comfortable. Plenty of bedding, towels, and room amenities.  Housekeeping does clean every day, despite the claim of light housekeeping.  Amazing staff !! Refurbishments of bfast area did not hamper morning bfast or weeknight snacks.  Pool and Hot Tub are huge and not overcrowded - share with Holiday Inn - open until 11 pm.  Guest Laundry and Gym are 24hrs.  Excellent AAA rate for all I got.  Von's delivers groceries, too.  I'll always look for a Staybridge from now on !!!

Summary Heading: Two room suites the best option for kids
Summary: We stayed in the Anaheim resort Staybridge suites hotel during Spring Break. Taking two teens and a 10 year old. This hotel was comfortable with  a king bed in our room two full beds in the other and a fold out couch bed. All the rooms had TV's and beds were super comfortable, okay... maybe not the fold out, but fine for a 10 year old who was almost too excited about Disneyland to sleep.  It had a kitchen area with full size refrigerator, and all dishes and cooking appliance's you would need. It was quiet and they served a good breakfast every morning. ( Saves $$$ because food at the park is terrible and EXTEMELY EXPENSIVE) Some evenings they had snacks and soda, beer, or wine. It is really close to Disney parks. Just across the highway, or we used the ACT transit bus that makes

We stayed here for 4 nights during Spring Break as part of a Costco Vacation package.  The hotel is easy to access from the freeway.  We arrived before check in time so our room was not ready yet but we hung out at the pool to kill some time.  There is no food concession at the pool however you can order food from local restaurants and they can deliver to you directly at the pool.  Towels are available poolside and is self service - if they run out proceed to the front desk and they can page for more towels (which we had to do).  The room was very clean and I really appreciated having a mini kitchen to store our snacks and drinks.    The hotel is deserted during the day as most guests are at the parks.  It's a good time to do laundry in their laundry room - you'll have it to

Summary Heading: Convenient to Honda Center, good value (but not great)
Summary: We stayed at Staybridge Suites Anaheim for two nights between arriving in LA and leaving on a cruise.  We stayed because of its proximity to Disneyland and the Honda Center (Anaheim Ducks).  We paid C$412 (all in, including taxes – approx. US$330) for a 1-bedroom suite for two nights.  The room was a good size, with a king bed in the bedroom, a pull-out couch in the living room and a relatively full kitchen.  The one odd thing about the room was that the bathroom was an ensuite off the separate bedroom, which wasn’t super-convenient with our teenage son sleeping on the pull-out couch, who had to come through our room to use it.  I appreciated that the wi-fi was included in the room rate.  I hate being gouged for that type of extra cost.  It’s like being charged for shampoo or
Manager Response: Dear AdvisorKing,  We strive to give great and impressive service to all of our guests and it makes us happy to read we exceeded your expectations. We look forward to welcoming you back to our establishment. Once again thank you for the wonderful and kind words of praise.  Sincerely,  Orlando A. Case Manager IHGCare

Summary: Hotel suites  are really good for family. Rooms have kitchenette, micro wave and fridge.  15 minutes shuttle ride to disney land. Breakfast area was bit congested but food was ok. Close to the outlet mall.

upon my arrival to this hotel I was taking out of my car my luggage when I looked up and noticed and hotel employees spotted me coming in and had a luggage carrier is waiting for me I was already in love with the place wants that deed was done because I'm so used to scrambling around a hotel looking for a carrier. once I checked in and got to my room I realized I was separated to a two bedroom suite which had all the fixings a laundry basket to use in the all free laundry facility there was an excellent continental breakfast which had everything from hash browns to bagels to pancakes to fruit to oatmeal to waffles and everything in between. I wasn't in the sea sweet kind of gal but now Staybridge is slowly winning me over. if you stay here you will not be disappointed. And the

Had a great time here. Good size room. Tidy apartment. Big fridge. Very friendly staff. Socials on tue to thurs was great too- free small feed and beer/wine. Breakfast was great with lots to choose from. Short transit to disneyland and not far from great restaurants and outlets. Would definitely stay here again.

We just returned from another trip to Disneyland.   Pros: 1.The hotel is about a mile from Disneyland. We didn't walk but I heard others at the hotel say they walked there. We took the shuttle and got to Disneyland in about 10 min.  2. The staff is very friendly. They were all helpful. They got to know us a greeted us by name as we walked in and out.  3. The swimming pool is lots of fun. It is heated and shaped in Mickey ears.  4. You do not need to eat out. We only ate out once on the whole trip and that is because we used the money we saved to go to Goofy's Kitchen.  5. Free parking   Cons: 1. Our room was a little dirty. I am not very picky but there was hair in my shower and trash stuck to the wall. 2. The manager dinner could be a little small for some people. We've stayed

We just spent 4 nights here to visit Disneyland. This hotel was so great. The breakfast every morning was good. Coffee, waffles, and bacon all very tasty. Managers reception Tuesday eve was very nice with beer on tap or wine if you choose.  We utilized the shuttle bus next door at Holiday Inn. Literally only a few steps away.  Pool was open til 11 each evening with a huge hot tub.  If you chose to drive to Disney it's not very far and learning the routes is easy. The $17 fee to park is good for that entire day. Come and go as you please. Just show the ticket.  The room was clean and had a nice fully equipped kitchen. We stocked the fridge and froze bottles of water to take into the park. This had two bedrooms and two bathrooms. We had 5 adults and a baby. Free crib use. Nice

I was looking for a hotel with free parking, free breakfast, and suites for a reasonable price. We didn't need a bed in the 2nd rm, just space to put a travel crib (they offer cribs but we prefer to bring our own so it's familiar). The 1 BR suite with 2 doubles worked perfectly for us. We had 3 adults in our group & 1 toddler. We bought $5 day passes from the front desk and took the bus from the Holiday Inn next door to Disneyland and came back for toddler's bedtime. Then one adult stayed with the toddler while 2 went back to Disney. The suite was clean and comfortable. Shower had good water pressure and the hair dryer worked well. It was also nice to have a full size fridge. The 2nd room allowed us to have the toddler asleep in the living rm while the adult could be awake in

Summary Heading: Nice and clean. No parking fee and free food!
Summary: I have stayed here several times now. I really like it. I have never had any problems with staff. They are welcoming, friendly and helpful. I used to have a different "favorite" hotel in the area but changed to Staybridge. I changed when the other began charging the standard $15.00 nightly parking fee that is charged by most of the hotels in the area. The rooms all have a full kitchen and I have always found this place clean, in working order and the beds comfortable. I am realistic about this hotel. It is not a fancy place but certainly does the job for visiting disney with a family or even for a budget conscious couple!  I really like the breakfast buffet here. It saves me so much money. It is plentiful with all the standard fair. They have  eggs, breakfast meat and different
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review your stay with us here at Staybridge Suites. I thank you for your kind words and are happy to hear you've come back to visit us. We realize you have many choices when it comes to lodging and we sincerely appreciate your business and look forward to your next visit.

Summary Heading: Back again because it's a family favorite
Summary: Our family has traveled to the Disneyland Area for over 30 trips in the last five years. This hotel is the unanimous vote for several great reasons. Free: free breakfast (don't arrive in a hurry it can be packed), free parking, free movie and game borrowing at front desk, free BBQ's just ask the front desk, and free wifi. Laundry is now coin operated but at least they still have it. The gym and pool are clean and the in room kitchen is convenient (no oven) Beds are comfortable and large rooms sleep 8. King in the master with attached bath, 2 double beds in the 2nd bedroom with attached master, and pull out sofa in living room. Buy your passes at the front desk for the ART (Anaheim Resort Transit) for shuttle service to the park and back. Great take up restaurants as well. Love

After a long old flight we arrived at staybridge, checking in was smooth and quick, not too much chat, just polite conversation, the receptionist offered any help if we needed it, The two bedroom apartment is sufficient even though the living area is small. beds are very comfy and very welcomed! Two bathrooms of reasonable size. The pool area is lovely, very relaxing with a great Jacuzzi area.  On Tuesday Wednesday and Thursday, the hotel offers light snacks and drinks, what a bonus and a really nice touch, we really appreciated that. There is a b-b-q area for your own use. breakfast is ample, always enough for everyone. every 2nd day thy offer sausages or bacon. there is a waffle maker, fruit, cereals,  breads for toasting, yoghurts, juices and coffee. Considering you could go
