Our family of seven stayed here while playing at Disneyland.   Rooms were clean and very confortable.  Shuttle bus-stops in front of Holiday hotel next door.  Staybridge had a great breakfast every morning.  Three of the nights we stayed they served dinner down stairs.  Hot dogs, chips, salad, and ice cold beer.  Another night was pulled pork.  Last night we had nacho's and Chili. Again we had choice of beer, wine, soda's, coffee, juice.  Swimming pool was clean and we'll maintained.  This is my second stay here and won't be my last.  You won't be disappointed.

Summary Heading: A fine place, especially the location
Summary: We enjoyed our stay here and would stay again. There's a stop for the bus to Disneyland at the hotel next door, and it takes just minutes to get to the Magic Kingdom. The breakfast spread well done. Best thing about this hotel is the lobby area, which is large and open and full of tables for gobbling breakfast.

Summary Heading: Great Extended Stay Hotel for Disneyland!!
Summary: My family of 3 stayed in the 1 bedroom suite for 1 week while visiting Disneyland!  We very much enjoyed our stay at Staybridge Suites!!  Here are few tidbits about our stay: --Breakfast-the buffet items rotated from day to day and there was always plenty to choose from.  We thought the food was yummy and enjoyed the variety of fresh fruit.  Disney tip-we made the small waffles then put them into ziplock baggies for my son to eat at Disney, we also took along fruit for the day as well.  It does get crowded during breakfast, so eat early if you can! --WiFi--the hotel offered FREE wifi and we found that it worked well!  --Laundry--it is coin operated and was not that busy, bring along your detergent --ART Stop-the stop is located next door at the Holiday Inn.  The bus does run

If you are planning on only visiting disney land, this is your hotel. They have a shuttle that leaves every 20 minutes and is only $5 for a daily pass! Included breakfast is included delicious eggs and bacon, waffles or bagels! Great quality. If you are there on a "social" night, you will have the option to have complimentary dinner (hotdogs, burgers, meatballs or something along those lines) also wine and soft drinks are included on these nights. We loved it! In terms of what's around the hotel, we never did venture further than disney land but there are a lot of Ihops around. :)

We stayed for 4 nights. My business partner and I shared a 2 bed appt ... Just perfect for our needs  The convention centre is a 20 min walk so this is not too far but taxi is available if you are lazy !! ... On top of being accessible you are a ten minute walk to some great restaurants, bars and shops including Cheesecake Factory and bubba gumps.  Location great for Disney (just take into account the walk as noted) , hotel is clean and great value for money and best of all is the welcome and friendly staff ( in particular Pam who just could it do enough for us )   When we will go back here for the next convention, we will not hesitate to return to this hotel   Thanks to all at Staybridge suites for being so caring and helpful  6 stars !!!
Manager Response: Hello Tim H!!!  We thank you for your kind words and are very pleased that you had a great time staying with us here at Staybridge Suites. We strive into providing our guests with an exceptional experience and I am happy to hear we were able to do that for you.  We look forward to your return and thank you again!

Summary: Stayed here at Staybridge for 4 nights so we could enjoy 3 days of Disneyland fun.  We had a 1 bedroom suite - so 1 king sized bed in a bedroom & a pull out sofa bed for the kids in the lounge room. (We always sleep better when we're not all in the 1 bedroom).  The beds were comfy and the breakfast in the mornings was great.  The ART bus service to Disneyland came every 20mins so never much of a wait to get to Disneyland (& it's a short ride - only 1 other stop on this route).  There was a kitchen in our room but not that easy to buy food unless you have a car, but the restaurant next door is good & reasonably priced.  We'd happily stay there again.
Manager Response: Hello!  Thank you for your kind words! We are pleased to hear you enjoyed your stay! We hope to see you again in the future!

Summary Heading: Get some customer service training for front desk
Summary: Charged twice and front desk seemed more intent with arguing that we hadn't been (despite us having bank statements showing we had), after 3 days of trying we finally decided to email all the managers we could find online which finally confirmed we had been and a credit was organised. I realise the front desk may not have access to this information but instead of trying to argue the point with the customer they should be at least pretending to be concerned and saying they will get management to sort out ASAP.  Breakfast although is free is not recommended unless powdered eggs is your thing, also they use plastic plates and cups to save having to wash a few dishes without a recycling bin in site, great for the environment!  But is close to Disneyland and not bad value for money
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review your hotel stay. We greatly appreciate you  taking the time to bring this matter to our attention, and apologize on how the situation was handled. I assure you we will address this with our staff.  We realize you have many choices when it comes to lodging and we sincerely appreciate your business.

Summary: Wow, this is family accommodation at its best! The rooms are quite spacious with a separate lounge room and full kitchen.  The bus stop is literally next door to take you to Disneyland each day and our room had a great view of the fireworks which was a lovely surprise on the first night at this hotel. Staff on the front desk were amazing!!! We arrived a touch early and our room wasn't quite ready so they directed us to the change rooms and immediately provided me with a key to the pool. They held our luggage and ordered take away pizza for us to have by the pool while we waited. The pool/spa area is quite large and has a bar serving economical meals and drinks. As with all Staybridge Suites (that I'm aware of) they had a social night a couple of nights a week which provided
Manager Response: Hello Hayleyh2379  Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel! We appreciate your kind words and are happy to hear you had a wonderful stay! We look forward to seeing you again if your travels bring you back our way

Summary: Hotel is clean and staff is friendly.  Breakfast was very good.  They are strict on the hours so if you plan to eat when they close, you will be not allowed to get food.  For weekends the breakfast is served at 7:30 which is late if you plan to be at the park when it opens.
Manager Response: Hello Seth,  Thank you for your review. I apologize that the breakfast buffet closed promptly at the designated time. I have spoken to the appropriate department to keep the breakfast area open a bit longer past the closing time. Thank you again for your review and we hope to see you again soon.

Summary: On our road trip Anaheim was the location we were going to stay the longest. This meant that the choice of hotel was important. Staybridge Suites offered at a reasonable price, a two bedroomed suite, useful when you have two kids, a small kitchen, free parking, free breakfast, free wi-fi and a free use of a washing machine/dryer room. Useful when you are in the middle of an almost three week road trip.  The alternatives we considered was the Embassy Suites and Ayres Hotel. The Ayres only had the one bedroom and Embassy had a daily charge for parking but I knew it would have a better breakfast after staying at the chain in Las Vegas.  Check in was easy, we had a nice sized room. The main bedroom had two Queen sized beds and we could see the Disney fireworks from our bedroom. The

Our family of 5 stayed from December 17th to December 21st. Check in was perfect, we arrived early around 2pm I believe, even though check in is at 4pm the let us check in. The young lady at the desk was incredibly nice. She made even my teenagers feel comfortable. We stayed in the one bedroom suite (2 full size beds and pull out couch.) it was very roomy. We stayed here before about 2 years ago and was what we remembered. They serve a light meal for dinner and drinks W-TH. We only took advantage of that on Thursday which was nacho bar night. The free breakfast is a little chaotic but more than filling for a day in the park. My children used the pool but we quickly learned it is not heated. I was a little disappointed at how expensive it was to use the Laundry facilities as the

Summary Heading: Excellent, Friendly Staff & Well maintained Rooms
Summary: We had a great time staying here for our Disneyland trip December 2014 with a family of 7 (not because of Disney either). The room was all in working order and very comfortable (the pillows were even decent). I've stayed in a lot of hotels and you can tell when the staff does a good job cleaning and maintaining, here they do. Also they were incredibly friendly, helpful, and courteous. I would stay here again for certain, I wouldn't even look anywhere else in Anaheim. The breakfast was great every day as well! We caught the ART bus over to Disney and home each day to avoid parking.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for taking the time to write a review regarding your hotel stay with us here at Staybridge Suites. I would also like to thank you for your kind words. I am happy you had a wonderful stay and will come back again to see us when in the Anaheim Resort Area. We look forward to seeing you again!

Summary: My daughter's family & myself stayed at the Staybridge for 5 nights as we travelled to Universal Studios & Disney Land. They upgraded our original room to accomodate the 6 of us and it was just wonderful! All of the staff were very polite and helpful with all of our many questions. The "continental" breakfast should be called a gourmet buffet- it was amazing.
Manager Response: Thank you for reviewing your hotel stay here with us at Staybridge Suites. I am happy you had a wonderful vacation and that we were able to upgrade you and your family so you had more space. We hope to see you and your family again if your travels bring you out our way.

Summary: We booked a two bedroom two bathroom stay for a family of five and were totally happy with the rooms. First bedroom had a king size bed and the other two king doubles . The sofa bed in the hall was also comfortable. Bathrooms had bathtub and the toiletries were adequate. Towels were supplied abundantly . The kitchenette had a medium size refrigerator , microwave oven and two small stoves. There was also a dishwasher. Wifi was good . What I disliked about this place was that we had to pay for laundry.$1.50 each for washing and drying. The last round that we stayed here , this was totally free though I must say the laundry facilities are very good though you need to supply your own soap powder. Free laundry was what impressed me the last round we stayed here. Breakfast was good

I found this staybridge property different to others I have stayed at in the past, I always book the same room type of a one bedroom suite with two double (sometimes queen) beds. I found the Anaheim rooms significantly smaller than others which given most people staying here are probably going to be here for a week. Closet storage space was about half of what you normally get and bathroom area tiny? This is also the first time I have ever had to pay for washes and dryers at a staybridge :( ...Now for the good things, rooms were clean, breakfast was probably the best I have seen at a staybridge, the marvellous people were constantly putting out new food and cleaning up after the what seems like hundreds of children let loose at the breakfast by their parents. Great selection of

We stayed at this hotel on a recent trip to Anaheim for a week. It was wonderful! The front desk staff were friendly, helpful and seemed to genuinely enjoy their jobs. We were helped with booking a bus tour, which was done efficiently and with care. She even called the bus company back to confirm the reservation to make sure everything was correct. Whenever we came down to buy something from the hotel shop we never waited long for help, and there was always a friendly conversation with the staff.  We had a family suite - two bedrooms, each with it's own bathroom, and a kitchenette/family room. The kitchenette is well appointed, though we didn't do any cooking we certainly could have! The bedrooms were quite spacious, the beds very comfortable and the pillows were nice.  The

We booked this hotel because we were looking for a true two bedroom suite for extended family where nobody would have to share beds and we'd have two bathrooms. The set up was perfect here. It was my husband and I along with our 4 year old, my mom and sister. Kid slept on the sofa bed, mom and sister had their own beds.   The full kitchen was great for having snacks and breakfast stuff on hand. We only did the free breakfast once because it was easier to just have something in the room while everyone got ready and one morning we had a character breakfast in the park. We just went to Target the night we arrived and bought supplies for the week.  The staff was very friendly and helpful. Called my daughter princess when she was all dressed up, greeted us warmly when we came in at

This has to be the best hotel for a chain suite . It is very clean, rooms are well appointed and in excellent condition. They have a nice size kitchen, living room and bedroom. The kitchen comes well equipped. The free breakfast buffet has great choices and always filled.  The front desk is friendly and informative. It is very close to Disneyland, no need to be at a Disney Resort.  It is great for families as well as couples.
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind words and for taking the time to review your hotel stay here with us at Staybridge Suites.  We hope to see you again if  your travels bring you our way.

Summary: We are still talking about the wonderful time we had on our stay at this hotel.  Similar to some recent reviews, my wife and I shared a 2 bedroom suite on our trip to Disneyland.  We checked in on November 1 and out on the 4th.  The trip was booked though Costco Travel.  We shared the room with our 3 adult children, an extra adult and 2 grandchildren.  The room was plenty spacious, very comfortable and the breakfast was very good too.  The front desk staff, managers and other staff were very helpful and friendly.  The Anaheim Resort Transit picks up right outside the hotel about every 20 minutes and takes you directly to Disneyland in about 6-8 minutes.  I highly recommend this hotel and would certainly stay here again.
Manager Response: Thank you for writing a review about your experience here at Staybridge Suites. I am so happy to hear you had a fantastic stay. I hope we shall see you again if your travels bring you our way.

Summary: We shared a 2 bedroom suite for 3 nights. Everything was exceptional. The front desk was very knowledgable and eager to help. The shuttle to Disneyland from the Holiday Inn. Next door was prompt and clean and reasonably priced. ($5 round trip per person). Very convenient to the resort as well as many popular restaurants.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time out of your schedule to share with us about your visit here at Staybridge Suites. Truly appreciate the pleasure of letting us accommodate you and your family. We know you have many choices when it comes to lodging, and we sincerely appreciate your business. Come back and see us real soon!

Summary: We stayed here for 6 nights, we had a two room suite for my husband, me, our five kids plus one extra;)  We usually stay atThe Crowne Plaza... We got a great rate here however and wanted a real suite and kitchen.  The free breakfast was really good, lots of options! The staff..especially Pam, are just fabulous!  So helpful and friendly.  The pool is very nice as well.  My only "complaint" which is not even a complaint would be that there is nothing close by as far as drug store, restaurants or coffee shops. It really is a great deal when staying with a large family!   I wouldn't stay here with just my husband, but as far as family trips, will definitely be back.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review our property regarding your experience here at Staybridge Suites. I am so happy to hear you had a wonderful time. We want to make sure each of our guests has an exceptional time and ensure your stay goes by smoothly. We look forward to seeing you and your family again when you return to the Anaheim Resort area.

Summary Heading: The place to stay for your Disney vacation!
Summary: We had an amazing stay here from October 19-24. We had a 2 bedroom suite and it was perfect for the 5 of us staying in it. Pam at the front desk was an absolute pleasure to deal with. Staybridge should be proud to employ someone so amazing. She even gave us some boogie boards to borrow when we took our boys to the beach! Thank you!! The room was clean and was touched up daily. The breakfast was just enough each morning before we hit the park and the evening socials Tues-Thurs were an added bonus. The ART bus stops right next door as well. We will only stay here for our future trips to disneyland.

Summary Heading: Clean, quiet and exactly what we wanted.
Summary: we have never stayed at a Staybridge Suites before but we sure will be doing so down the road. our room #103 was a king suite: separate bedroom, bath, kitchen/living room area. 2 flat screens and a dvd player. nice L-shaped couch, chair, etc. the bedroom: nice dresser, comfy bed, down comforter and pillows and a nice sitting chair. so that's the room....  our suite was spotlessly clean, from the kitchen cabinets to the bathtub. our suite was super  quiet, too. they were full and we never heard anything. we were not expecting daily light housekeeping but it happened. The girls who attended to our room were great! fast like a room ninja!  the daily breakfast/coffee was enough to get us out the door and ready for the parks. nothing fancy but we are not fancy people so it worked out
Manager Response: I would like to thank you for taking the time to review your stay with us here at Staybridge Suites. We appreciate your kind words. I am very happy to hear you will be staying at more of our IHG properties down the road.  Thank you again for staying with us, we hope to see you again if your travels bring you out our way.

Summary: Great value, close to Disney via bus! Weren't looking for anything fancy but the hotel was pretty quiet, had a decent pool, and was pretty roomy!  Slept five people comfortably.  Was very clean, as well!

Just a short bus ride away from Disneyland, everything about this hotel was superb - the suite was quiet, secure, clean and welcoming, the beds were luxurious with great pillows; the breakfast is amazing with a huge variety (loved the waffle machine!) and complimentary. We wished we had been able to stay longer to enjoy the week-night social hours - such a good idea for travellers! Best of all, the staff were amazing, making a special effort to give a young girl the experience of a lifetime - thank you especially to Erica and Kim.
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind words. It was truly a pleasure to have you all stay with us. I wish you could have stayed longer, but hopefully we will see you again if your travels bring you out our way.  *I also agree about the waffle machine... it is so much fun to make your own waffle and they are so yummy! Thank you again for taking the time review your stay with us... Tell Renee we say hello and hope she had an amazing time here and at Space Camp!

Summary: We stayed for 4 nights in September 2014 and enjoyed as a base for theme parks, staff very helpful and welcoming. Only 20 minutes from Disney and 35 minutes from Universal. Great breakfast and get togethers in the evening.

We stayed here for a few nights before flying to Hong Kong.   Pretty standard Staybridge with friendly staff.  We had a one bedroom suite which was pretty much like every other staybridge - no complaints here.  It was nice having breakfast outside on the patio.    Funny thing happened on checkout - we had a little time before going to the airport so I asked at the front desk if they knew if there was an In n Out nearby.   I was surprised when the clerk handed opened a file and handed me directions to the nearest In n Out about four miles away.

This hotel was a pleasant surprise, and seemed like a good value compared to other lodging in the area.  The comfortable queen suite had a kitchenette with dishes, microwave, stovetop, full-sized fridge and freezer, dishwasher, coffee-maker, desk, foldout sofa, and lots of storage.  The free breakfast had great variety with lots of breads, patries, waffles, cereal, fresh fruit, yogurt, eggs, bacon etc.  Staff did a nice job of keeping things stocked and clean despite the dining area being very busy.  There were many families with young children in rooms near mine, but I didn't hear a peep from inside my room.  The bed was very comfortable for a good night's sleep.  There is an Anaheim Resort Transit bus stop next door at the Holiday Inn.  The bus runs every 20-30min and only
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share with us about your visit here at Staybridge Suites. We hope to see you and your family again if your travels bring you our way.

Summary: This hotel was clean and friendly ,great location few minutes away from Disneyland. The suite was spacious with a kitchenette,  great for our family of four. The continental breakfast included with the suite was good. Enjoy your trip :}
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time out of your schedule to share with us about your visit while in the Disneyland Resort area. We truly appreciate the pleasure of letting us accommodate you and your family and we are happy to hear your stay with us was a pleasant one.  We look forward to seeing you again if your travels bring you our way.

Summary: We stayed in a two bedroom family suite with a kitchen and living room.  One room had a king-size bed and the other had two double beds which was perfect. Although this is an older hotel, it was well maintained. The suite was complete with dishes, silverware, refrigerator, microwave, paper towels, coffee maker and Wolfgang Puck coffee.  There were two separate bathrooms with combo tub/showers and plenty of shampoo, soap, and towels.  My four grand children. ages 2-11, enjoyed the pool very much (towels were provided poolside for convenience).  The hotel offered a wide variety of choices at the complimentary buffet breakfast, including waffles, bacon, sausage, scrambled eggs, yogurt, fresh fruit, breads, pastries, and both hot and cold cereals.  The dining area was large and had
Manager Response: Thank you for reviewing your stay here at Staybridge Suites. I am happy to hear you enjoyed your stay. We look forward to see you and your family again if your travels bring you our way.

Summary: We stayed here a couple of nights back in July and I must say I was surprised. I didn't know what to expect but I was very happy. The room was a little small but it was nice and clean. Also the complimentary breakfast was good. We loved the location (for Disneyland) and the front desk personnel was awesome! They booked our LA Tour for us and provided us with directions to the various restaurants.  I would recommend this hotel and we would return again.

We stayed here for our 25th anniversary. We wanted to do something special. The two bedroom suite was exactly what we were looking for. With a room for the kids so we didn't have to hear their texting and giggling, and our own bedroom, it was a perfect home away from home. The only complaint is the maid service. They don't do it every day and the maids definitely don't know when to throw something away. The closet in the master bedroom needs to have plastic ends put on the metal shelving. I received a scratch on my hand the first night that hurt the entire trip. Will stay here or any other staybridge suites again. This was a wonderful hotel.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review of your stay at Staybridge Suites. I am happy to hear you had a wonderful stay and Happy late Anniversary! I appreciate your feedback and will be addressing it with my management team for enhancements needed.  Thank you again for staying with us. We hope to see you again in the near future.

Summary Heading: This Staybridge A Solid B+.......Pet Friendly
Summary: We have stayed at many Staybridge Suites and speak of these on a relative scale to each other. 2 Thumbs up for their relatively inexpensive and liberal pet policy which is a hallmark of all Staybridge properties.  This Anaheim property nicely situated away from the Harbor Blvd Disney Hotel frenzy but close enough for Disney access.  Free parking a nice surprise.  This property is a high traffic  location and is starting to show the wear but generally clean.  Unfortunately the outside patio furniture had mostly ripped and torn cushions which require some management attention.  The usual free breakfast and week day evening snacks were there as advertised.  The large Disney crowd rush in the morning could be better handled if they improved the food flow a bit to put the waffle

We've stayed at the Staybridge on 3 different occasions, each time in one of the two bedroom suites. It's the perfect set-up for two families who like to travel together. The distance is too far to walk to the parks but an ART pass can easily be bought. I've done lots of research on large suites in the Anaheim area and the Staybridge offers the largest suites. The 2 bedroom suite also has 2 bathrooms, and the kitchen contains a full size refrigerator. Perfect set up for the family who is looking to save money by taking in their own snacks to the park (we make a trip to Costco).The free hot breakfast is delicious! The pool and hot tub area is shared with The Holiday Inn and can be a bit crowded after a long day at the parks. I will stay there every time I have a chance.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel. We appreciate your kind words and are happy to hear you've come back to visit us! Thank you for your repeat business and we look forward to seeing you again on your next visit.

Summary Heading: Two separate rooms and a kitchen Value
Summary: Free hot breakfast - check! Free parking - check! Stocked kitchen with dishwasher - check! Separate bedroom - check! Bus to Disneyland (close by) - check! Pool - check! Sleeper sofa - check! Clean, warm, comfortable - check! Laundry - check! Unexpected evening cracker barrel (T/W/Th) - check! Affordably priced - check!
Manager Response: Thank you for your review of your stay at Staybridge Suites. I am pleased to hear you enjoyed your stay. We look forward to seeing your and your family again if your travels bring you our way.

Summary Heading: BEST HOTEL AND CUSTOMER SERVICE EVER
Summary: How do I start............. FANTASTIC.   When we arrived we were checked in by the wonderful Pam. Pam was very professional, polite and knowledgeable.   It was our first trip to California and we were exceptionally pleased with our 2 bedroom room with sitting area and kitchen.   The rooms are very clean and the beds are very comfortable. It's great it had 2 separate bathrooms.   The lounge and both bedrooms have huge tv's which is a great touch.   Housekeeping were fantastic and could not do enough for you.   The breakfast was great. Not a huge selection but fresh  and most certainly enough to fill you up for a good start to the day.   The hotel itself is very comfortable with a swimming pool, a gym, laundry and 24hr convenience small shop for your snacks and drinks.   The
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review your stay with us at Staybridge Suites. We appreciate your kind words and are thrilled to hear you enjoyed your stay here with us. We strive into providing our guests with an exceptional experience and for all of our staff to ensure your stay goes by smoothly. Thank you again for staying with us. We hope to see you again in the near future.

Summary: Stayed here in July2014 & enjoyed the experience. Price was affordable, very large rooms & self contained kitc hen. We had a two bedroom with ensuite in both bedrooms & separate lounge at an afordable price. WIFI for free & customer service good. price include a buffet breakfast. The only negative was no place to eat on premise, although the holiday inn was around the corner.(1oo metres) with a few dining eating option. Would recommend.

We stayed for three nights as part of a three week trip to the US. It is a little out from Disneyland and a lot of the restaurants so you would need your car if you wanted to vary your meals out. It is not a luxury hotel but the little touches make it a great place to stay.  We booked a one bedroom suite through our travel agent as on paper it seemed big enough for a family of five. On entering the suite it became apparent that it was going to be a squash for us and our luggage so we went back to the front desk to see if we could upgrade to a two bedroom suite. They didn't have any available but when we returned to our room, the phone was ringing, and after some jiggling they had got us a two bedrooom suite - excellent.  The rooms were clean and there were plenty of towels.

We had a large group going to Disneyland for a family trip. Travelling for 2-3 months out of the year, I would consider this hotel to be in my top 5 The staff went above and beyond multiple times for our group. Our room was always clean when we arrived in the evening. Lots of perks come with staying at the Staybridge Suites Anaheim. in our group of 11 staying in 3 different rooms, there was not a single complaint from anyone, not even from my in-laws! Thank you for helping to make our Disney trip magical!

Pros: Hot breakfast was great - eggs, bacon/sausage, waffles, fruit, bagels, cereal, etc. Kitchen in room (no oven). Free laundry facilities  Cons: The pool was quite dirty. Rooms could use a fresh coat of paint...they are a bit run down. Washers/dryers should be cleaned on daily basis.  Location: Disney is real close, easy drive and the beaches were easy to get to as well.  We were staying in the area for a week, 3 days at Disney and 3 days at the beach. We wanted to stay close to Disney since we wanted the option to go back to the hotel during the day for meals and resting if we needed to and we definitely took advantage of that. It was nice to go back, have a meal, swim and then head back to the park. We also wanted to stay near a freeway for easy access to the beach which

We had a great experience at the Staybridge Suites Anaheim. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful and the rooms very nice. During the week nights the hotel put on barbecues and/or had some appetizers which was a nice way to meet some of the other guests.

This hotel is close to Disney but just far enough away great pool area for the Kids and Adults to relax around. Free Breakfast hot and cold. Rooms were comfortable and clean. Staff were realy helpful with locat information re outlet Malls to shop at  Orlando Mills 35 min drive away under cover Air Cond enjoyed our 5 nights. Would stay here again  Vons 5 minutes drive away  great Steak house 5 minutes drive love the area

Hotel is conveniently located right off I5 and down from Shops at Orange in addition to Disney. Very friendly and knowledgable staff.  Shuttle bus to Disney is in same shared parking lot as Holiday Inn. Clean large  pool with nice picnic facility.  Rooms were very spacious and more importantly clean and comfortable.  Would stay here again.

My family was headed to southern California for a week. We couldn't find a hotel for 7 nights in the area we had planned to visit. So for 3 of those days we ended up here at Staybridge in Anaheim. The hotel was a little confusing to get to with Manchester ave also being the I 5 South road, but once we figured that out it was all good. The hotel is exactly as the pictures show. The staff was fabulous, very polite and easy to chat with. We were on the 2nd floor at the far end overlooking the pool. Our room had a kitchen with full size fridge which is really nice when you're on the road. Two queen size beds in the bedroom. My only real complaint about this property was the layout of the bathroom. Beside the bed was a closet which was opposite the sink. The problem, that closet and

A good budget suite hotel so we had 2 bedrooms both en suite, lounge/diner/kitchenette. Great for trips to Disney as a bus $5 stops outside the neighbouring Holiday Inn every 20 mins. To be fair we spent little time here but the beds are comfortable, the breakfasts edible, the pool accommodating and the staff welcoming. Not the best hotel I've stayed in but what more do you need when you're going to be a Disney all day. You really only need somewhere to sleep and on that score it rates highly.

We took two ten year olds (grandson and great-grandson) to Disneyland in July and stayed at this hotel.  We had a two bedroom suite that was perfect.  Although I had no intention of fixing any meals, there is a complete kitchen.  The shuttle to Disneyland picks you up right next door at the Holiday Inn which was really convenient.  My only complaint is that the eating area at breakfast time is jam packed so seating is slim.  The hotel staff was nice and very efficient.  We had a bathroom problem and it was taken care of in less than ten minutes.  The afternoon snack was adequate and the complimentary wine was welcomed after many hours at Disneyland.  Would recommend the Staybridge to traveling families for sure.

At AUD295 per night for a 1 bedroom suite where our family of 4 (2 x adults and 2 x children aged 12 and 10 yo) had to share 2 x double beds, I thought this hotel was over priced for what it is.  There is a decent bathroom, lounge area and kitchenette.  The hotel did grow on me though, over our 4 night stay. The Buffet breakfast was substantial. There was always 2 x hot choices. There was also a free of charge "Social Dinner" most nights of the week, which was a nice gesture. Hamburgers one night, Nachos the next. Soft drinks, alcohol included. There is also a laundry which is free to use.  The hotel was very handy to Disney. The shuttle bus pulled up every 20 minutes right outside the door. 5-10 minutes trip to Disneyland.  Mainly American families patronised the hotel. I

this hotel is in a convenient location, easy access to major roads into the city. Disney is about a 5 minute drive down the block. Has plenty of restaurants, cineama's and shopping close by.  the breakfast on offer is good. Extremely busy whilst we were there. no afternoon drinks or food whilst we were there, Friday through Monday, food and drink on offer only midweek.  did have free dvd rentals.  the rooms are small. not a large suite as I had envisaged, not great value for money. there is a free laundry on the premises. Pool and spa are lovely as with the bbq area. lots of seating and tables provided.  plenty of parking.

We recently stayed at the Staybridge Suites during our trip to California. I was initially wary of my husband's choice based on other reviews but I couldn't have been happier.  The location of the hotel was right off the parkway making it easy to get to other parks like Universal Studios and Sea World.  It was a two minute drive to the Disney parking lots and it was surrounded by many restaurants.  The rooms were clean, the bathroom and kitchen were spotless. The staff was very helpful too.  The free breakfast was great and offered many different options. There was always staff refilling food trays and cleaning.  The availability of a washer and dryer was nice too ( you just have to bring your own detergent which is fair) The cleaning policy for the rooms was clearly posted in

The overall cleanliness of this hotel is terrible. The rooms don't get cleaned everyday, strictly only beds being made. With 8 people being in one 2 bedroom room for 7 nights, it needed to be cleaned. The breakfast buffett was always dirty around the food and the general downstairs always smelt like rotten milk. I was also not impressed with the friendliness of the hotel staff. The front desk should be welcoming and friendly, but they always acted so annoyed when you asked any question. The size of our rooms were great and accommodated my family, we just all felt as though the hotel could have been MUCH cleaner!
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review your stay at Staybridge Suites. I am sorry we failed to meet your expectations. All of our reviews are evaluated by management, and your review is no exception. Your feedback is very important to us as this assists us in continually improving the service and facilities we have to offer to our guests. I will be speaking with all department managers addressing all points you raised.  Thank you again for your comments and we hope that your future travel plans will continue to include IHG properties.

Summary Heading: Great place for a large family
Summary: We headed out west for our summer vacation with 21 of my in-laws.  The hotel is great has plenty of stuff to do.  We took advantage of the grills. Front desk staff is friendly and all staff is there for you!  Pool is shared with holiday in but is very large area. The grounds are clean and taken care of!

Very friendly staff and had a room available when we arrived at 11AM. Had the big suite and room enough for four moms and four kids. Had really nice kitchen and two big bathrooms. Very large heated pool that kids really enjoyed. The breakfast buffet was wonderful and didn't have to worry about anything. Even had snacks in the buffet some nights. The shuttle was at the hotel just next door and took only 5-10 minutes to get to Disneyland.  Thanks to the staff for all their great suggestions on arranging a special limo ride back from Universal Studios. Loved having the "store" by the front desk for special after dinner snacks. I would recommend this hotel again and will stay in Staybridge Suites in other cities as well.

Summary Heading: Travel Agent Review for recent Disney Trip
Summary: Booked a 1 bedroom unit for 4 of us - mom/dad & 2 adult children ages 19 and 21. Did we have a great time at Disneyland - YES! DID the ART transfers work well - YES! Did the breakfast in the a.m. save us time/money - YES!  What did I think of the property??? Unit was clean upon arrival. Beds in bedroom were very comfy. Sofa sleeper has the usual thin uncomfortable mattress, therefore 21 year old son slept on couch opposed to using the bed part. Bathroom is off of the bedroom and is very small. Door to toilet/shower/tub opens right in to where the sink is...so it was tight and did not have a good flow, however we managed. Housekeeping was our biggest issue...it made no sense even though front desk advised we would it get daily.  We had days where towels, soap, toilet paper were
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel. I offer my humble apologies for the issues you had during your stay and will be addressing all points you raised to the appropriate departments. We hope that when your travels return you to Anaheim, you will give us another chance to redeem ourselves

Summary: I stayed here a few weeks ago. The staff was polite, the rooms were clean, and the breakfast wasn't bad at all.  There is a shuttle that runs from the hotel to Disneyland. It runs every 20 minutes.   I would totally stay there again!

Summary Heading: Room to get away from your family while still sharing.
Summary: Stayed at Staybridge in Ohio on our "Zoocation", so was happy to see this location for our family vacation.   This did not disappoint.  You'll see some bad reviews; but you have to read between the lines.    What to expect:  This is NOT a 5-star hotel.  If you have kids, multi-family vacation, or need a place with extra room to spread out, you are in luck.  It's clean.  Dated some as you expect.  Got some dings here and there (home-y to me).  We had a 2 bedroom suite. It was great.   I love my family,  but sometimes, closing a door and getting away is awesome, and necessary for all of our well- beings.    Breakfast:  Wide variety, alternating qod menu.  Multiple waffle makers, will take a few minutes.  Juice/coffee/milk/cokes.  Good start.  Not the iHop; but it is good.   We

Summary Heading: not for business or long term stay
Summary: so I have traveled a lot.  not as much as some, but I have spent a couple years worth of my life in hotel rooms.  I've stayed in a number of staybridge hotels and their equivalent competitors. I'm staying here for several months  so the good points clean, good service, large pool, surprisingly quite considering all the Disneyland bound kids  location is pretty good to being right next to a free way and several major roads.  plenty of food in walking distance, several grocery stores within a short drive, gas station around the corner.  walking distance of Disney land.  shuttle to I think.   since I am going to be here so long and my status is Platinum I asked for a room upgrade, couldn't happen due to bookings.  but they did get me a toaster oven since the hotel did not have a
Manager Response: Dear jason d,  Thank you for taking the time to provide feedback on your stay.  We are pleased to see you enjoyed your time at the hotel, and  look forward to serving you in the future.   Sincerely,  Ben J Case Manager IHGCare

Summary: I can't say enough good about this hotel. Fabulous heated saltwater pool; hot breakfast every morning; social hour Tues-Thur with hamburgers and hotdogs on the grill every Wednesday; complimentary laundry; free movies and board games at the front desk...and very friendly service. I would recommend this hotel a hundred times over.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel! We appreciate your kind words and very pleased you enjoyed your vacation! We hope to you see you again in the near future!

Summary: Before I get started I have to say the staff (with one notable exception) went out of their way to be friendly and helpful. Also, the breakfast was excellent despite the cramped kitchen area.  That said...  Changed reservation from cancellable to prepaid to save a few $$ and the prepaid room confirmation showed a downgrade from a 1 Br. to a suite. Huh?   Did the online chat. No help. They told me to call the hotel.  Called hotel. No help. They transfered me to reservations. Reservations said sorry and they transfered me to customer relations. The person that picked up was in reservations. They explained that customer relations was unavaialble and asked that I call back later.  Customer relations was excellent and fixed thre problem. Too bad I spend an hour on chats/phone getting
Manager Response: Dear Ken P,  Thank you for taking the time to provide feedback on your stay.  It is unfortunate the room conditions prevented you from fully enjoying your time at the hotel.  We are confident the necessary adjustments will be made, in order to achieve complete guest satisfaction.   Thank you again for your comments, we look forward to serving you in the future.   Sincerely,  Ben J Case Manager IHGCare

Summary Heading: Sleep tight and don't let the bed bugs bite.
Summary: We stayed here in May 2014 after a friend who had visited Anaheim had stayed there and recommended it to us. We walked into the hotel and we were impressed by the friendly staff and the overall look of the hotel, that was until my husband woke up after the first night with mystery bites all over him. The second nights he had more bites and had to seek medical treatment for an allergic reaction to whatever it was that was biting him. It wasn't until the 4th night at 4am in the morning that we found the bed bugs in both beds in the room.   I went to reception that morning and we were moved rooms, which after I checked there was no bed bugs. The downfall was not only did my husband have the bites all over his body, he was unwell for a few days and having to wash all of our
Manager Response: Dear Jodi P,  Thank you for staying with us and for leaving a review of our property. I am pleased to know that you found our staff highly commendable. On the other hand, we regret that your stay with us did not live up to your standards. Our hotel is very proud of its level of service, cleanliness and quality of its product and for this reason your comments are very troubling and will certainly be looked into. I have sent you a private message in an effort to obtain more information.   Thank you and I look forward to hearing back from you very soon.  Sincerely,   John O Case Manager IHGCare

Summary: Stayed 4 nights for Disneyland trip in a 2 bedroom suite. Room was perfect with lots of space, comfortable beds and noise was minimal.If traveling with kids the 2 bedroom is well worth it, the kids can sleep and you can move around and get ready for the next day. Breakfast was good, enough to get you ready for a long day at Disney. Staff was friendly and helpful. Pool is next door at the Holiday Inn with easy access via the courtyard. FREE LAUNDRY MACHINES!!! What a bonus. Hotel is close but not walking distance, did not use the shuttle, drove over daily (book via AAA and get free parking at Disney daily. Never had a issue finding hotel spots, even when returning very late at night.

Our group of 5 (3 adults and 2 young boys) had a pleasant 3 night stay.  We arrived by car late on the first night and took advantage of the free car parking.  The front desk staff were helpful and the small on-site was convenient.  We appreciated the complimentary breakfast, which included both hot and old items.  The room itself was tight for 5 people (we had to use the sofa bed) and our luggage but clean, well furnished, with all necessary appliances and utensils.  The hotel's location (close to Disneyland and the main freeway) and reasonable room rate made up for the lack of space.  All in all - a pleasant stay.

We really liked this place. It is not to far from Disneyland and there is a bus that picks you up in the front.  The staff was wonderful and very helpful. The kids had a wonderful time and they even meant some kids there age and keep in touch. We will definly stay again.

We spent 5 nights and it was a good value .  Good full breakfast is included. Disneyland bus stop is just next door to the hotel. As we are platinum members of IHG , we were upgraded to a 2 bd. suite. , which was very roomy, also passes to Disneyland are available at the front desk , for a discount. Great staff was very helpful.

This is a 3 star family hotel.  Just finished 4 nights here. Had a Quiet large room with a large bathroom and separate bedroom. Much bigger than most hotel rooms . It included a Good buffet breakfast  that changed daily. Had Friendly helpful staff that was good to print directions , even got a late check out with out a problem. Nice large pool the kids enjoyed with lots of chairs. Never had a problem getting lounge chairs. Lots of parking. Very good wifi ! We travel lots and stay in lots of hotels and I found this  was a good hotel for the money. We usually only stay at 4 or 5 star hotels but will definitely come  back!

We stayed for 8 nights and it was awesome! The room was great with their being 6 of us (the beds were a little hard but the hotel was quick to assist with this!) We were able to watch the Disneyland fireworks from the 6th floor at the end of the hall, that was awesome!  It was great having a complimentary hot breakfast every morning, made it easy to start our day. Along with this, they had 3 nights that they had snacks and complimentary wine and beer!  Special shout out to the front desk clerk, Pam! She was amazing, was always their to answer our questions, give us tips and ensure our stay was extra special!   We would definitely come back to this hotel.

We stayed here for 5 nights, from 5/5-5/10, while we visited Disneyland. There were 6 of us. My husband, myself, and our 4 grandchildren ages 12,10, 9,and 8. We stayed in a 2 bedroom suite. There was plenty of room for our party and having 2 bathrooms was great. Our room was clean. We had a 5th floor room facing the highway. Noise was not a problem at all. We loved the complimentary breakfast. Plenty of hot/cold options. I particularly liked that the scrambled eggs were well cooked and not runny. Previous reviews had me concerned about breakfast being crazy and crowded. We went down for breakfast between 7 and 7:30 every morning. It was not crowded at this time. In fact, there were few people here. I did notice it was extremely busy at 8:30 one morning when I walked by. Go early

Great value. They have a good layout. Rooms are a nice size, kitchen is very functional and clean! Their staff is very helpful and friendly! Close location to bus that takes you directly to Disney land about a 5 minute ride.  Really good size heated pool. The complimentary breakfast (hot) in the morning is good and has a decent selection. They even have a waffle making area! (You make yourself) great location and hotel for families.

The one bedroom with sofabed was tight for 4adults+1child and suitecases.  Lots of parking.  Disneyland charges $16 parking; hotel shuttle Charges $12 per person so just do math whether or not to take the car to Disneyland- too far to walk. The kitchenette was nice.  Problem was that with all the activities, we hardly were able to use it.  The large refrigerator was nice!  Free use of washing machines; just bring soap!   Breakfast was good- scramble eggs, sausage or bacon, waffle, bread, oatmeal, fresh fruit, cereal, coffee, soda, milk and juice everyday! Cons: service was only change towels, garbage disposal and bed making.  Cleaned only if you stay more than 7days.

Summary Heading: Great Home Away From Home for Family
Summary: My husband and our two children (11 and 18 years old) stayed in a two bedroom suite. We were at the Staybridge Suites for ten nights from April 14th to April 24th. With a small kitchen, living room, two bedrooms, two bathrooms, and three TVs, we were very comfortable. It is not fancy, but is decorated tastefully. One bedroom has a king-sized bed, the other bedroom has two double beds, and the living room has a sofa bed. We all slept very well in the comfortable beds. We did a lot of sightseeing during our time there, and found this to be an excellent home base.  The staff were friendly and helpful. Erica checked us in and made us feel very welcome. We found her especially helpful in advising us on our visit to Disney and on purchasing tickets. On Tuesday, Wednesday, and Thursday

We stayed at the Staybridge over Easter Weekend.  We had 7 in our party, 4 adults and 3 children.  We had a 2 bedroom suite and was very pleased with our room.  There was enough space for everyone.  Although our room was near the freeway we didn't hear a thing coming from the freeway.  The small kitchenette in our room was a godsend.  We were able to cook small meals and keep snacks cold.  The location was great. Close enough to Disneyland yet far enough from the hustle and bustle.  The staff was very friendly and often said hello or good morning. They were also helpful and prompt when we needed some items replaced in the room.   We also loved the breakfast buffet, the kids filled up nicely before heading out for the day.   Kids also enjoyed the pool, while adults rested

Summary Heading: The place to stay with young children!
Summary: Speaking from professional experience running a hotel is difficult enough in normal circumstances but having to do it during Easter week at Disneyland is an extraordinary challenge and the Staybridge Suites does a great job. The 2 bedroom suites were clean and generous in size and the breakfast was above average especially in the face of families who are all trying to get to Disneyland at the same time. The front desk staff was enthusiastic and always helpful. The only down note was that the common areas especially the elevators could use some refreshing.

Summary Heading: A great place for families visiting Disney
Summary: We had a family group staying in two suites at Staybridge and were very pleased with the hotel. The staff are very welcoming and were extremely helpful, particularly Erica on reception. The rooms had everything we needed. We had one lovely quiet room overlooking the pool area with two very comfortable double beds and a sofa bed in the sitting area. From this room we even had a great view of the fireworks at Disney each night. The other room was opposite (we asked if we could be near each other and that request was met). This room overlooked the front but was quiet considering how near the road is but was much darker. If given the choice, I would request a room on the pool side.  Breakfast is great with something for everyone. The children particularly enjoyed making their own

We spent 9 nights at this hotel in a 2 bedroom suite which was very spacious and perfect for our family of 4.  The master bedroom has a huge bed and an ensuite and the second room had 2 double beds and another bathroom.  In the middle of the two bedrooms is a lounge/kitchen area.  There are 3 TV's altogether and a DVD/CD player.    The beds were really comfortable and the suite was nice and clean.  There is plenty of choice in the breakfast buffet and we found all members of staff to be helpful and friendly.    The children enjoyed the pool area which was also lovely and clean.  A big help was the laundry room which is free to use - you just buy your detergent from the shop next to the reception area.   This hotel is located close to all the attractions in Anaheim but a car is

We celebrated our daughters Sweet 16 in Disney and enjoyed our stay at Staybridge suites for 4days. It was great! Very clean, very accomodating staff. Awesome breakfast for our family. We booked a 2bedroom suite for 7 people and it was roomy for us. I would definately recommend this hotel to my family and friends.

We stayed for 10 days with a family of 6. We had 3 large beds and a smaller pull out bed . We also had a fully fitted kitchen,  which was ideal for making drinks . The free breakfast was brillant. The hotel location was okay as long as you have a car. Disney 10 minutes . Orange mall 5 minutes . Knotts berry 20 mins .  We drove to los angeles a few times which took about 1 hour . For this reason,  If I came again I would split my stay. Staying in both anahiem and los angeles .  Finally the staff at the hotel could not do enough to help . Well done to Staybridge Suites .. 5 star stay .

Summary Heading: Quality Family Stay For Reasonable Price
Summary: A wedding, honeymoon, meeting of new in-laws, the entertainment of pre-teen children of the bride and groom, needs of various family members, and cost, were all issues taken into consideration when we chose Staybridge Suites.  Some of our family were at the sister hotel next door, the Holiday Inn.  Our suite contained a very well equipped kitchen and separate bedroom.  As both sets of grandparents had extra children on wedding night, extra beds were needed and the hotel was very quick to respond to the special needs, at a reasonable cost.  The rooms were clean, nicely decorated and the bed so comforting after a day at the wedding or a day after Disneyland.  The pool and spa was well used by everyone.   The included breakfast every morning provided an excellent number of

Our family of 4 including 2 adult sons, doesn't want to feel cramped or in each others faces when we travel together. So finding a 2 bedroom suite has been a priority for a number of years.  Glad we found this facility as it offers so much in a no nonsense way, The king bedroom was an excellent size with a very good mattress, slept very well. The second bedroom had 2 double beds, perfect for our 2 sons. Each bedroom had an adjoining bathroom, vanity, and television. Connecting the 2 rooms is a lounge/ kichen area  well equipped and with another television and dvd player. Full size fridge, microwave, stove top elements and a dishwasher make for a home away from home atmosphere.  You could stay here a long time and be very comfortable.  We stayed for 4 nights and enjoyed the

Staybridge is clean and comfortable, and the staff is friendly and accommodating. The free breakfast is a nice bonus, and we appreciated the small kitchen in our room.  Heated pool and hot tub was a hit with our two boys, as well as the free movie DVDs available at the front desk. We bought 3 day pass for ART, the public bus, which dropped us off right at Disneyland. Can't complain about our 4 night stay!

We recently stayed at Staybridge suites in Anaheim for a two-day family trip to Disneyland.  We got a 2 BR suite that sleeps 8.  There were 5 of us - my husband and me, our two boys (8 and 1.5), and his mom.  For 5 people it was very spacious.  The kids LOVED it.  My 8 year old said "it's bigger than our house!"  Not true - but 3 TVs - two more than at home.  Two bathrooms - one more than at home.  Pool: Heated.  Very comfortable.  (Cold when you get out though) Breakfast: Adequate.  Eggs, meat, yogurt, cold cereal, oatmeal, fruit, toast, bagels, waffles, coffee, soda, juice. Afternoon social: hot snacks and beer/wine (2 buck chuck) Suite: spacious and I liked the kitchen.  We were a short drive from Vons so we bought some steam-in-bag veggies, bread, and a roasted chicken and

Our party of 3 adults & 4 children enjoyed our stay here. Rooms were clean, beds comfortable, appreciated the amenities for the kitchen (dishes, flatware, cooking utensils, and cleaning supplies). Loved the continental breakfasts and special dinners. The staff was extremely courteous and helpful and the mini-convenience (sundry) store was well-stocked, reasonably-priced and open 24/7. Would gladly return again.

Summary Heading: Perfect Place for Family Reunion at Disneyland
Summary: We recently spent 4 nights at the Staybridge Suites in Anaheim, CA.  We had a two bedroom suite:  two Queen beds, one King, and a pull-out couch.  Thursday evening we were treated to their weekday social hour, featuring a substantial nacho bar, sodas, beer, and wine.   The kitchen was adequately stocked with dishware, utensils, a skillet, two pots, microwave, dishwasher, and stove.  The free breakfast was pretty standard fare.  The shuttle to Disneyland was in front of the Holiday Inn (the two hotels share the property, including the pool & hot tub) and came every 15 minutes during the day.  Only one other hotel was on this route, so we arrived at the Disneyland entrance in about ten minutes.    There were seven adults, ranging in age from 61 to 20.  Having a kitchen meant we

Summary Heading: One of the best shows in Anaheim - Breakfast @ Staybridge
Summary: As a family of three staying in a two-room suite we had an enjoyable stay for 6 days.  Being from Australia we found the morning show at the complementary buffet breakfast to be one on the best we had witnessed - anywhere.  We found ourselves getting up early so we could get down & find a prime table to watch the freak-show of weird behaviour, strange eating habits & pure gluttony unfold before our eyes - what a performance, Merica! Food quality was poor but got the day underway, what do you expect - gourmet? The front desk staff were always helpful, the hotel position was ideal for driving to Anaheim then commuting to D'land via the bus that stops next door.  We would stay here again, however after reading some of the other reviews about property being stolen from guests rooms,

I totally disagree wih the bad reviews on here. We traveled with 6 kids and this hotel was great. The rooms fit us all well, buffet in the morning was perfect and customer service was awesome too. The beds were comfortable, clean and pool was nice as well. I would stay here again!!!

Although a little tired around the edges, this hotel is excellently located right on the intersection of the I5 and the 22 freeway. You can walk to the restaurants at GardenWalk and could even walk to Disney is you can't wait for the shuttle bus. The hotel provides a basic hot breakfast buffet everyday and hot snacks in a happy hour Tues, Weds and Thursdays plus complimentary beer and wine. The rooms are a good size, each with a kitchenette for basic catering. Free parking and WiFi in your room is a definite plus.

Summary Heading: stolen belongings by staff, horrible service, dirty room
Summary: I cant say enough how horrible our stay at the Staybridge was.  This is unfortunate as it was an otherwise wonderful vacation.  I'll sum it up for anyone looking at this hotel by saying "stay at your own risk!!!"  And I wholeheartedly mean that.  It is a huge risk.  In now reading other peoples reviews regarding some of their negative experiences in the past, there are so many similarities to our recent experience and I would not take those reviews lightly when doing your research.  There is not enough space to go into all the details and accumulative things that we went through during our stay.  But I will share the highlights with the hopes this gives someone planning their vacation to Disneyland or elsewhere some serious food for thought before booking here.  Essentially here
Manager Response: Dear S J,   Thank you for taking the time to convey your comments regarding your recent experience with us.  We rely on you, our guest, to let us know how we are doing and how we can better meet your needs.  We have sent you a private message to obtain additional details about your experience.  Regards,  Karen C Case Manager IHGCare

Summary: We stayed at Staybridge mid February for 4 nights while on a family trip to visit Disneyland and CA Adventure.  While this is not a fancy hotel it is very clean and served our needs well.  The suite we stayed in was very clean and had a view of the pool (which was helpful because the other side would have faced the freeway and would have likely been noisy).   The beds are a bit soft for my taste, but we all slept well.   The complimentary breakfast was standard but offered a variety of breakfast choices.  (Scrambled eggs, bacon or sausage, fruit, breads, oatmeal, waffles, cold cereals, yogurt and juices, teas, coffee and hot chocolate).  There was something for everyone.  There is a heated outdoor pool which was clean and nice.  The only complaint I have about this is the first

It feels like nobody at the front desk takes initiative to do anything for guests. My call was transferred around and promised with a call back but no call back.   And when I spoke to an Erica? at the front desk, I only felt like she wanted to pass me on to the next person and never attempted to resolve my issue. It was disappointing because because if she cared just a little bit more she could have resolved my minor issue with a room.
Manager Response: Dear Caldr,  Thank you for your review regarding your experience.  We greatly appreciate you taking the time to bring this matter to our attention and apologize for any inconvenience the hotel staff may have caused.  We will follow up with the staff to ensure that similar incidents won't happen again.  We appreciate your feedback as this is our best resource for improving guest services.   Thank you for staying with us, and we hope to have an opportunity to serve you again.  Regards,  Jaime W Case Manager IHGCare

Summary: The hotel is located next to a very busy freeway and has little in the way of sound proofing.  Motel 6 style beds and pillows.  Nice staff.  Breakfast starts too late on the weekends.  Did not get a good nights sleep.  Not worth the $150 + a night.
Manager Response: Dear David H,  Thank you for taking the time to provide feedback on your stay. It is unfortunate the noise from the road and the bed prevented you from fully enjoying your time at the hotel. We take all of the reviews we receive very seriously as they allow us to identify areas that may benefit from additional attention. We have shared your comments with the staff and we’re confident the necessary adjustments will be made, in order to achieve complete guest satisfaction.  Thank you again for your comments, we hope to have the pleasure of serving you again soon.  Sincerely,  Adrian D Case Manager IHGCare

Summary: Our family of 4 stayed at Staybridge for 4 nights - January 12-16 - while we were on vacation and visiting the Disney parks. Although the hotel is not overly fancy or modern we really had great stay. It is clean and the beds are comfortable and the staff are very friendly and helpful. The complimentary breakfasts are good and the evening 'snacks' (mid-week), although basic, are also good (and basically served as our evening meals). Even the laundry facilities are complimentary. Between that and the kitchen in the room we had an incredibly cost-effective stay. The hotel is on the bus route for both the Anaheim Resort Transit (ART) buses which take you around Anaheim and to Disneyland and California Adventure, and also has a scheduled pick-up and drop-off by Disneyland Resort

Nice hotel, but not great.  It is in need of a bit of updating, and cleaning.  Elevators were pretty dirty too.  But, comfortable, and the free breakfast is great.  They never ran out of food and were constantly attending to the breakfast bar and guests.  The breakfast area is large and airy with a TV over a fireplace and plenty of tables.  There's a little store to buy things like advil, razors, etc.  Bus shuttle to Disneyland is at hotel next door which is convenient.  The suite room was great for an extended family, as grandma has her own bathroom and there is a small but adequate sitting/ TV area.  The kitchenette could definately be used for cooking a simple meal (i.e. mack and cheese) although we never used it.  A downside is that there's really no store/supermarket you

Great hotel in a great located. It was a great customer service and which in walking distance to Disney land and many great restaurants. The hotel have kitchen so that if you have children you may cook or breakfast is free. It is great for a weekend get away or just coming to enjoy yourself with family and friends or by yourself.

We recently spent a week in Anaheim at the Staybridge Suites this is the 2nd time we have stayed there. It is a great place to stay especially with families.  Rooms are great and the service fantastic.

Have stayed at the Staybridge Anaheim twice now; both trips were for Disneyland vacation.  The hotel has a bus/shuttle that picks up about every 20 minutes to Disneyland, so no need to pay for parking or walk all that way.  It is very convenient, especially for large groups that would require several vehicles.  The shuttle ride is only about 10 minutes and you get dropped off right at the Park entrance.  Also, we bought our 2-day park hopper passes right at the front desk.  Saved time when we got to the Park. Another great thing about staying at Staybridge is the free breakfast.  It's not 5-star food, but definitely good enough to fuel you up in the morning before heading out the the Park.  Waffles, eggs, bacon, sausage, cereal, muffins... pretty much anything you would need to

I stayed here for 10 nights while visiting friends in Anaheim. Very friendly staff that were very helpful and informative. The hotel was very clean and well laid out and had a cheap shuttle bus right right door that took you to Disneyland. The room was very clean and well organized and had everything you needed. There was a pool and a Spa outside which I didn't get chance to use, but they looked very nice. Its in a nice area of Anaheim and I felt very safe in the resort. Close to the Disneyland Resort and Plenty of Classic American restaurants: Dennys, IHOP ..ETC.  Its not the most fancy of hotels, But its clean, well run and has a nice family atmosphere!   Would totally recomend this hotel to anyone wanting to have a great stay In Anaheim and at Disneyland!

Slight differencing of opinion between me and my partner on this one. I thought the hotel was okay. Middle of road, did what it should but nothing noteworthy really. Partner loved it.   The check in was very pleasant with a very friendly and warm receptionist. Hotel was pretty busy and so we got a room that was quite a distance from the elevator (not a huge problem for us though) The room itself was a decent size, maybe a little bit tired - good selection of crockery etc for the kitchen. The bed was comfortable and large. I found the room lighting to be very depressing - all strip lighting and stark (but a very minor point really) It felt like a floridian hotel. We were not visiting the theme parks but using it as a base to explore the greater LA area and for that it was a

Room was comfortable and clean although not luxurious. Breakfast was excellent with cooked eggs and meat(alternated between sausage and bacon) and delicious muffins. Staff were polite and friendly. All in all this was a very relaxing hotel and I really enjoyed it.  I would stay here again.

Visited Staybridge Suites last week.  Very complete stay.  Complimentary offerings: parking, internet, breakfast, adult beverage at night, meal a couple of nights a week.  Full size refrigerator, microwave, stove top, and a small assortment of plates, silverware, and pans.  It is on a feeder road for the I-5 on-ramp, so it is pretty bare.  But there is a number of restaurants close by.  Good sized room with an additional folding sofa bed.  AAA rate was very competitive.  Pool is shared with the Holiday Inn next door.  Didn't check out the fitness center.  Enjoyed the stay, look forward to using it for another stay in the future!

I'm not sure how many readers have experience with Staybridge hotels, which is IHG's (Holiday Inn) "semi-upscale" extended stay chain.  If you've stayed in a Staybridge, you'll know what to expect.  This property follows their formula, so you get a good free breakfast buffet with some changing variety (better than what you'd get at a Holdiay Inn Express, worse than what you'd pay for at a 4-star hotel), a nice-but-not-luxurious suite with cooking facilities, and some free evening food on Tuesdays through Thursdays.  Given all their Disney traffic, the staff here seemed a bit more harried than most Staybridges, but they were friendly and helpful when they weren't over-run with guest requests.  I'm sure many families will want to know whether this is a good hotel to stay at for

Summary Heading: So glad we chose this hotel
Summary: We had a spacious suite with one king bed, two queen beds and one sleeper sofa for our family of 6.  The price was right, including free breakfast buffet.  It was close to Disney but we did drive to the parks as the bus was not too frequent and the walk was long.  It is a Disney Good Neighbor Hotel so you do get "magic hours," which were lost on us - who goes to the park at 7am???  The Anaheim Angels Stadium is very close by as well.  We met up with friends whose family of 5 stayed in a smaller suite.  I'd definitely recommend the two bedroom suite for families of 5 -7.  Our only regret is that we stayed in Santa Monica for the last two days of our vacation, where we paid 3x the price per night with far less amenities.  We caught a Dodgers game while staying in Anaheim and the

Summary Heading: First time at a Staybridge, might be the only time
Summary: We booked this Disney Good Neighbor hotel because the Disney Resort hotels were full.  This hotel was cheaper than Disney Resort, and the included Anaheim Resort Transit passes worked out well. The other plus was that this hotel was SUPER quiet. The walls are insulated well! I could hear people in the room next to us through their door in the hallway, but once I walked into our suite, there was absolutely NO noise coming from that room. The continental breakfast was very good! Wide selection and complete with a variety of eggs, meats, etc.  Here are the negatives: The rooms were not ready at 4:00 check-in. We were given a SMOKING room without our approval, and the desk staff was not very congenial. Coffee in the lobby was supposed to be available, but if one gets up and going by
Manager Response: Dear MNWilder,   Thank you for taking the time to convey your comments regarding your recent experience with us.  We rely on you, our guest, to let us know how we are doing and how we can better meet your needs.  We have sent you a private message to obtain additional details about your experience.  Regards,  Karen C Case Manager IHGCare

Summary: We stayed here for 5 nights when visiting Disneyland. The hotel is overwhelmed with the number of visitors and you can feel that the staff is doing their best to keep up. We stayed in 1 bedroom king suite, and it was nice, clean and specious. However, The breakfast area and common facilities is a mess, and it is obvious that they are way understaffed.

The hotel staff was friendly and had a free cookout one night while we were here. The main pool and jacuzzi were adequate.  The rooms were standard with either a view of the highway (front) or the pool and trailer park (back), so if you really want nice views this isn't the hotel for you. On the other hand, there were tons of families with kids - so if you have children you will fit right in. Also the shuttle bus to/from Disneyland stopped at the hotel next door (Holiday Inn), so it was conveniently located a few easy steps away. The bus was very crowded at times, so if you don't like squeezing in - you may want to rent a car. Fortunately the park was only a few miles away so the bus ride was quick.

Stayed for 4 nights for a Disneyland trip.  Rooms were mostly clean, and beds comfortable.  The bathtub was dirty, and the bathroom sink was visibly cracked.  We were there shortly after some windy days in Anaheim, but it appears little or no effort was made to clear wind blown dirt out of the pool, or to clean up the grounds, as there was litter everywhere around the parking lot. Breakfast was about what you expect for a "freebie", but same thing day after day.  It is close to Disneyland, and the price was average for the area.   We would consider staying again, but would probably check out other hotels in the area first.

Stayed for a week.  Comfortable bed and nice sized room,  clean throughout our stay.  The ART bus service to Disneyland stops outside and runs every 20 minutes.  You can have unlimited travel anywhere in Anaheim for just $2 a day if like us you are over 60.  Transfer to other routes at the Disneyland Resort.   Breakfast is provided as part of the deal,  although there is no provision for an evening meal.  You can however use the restaurant at the Holiday Inn next door, which is reasonably priced.   Turn right out of the hotel and walk 300 yards down Manchester Avenue under the fly over and you will find the tour bus terminus.  From here you can book tours to San Diego Zoo and Sea World, Universal Studios, and various trips around LA.  If visiting Disneyland Adventure make sure

Stayed a couple of nights here and it was a decent place. It obviously sees a lot of traffic and shows it as the wear and tear shows all around the property. Good value and was a little crowded on a weekend stay. Breakfast was limited but was to be expected in this class of property. The value was there and would stay again for a longer stay as it has nice in room features. Front desk staff was helpful and cheerful.

Our family of four traveled from New Zealand to visit Disneyland and found that the Staybridge Suites had everything we needed for a great stay. The 2-bedroom unit had everything we needed and it was good to have the option of cooking facilities, although we ended up eating out on both days of our stay. The bus for Disneyland left every 20 minutes from in front of the Holiday Inn next door and was easy to use, once you worked out how to use the ticket machine. The bus trip only took about 10 minutes. I would recommend this hotel for a family visiting Disneyland.

Stayed here to visit Disneyland and I'm glad we did. It's a limited service hotel with efficient staff. The suite was well appointed with a microwave, a dishwasher and a refrigerator. There is a 24/7 store for anything you may need. They serve free beer and wine along with burgers and hotdogs from 5.30 to 7.30pm.....and a shuttle every 20 minutes to Disney. What more could anyone want?!

Summary Heading: Disney and LA Trip with children and grandchild
Summary: We are really glad we picked Staybridge Suites for our trip to Disney and California. We rented a 2 bedroom 2 bath suite with kitchen and had plenty of room for 5 of us. The room was very clean and the 2 baths made it easy to get ready. The place had a nice pool that we did not use and a fitness facility. The staff were so nice and answered all our questions with a smile and gave us good directions to every place we went. We had a good full breakfast every day which had a variety of food to please us all. They do have food and drinks Tuesday - Thursday around late afternoon, but we were never there at that time. We spent 2 days at Disney, 1 at Universal Studios, 1 in Hollywood, and 1 day we drove to Big Bear Lake which was beautiful. We also liked that there was no fee for

We arrived late into LAX and had a pre-booked towncar to the resort. ($120 plus tip - Sunnys Transport). Was nice and easy.   Stayed for four nights and spent 2.5 days at Disneyland parks. Kids had had enough by lunch on third day.  We had a two bedroom suite. Kids room has double beds each in their room and own bathroom. Great layout and room was nice and clean. My wife really fussy about rooms and was given the pass mark. The room is not 5 star but trade off is for the great space. I had read about freeway noise but we did not experience it and we were on that side of the building.   The free breakfasts are great and plenty of hot food as well as usual fruit etc. Breakfast is a buffet and we fuelled up for the day. It is completely self serve and all plates and cutlery are

My husband and I recently got married and we wanted to honeymoon in Anaheim. After reading online reviews for local hotels in the area, we chose Staybridge. This hotel had a 4.8/5 star rating on most sites, and after staying there for a week, we can see why!  The Hotel: The room itself was clean, and it was great having a full kitchen. This hotel has a laundry mat, a gym (which is basic, but I used it and it served its purpose), and an on-site convenience store which sells snacks, beverages, and little meals that you can heat up in the microwave in your room. You can also borrow DVDs from the front desk to watch in your room. They even have a computer where you can print your boarding passes, and they held our luggage for about 8 hours while we waited for our overnight flight.

We are on a road trip from Indiana. I'm a IHG member and we stayed at another Staybridge on the way. So we looked into one in Anaheim area. We were not disappointed. Love it here! We got a two room suite and had 5 people in it for a few nights. We had more than enough space to even spread out. The breakfast was delicious. We had no problems finding a table. Yeah it was busy but I think that proves how fantastic the hotel is. The front desk was always extra kind to us. Kymmy (I think that's her name) helped us so much!
