Several ladies really made us feel like we were valued friends instead of just hotel guests. Everything you need and then some.  My 15 year old is in a wheelchair and the shuttles being right next door was priceless. For $5 for a day pass we could go pretty much

We have just come back from a fantastic  stay , from the start check in was quick,polite and fully informative even after 23 hours of traveling. Free breakfast saved us $$$$$! . Rooms were clean, little small but we didn't spend much time inside. From our side of the hotel  we could see the Disney fireworks each night at 21:30 from the comfort of our sofa!.kitchen well equipped massive fridge, microwave,dishwasher,hob. X3 nights a week snacks (hotdogs/nachos/chilli free soft drinks, beer/wine) again free very nice eaten by the pool. Boys 12,15,19 had plenty to do and it felt like a very safe area to give them a bit of freedom going to the local shops or to the games room in the Holiday inn next door. Can't fault it.

I am a IHG Rewards member and I must say, my family and I LOVED this hotel!  It was selected by our travel agent for a trip I had earned at work.  Due to some special needs in our family, we elected the two bedroom suite.  Our room was great!  Clean, stylish, functional. Wonderful view of the pool that is shared with the Holiday Inn sister property next door.   My only concern here is that due to the popularity of this hotel with families, it is a little worn on the edges, but in a way, that endeared us to the property as it felt like home.  The kitchen in the room helped us accommodate certain dietary restrictions, but some of us elected for the full breakfast each morning which was very good.  This hotel was close enough to Disneyland for convenience, but far enough removed

We have recently used this property for the third time and I feel compelled to write a review. We were upgraded on the first night without question to fit in with the rest of our stay. With an on site laundry, pool, buffet breakfast supplied, and self contained rooms this has to be the answer to the traditional kiwi motel and very well appointed.  It is slightly away from the main hustle and bustle of downtown Disney but I think that's a good thing.  The big improvement since our last stay are the large screen high definition televisions.  Please don't dismiss this as a great option for a traditional holiday with all the additional extras you could hope for. Pity more NZ motels didn't follow the pet friendly model!

Summary Heading: Excellent location; relatively aged rooms; service has room to improve.
Summary: My daughter, wife and I stayed at this propery in August of 2013.  We stayed a total of 4 nights.  Our overall experience was positive.  Breakfast is good but also filled with people.  Room is relatively older than we had anticipated.  Service is adequate but can be improved.  I guess when you deal with so many people, it is hard to get your service up to a certain standard.  Location wise, this place is awesome.  It is very close to Disneyland and shuttle stop is just a few steps away from entrance.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review our property.  I understand your concern with the age of the property and we are planning a large renovation in the next couple of years, however we have had a number of improvements this year.  This year alone we received flat screen televisions with HD programming, new table and floor lighting, sofa sleepers, sofa/kitchen chairs, new carpet throughout the common areas, etc.  It does concern me that you had issues with the service.  We pride ourselves on customer service and it is reflected in many of our reviews.  I have sent you a private message in order to gather more details.  Thanks again for staying with us.  We hope to see you again in the near future.

Summary Heading: Great Family Hotel - lots of space, great for Disney Visitors
Summary: This is a good quality Staybridge Suites. We have rented a two bedroom suite three times now in the past three years for our summer Disney trips.  Rooms are large, full kitchen, three TV's (1 in each bedroom and 1 in the livingroom area).  We were 5 people in the room and it felt like plenty of space.  Clean, well equipped and you get free breakfast (but get there early - its a mad rush anytime after 7am every day we were there).....  great for families or sports teams.  Would stay again (and we have!)

Spacious, clean, kids room with bunk beds, kitchen and dining table. On site laundry and daily breakfast. Starbucks next door! Nice size pool. Close to Disney. Really cute shop in lobby, great friendly staff. Especially the night front desk guy! We had a large white with 10 that was blocking the entrance a bit as we unloaded, another guest made a really huge issue of the situation, staff member was very diplomatic and professional! His understanding was really appreciated. Will stay here again next time we pass through!

Summary Heading: Great place to stay when visiting Disneyland
Summary: We stayed at this great hotel for three nights and we were delighted with it.Nice rooms,good breakfast and outstanding staff. Pam on Front Desk gave us excellent advice concerning Disneyland and the perfect time to arrive there.In fact we had done many rides in the quiet time before 10 a.m. And we could return to the hotel in the afternoon to regroup before more fun at the Park in the evening. We will certainly stay here next time we visit.

Whenever I travel to this area for business, I usually pick this hotel.  The prices are always reasonable and the Staybridge Suites always offers the most for the money.  From the free breakfast to the "manager's reception" during the middle of the week - and don't forget the free laundry service - I'm always happy to stay here.  The hotel is quiet and well maintained.  The staff is friendly. I don't usually take advantage of the shuttle as I usually have my own vehicle.  It's also very centrally located for all my business needs.

After much consideration and debate, my wife and I decided to spend this year's Disneyland vacation at the Staybridge Suites Anaheim.  In making this choice, we were deciding for my entire family which, in addition to my wife and I, included my parents as well as my sister, her husband, and her large family that includes 5 kids.  The hotel appeared to be close to the parks with easy access to the 5 freeway should we decide to visit other parts of Southern California.  The location is fine, though it's a little further than it might appear due its location on a one way road.  The staff is friendly and efficient at check-in, the grounds well-manicured, and the pool adequate (as it's shared with the large Holiday Inn that's part of the same complex), but there are better choices
Manager Response: Dear eibzz121,  Thank you for taking the time to provide feedback on your stay.  It is unfortunate the popularity and available sections of the breakfast prevented you from fully enjoying your time at the hotel.  We are confident the necessary adjustments will be made, in order to achieve complete guest satisfaction.   Thank you again for your comments, we look forward to serving you in the future.   Sincerely,  Ben J Case Manager IHGCare

Summary Heading: Better than expected for a family trip
Summary: We booked our trip at the Staybridge Suites Anaheim because it seemed reasonably close to Disneyland and because we figured we might as well splurge to get enough space for all of us and earn some points at the same time. We spent four nights there, and it was well with it. First, the location, while not as close to Disneyland as we'd hoped, is actually fine.  It's just far enough away that you're not in the middle of the Disney chaos. It's a short drive to Disney parking, which, depending on how big your group is, may well be easier and cost less than taking the Anaheim transit thing. Also, it's a really easy trip to the 5 or the 405, or several useful surface streets, which made it a surprisingly good base for day adventures as distant from each other as a Burbank studio tour,

Clean hotel and friendly staff. Front desk offered to upgrade our room for free - from 1BR to 2BR with small living room. Made a big difference since we were staying multiple nights w/ kids. Convenient to Disney using public transportation. Bus stop was a short walk from hotel. Bus ticket kiosk not user friendly. Said it accepted credit cards but did not. Bring exact cash w/you since machine does not dispense change. Don't understand neg breakfast reviews. Had variety of hot/cold items. Staff did a nice job keeping area stocked and clean considering such a large number of people moving through in a short period of time. Would agree they need to provide more fresh fruit and maybe a few flavors of yogurt.  Did not see poor behavior from staff, but did see several rude guests,

My family and I (all 15 of us!) stayed at the Staybridge Suites for our vacation to Disneyland back in June. We had two suites. The staff was very accomodating, they were super nice (even when I thought I lost some of my luggage when we first checked in--they sent someone out to look for me--turns out my other family member picked it up for me). The pool was nice, only got to use it once (was at Disneyland too much) they had the ART shuttle running every 20 minutes, which was very convienent. We just had to walk across to the hotel next door to catch it. We had my elderly grandma, who is in a wheelchair, and they were so nice to her at the shuttle. Always first one on, first one off. I would recommend ordering the room service, we ordered some salad (thinking it would be a light

This is a great family resort close to Disneyland and Angel Stadium. We were down there for a concert at the stadium. Perfect location and walkable to the stadium. All rooms are suites with kitchenette. Helps to cut the cost for eating out. Very helpful staff too.

We stayed here for 14 nights with 2 young children (3 and 5) whilst visiting the Anaheim and LA areas.  The rooms are clean and comfortable without being to flash.  The kitchenettes are handy when you don't feel like eating greasy takeaway.  The included breakfasts were great, although you had to get downstairs early to avoid the masses.  The waffle makers were very popular!  The ART is just out the front next to the Holiday Inn making it very easy to get to Disneyland.

Summary Heading: Clean and basic hotel with good rates and helpful staff.
Summary: My family and I just stayed at this hotel for 9 nights and we were satisfied with our choice.  The hotel was clean and the staff were friendly and helpful.  The clothing washers and dryers are free to use which is excellent with a family.  It is a five minute drive to Disneyland which was good for us.  It is right beside a highway so the view out the front is nothing special although we could see the stadium where the Angels play from our hotel room.  One thing I didn't like was the selection at breakfast.  There was hardly any fruit, canned peaches and melon were the only choices every single day.  The pastries and muffins were cheap and didn't taste very good.  I also saw a staff member refilling the Kellogg's branded Fruit Loops with a no name brand "fruit Whirls" package.
Manager Response: Dear Kandice R,  I appreciate your candid feedback about our property. It is nice to know that you found our location clean and staff friendly. However, I apologize that the breakfast experience was not up to par. I have your concerns noted and this will be addressed with our team to consider for enhancements needed.   We hope to have another chance to welcome you back soon should your travels bring you back to the area.  Kind Regards,  Pam G Case Manager IHGCare

Summary Heading: Great Location for Disney family vacation!
Summary: We just returned from a week with our son and family, total of 7: 4 adults, 3 kids.  We had a 2 bedroom suite: 2 double beds in one bedroom with private bath, king in other bedroom with private bath, separated by sitting area with kitchen.  We expected small appliances, but the refrigerator was full size, a plus for stocking food. We loved our time at Staybridge!  The breakfast was wonderful, plentiful and re-stocked for the breakfast hours. No matter if we went early or late, food was there & hot.  The laundry area-free, no less!-was available 24 hours. We knew about the laundry room from other reviews and packed light.  We flew from Ohio and our son drove from WA State. Packing light was a plus! We also enjoyed the happy hours with generous snacks Tues- TH, also complimentary.

Our party of 2 adults and 3 children stayed in a 2 bedroom suite which was a perfect for our stay. We stayed for 6 nights and found the property to be very clean. The hot buffet breakfast was really good. The swimming was pool was also really nice and has tidy grounds.  After changing to this hotel last minute we were really happy that the hotel was only a 7 minute drive to Disneyland. Fantastic family hotel.

Summary Heading: Treated poorly and management knows of health food safety violations
Summary: I booked through Disney travel and they placed us here.  The room was adequate although small.  The dishwasher was broken.  While the staff did maintain and clean our room,  the cleaning service was adequate, as most of the hotel was dirty or just old.  What ruined our stay was the breakfast.  While it is include in your room charge, the food was low quality and staffed by somebody he most rude staff.  Before the posted time of the kitchen area closing, they placed a chain across the entrance stated they were closed and baring guests from getting any food.  Furthermore, the staff was replacing food and then helping them self to plates of food.  The staff then took the eggs out and placed them on ice for use the next day.  This is a food service violation,  and the management
Manager Response: The breakfast closes promptly at 9:30am during the weekdays.  Often times guests arrive late but we still allow them to go in and grab what is still available.  Typically they will allow one or two family members go in and get food for the rest of their family.  We can’t let multiple families come into the buffet area after it has closed otherwise the staff would never be able to clean and go home on time.  We feel that three hours is more than enough time to come down and enjoy breakfast.  While staff members have taken advantage of what was left over after breakfast we never replenish items specifically for them.  I spoke with our kitchen staff and they informed me that any eggs that are on the buffet line at the close of breakfast are discarded.  The eggs that were on ice were cooked prior to the end of breakfast but were not used so they were placed on ice.  They remained covered and were cooled down to the proper temperature in accordance with local health regulations.  Typically we have between 500-700 people in-house each day during our peak season and we have not had any reports this year of guests becoming ill due to the food from breakfast or evening managers reception.  We receive surprise inspections a minimum of twice a year and have always passed.  We are very proud of the hospitality as well as the services we provide and I feel that is reflected in the outstanding reviews we have received via TripAdvisor.  We invite you to see first-hand the above and beyond approach we take to providing our guests with a unique and memorable experience.

Summary Heading: Great studio room for visit to Disneyland
Summary: We stayed at the Staybridge Suites for our visit to Disneyland and LA. The queen studio unit we had for the three of us was very nice with a full kitchen, sofa bed, and large screen TV. It was the perfect size for  us and it was great to have the kitchen to prepare meals. The kitchen includes a cooktop, full size refrigerator, microwave, coffee maker, dishwasher, and dishes, glasses, utensils, and pots and pans. Everything worked good, except the dishwasher in our room wasn't the best at cleaning some of the utensils and pots and pans and they only give you a very limited amount of utensils.  The queen bed was honestly one of the most comfortable beds I have ever slept on. There is a great breakfast buffet every morning with a large selection of hot and cold items and we never

The Staybridge Suites were EXCELLENT!!! The staff were more than helpful and friendly. The breakfast each morning had a wide variety and there were also free meals a couple nights each week for dinner. Laundry services were FREE! That is unheard of. The room was clean and well-kept. I would recommend this hotel to EVERYONE!! Thanks Staybridge Suites. We will definitly be staying again!

I really like our stay here. Everything looks clean and the kitchen is a plus too, new cooking ware and you got everything you need. We loved having a free breakfast, its definitely a dollar saver considering how everything at the park is expensive. The area as well is safe and not ghetto-ish. 2 miles away but we saved by staying here. TIP: ask what time the buffet breakfast ends, we did not get our freebie on a monday which ends earlier than on weekends.

Can't beat this place for the buck; Quiet, nice clean rooms, friendly staff,  and a FREE breakfast. We will definitely stay here again.  Side note, they have the most comfortable sofa bed I have ever slept on!

Some things were a little dated and rough but overall a great hotel.  We had a 1 br suite for 3 adults and 3 kids.  The bathroom could have been bigger.  The breakfast was ok...not great...but it was free.  Free laundry was a plus.  The pool area was nice.  Kind of cold! but nice.  The hot tub was large and nice after a chilling swim.  The location was good.  We rode the ART to Disney.  Only about 15 minutes to the gate.  Staff was awesome.  Overall a good experience.

Were a family of 4 (2 boys 6, and 8) from Modesto CA. As soon as we arrived we were informed at check in we had been upgraded to 1bdr suiet. The hotel was very clean for the amount of kiddos running all around.  The breakfast was just ok.  It was a free for all hot buffet with lil kiddos running in and out.  During the week they have beer and wine in the evening to help calm the nerves from 2 fighting boys in the park all day.  We have been going to Disneyland every year for 6 years now and this is hands down one of the best.  If you have kiddos and want a nice clean room and comfy bed with free breakfast this is your place.  This is not a business hotel or for someone looking for piece and quiet.  I look foward to bringing my lil monsters back next year.

We Stayed here in May 2013,Me,my husband,kids and their kids.We loved waking up everymorning to hot breakfast,making your own waffles, toast & bagels your way. It was a great way to start our mornings before heading out to our destinations. The pool and grill area was exceptional we bar- b- qued while the kids were swimming. Our suite was perfect for 8 of us.  We would definitely return and recommend this place to family and friends ( as a matter of fact, I already did) The kids loved the free Wi-Fi,laundry,excercise room and free parking!! The only thing we were sad about was leaving.

Staybridge is a really fantastic motel near to Disneyland with a friendly staff & an awesome hot breakfast!  The gentleman who cleans up after breakfast visited with us each mornng.  We stayed six nights & really enjoyed the kitchen in our room.  We found the ART easy to use to get around...It feel so good to sit down on the bus & get delivered to the front gate of Disneyland.  Medieval Times was waaaaay more fun than we expected. Staybridge was much nicer in every way than some of the motels right across the street from Disneyland we tried in the past.  We really appreciate the happy staff & good prices.   Have FUN or don't go!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Summary Heading: A great alternative when our Timeshare was not available
Summary: We are owner of Worldmark and when that was not available for the weekend we wanted to visit SoCal we booked this place.  We wanted to have that feel of a small apartment and this did the job.  We love the big size pool and the BBQ grills outside.  We didn't use the kitchenette in our room but it's there for those who want to cook.  Plenty of parking and it also shares the pool and parking with the Holiday Inn next door (we stayed there too....see my other reveiw).  Has a descent fitness center and laundry room.  Love the free breakfast!  The weekend we stayed ehre was quiet! Staff was wonderful!  Close to grocery store, 24 Hour Fitness and restaurants.  Would stay here again for the right price!!

We stayed here the first week in May for 6 nights. First impression was good, clean, not muggy, didn't smell bad. Our room was very clean and looked newly updated. We stayed in a 2 bed suite facing the pool. Was very quite. It was so nice having the full kitchen, however, it took 2 days for the fridge to get cold, they must turn it completely OFF in between people? When we first got there it was not cold at all. The breakfast was ok, same powdered eggs, etc as any other hotel. It was nice to have though, but they do not have nearly enough tables for people to eat at. One morning we sat outside, which was fine, but we left our key in our room and we were locked out of the hotel for about 20 min until someone came out. The beds are very hard, they either need to be replaced or get

Good parking.Clean rooms and nice and quiet rooms.We had a one bedroom suite,Breakfast ok but hectic area.Had a swim in the pool and it was very clean and refreshing after being on a plane for 18 hours.

I absolutely love this hotel. I've stayed several times and I wouldn't stay anywhere else. I would recommend this hotel to anyone traveling with or without children. We had a suite for our party of 8. The room was set up well and was very accomodating. The staff is always kind, friendly and helpful and the hotel is clean. They have great amenities and the breakfast is good. We had the free breakfast several mornings in a row and we were very pleased with their breakfast options. They have fully stocked kitchenettes for preparing your own meals if you'd like. The hotel is also very well kept. We utilizied the laundry facilities and heated swimming pool and found them very clean and convenient.  We met many of the other guests in the hotel at the pool while on vacation and
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to fill out the survey.  We appreciate your kind words and are happy to hear you've come back to visit us!  Thank you for your repeat business!

Summary: This is prime location for Disney and going to the angels game staff was nice, room acceptable, but, the breakfast is packed and a little low on quality.  The rooms are mostly clean appliances are a little old, but workable.

Summary Heading: The hotel isn't the cleanest but it has a lot of amenities.
Summary: We started with a one bedroom suite with two kids, my wife, and I. Big mistake. Don't try to save the coin...get a two bedroom. The AC unit went out in our first one bedroom suite so we upgraded to the two bedroom suite for a far better experience. The two bedroom was much cleaner. The lady (Kim) at the desk was a bit uh less than nice. I probably would be too but just sayin'. The pool was filthy our first night but was cleaned up. Overall it's probably one of the better options in Anaheim. Don't pay more than 240/night for the two bedroom suite.
Manager Response: We pride ourselves on our overall product, not just customer service.  It concerns me that you experienced issues with cleanliness, both in the room and the pool area and I apologize if it caused you any inconvenience.  I appreciate your feedback and will be addressing it with our staff.  Thank you for taking the time to fill out the survey, your feedback will help us serve you and other guests better in the future.

Summary Heading: I concur that this place is great
Summary: The suite was cozy, with 3 flat screen TVs having a good channel selection, two bedrooms each with their own bath, and a shared space with kitchen in between the bedrooms. This Staybridge was a price premium over Embassy Suites but the extra comfort and privacy was worth it for myself and 3 teens. We were on the freeway side. It's low white noise, maybe bring earplugs if you're sensitive to that.The outdoor pool area and jacuzzi is nice. Staff were pleasant and efficient, including for breakfast.

We arrived early am from and overnight flight And the staff allowed us to check in early and help ourselves to their buffet breakfast.  The room was comfortable and had everything we needed.  A buffet breakfast was available every morning.  The kids loved the heated pool and the laundry room was also a bonus. Shuttle buses run every 20 minutes from the hotel next door to Disneyland all day so getting around was easy.

The staff was amazing. We got into Anaheim earlier than expected. Our room wasn't available early (which was fine) but they called us when it was ready while we were enjoying Disneyland. I had bought gift baskets to surprise the kids when we checked-in. They had them waiting in our room. The kids were so surprised. Anytime we had questions or needed towels to the pool they were so friendly. The hot breakfast was good and had variety. It is so convenient that pool is open till 11pm. There is nothing like a dip in the hot tub after a long day of walking at Disney. The other guests we encountered were friendly as well. It was a great place. I'm glad we opted for a suite. Having the kitchen and living room area was a plus. I thought our room was great. They were remodeling the week

Summary Heading: Great location, great service, great suite.
Summary: After trying an online booking company my wife called the facility directly.  The contact person was very helpful and friendly, arranging a wonderful two bedroom suite for our family of seven.  The free breakfast that was provided was exceptional! Facilities were clean, staff friendly and helpful, great pool. Staybridge is now our first facility choice for Disneyland trips.

We recently stayed in a two bedroom, two bath suite with kitchenette while we went to Disney and Legoland.  It worked out very well for three adults and three children.  The public areas are very nice.  The free breakfast and afternoon snacks were a great surprise!  The furniture in the room was nice and it appeared the carpet was newer.  The bedding and linens are "tired" and need to be updated.  There was a note they were replacing curtains in the rooms so I think they might be in the process of updating.  The pool area was really nice also and we spent a fun afternoon there.  The staff is helpful.  We were a little surprised that room cleaning is abbreviated.  During the week, they make the bed and replace used towels.  On weekend, you have to request even that.  However, if

Summary Heading: Best place for a Family trip to Disney
Summary: The suite was perfect for a family of 6. Breakfast was well worth the wake up before going to Disney. The kitchen was lacking an oven, but the two BBQ's in the back near the pool allowed us to grill many dinners... And a couple pizzas! Staff was more than friendly and attentive. Pool was great.

Stayed here for one night in a 2-bedroom suite. Suite was spacious and clean, and extra bathroom was helpful. Convenient location, very close to Disney. Depending on your room, you may have a view of fireworks. Bright decor and friendly, attentive service. Depending on availability, you can purchase park tickets at the front desk, and they offer free computer access as well. Complimentary buffet is your standard fare: decent, but nothing to write home about.  Cons: Cable/satellite, so no real movie options and no parental controls. Free WiFi was somewhat spotty in our suite.   All in all, served our needs well. I would stay again and recommend.

We chose this location as it was convenient for both Disney and Knotts Berry theme parks. We booked a queen sized room for two adults and two adult size sons. The room was of adequate size with a small kitchenette area but the bathroom area was a bit on the small size. The level of service was very good from the staff with the receptionist particularly helpful after a long flight. The breakfast is complimentary and was of a high standard, also the hotel offer complimentary evening meals / drinks on certain evenings. We used the gym a couple times and was small but served a purpose.

Our family of 4 recently stayed here for our trip to Disney.  We had the 1 bedroom suite with 2 double beds...perfect size for a young family.  Very roomy & quiet....our hotel floor was full of families with young kids, we could barely hear any noise unless they were walking past our door. Service was fantastic...we really appreciated the help of one of the front desk hostesses...I believe her name was Pam, she made our stay there that much better. So many perks to this hotel...breakfast buffets were great to start the busy days, they had Social nights 3x/wk which were also great after spending a busy day out, & FREE laundry machines to use!! Although we shared a pool with another hotel, it was never full...& it was heated!!  We rented a car, so, didn't use the ART...but, it is

We stayed here 3 years ago and were very pleased, so we booked it again for family trip.  It did not seem as nice this time, just alright.  The room was clean. Our children were disappointed to find out the pool would be closed until our last day/night. The parking stalls seem rather narrow and parking is tight.  The breakfast buffet lacks variety; would like to see biscuits and gravy on occasion.  Probably will stay somewhere else next time.
Manager Response: Dear lawin22,  Thank you for taking the time to write a review about your experience with us.  Please accept our sincere apology for the shortcomings you experienced and regret your most recent stay experience with us did not live up to your expectations. While we understand that your stay was less than satisfactory, we thank you for sharing your feedback as this is our best resource for improving guest services.  We thank you for staying with us and hope that you would give us another chance to make your stay as best as it can be.  Sincerely,  Joel B Case Manager IHGCare

Summary: Our family of 5 stayed in a 2 bedroom suite. The room was fantastic. Very roomy, clean and quiet. The hotel service was good. We bought tickets on the shuttle which were great, however ended up walking to Disneyland a couple of times due to the bus filling up and having to wait another 25 mins for the next shuttle. Quicker to walk. Our only criticism of the hotel was the breakfast. Food quality was poor to average and it didn't open until 7.30am on Sunday meaning it was not possible to make the 8am opening for Disneyland if you wanted to have breakfast before going. On other mornings, we had to wait quite some time as the hot food was out, bread was out, butter was out, juice was out. Finally when they were replenished, the crowd swarmed in like seagulls on a chip. Apart from

This hotel worked out really nice for our trip to Disney.  Had a two room suite, king bed in one room and two queens in the other.  Each room had a seperate bath, with a living room/kitchen in the middle.  We were on the back side of the hotel and did not notice any traffic noise, as this hotel is right off the freeway.  The room was about the price of two regular rooms, but worked really well with the room in the middle.  Hotel was not shinney new, but clean and the staff was friendly and gave good service.  Breakfast was very good.  If you ever bought breakfast at the park, this is a big savings.   I will stay here again on the next trip to Disney.

Summary Heading: for family rather than business trip, close to freeway
Summary: Among the many hotels in Anaheim, this one clearly is oriented towards the Disney visitors, specifically families and youth groups, rather than at business travellers. This also shows in a certain level of wear and tear inside the hotel. Rooms (called studio, included a kitchenette) are spacious for single use, but I talked to another guest who had reserved a room for four and got basically the same room I had with one king bed and a sleeper couch; for four people a little too cosy. My room faced the busy I5 freeway, and there was ample noise from that in the room all night long. Fairly good breakfast spread. Staff was friendly and very helpful. Connection to Disney and other locations by the Anaheim Resort shuttle for $5 per day,takes about 20 min to get to the parks.
Manager Response: Dear tmk010,  Thank you for taking the time to express your thoughts and concerns. We are so glad you liked the friendliness of our staff and our breakfast selections. We apologize for the room accommodations you had that was less than satisfactory and the outside noise which affected your stay negatively. We take our guest comments very seriously and always strive to provide comfortable and friendly accommodations. Thank you for staying and we hope you give us another chance to make your stay as best as it can be.  Sincerely,  Anthony M Case Manager IHGCare

Summary: Stayed here on recommendation of a friend, and had a great experience.  Complimentary breakfast was excellent, Wi-Fi worked fine, self-service laundry machines are free (except detergent - $1 single-use Tide boxes available at the front desk.)  The bedroom fitted with 2 double beds is a little tight on space, but not a big deal honestly since it's just for sleeping.  If you have young kids, having a separate living room in the suite is a godsend.  Hotel parking is free, and it is just a few minutes drive from the Toy Story Disney parking lot.

Summary Heading: Wahoo ! Great value, close to Disney ,clean and great!
Summary: Will definitely stay again! We had a 1 bedroom suite with kitchen king sized bed in the bedroom and living room. Was clean and newly updated from what we could tell. Breakfasts were great- lot of options. It isn't a 5 star breakfast, but perfect with kids- just get up and head down the hall for food! Saved lots of $$ with this option . DId a night social with bbq'd hamburgers and hotdogs and wine and beer. Was fabulous! What a way to be greeted after a long day at Legoland ! A fun bbq waiting! Staff was nice and things were clean- I really can't see how clean they keep it seeing they have so many socials and breakfasts with small kids eating and dropping food, touching things with sticky fingers etc- but they do a great job :) Bed was very comfortable- the pullout wasn't so

Just came back from our westcoast trip to Disneyland.  Stayed in a 2 bedroom suite for 4 adults/one child.  Fantastic hotel through and through.  room was great - kitchen area was a bit dated but otherwise spacious, comfortable and VERY clean.  Buffet breakfast was tasty and free each morning and 3 of the nights they had free beer/wine and apps.  Also free was the washing machine/dryer.  Housekeeping staff kept this family friendly hotel spotless.  Easy access via ART bus to the parks and anywhere else you wanted to go. Can't say enough good things about this hotel.  If I every go back I will definitely stay here again....so worth it in every way!

Just came back from there first time, stayed 7 nights, had a fabulous time, all the staff there were really nice and very helpful and full of tips, (if you smile, ask nicely and show how grateful you are then they will show you the same courtesy). The social nights were a savior because we were too tired to cook or find somewhere down the road to eat, free breakfast great way to start the day, on our last day we checked out by 11 am and as we didn't have to be at the airport til 6 pm they stored our bags while we went up the road for a few hours and let us sit in the lounge till our express bus came. If you are a hotel snob don't come here because you would ruin the place, people say you get what you pay for I think we got way more!!!! Before you catch the no12 ART bus to

I stayed here a month ago with my brother and his family.  Our first impression of the hotel was good.  The room was good. The rates were good.  Sadly, this was short lived when we discovered that my brother's truck was broken into in their parking lot.  Someone broke into my brother's car and stole the entire 3rd row seat out of his SUV.  The receptionist's response to this was "oh no, not another one".  After reading reviews on Travel Advisor, other people have posted that the same thing has happened to them in this hotel's parking lot.  I have tried to reach out to the hotel to discuss this but they are not responsive. There wasn't even any hotel management on site the day this happened.  Clearly they know they have an issue with theft in their parking lot but they are
Manager Response: Dear Tutu816,  Thank you for taking the time to relay your comments regarding our property during your recent stay. Your comments are very troubling and will certainly be looked into. We’d like to obtain some additional details regarding your experience, so we have sent you a private message.  We look forward to hearing back from you soon.  Sincerely,  Janice A. Case Manager IHGCare

Summary: Room wasn't available upon check in...so we left our luggage with the front desk and left to enjoy Disney. When we returned we got our room keys and luggage and went to our room. Initial thought was that is was adequate for what we paid, but the odor in the room was overwhelming. We were put into a smoking room and when we called the front desk we were told that they had over booked the hotel and that NO rooms would be available for the remainder of our trip. We ended up leaving and would never return. If you can....stay in Downtown Disney-well worth the expense. Much better experience!!
Manager Response: I'm very sorry that you were given a smoking room.  We try our best to meet the requests of all our guests but during our peak seasons it is not always possible.  Often times when you book through a third party the smoking preference is not guaranteed.  If you have a medical condition and require non-smoking please contact the hotel directly and we will do our best to accommodate your request.

Summary Heading: Great Hotel near Disneyland for Large Family 2A-4K
Summary: There are always going to be reviews by those can never be pleased and expect 5 star treatment at a 3 star hotel....The Staybridge in Anaheim is a GREAT place to stay.  We spent 7 nights there last week (Feb 5-12, 2013) and had a GREAT experience.  We have 4 kids and we all had lots of room to spread out in our 2 bedroom 2 full bathroom suite.  We never used the kitchenette, but found that it would have been handy if we weren't so pooped to cook after Disneyland.   The hotel offered a hot breakfast every morning and yes, it wasn't a 5 star menu, but it offered healthy choices and fed my family of 6 very well.  We were very pleased with the staff who were excellent!   Very friendly, helpful and genuinely nice people.   The hotel was very clean, the beds comfortable and the pool

We checked in here on Feb 2nd and departed Feb 7th. We stayed at a 1BD king suite. The front desk was quite helpful. Our first impressions of the lobby was that it was clean, and upkept quite well. Upon entering, the suite was a bit smaller then I had hoped. Last Disney trip, we stayed at the Best Western Meridian in Orange and the 1BD suite was quite a bit bigger. The suite had all the amenities, full sized fridge, stove, microwave, etc. It was quite nice having a separate little area to eat. The king bed was a bit firm and they also do not provide full sized pillows, they provide these little square pillows, which is quite odd. We ended up buying our own pillows instead. The WiFi there was actually pretty good. Best signal we've had yet at a hotel. The TV lineup was quite a

We stayed at The Staybridge for the first time after a day at Knott's Berry Farm. This hotel was outstanding. The front counter staff are awesome, and we got DVD's to watch in our room for free. We laughed our butts off until after midnight, and slept great on the soft beds. The view out into the courtyard was beautiful with the trees waving in the wind. The wife & kids enjoyed the outdoor hot tub too. In the morning we had a great breakfast at the hotel. Perfect stay.

We booked this hotel for the location and price and it was well worth it.  We checked in late, with two tired boys and the receptionist was lovely to us all. She gave us a room overlooking the pool and told our boys if we hurried up to the room we could the fireworks!  The room was perfect, comfy beds, little kitchen and a clean bathroom.  Breakfast was busy, so get there early, but it was very welcome before a busy day at Disney.  The pool was also nice and never very busy. A real unexpected treat was the mixer night, with free hot dogs, burgers and drinks.  Overall, it's a great place if your there to visit Disney, we've already booked again for our next trip.

Summary Heading: what is the hype on this hotel?
Summary: I dont think this hotel is everything ppl make it out to be. we stayed for three nights, family of 6 and for the price we paid I  thought it would be big enough to sleep the whole family. Wrong! there were two beds, full size (which for our family was very small) so we had to use a blow up mattress. Kitchens are very small and they do not have ovens, each kitchen has  two burners only, full size fridge, and a dishwasher. The breakfast is way overrated. Lots of hotels in anaheim offer fresh waffles and other breakfast goodies. There is one laundry room on site, and gets PACKED fast, ppl are rude and leave there clothes so you cant get yours done. To many hotel rooms to washers/dryers. Spa area gets PACKED fast too and ppl allow there kids to splash/dive/whatever. We went to use
Manager Response: Dear lwallace95,   Thank you for taking the time to review our property. We are sorry to hear that you were not satisfied with your overall experience with us. We work diligently to ensure our facilities and service superior and we try our hardest to provide not just good value, but comfortable, clean and friendly accommodations. Please accept my apologies for falling short of your expectations. Your comments are important to the success of our organization, as we rely on you, our guest, to tell us how we are doing and how we can better meet your needs.   Your business is valued and we hope your future travel plans will continue to include IHG properties.  Sincerely,  Lera P Case Manager   IHGCare

Summary Heading: Good price for a 2 BR suite near Disneyland
Summary: Havng read some of the other reviews I think some people's expectations were too high - you get what you pay for.  My priority was a 2 bed room suite close to Disneyland for 3 adults and 2 children and that is what we got at a good price, which is why I'm saying it was excellent considering other hotels in the area either didn't have that set up or were much more expensive.  We were here during a holiday weekend in January 2013.  The rooms were spacious, clean and beds were super comfy.  Staff were really helpful and the kids loved the pool.  Breakfast was extensive and included - a great start to the day.  There is a shuttle to Disney from the car park.

We stayed here 3 years ago and it was not bad so we tried it again on our yearly jan trip to anaheim.   Hotel needs a makeover badly! It's very blah and dated. Elevator doors were disgusting how dirty they were.  Breakfast is a nice touch but being the hotel caters to families going to Disneyland it can be a bit much. Parents lets their children run around breakfast area, spilling and pushing their way through to get food. And to top it off in their pjs and barefoot.   Staff extremely unfriendly. Not one hotel person smilies or said hi as you pass in the hallway.   Parking was a joke, couldn't get a spot when we arrived back sat evening.   If you stay here request the backside of hotel. Freeway can be a bit loud.   I think we will stay elsewhere next time. We hotel often and
Manager Response: Dear Jennp48,  Thank you for taking the time to convey your comments regarding your recent experience with us. We rely on you, our valued guest, to let us know how we are doing and how we can better meet your needs. I am sorry to read our hotel did not live up to your expectations and regret that you were not satisfied with the parking situation and poor customer service received. I have taken note and wish to thank you for all your valuable comments. These are of great importance to us and allow us to monitor and improve our service continually.  While I understand your stay was not 100% as it should have been. I do hope you can stay with us again so we can show you how truly great our hotel is.   Sincerely,  Zelyn N Case Manager IHGCare

Summary: I wish I didn't have to write this given that we were on a holiday of a lifetime, but it needs to be said, this place is woeful!!    If you don't mind eating your breakfast with plastic cutlery off a polystyrene plate and drinking from your polystyrene cup, then this place will exceed your expectations!! If what I've just written doesn't deter you keep reading....   The reception area resembles a motel, albeit a very old one. The decor is old and dated and the walls down every corridor are badly marked or stained.  We had two rooms, one which overlooks the pool the other a busy freeway, guess which room got the better night's sleep?  The rooms themselves are tidy but again, very dated and in desperate need of a lick of paint and refreshed furnishings.  If I were to guess, it
Manager Response: Dear mdplus4,  Thank you for your detailed review regarding your recent stay. We strive everyday to create special experiences to our guests and we are truly sorry we did not manage this for your stay. Please allow me to apologize for the inconvenience you may have had due to the condition of the hotel facilities, room and poor customer services received during breakfast. I have taken note of your valuable comments and your review will be used to reconsider improvements needed and I hope you can give us a chance to show what we have done.  Thank you for bringing this to our attention, as we pride ourselves on excellent customer service. I hope to have the pleasure of welcoming you back to our hotel and replace your bad experience with one that reflects our true standards.  Sincerely,  Zelyn N Case Manager IHGCare

Summary: We stayed here in sept/oct 2012 in a 2br non smoking suite.  It was fantastic, having a free hot breakfast every morning, with plenty of variety with eggs, bacon, different cereals, make your own waffles, toast, yoghurt and fruit, there was something for all of us to enjoy.  It was nice to come home daily to find beds made and tidied up.  Its great having a TV in each room and a separate bathroom to the kids.  We all found our beds very confortable to sleep in, we faced the road but heard no noise from the highway and the curtains blocked out all of the morning light so we wernt woken up early like other places ive stayed by sunlight steaming in. The pool was nice and clean and refreshing for a swim.  Staff were friendly and helpful.  The restaurant at the hotel next door had

This hotel is pretty nice, the free breakfast in the morning is really good.  We had booked a non-smoking 1 bedroom suite back in April for our stay at Christmas and they tried to put us in a non-smoking room on a "smoking" floor...ya, I don't think so.  Not impressed to have to argue with front desk to get the room that we booked so freaking long ago.  They have free washers and dryers for guest use which is really nice and free parking.  The king bed was comfy but the sofa bed the kids had to sleep on was horrible.  Overall the room needed a good deep thorough clean as well.  We had to ask for bathroom amenities, they do not automatically provide these.  Coffee in the lobby all day was nice too.  Close to Disneyland, only a 5 min drive.  The hot tub is good, not too hot so you
Manager Response: Dear SunLovingGurl,   Thank you for taking the time to convey your comments regarding your experience with us. We are delighted about your positive comments with the breakfast as well as our location. It is always our goal to provide the best possible service and create memorable experiences and on this occasion we apologize we did not exceed your expectations with your room accommodation. We have taken note of your valuable comments and will use these to monitor and improve the quality of services we offer to our guests.  Thank you again for your review and hope to have the pleasure in welcoming you back again very soon.  Sincerely,   Karen C Case Manager IHGCare

Summary Heading: One of the best in my life
Summary: Really, it was one of the best. Maybe, because we took a very good room with a kitchen and an extra living space. We had the BEST kitchen in our US trip! We stayed here 3 hts and even skipped 2 incl breakfasts because we preferred to cook them at room. The pool is really good too. I recommend to use it with kids! Another great theme is the bbq zone foc at the backyard - very good! at the most of the places I have something to recommend to improve, here I have to say - please, stay at where you are - you will always get success!

We stayed here last year with 4 adults and 2 kids. The place was amazing! The 2 bedroom suite was a great size. The kids loved the pool and spa. The buffet breakfast was brilliant! So many choices. We also loved the dinner that they put on a few times a week, it really helps the budget conscious. I would highly recommend this hotel!

Great, basic hotel close to Disneyland! The breakfast was simple- eggs, bacon or sausages, waffles, yogurt, cereal, toast- but it was a great way to start the day without the hassle of driving out in search for a restaurant.  Plenty of tables so seating wasn't an issue.  The shuttle was a bit slow some days, but that was okay for us- we're on vacation, who cares about time? The bus ride was less than 10 mins and cost $5 for a day pass.  We stayed in a basic room- king bed and kitchenette with a full sized fridge.  Room was a clean and simple.  Nothing too fancy but that was okay with us as we got a great rate.  Ask for a room with a view of the pool.  I would definitely recommend this hotel if you're just looking for a clean place to sleep near Disney!  Bonus: hotel was only a

Summary Heading: Great value, service and fantastic amenities
Summary: We had a car with our trip, and thee hotel is ideally located to Disneyland.  I agree with reviewer "rem869" re parking at the Toy Area, where we parked in the "Woody" cation, and that is the first drop off point by the shuttle bus when you return from a big day at the theme park. We had a room near the freeway, but the room is very quiet.  The amenities in the room and in e common area are fantastic - there is a large fridge in our room, and sufficient crockery and utensils for a family of 4. Would be nice to have a kettle to boil water for a cup of tea, but the microwave is a good alternative.  There is a dishwasher and the hotel gave us a starter pack of dishwashing powder and dishwashing liquid.  There is also a DVD player in the room and with two TVs, we did not have to

Summary Heading: The only place we stay, when we visit Disneyland!
Summary: We LOVE Disney... but we don't love Disney hotel prices. That's why we stay here - at the Staybridge Suites in Anaheim! You get a reasonable room rate and a good, hot breakfast, while being close enough to the parks, without breaking the bank. It's awesome!  We visited the weekend before Thanksgiving 2012 and stayed two nights in a one-bedroom suite. We like having access to a refrigerator and toaster, as we can toast frozen gluten-free waffles, chill water, and use a stove if we decide to cook in the room (which, on this trip, we did not). It's nice to be able to put the kids down for bed, close the bedroom door, and unwind in the separate living room using the free wi-fi. Then, in the morning, it's nice to be able to wake up, head downstairs, and get a few different items to

I don't usually write  reviews but this hotel really deserved a great one. Long story short ... 1. Great room with a kitchenette. We didn't really utilize this because our family lives near, but it can save you lots of money if you stop at Walmart and pick up some groceries on the way in. 2. Excellent free breakfast. 3. Free washers and dryers. I hate taking dirty clothes home so this is a big plus for me. 4.Free appetizers and drinks on Tues, Wed, And Thurs evenings. 5. Overall an outstanding value.

Took a quick trip to Disneyland to celebrate my nephews 7th birthday and stayed at Staybridge Suites under recommendation from friend.  We arrived a few minutes before 7:30 pm, which we found out was closing time for their social hour, and the woman checking us in put off the check in so family could make it outside before they put food away.  After spending 6 hours at Disneyland the family was thankful for fresh grilled burgers and I was thankful for the free cold beer.  Check in was a breeze and our suite was lovely with separate bedroom and stocked kitchenette.  We really utilized the kitchenette and it was great to have a full-size fridge vs. the mini's offered at other hotels.  Beds were comfortable and my only complaint would have to be about pillows.  They offered a good

The welcome was excellent, we arrived a day early and the managed to find us another room. Staff could not be more helpful in offering advice. We stayed in a suite with room to move. If staying for more than a couple of days I would recommend going to VONS supermarket for supplies. Too far to walk. We did not have a car so we had to make use of cabs.One of the those cabs offered a day tour of LA for $280. Good value for two or three people, we went to places that we would not normally see on a tour bus. Other than that we found the hotel to be of good value. Good Columbian coffee and Mexcian food  can be found nearby at Anepalcos Cafe, 1717 W Chapman Ave. A good ten minutes walk from the hotel but worth it. Your staff made our stay in the US one to cheerish

California was sunny and comfy weather wise, 70's and sunny at Venice and Redondo Beach.  Disneyland was mostly open, due to filming their Christmas Show some areas where taped off temporarily, I did wave and smile when the camera came around!  Staybridge for the price was average.  I stayed in a one bedroom suite, room 414.  It was clean and well used.  The room staff were friendly and attentive to calls. The kitchenette was furnished with a fridge, coffee maker, two burner stove, microwave, toaster, cupboards with dishes and pots and pans, and they even furnish dish soap and dishwasher soap. BUTS-you cannot make a phone call and hear yourself or the party your talking to because of the LOUD AC/Heater inside room.  I could not even watch television because it was so loud.  My

We stayed the first week of October and choose this hotel since it offered breakfast, a separate bedroom and kitchenette.  The location was convenient to access from the freeway and a 10min drive to Disney. A convenience store and authentic Mexcian take-out was in walking distance.  The pool was a hit with the kiddo and she quickly made friends with other young swimmers but they ran out of pool towels and we had to go back up to the room to retrieve some.  The staff seemed friendly but were slow to respond.  I was only disappointed in the cleanliness. There was always food, garbage a crib, or laundry cart in our hallway we had to step around and we had to wipe our table and chairs at breakfast.  Otherwise the facilities were in good condition and we would consider staying here

Very nice hotel. I was worried cause some people had posted some bad stuff on here... However since the VAST majority of the reviews were positive... We went ahead and stayed here. Boy are we glad we did! Room was excellent, service was excellent, staff was AMAZING, food was buffet food but it saves you quite a bit of money so absolutely no complaints there.   If you are on the fence about this place... Rest yours fears... You will enjoy yourself! We did!

We didn't stay in Nov of 2011, we actually stayed at Staybridge in October of 2010. There were 17 of us on a once in a life time family vacation. The check in was easy and the staff were friendly. The rooms were more than adequate with 2 queens and a pull out sofa. Having the kitchen was an awesome bonus and saved us a lot of money by eating at the room instead of the park. The restaurant next door is ok, but not fabulous and just so you know, there are actually two different take out menus for the rooms. My parents had a different one in their room so we ordered delivery from that menu. Kids were tired of Chinese. The breakfast was great, waffles, sausage, bacon, eggs, etc. Saved us a lot of money. The pool was great! Our first full day at the park it was 42 degrees (LA /

We were very happy with Staybridge. We stayed in 2 room suite with kitchenette for 6 nights. I did not know that it did not have an oven so that was was a bummer but not a big deal. And the free breakfast was not great but again not a big deal. Overall hotel staff was friendly and helpful, room was big and clean, amenities like free wifi, free laundry and use of business center were all great. Close to Disneyland and dining. We will use Staybridge again for Disney trip and I will also use them for any other family vacations in other cities

This was a family vacation to Disneyland.  Staybridge was a very good choice.  Staff was very helpful.  Breakfast was good with lots of choices.  Social hour was an added bonus.  We had a 1 bedroom suite with a full kitchen.  The kitchen was great.  Didn't use the shuttle as we had a free parking pass.  Close to everything.  We would definitely stay here again.

Loved the full kitchen and the needed items. That was a huge help. Nice and quiet and we loved the breakfast and they also had free food, wine and beer 3 time a week. What a great way to save money. I dont think the staff was as friendly as I thought they should be but I guess thats expected when you are not paying top dollar. Good price for what is included!

Summary Heading: Good value for a Disney vacation
Summary: Just spent 5 nights at the Staybridge Suites Anaheim. It was perfect. We were there for a Disney vacation. We used the Anaheim Resort Transit (ART), which serves the Staubridge and the sister hotel, the Holiday Inn. In 5 days, we never waited more than 20 minutes. On several occasions, the line for the bus to Disney got too long for one bus to accommodate everyone. At which point, they called in extra busses.  We booked a studio with a kitchen, but were upgraded to a 1 bedroom. There is a complimentary breakfast, but it is very crowded and the food is of low quality. We chose to stop at the grocery store and make a quick breakfast in the room. The only criticism was with the bed size. The one bedroom had more than enough room for a king size bed, but only had a queen. Itlooked

My family enjoyed 6 nights at the hotel while on our Disneyland vacation 10/7/12. The one room suite was good sized, had a full kitchen, and was clean. The buffet breakfast daily had options for everyone in my family and was delicious. The social hour at the hotel included free wine/beer and snacks.  We saved loads of money on food due to these options. When my hair dryer died they promptly brought another one to my room. The free laundry facilities were fantastic and so helpful. The digital thermostat in the room was easy to use and kept us all at our normal comfort zone. All the staff were courteous and friendly. We will definitely return to this hotel.

We stayed for 4 nights in September as part of a fortnights holiday in the USA and wished that we had arranged to stay longer at this hotel.  The reception staff were always welcoming and friendly.  It was useful to have wifi in the bedroom and use of the computer in reception lobby.  Breakfast time could be busy but we always got a table, and even managed to make our own waffles!!  We had a room facing the highway and did not notice any noise. Free ample car parking.  We hope to return next year!

The Hotel is located directly on the highway and the rooms facing it are very noisy. Although booking more than 6 months in advance and being a Priority Club Gold menber, the hotel staff choose to ignore our request at time of booking of having a quiet room not facing the highway. The noise was so horrible that we had to leave the hotel, without any compensation from the hotel. The hotel front desk staff was totally unfriendly and our request to speak with the manager was declined and ignored. Also their promise that the hotel manger will contact us at the following day was unkept.
Manager Response: We strive very hard to meet the requests of all our guests, however, in our high demand seasons it is not always possible.  When making a reservation you are only reserving a type of room (one bedroom, studio, etc.), not a specific room in the hotel.  Normally we do not have an issue meeting a request but we do not guarantee to 100% certainty that we can accommodate all requests being made.  If you have a very specific need we suggest you contact the hotel approximately one week prior to your arrival so we can review your reservation and give you a better answer as to whether or not we will be able to fulfill your request.  I apologize we were unable to meet your needs but I hope you will give us another opportunity in the future to serve you and your family.

Summary: The rooms are very spacious. A fully equipped kitchen with all necessary amenities. Very friendly, helpfull staff. Pool is nice, suitably for small and bigger children. No separate babypool, so keep an eye on the little ones. It is close to the freeway and Disneyland. Although it's a bit to far to walk.

We recently stayed here with 2 other families. The hotel was clean and comfortable with all the amenities we required to have a home style stay. We used the BBQ area twice and it was always clean and was free of charge. The rooms had coffee makers, a full size fridge, ice machines and a separate small lounge area. The morning breakfast was great and offered many options such as toast, bagels, cereal, fruit, yoghurt and waffles - this was also free of charge. The hotel offers snacks in the late afternoon  a couple of nights a week as well as free beer, wine and soda. It also has free wifi which worked perfectly all the time and free domestic phone calls. The staff we amazing and incredibly helpful at al times and nothing was ever too much trouble. The hotel also had washing

The hotel is very tired and is in desperate need of modernisation. The rooms are ok space wise and yes you have a kitchen, but the fridge was noisy for the friend who stayed on the pull out bed. The air conditioning was about as effective as an asthmatic granny blowing on hot food. The gym was next to the laundry room and was about 100 degrees. The staff (I only ever saw one person on the front desk) and they seemed to have taken 'medication' to relieve the boredom. Lots of parking, which is my only plus point.

Stayed in a 2bdr suite for 6 nights in Sept. Beds were super comfy, handy kitchenette and the room overall was clean and tidy. Plenty of brekky options. Staff were friendly and helpful. Would stay again.

Hotel was very clean, room was very comfortable. We were only there for an overnight stopover but would stay again if ever returned to area. Excellent value for money for $90 per night. Free parking and breakfast included. Full kitchen in room handy for families. Friendly service. Can't comment on outdoor/pool area as we didn't see or use it.

Highly recommend this hotel the people are very friendly and the rooms are very clean. The breakfast was great. On Tuesdays they have a get to know your neighbor gathering downstairs that is a great place to relax and meet other people. So if your looking for a relaxing, fun and overall great place to stay visit then choose the stay bridge suites here in Lafayette la. You won't be disappointed. Thank you!

This hotel was a wonderful place to stay, we had a 2 bedroom suite. The kids had a double bed each and we had a king bed, that was so comfortable. You get complimentary breakfast each day and you get to make your own waffles.......The shuttle to Disneyland, is outside the hotel and comes every 10min. The service is great. The only thing I would suggest is 2 ply toilet paper.

My family stayed at Staybridge for 5 days. Our reservation was done through The Disney Company. We chose Staybridge because a couple of years ago we had stayed at their property in Reno where we had a fantastic stay. Our room 214 was very tired. The hallway decor belongs to a prehistoric era-completely outdated. The shower curtain poll has fallen off the wall several times and you can see 3 different sets of drill holes, painted in different shades of paint.  We even forgo going for breakfast, the egg imitation was terrible. How this hotel is associated with the Disney Company boggles the mind. During the second day of our stay there was a poster on the hallways stating that there would be no hot water till 5 pm. That very day there was a problem with the plumbing system.
Manager Response: Dear SeattleTravelcrazy,  Thank you for taking the time to write us a review. I deeply apologize for the issues you experienced at our hotel, especially with the room accommodations you received. I want to assure you that our hotel is very proud of its level of service, cleanliness and quality of its product. I have taken note and wish to thank you for your valuable feedback as this is our best resource of improving guest satisfaction.   We hope you give us a chance in the future to show you how great our hotel is.  Sincerely,  Pam G. Case Manager IHGCare

Summary: We stayed from 24 August for 7 nights.  We had a two bedroom suite and it was a good option for us to go to Disneyland form.  The pool was also good for the kids and not too busy.  Plus it was deep enough to be enjoyable for adults.  The free breakfast was great and also the free options for dinner on Wednesday and Thursday were also a great addition to our stay.  A good value priced option in Anaheim.

We arrived August 24 for a 6 night stay.  We spent considerable time evaluating the different hotel options prior to booking and chose Staybridge due to location, cost and amenities.  We felt being a few blocks farther away from Disneyland (than other hotels) would be beneficial for noise, traffic and a better property and we were not disappointed.  Regularly during our stay we encountered hotel staff, cleaning, repairing and maintaining the grounds.  They were pleasurable and welcoming to us.  The front desk staff (David in particular) was excellent.  Very helpful and informative with our questions about the surrounding area (restaurants, beaches, shopping etc...)    As mentioned, the pool is shared with the Holiday Inn but this was no issue.  The pool grounds are clean, big

Summary Heading: CLEAN, COMFORTABLE, HUGE SPREAD BREAKFAST incl. EVERYTHING!
Summary: The staff goes out og their way to make your stay exceptional! The rooms are clean, and comfortable, the breakfast has anything, and everything you can think of for breakfast! Even Belgian Waffles! I cannot stress how comfortable, SAFE, and how Help Full the Staff are as well! This is where We WILL be staying Each and Every time we vacation in Anaheim/Disney Calif! Oh, Did I mention how When/If you arrive early Before chack in time....they Store your luggage in a LOCKED ROOM for you! There is even a Little 24/7 Convenience Store Right in the Lobby, just in case you need ANYTHING! Cuz their little store Definitely has what ever you need! WOW I LOVE THIS HOTEL!!!!! THANK YOU STAYBRIDGE ANAHEIM! I Have to and Must Give this Hotel ( STAYBRIDGE ANAHEIM  ) FIVE STARS! * * * * *

Stayed here for four nights as part of a Disney Holiday. We had a Studio room which was nice and had a Kitchenette which we used often. The room was very clean but as we were there for less than a week we only had a light touch housekeeping service which is just towels and bins. The breakfast was good which hot and cold options, the kids loved the waffle makers ( I've had to buy one!!!). The pool was shared with the Holiday Inn next door but wasn't too busy when we were there. All in all a nice stay and we would stay there again but probably in the suite next time.

I go to this Staybridge at least twice a year for business.  I take advantage of the available kitchenette to have healthy food even while traveling for business.  The breakfast buffet is small but varied enough to keep anyone in the family happy.  Tuesday nights through Thursday nights there is a nice little happy hour with family snacks along with wine/beer for the adults.  The Disney fire work show is visible from the hotel and makes for an uplifting end to an evening.  The hotel is always filled with families but that has never been an issue for me.  For the price and amenities, this hotel is a very good value.

I first stayed at this hotel with my family in 2009 when it was quite high on the trip advisor ratings , we had such a successful trip that we booked it again in 2010, but by this time there were signs of decay, the hall carpets were smelly & worn out , washing machines and dryers were worn out plus the maid service was a bit hit & miss, please read on "................  We booked a 2 bedroom suite  for 26th July 2012 , on arrival the hotel staff were very efficient & polite & i noticed alot of improvements, they have new washer driers , new tv's, new gym equipment , free parking , free wifi, free breakfast,free laundry , also  threre is a managers reception every tues , wed & thursday with free beer or wine & snacks, to be honest it's very clean & compared to other local hotels

Our family of six book our 7 day night here it was great The rooms are clean,the staff where nice and helpful,breakfast was nice everything tasted nice  There was a work out room that all the equipment work the pool was nice and warm,sometimes, I also loved that you could rent movies for free at the front desk,they had a wide selection of movies they have a working fridge and a coffee maker and a microwave, didn't land wasn't very far so you could walk to it  So all the other reviews are cranky people who blame the hotel for other guests problems This review was made by everyone in my family But I typed it out a 13 year old

Our two family's checked into this motel in April 2012, for a week stay. We went to Disneyland, Knotts Berry farm and at the end of the day looked forward for a nice Hot Tub. The hot tub was cool to luke warm for our total stay. We complained at the front desk to no avail, until numerous complaints they decided to get it fixed (they blamed it on the Holiday Inn next door, its shared with other guests) It was never fixed, we checked out and asked if they could Refund one nite, they said No, but offered a Free nite next time I came. We will never stay there again.
Manager Response: Dear Gunsmokejustice,  I would like to thank you for your review regarding your stay with us. Your comments are highly valuable to us and will assist us in our continuous efforts to maintain and improve the service level we aim for. We apologize that your experience with us did not meet your expectations. I'm sorry your stay was negatively affected by the condition of the hot tub and service you received. The feedback we receive from our valued guests, like you, enables us to target problem areas. We welcome any opportunity to improve.   We hope that you take the time to stop in for a visit soon to see how we have taken every comment very seriously in order to make your future stays with us as pleasant as possible.  Sincerely,  Zelyn N. Case Manager IHG Care

Summary Heading: As close to feeling like home as you can get in a hotel
Summary: We booked the two bedroom suite and LOVED it! Each bedroom had its own full bath and there was a family room and kitchen in between the two bedrooms. The kitchen had a full-size refrigerator, a cooktop with two burners, a microwave, coffee maker, and dishwasher. Each bedroom and the family room had a TV and the family room had a DVD/VCR player. The front desk keeps DVD to borrow for no charge. There's also a nice pantry next to the front desk to purchase those items you forgot at home or to handle those midnight cravings.  The pool was big and could handle a lot of people without feeling crowded. It only got to a depth of 5', but that's enough to float in.  Literature in the room says there's no housekeeping on weekends, but our room was clean every day anyway. Not sure what's

We stayed here because this hotel had a lot of good reviews, but after staying here, I do not believe them. This place was nasty. I think the people who work at the hotel are writing the good reviews to keep in business. The service was horrible. The breakfast was not even worth going to.  The rooms were filthy. I took a washcloth when I got there and had to clean the kitchen and bathrooms myself. The decor is more than just outdated it was stained with who knows what. The walls were a dingy yellow color....and that wasnt the paint color. We couldn't wait to leave this hotel. It's right next to the freeway, so it is really loud all night. It is not very close to Disney, so don't plan on walking. The pool is shared with another hotel.  It is not a good place to stay, and very
Manager Response: Dear Worldtraveler8409,  Thank you for taking the time to write us a review. It is regrettable you were not satisfied with the service you received. I would like to address this with you further. I have sent you a private message to obtain more information about your stay. I look forward to hearing from you and being of further assistance.  Sincerely,  Pam G. Case Manager IHGCare

Summary: We stayed here for 3 nights, family of 5. The hotel is clean, room is a little small. Beds are comfortable. The pool is a nice size but they share it with guests from Holiday Inn. No big deal though as it was never crowded when we were there. It is close to Disney, not walking distance but a close drive. Close to restaurants too. It is along the highway but I never head issue with noise. Breakfast is the typical omelet, bacon, and sausage. One day it is sausage, then next day is bacon. You can make your own waffles though which my kids enjoyed. Very friendly staff.

Summary Heading: This place is much better than San Diego's Staybridge.
Summary: Amazing. Under a mile to the hollywoood Tower of Terror farthest ride is just only a mile. As of suite 322

Every year we take a family vacation to Disneyland and every year we stay at Staybridge Suites Anaheim. We have never had a problem and always treated like were the only guest in the resort. We always stay in their 2 bedroom suite which are always clean and serviced very well. The beds are amazing and the pillows to die for. Tues and Wed they have a social gathering with FREE beer/wine and food. On Thurs they have a BBQ in their back yard, again all FREE to guest. With your stay you get hot breakfast every morning, very yummy. I loved how you could make your own waffles, my little nephew always gets a kick out of that. Fresh hot coffee was avaible 24/7 and it was delicious!! The resort also offers FREE parking, that's very rare to find these days! I was able to do laundry before

We stayed in a 2 bedroom suite. Plenty of space for the whole family. (Grandma, Hubby & I, 3 children and a baby.) There was space for us to put up the playpen for the baby to sleep, and I was told they do have cribs available as well. We never heard any other guests while we were in our room. The breakfast was GREAT! We all got super full. I just wish it started half an hour earlier for those trying to do a "Magic Morning" at Disneyland. Luckily there was a full-size fridge, so were able to make our own. There was also a two-burner stove, a microwave, plenty of dishes and a dishwasher. Front desk was extremely helpful with directions, and advice for our stay as well. I would stay here again in a heart beat!

We had a wonderful stay at this hotel.  The hotel is clean and the service is friendly.  We stayed in a 2 bedroom, 1 King bed, 2 double beds, living room and sofa bed.  The suite was immaculate and the hotel was quiet.  We were able to sleep late and not be awakened by people coming or going in nearby rooms.  The breakfast was excellent, a full service breakfast and coffee is available 24/7. The wireless internet is complimentary .Parking is plentiful and if you park in the back you can go through the dining/social area and straight to the elevator.  The hotel has been updated with new carpets and I the hotel is kept very clean.  The beds are amazing, we slept so good.  This was our second time staying at this hotel and this is the only hotel I will stay at in Anaheim.  This is

Summary Heading: Beware...STAY AWAY at ALL COST!!!!!  Gross!!!
Summary: I would never stay at this hotel again or reccomend it to anyone.  We booked 2 rooms, they messed up on the reservation and then blamed our travel agent, who I know did not mess up.  One of the rooms they booked us was a smoking room which they said we "requested" - NO WAY did I request it- I have 5 children, one with ashtma, one that gets migraine headaches and a baby.  The rooms were filthy.  The furniture was stained, the carpets made my kids feet black, the walls had dirty spots all over, and the bathrooms were disgusting. I just feel gross by being in the rooms.  We have been trying all night to find a new hotel to switch to. The staff was not helpful, I have never been treated so poorly by any business.  I seriously can't believe all the good reviews it's gotten, stay away
Manager Response: Dear skisom,  Thank you very much for your recent stay with us. I am deeply sorry we fell below your expectations. Our hotel is very proud of its level of service, cleanliness and quality of its product and for this reason your comments are very troubling and will certainly be looked into. We’d like to obtain some additional detail regarding your experience so we have sent you a private message. I look forward to hearing back from you soon.  Sincerely, Katie J IHGCare

Summary: Husband and I stayed here for 5 nights at the beginning of June. We had a studio suite facing the pool. Room had kitchenette area with Stove top, Microwave and Fridge/Freezer, Dishwasher, dishes and pans were provided. No kettle but coffee maker and supplies. Hotels offers free breakfast which was good and well stocked. Was not there for the evening socials. This was our first time staying at the Staybridge Suites and we would reccomend this hotel and would stay here, or at other Staybridge suites in the future.
