had a great time spent here.  didn't really understand the extended stay concept but am looking forward to another visit here.  we checked into 3 rooms from Saturday 6/16 to Tuesday 6/19. the check in process was smooth and efficient and the information given was useful and concise. rooms were very clean and comfortable, we had a 3-1 bedroom suites.  we did not utilize the kitchen but our next stay we most definitely will. the pool was decently sized and also a hot jacuzzi with towels supplied specifically for that purpose. there is also a laundry area connected to an exercise room.  the laundry room has 4 washer and dryers.  it is free, so all you have to supply is the soap, bounce and dirty clothes. the exercise room had a recumbent bike, elliptical, (2) tread mills, and an

Summary Heading: Nice room and close to Disney
Summary: Booked the 2 room suite at the Staybridge Anaheim for our family vacation this week and was very pleased with the accommodations.  Room was clean, plenty of space, the beds were very comfortable.  The breakfast was free and had quite a few choices to choose from, hot and cold.  Anaheim Resort Transit bus runs every 20 mins from the Holiday Inn next door to Disney.  Very convenient.  Wouldn't hesitate to stay here again in the future.

We stayed here in May in a 2 Brm Suite, 3 adults and 2 kids. It was  perfect size.The room was clean and any issue we had i.e. like the key not working, was seen to straight away. Pam on the front desk was a fountain of knowledge and couldn't have been more helpful. The buffet breaky was pretty similar each day but more that enough to fill a hungry belly ready for a day at Disneyland. On a Tues-Thurs from 5:30-7:30 they have happy hour. This included beer, wine and hotdogs, hamburgers or nachos all for free! The coffee and tea that is available 24hrs is a great treat when you come in after a long day at Disneyland. Another bonus is the free wifi and the use of computers in the foyer is a bonus if you don't have your own.The shuttle service from the hotel to Disney was so easy

I traveled with 3 other people to the Anaheim area just this past week. We booked a 2 bedroom, 2 bath suite. The suite was plenty enough room for the 4 of use. It had a small kitchette which we did not use, but if we had stayed longer, might have. They offer breakfast daily, but none of it looked appetizing to me, although my sister enjoy the mini-waffles. I believe they also served snacks and beverages during "happy hour" but we did not check it out. There is also a pool, but we did not use any of the pool or recreation activities.  Basically, we did an Angels game one night and a full day of Disneyland the next and checked out the following day. So if you are doing a quick visit or trip like we did, I would recommend this hotel.  I gave this hotel a 4 instead of a 3 because
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us recently and providing us with your feedback.  I apologize that you had an issue but am happy to know we were able to resolve it for you.  I wanted to also mention that the happy hour you referred to is what we call "The Social", which includes complimentary beer, wine, soda and a light appetizer.  On Wednesday nights we host a barbecue for our guests which includes hot dogs and/or hamburgers.  Hopefully you can join us on your next visit!

Summary Heading: VERY good value, helpful front desk, a few minor issues
Summary: We stayed in a one-bedroom suite June 1-4 (Friday-Monday). The BEST thing about this property is the extremely helpful front desk staff. They are very knowledgeable about the Disney parks and always willing to provide useful tips. Also, what I found unique about the staff is they don't just answer the questions asked of them, but engage in conversation and are proactive about adding information to benefit the traveler, for example informing us that an 8 a.m. departure would result in rush hour traffic and reminding us that a 6a.m. start would be beneficial. We got a great deal on our room ($108 per night) which consisted of a bedroom, living room with fold out couch and a full kitchen, which I booked six months prior to our arrival. The pool and surrounding area is fun, clean
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review your recent stay.  I will definitely share your review with our staff.  I did want to point out that we are an extended stay hotel therefore we replenish coffee, shampoo and other amenities every seven days.  There is a staff member available at the front desk 24hours a day so if there is anything you need you can simply call us and we can have it sent up to your room at no charge.  Thanks again for staying with us, we hope to see you again in the near future!

Summary: I LOVE this hotel. First time staying here and i will definitely stay here for every Disneyland trip we take in the future. Very nice for families with younger kids. We had a Disneyland vacation with the grandparents, us, our 2 kids and our nephew, ages 5,4, and 2. We had a 2 bedroom suite, with 2 bathrooms. Love that we could be together but had our separate rooms. Also loved that there were 3 tvs. The continental breakfast was HUGE and delicious, saved us TONS of money. Also the coffee was yummy, Boyds. They had free dinners nights from 5-7, i know one night was hamburger/hot dog night. Very nice, also saved on the budget. Since we have younger kids we always made it back by then. The pool and hot tub were also nice. For people visiting Disneyland, they had a shuttle bus, that
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your recent experience.  We really appreciate your positive feedback and are glad to hear that you will be staying with us again for future trips.  As a note, some of our guests choose to sign up for Von's online grocery delivery.  At the current time there is a $49 minimum order but if you are staying with us for several days it is definitely worth checking out.  You can view their web site at www.vons.com.

Summary Heading: Nice hotel, good breakfasts, helpful staff.
Summary: While visiting Southern California (Disneyland & beaches) we stayed at Staybridge Suites in Anaheim.  The staff was very nice, friendly and helpful.  Check-in and check-out were easy.  The rooms were clean and quiet.  The breakfasts were very good and seating for guests was ample.  We stayed in a double queen bed suite.  The room was equipped with a small kitchen and a full-sized fridge and dishwasher.  One bed was very close to the wall - barely room to walk, but the beds were comfortable.  The only real complaint I have is that the light switch for the bathroom is outside the room, so the light had to be turned on before entering, which could wake up others sleeping in the room.  We were only able to try one of the manager's receptions, but there was lots of food and it was

we stayed in a two bedroomed family unit for 4x days on 13th may. what a great place, clean, modern, tidy and spacious. perfect for our family of 2x kids and 2x adults. The free breakfast was fabulous to start off the day with. We  also got to experience the evening snacks and drinks on one night which was a big bonus. Unfortunately we didn't have time to go in the pool but it looked inviting once the weather gets a bit warmer. The bus next door was conveinant if you didn't have a car and Pam at the reception was very helpful with booking theme parks etc. If this motel was in New Zealand it would do so well, great value for money. i would highly recommend this accomodation.

A bunch of us were planning to go Disney and Knotts Berry Farm in late January, so we got a couple of suites at Staybridge Suites Anaheim. We didn't quite know what to expect, except that it had a fully stocked kitchen and the location was great for where we wanted to go.   When we entered the rooms, it was a pleasant surprise to see how big the suites were. Now don't be expecting some 5-star hotel decor or anything because that's not what Staybridge's is about. What it was was a spacious suite that is homey, clean, televisions in each room and the seating area, fully stocked kitchen and comfy beds.   Most importantly, the lobby has a CONSTANT supply of COFFEE! I can't stress to you what a relief it is when you are tired and half-dead after travelling and just want a caffeine

This Place is Amazing!!!! Sooo relieved it was everything it said it was and More!!!Friendly staff, Delicious freee full breakfast before Disney everyday!!! CLEAN ROOM And SHOWER!!! Clean Clean Clean!!! I was so scared to book our first vacation without seeing in person exactly what I was getting, This Hotel exceeded all my expectations and I continually recommend to friends and family that are looking to book. Trams to Disney every 20 minutes, free laundry, free parking, free dinner three nights a week, free cocktails three nights a week,(i don't drink) But still thought that was very generous to exhausted parents after a day at Disney!!! This Hotel saved us sooo much money in food alone!! Comfy beds and extra pillows!! I will stay here every trip to Disney, LOVE LOVE LOVE this

We were going to Disneyland for four days and decided to go a day early. When our hotel couldn't take us, I discovered Staybridge Suites.  Lucky for us!  After only staying one night there, I am looking forward to going back again.  The rooms are spacious and clean. Comfortable bed(s).  Well appointed with full-sized appliances in furnished kitchenette.  Staff was pleasant and helpful when needed.  Breakfast served was hot and very good.  Chafing dishes were kept filled until just before the end.  Cold cereals, muffins, fruit, yogurt, etc., also available.  Next time I go, this is the place I'll stay.  It's also fairly close to Disneyland Maingate .  You could walk, but they have a shuttle every 15 - 20 mins.  The cost was reasonable.

We spent 4 nights in a 2 bedroom suite this last week and have no complaints.  The rooms were clean and nice and the help was more than helpful.  The breakfast was a step up from a continental breakfast with hot food options and a great way to start the day before Disneyland.  We will stay here again when we go next time.

We have stayed at this property 3 times over the past 15 years. For the most part, it is an awesome place!   Let's start with the goods. - wonderful large heated pool and hot tub  - full complimentary Breakfast  - free 'appetizers' (more like dinners for us) on several week nights - Helpful staff  Downsides. - rooms are a little tight (at least for a family - and we had a two bedroom) - needs some updating. Rooms are starting to look tired and out dated. The kitchen was also missing some items (like a Kettle and a toaster. But they will bring one when you ask.) - you need to take the Anaheim Resort Transit to get to Disney which isn't always reliable.  Like I said, we have stayed here 3 times now and it has always been a comfortable happy stay. The only reason we plan to go

My step daughter was staying in the Holiday Inn next door. She was taking her son to Disneyland. My 12 year old daughter wanted to go with her big sister to Disneyland so we drove down from Canada to meet her. We did not stay at the Holiday Inn next door because it was not dog friendly. I ended up here because they were dog friendly and it was a reasonable price. (for the room and the dog charge) Boy was I glad we found this place. I was not going into Disneyland so I got to enjoy relaxing by the pool with my niece who joined me. We were real glad they had breakfast and snacks in the middle of the week. The breakfast can get really crowded when everyone is tring to get off to Disney in the morn. On the down side when we first walked into the room it was really hot, the heater

Summary Heading: Good for familys of 5 or more
Summary: More bang for your buck, Free Buffet breakfest you can easly spend $10 per person eating out free Wi-fi, Free parking. Down side Tv's Dated, mad house during Breakfest, On a one way Street Next door to a trailer park. So lock your cars and set your alarms.

Great for a big family. Free breakfast saved about 60.00 bucks a day. Ten mins. away from Disenyland. Has a fire place in lobby nice to relax by. Free washer and dryers. Free parking. Free wi-fi. Front desk staff was very nice. Pantry a little pricey. Will be coming back again. 3 out of 5 stars. Didnt like that you share a pool and hot tube with two other hotels. Small pool for three hotels

Summary Heading: Great Family Location for Disney Visit
Summary: Just returned from 3 days at Disney. This was a super hotel for a family (we had a large group). Suggest you book the 2 bedroom suite. You can load a lot of kids in and still have the non-bedroom areas for TV, eating, etc. Great free breakfast, reasonable pricing, clean rooms. Downside...just barely a 3 star hotel; not good for non-family visits as kids running and screaming all over the place; shuttle service (public transportation bus) to Disney was inconsistent (we waited for 45 minutes in freezing rain to get back to hotel); bus every 20 minutes claim by front desk was a figment of someone's imagination; first impression marred by stained, worn and dirty carpet behind front desk area.
Manager Response: Dear Paintjoe,  Thank you for your detailed review of our hotel.  I am pleased you did enjoy your stay and your family's suite.  I certainly apologize for any inconveniences you may have experienced.   We rely on you, our guest, to let us know how we are doing and how we can better meet your needs. I have taken note and wish to thank you for all your valuable comments.  We thank you for having chosen our Hotel.  We take this opportunity to send you our best wishes.   Regards, Brenda J. IHGCare

Summary: Stayed at the property during a 2 day trip to Disney.  Property was not bad, but definitely not a 4 or 5 star property.  All rooms have full kitchens which is nice if your staying for an extended stay.  Price included free breakfast, wi-fi, and free parking which is not common for hotels in Orange County near Disney.  There is a shuttle leaving to and from Disney every 20 minutes from the Holiday Inn next door which is $4 a day per person.  Room walls were thin so you heard noise from neighboring rooms at times.  The breakfast buffet was just ok and very crowded, so go early or late to beat the crowd.  Overall it was a decent stay with no issues and good customer service so probably a good idea for family, maybe not so much for adults.
Manager Response: Dear Buckeye1_11,  I would like to express my sincerest thanks for the observations you sent me regarding services at our Hotel.  I appreciated your observations and advice.  We are continually striving to improve the hospitality we offer, and comments from our guests are always welcome.  We thank you for having chosen our Hotel and look forward to greeting you personally. We take this opportunity to send you our best wishes.  Regards, Brenda J. IHGCare

Summary: My daughter and her family stayed here while visiting Disneyland.  One night the third-row seats of their SUV were stolen.  The car was locked and parked in the hotel parking lot.  When this was reported to management, they didn't seem to care, and said that yeah, a lot of things had been stolen lately and they probably needed to increase their security.  They were of little help filling out police report forms, and the buffet attendant seemed more concerned and sympathetic than the desk personnel.  This ruined an otherwise wonderful trip.
Manager Response: Dear FoodyMama,  I am terribly sorry for what you experienced at our hotel. I assure you the safety and security of our guests is of utmost concern to us. We would like to discuss you experience further.  I have sent you a private message with more details.  Thank you  Katie J Case Manager IHGCare

Summary: You can't beat a "suite" when traveling with family.  To top it off, you can't beat free full breakfasts every morning!  What a way to get a very long day at Disneyland started!  As I've stayed here before, there weren't any surprises.  When we checked in, we were greeted by the very friendly front desk staff that gave us some very good tips for our stay and for good times to go to Disneyland, etc.  Since we are veteran Disneyland travelers, this wasn't needed, but very appreciated!  The room we got was a one bedroom suite.  We traveled with my family of 3 plus my mother in law.  In all, the room was perfect for what we intended to use it for - pretty much sleeping and that is about it!  If you plan on spending more time in the room with a group of 4 or more, I would suggest a 2

We were very suprised at the lack of care in every part of our stay! Carpet in the hall way had more rolls then you could count, Bathroom had black pubic hair all over, bathtub would not hold water, swimming pool heater broke (very cold), washer and dryers had only one working which employes were using, asked for three days for soap that never came even after five phone calls. breakfast was cold imitation eggs and canadian bacon you would put on a pizza for your protien :(. This was a nightmare that was never ending. Have stayed at different stay bridge locations and loved them. AVOID AT ALL COST! MANAGER HAD EVERY EXCUSE IN THE BOOK BUT NO REFUND SO WE COULD GO SOME WHERE ELSE. SKIP THIS PLACE!

Two grandmas with grand kids had  a very nice stay at the Staybridge for 5 days. Lots of selections for breakfast buffet, short walk to catch frequent busses to both Disney Parks, heated pool and spa in the evening plus mid week "social time" in the spacious and comfortable great room.Two BR. suite more than adequate,  the front desk pleasant and ready to answer questions. Yes it is an older property but everything was clean and our room was quiet. Loved having access to free W&D.

Summary Heading: Great service and staff! Lacking in capital budget.
Summary: I was staying at this hotel on business and extended a few days for some vacation time. The staff was welcoming, friendly, efficient and knowledgable. One evening I was down at the FD and asked if I could get some more TP. I was expecting for them to just hand me some but FD Agent said he would have it brought up to our room. Within 5 minutes it was there. I was very impressed by the quick service!  Pam at the FD was great and really made us feel at home. She had all kinds of suggestions for things we could do around the area. Breakfast was good. There was a nice variety. I really enjoyed the waffles, scrabbled eggs and coffee cake. The french roast coffee was wonderful!   Now for the reason I gave 4 out of 5. The facility could use some updating. The equipment in the fitness

My boss booked this hotel for our crew while we were in town for a trade show. The room itself was nice as it had one room with the beds and bathroom, and a second with a small kitchenette and seating area with TV.  The bed was comfortable, although I didn't particularly care for the pillows.  There was a buffet breakfast which was included in the price. It included items such as bagels, eggs, toast, cantaloupe, yogurt, a waffle station and one meat which rotated each day: bacon, ham and sausage.  The hotel shares its swimming pool and hot tub with the holiday inn next door. We went into the hot tub one night, but it was not hot only warm and the jets were very weak. So although typically I will visit the hot tub each night, we only went once in our 7 night stay.  Our bathtub

Summary Heading: Staybridge Suites a real bargain in Anahiem
Summary: The Staybridge Suites Anahiem is the best "bang for your buck" achievable for families travelling to the Disneyland area in my opinion, friendly staff, exceptional continental breakfast, lovely grounds, pool and whirlpool sites.Free coffee, juice etc. 24/7 in the lobby, The dog friendly full kitchen suites are a bargain at 99 per night, there is the Brasserie with great food in the adjacent Holiday inn that shares the property and facilities and the gym there is well set up. Shuttles every 20 minutes to Disneyland and also shuttles downtown and to Universal studios.

Summary Heading: Friendly Staff, but this place needs some refurbishing 3.5 is more accurate.
Summary: Checked in for a one week stay as a business traveler.  This needs stating because you are in Anaheim either as a family to visit Disney or as a business traveler.  Depending upon which there are some different ways to look at this property.  The front desk staff were very friendly when I checked in and explained up front all of the amenities that the hotel offered.  She also said that they are planning to modernize and spruce up the rooms, which will be needed before I check in again.  As a parent, this would be a decent place to stay if you are visiting the theme parks, particularly for the following reasons:  Free and good quality breakfast; "happy hour" beer, wine and some sorts of food, rooms with fridges, microwaves; an acceptable pool that is shared with the Holiday Inn

Summary Heading: Amenities/value/price made up for the distance from Disneyland (cf Best Western)
Summary: We stayed in the 1 BDR suite whilst my BIL stayed in the studio unit that also had its own kitchenette.  We enjoyed the spaciousness, daily housekeeping and the kitchen facilities (one big fridge) esp for takeaways  Good pointers - friendly American staff though there seemed to be only 1 or 2 on at any time - buy your tickets thr Reception rather than queue and waste time at Disneyland as we had not booked online or thought of buying it at Staybridge - ample free laundry facilities - detergent can be bought from the little sundries room next to Reception for $1 per mini pkt, also titbits in pkts and refrigerated, souvenir fridge magnets, souvenir Disney towels - the laundry is next to a mini-gym with a TV set  - comp access in the lobby - 2 terminals - free wifi - reasonable

Summary Heading: Great Disneyland choice for families with young children
Summary: This was our go to hotel in Anaheim when our youngest was an infant.  If you are going to split your Disneyland "days" in half and squeeze in a nap, this is a great option.  It is only 2 miles away from Disneyland, but the location is very quiet.  I always preferred this to the hotels right across the street, where you never feel like you could escape.  The rooms we had included a fridge and microwave, so we could heat up formula and other baby food.  They have washer and dryers available to clean up onsies and other outfits.  The pool was great as well, for those days where you decide to just stay at the hotel.  Transportation to and from Disneyland is less than ideal, but that is the tradeoff here.  They do have a shuttle the runs every 1/2 hour or so, if you want to buy

Summary Heading: Would choose this place again and recommend to my friends
Summary: The hotel is a little ways away from Disneyland, but we had a vehicle and I believe there is a shuttle available from the hotel.   Really enjoyed the breakfast each morning, and the dinner get togethers.   The first room we stayed in was not a bedroom suite and would havd been fine if I didnt have a younger child who needed to sleep before the rest of us.   We upgraded to a bedroom suite and it was excellent, comes with a kitchenette so we went and got some groceries, which added to the value.  Nice place to stay.

Summary Heading: Room was what we needed, but it is an extended stay hotel.
Summary: Extended stay hotels basically mean, people will stay there for sometime months on end. So it is more of a condo rental then a `hotel`room. If you dont mind cleaning once per week, then it is completely fine. I dont clean my toilet at home more then once a week, so it was no big deal for me, but my mother in law was bothered by it. They do take the garbage out daily and make the beds (which were extremely comfy!). We stayed in the 2 bedroom suite and it was great for our needs. Having a full kitchen is always helpful especially with little ones. Breakfast was good, everyday the `meat`would change. So it would be scrambled eggs or omlet style egg patty with either sausage or bacon rotating daily. They had ample wafflemakers which was nice so the wait was not the long! The canned

Summary Heading: Best accom. of our 4 week trip.
Summary: This place really felt like home. We had 2 b/room family suite which was ample for us all - 2A & 2C U/13. Close to everything but not noisy at all. My kids loved the free WiFi. I loved the free coffee in the lobby on the way to my room after a long day out. We stayed 8 nights and were sad to go. The buffet breakfast is awesome. It was our 1st time at a Staybridge Hotel and we wouldn't hesitate to stay again. All the staff were awesome and the cleaning staff quick & efficient. Thanks a lot, our stay was the best of our 4 weeks away.

We (my wife and I, DD and MiL) spent three nights at the Anaheim Staybridge in early December.  After a long flight and early morning arrival from Australia into LAX we arrived way too early for check in but were able to stow our bags and were offered the complimentary breakfast which was a nice touch.  First impressions were of the warming fire between the lobby and dining area and the friendliness of the desk staff. After spending a few hours and lunch at Downtown Disney we came back around two-ish - our room was ready so we crashed out.  There were 2 bedrooms each with facilities and a middle lounge and kitchen area, which we didn't really use (we were always out in Disney) but gave us extra space for the bags and for more privacy. The matress and pillows were super comfy,

We stayed 4 nights. The room was great for six with 2 doubles and a pull out couch. The free breakfast was good each morning for a start to Disney and 3 nights (served Tues, Wed, Thurs) they serve things like hamburgers, hot dogs, nachos with draft beer and wine. Soft drinks for younger.. The pool was very large and heated. The hot tub was also quite large. You can't beat the price with 2 meals.

This was a great place close to DisneyLand California. I stayed here for 2 nights. The front desk staff were courteous. The property seems to be a little old but very well maintained.   Pros:  a. close to disneyland b. free wifi c. free breakfast (much better than the regular breakfast buffet) d. nice room - comfortable - very clean e. safe location  Cons: nothing at all in my opinion

Stayed for two weeks whilst enjoying Disneyland and all that the area has to offer. This resort is perfect for families - good sized rooms, comfy beds, free breakfast daily, free dinner three nights a week, free parking, free wi-fi and free laundry! The breakfast is basic, but plenty to cater for hungry teenagers. Staff are fantastic and very helpful - always willing to assist with tour bookings and directions to local attractions. The location is good, we had a car so we drove everywhere and had no problems.  Would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for good value.

The hotel was very nice with free wi-fi and breakfast.  Very nice suites.  The confusing thing was that they made us sign a "no noise/no parties in your room" form when we checked in.  But they didn't seem to do anything about the teenagers running up and down the halls shouting at 1am, or the younger kids doing the same at 6am.  Definitely a family hotel, which is OK, but since the parents obviously weren't going to control them, the "no noise" staff should have.  Overall, it was very nice and we would stay there again.

We stayed in a two bedroom suites with one king and two double single and a sofa bed as well as two attached baths. Location wise not that good if you do not have a car and need to do grocery shopping (nearest shop at Vors 20-30min walk away  but 5 min by car), otherwise the stay was perfect. The room had a full size kitchen, free yummy breakfast with free flow drinks like coffee, tea , soft drinks , delicious waffles with scrambled eggs , either sausage or bacon or ham , peaches , yogurt, bagels , bread , assorted sara lee like cakes. Totally great to start the day with. They also have small meals like mini burgers, free drinks every Tuesday , Wesnesday and Thursday evening. There are no local restaurants on site however there is local delivery of pizza and Chinese food

We traveled with three kids (ages 13, 11 and 6) and would definitely go back. The property is close to Disney and a good value for the money. We opted to drive to Disney (parking is $15) and found it very easy to get in and out. Parking at the hotel is free. Room was nice; we didn't use the kitchen. The mattress on the pullout sofa wasn't great, but the two older kids didn't complain. Breakfast was typical buffet style with scrambled eggs, bacon (or ham), cereal, bagels and make-your-own waffles (there are three waffle irons). The breakfast area isn't a very big space and was pretty crowded both mornings we were there. We bought our Disney tickets (for one day) at the front desk; there was no cost savings by doing that, but we did avoid the ticket lines at the park.

Summary Heading: Great room configuration for extended stay
Summary: Really enjoyed the affordable layout for a family of four.  Sep bedrooms with a living area between them. This works well if you are travelling with young children to get them to bed exausted from a day at Disney.  Parents do not have to go to bed to help them sleep as you do in a single room with two double beds.  A not too long walk back from Disneyland, just long enough to walk off a burger.  Helpful front office staff.  Would stay there again.

We liked this hotel, especially sharing a 2 bedroom suite with grandparents. The buffet and pool were good. Only downside was having to take the ART to the park, it did not always come on time. Good value and clean.

Summary Heading: Good place to stay in Anaheim
Summary: I have recently become a fan of Staybridge Suites.  The front desk personnel are always friendly and efficient.  The breakfast is always decent.  We walked each day to Disneyland rather than take the shuttle.  It is about a mile I would guess - not bad.  It is also very nice to have a separate bedroom/livingroom/kitchen.

I have to say I really enjoyed staying here! After finding out that not only would we be saving $1,000 compared to another hotel, but we would have a much more comfy room with all the amenities of the "other" place, we were sold!   We arrived Oct 23 and stayed until Nov 2. A definite long and pleasant stay. We got a two bed room with a kitchen suite. Super comfortable, very private. Some thing all moms (and some dads, heehee) love, FREE LAUNDRY! Simply buy your own soap, or just purchase from the small market next to the reception desk and wash and dry for free! I LOVED that! Having a family  of 5, that definitely came in handy. The complimentary breakfast was offered like clock work every morning. You were met with hot eggs, a breakfast meat, bagels, make your own yummy

Summary Heading: Fantastic place to stay, not far from Disneyland
Summary: We stayed here for 11 nights in April.  Had a fantastic time, awesome pool and spa, great staff.  We had a two bedroom suite with two bathrooms.  We had a King bed and two double beds in the other room.  Everything you need in the suite, microwave, all cooking utensils and full size fridge, although we never ate in.  We had several meals at the Holiday Inn next door which has a great restaurant.  We drove to Disneyland as it was much easier than waiting around for the ART bus that was suppose to be every 20 mins but was much longer than that.  Close to other restaurants, Dennys, Bubbagumps etc.  Close to The Block at Orange for shopping.  Very reasonable and great place to stay.

The Staybridge Suites was exactly what I expected when I booked it. No more, no less. We had a one-bedroom unit with a king-sized bed. I had requested a room away from the freeway, but once we arrived, we found that we were facing the freeway. They seemed unable to change this situation, but were able to grant us early check-in around 1:30 so that was great. I should mention, even facing the freeway, they must have good windows because the noise was not that bad.  The rooms are not large, but did the job. The kitchen is utilitarian. We had requested a crib for our infant and although we received one, it was one of the old-style metal cribs that some hotels still use. Why they are using these instead of a pack n' play is beyond me; it takes up a lot of room and I don't feel they

Summary Heading: Dated and beaten up; decent location, quiet, and staff
Summary: We stayed here for four nights in October 2011. The location was about a 10 minute drive from the Disney parking deck.  There is a shuttle to Disney, but it left too late for us and cost $4 per person.  There are many hotels within walking distance of DL, but not this one.  Watch out for road construction in the area.  This hotel is next to I-5, but our room was surprisingly quiet.  The suite was mid-sized with a separate living room/kitchen. There was no extra space as the beds were practically against the walls in the bedroom and the sleeper sofa hit the tv cabinet when opened.  The room was clean, but the kitchen was not well stocked.  The furniture was beaten up, the hallway carpet was faded, dirty, and detaching, and the elevators were dirty.  The pool area was nice and

We are a family of 4 and the one bedroom was quite adequate. The hotel is a bit dated but it was clean. There is free breakfast every morning, free wifi, free use of their laundry, heated pool, a nice dining room where you can entertain if friends visit you. The staff even gave us some crayons and colouring pages for the kids and turned the tv to the cartoon channel to entertain the kids.  My only complaint was the vents of the AC in the room was directly blowing into our faces and try as we might to fix it, we couldn't change the direction so we just turned it off at night. It was still cool until the next day and we turned I on again before leaving the room.  Overall I would definitely stay here again for the value and convenience.

I stay here with my mun sister and myself had good time the room was so big 3 TVs two full bathroom stay in 112 only draw back was we found a cockroach but that's ok it came up from the drain in the bathroom happy hour mid week was welcome save money will be back

The hotel was excellent, clean and very friendly staff. We were able to walk to Disneyland ( around 20-25 minutes), the walk could be to far if there are small children within your party but as a group of adults the walk was fine. It was also only a 25 minute walk to the Anaheim train station which was very convenient for our trips to LA. The staff at the front desk were very helpful with bus information for our return journey to LAX and were always pleasant whenever we saw them. The buffet style breakfast was a great start to the day before going to the theme parks.  The room was a good size and housekeeping was good. There was even maid service on the weekend which we hadnt expected.

Here now arrived yesterday from Vegas after staying in that he'll hole what a welcome change to arrive somewhere so homely and welcoming staff seem friendly enough rooms far nicer than they look in photos very clean yes as other reviews state only light clean with main clean once per week but that's fine I'm fussy but no problem with this beds made towels refreshed etc so no problem pool area fantastic never too busy large enough and nice temperature only slight neg here was pool towels no where near large enough and very thin these are handed out by reception rather than freely available so I'd recommend to bring own plenty of beds chairs etc and open 8 til 11 fab! Breakfast bit manic and basic but free and can find something to eat from choice of yoghurt muffins cereal bagels

Summary Heading: There's no place like home, but this is very close....
Summary: This hotel is one fantastic place to stay. The Disneyland shuttle picks you up and delivers you back about every 30 mins for a small fee. When we went it was $4 for the day per person and you can come and go as often in the day as you need. Free laundry, free breakfast - yummy.   We had a 2 bedroom suite and it was huge with a TV in every room. Every Tues, Wed and Thurs they put on dinner - hot dogs, meatballs, or something along those lines with beer, wine and soft drinks allthis is FREE. What a joy for a family holiday. The staff were excellent and very good at their job. Would recommend this place for everyone.

Staff was very nice and provided extra dishes and towels when requested. Breakfast buffet was always well stocked and they never ran out of anything while I was there. Room was an okay size, a little small for five. The beds were a little lumpy and the chairs were a bit dingy. The free Wi-Fi was very handy and I got about 1.5Mb up and down. I did not like the "Light Touch" cleaning. I like to have the room vacuumed, bathrooms cleaned and linen changed every day. The shuttle to Disneyland was convenient and came about every 15-25 minutes.  I would stay here again it was a pleasant visit and a good value.

Recently, we took our adult kids to California, as a Last Family Gig, we did all the Thrill Experiences available in Los Angeles within a 2 week period. As a base for our adventures, we chose Staybridge Suites Anaheim, traveling to & from the theme parks from our hotel was a breeze. I would recommend this property to any family configuration. The service is good, the staff are very friendly and knowledgable about their surrounding areas. I'm sure when our kids have their own kids, Staybridge Anaheim will be on the menu for their Cali Trip

Summary Heading: Nice place to stay well equipped clean and perfect for access to Disney
Summary: Nice clean rooms, helpful staff, free wi-fi and access to a computer in reception.  Bit noisy with kids around (even though we were there off season, kids back at school) great value for £116 a night.

Stayed at the Staybridge Suites in Anaheim for our first trip ever to California.  Awesome location and extremely clean, accomodating and friendly place to stay.  Close to all attractions and very easy to navigate to the convention center.  The breakfast every morning was superb.  Especially when feeding hungry teenage boys.  The place was spotless.  Our room (beds, kitchenette, sleeping accomodations very well appointed and comfortable.)  Close to several different shopping facilities for groceries.  The Staybridge staff was so accomodating when we gathered with the other teams one evening for a bbq and potluck.  They let us arrange the tables and made sure we had extra bowls, etc.  Our team has used this facility in previous trips and now I understand why they return to the
Hotel was good but location to restaurants is lacking.

This is a great place for families to stay, as it's near Disneyland and has large enough rooms for families to share without being squished.  Easy freeway access, though keep in mind that Manchester Avenue is a one way street.  Only 15 minutes from John Wayne airport, and 30 minutes to the beach.   Only thing that some would consider a negative is that this property shares a pool, sauna, and gym with the Holiday Inn next door.  It never seemed busy, but we were only at the hotel at night.

Traveled with hubby, brother and sis in law, two teenagers, an 11, 7, and 5 year old.  The rooms were perfect.  Bed was comfy.  Food was good and hot.  The large suite for the couple and 4 boys was a perfect size and they were thrilled to have their own space.  Shuttleto Disney is super close and staff was friendly.  You can even do pin trading there.  We will definitely be back!  Even though you have to wait a bit, nothing beats the free laundry facility.

Summary Heading: Very Nice Hotel, We Will Stay Here Again
Summary: We stayed in the 2 bedroom suite, and it was fabulous! Two full bathrooms, so nice we were able to get ready in half the time. Also a very clean hotel. Staff was very helpful, breakfast was excellent.

Summary Heading: Great family base for Disney Parks
Summary: Our family of 2 adults and 2 older children spent 3 nights here this August.  Having used Staybridge Suites before we knew what to expect from out 2 room suite.  Yes they can appear dated in decor but they are clean and nice an spacious. Breakfast was simple but adequate and the staff were all pleasant and polite.  This was just a quick stop with 1 full day at Disney, handy location within a few minutes drive from the Disney parking lot and a second day seeing some of the downtown LA sights and a trip to the mall so we didn't use the pool or laundry facilities.

We booked a 1 bedroom 2 double beds, nonsmoking, with kitchenette  for 1 week.  The 2 double beds are exactly that.  Not queen beds!!!!  The sleeper sofa had seen better days.  Our younger teenager could feel the individual  springs poking through.  I requested 2 mattress pads which I folded in half, to lay on top of the sleeper sofa mattress.  This helped somewhat.  After a 3rd night of mediocre sleep on the double bed, I went down to the front desk, to inquire about checking out early and moving to another hotel, which we normally stay at, when we are visiting Anaheim.  Alexis, who happend to be in charge, listened to my predicament, and offered to send up a cot, to see if this would help.  Thankfully, it did somewhat, but our teenagers still had to take turns on the dreaded

Summary Heading: Loved it and will return when visiting Disneyland
Summary: Great breakfast buffet with many choices and had hamburgers and hot dogs offered some evenings!

The large 'studio' room we had included a kingsize bed and a bed settee (we didn't use the bed settee).  Having frequently travelled with our children in the past we very impressed with the kitchen facilities including a family size fridge/freezer, large microwave and cook top.  There was an adequate supply of kitchen utensils and crockery.  For our family this would have been ideal as our kids are often happier 'eating in'.  The pool was good, breakfast was fine for families but not so good for discerning adults. The room was clean and tidy.  Location was just 10 mins walk to restaurants, attractions and a bit more for Disney.

During our stay we had an issue with the room and we asked to change a room. Hotel manager Richard was very helpful and switched rooms, taking care for our luggage all in all, good value and good location. If you are sensitive to noise , ask a room off I5

Summary Heading: nice pet friendly place and a great value
Summary: We stayed here on our recent trip to Disneyland for six nights.  It was a good choice, pet friendly, included breakfast, and very economical as well.  The laundry facilities are free to guests, they provide free newspapers, and the staff were very friendly.  The shop is spare and spartan, and while the pool is alright, it is also shared with the Holiday Inn next door.  This proved to be a problem one night as it was taken over by a few busloads of high school students.  They also have a picnic area and BBQs to use as well which was nice.  The major drawback was its distance from Disneyland.  There is a Anaheim Transit available, but as we were a party of six, it proved to be cheaper to drive to Disneyland and park there.  It proved tiring over the 5 days in the park.  We had a

Summary Heading: fantastic place would recomened 10000 % and more
Summary: lovely place would go back for sure wish we were still there rooms very clean always clean towels and plenty of them as we are a family of seven very helpfulstaff on front desk especially pam who sorted out for us to go to the orange county fair where we watched bull riding and bonnie who lent us her books on road directions and places to see very good breakfast spread every morning with so much choice very very clean place so wish we were still there you must stay here and say hi to pam and bonnie for us if you do thanks  stephanie david and family  if there had been pets in our room before us there was certanily no traces of any kind  no smell or anything so believe me its a wonderfulplace to stay

Summary Heading: Great option!  Could seem expensive but a VERY comfy, clean, money saving value!
Summary: My first criteria is cleanliness.  Then i look for quality of service, amenites, convenience which will point to superior value.  It'd been decades since i was in anaheim, so i read about just about every lodging option.  Several times.  My cousin was giving her daughter, her sister and herself the kid's long-wished-for visit to DL, so i hoped to guide them to a good & hassle-free experience.  Staybridge Suites, a Holiday Inn affiliate, provided just the home base we needed.  Under optimal conditions, it's even (a mile+) walking distace to DL.  The daily breakfast and the Tue/Wed/Thurs evening light dinner (snack) buffets can be crowded but, as other reviewers said, don't run out.  And these meals really did minimize our meal expenses!  I cooked a big pot of rice to enjoy our

The suites are great for a family. We had 8 people in our group (4 adults, 2 teenagers and 2 kids) The staff was friendly and helpful. We weren't able to check in early as the room wasn't ready since they were sold out the night before. That was as expected so no problem. They did call my cellphone when the room was ready. The room looked nice and was clean. It was great having a fridge and kitchenette and small living area. Each room has a tv so 3 total. The couch is small so the pull out bed is very small. One of the kids was not happy about having to sleep on it and complained that the mattress was not comfortable, but housekeeping provided a pad for the mattress which solved the problem. I was very impressed with housekeeping. We called for more towels and shampoo and they

Summary Heading: Would Look For Something Different Next Time.
Summary: This was what I think of a as a "Cattle Car" hotel.  As we checked in I heard the staff telling various people that their problems wouldn't be solved.  They were nicer to me, but the overall feeling seemed to be that the guests were demanding nuisances-- not that they are what makes a hotel's existence possible. The same attitude was clear at breakfast.  The staff started cordoning off the food area before breakfast was due to be over-- as though they were afraid that some undeserving-paying guest might try to get another piece of bacon in the moments after breakfast was supposed to be done.  I was glad we were only there for one night. On the plus side, I asked for a room in a quiet location and got one.  The room itself was dingy, but I slept well. There are a lot of hotels in

Arrived 23 Jul and stayed for 3 nights. On arrival we had a free upgrade to a suite that had an extra bedroom, the living space was small and I would not have wanted to be sharing it with what could be up to approx 8 people (room 618) This must have been the only place on our road trip of the West coast that I did not research on TA. I had no idea that Disney Land was next door and that this venue would be packed with families. From the outside the building looks very modern. On the inside it’s very dated and harks back to the 80’s. Another traveller reported on the state of the hallway carpets, you will be pleased to hear that nothing has changed, they are filthy.   Note to Staybridge, either deep clean or renew the carpets ASAP.  There are only 2 lifts to service 7 floors so

Summary Heading: Great family value for a family of 5 with lots of extra freebies
Summary: For our family of 5 the Staybridge was great . Two bedroom with 2 doubles in one and a king size (very confortable) in the other. With a pull out double in the lounge , it suited us perfectly. Each room had a tv - 3 in total , which made it easy with the kids - no fights over the remote  On Tuesdays through Thursday the hotel put on a free tasty treat for everyone. Hamburgers , meatballs being my daughters favourite and nachos were another. Breakfast was free too. Consisting of more than enough variety. Eggs , sausage , bacon , waffles , fresh fruit and yoghurts , cereals , bagels and much more !  Also free dvds on offer at the front desk which has someone there 24/7 . Not to forget the free laundry - washer and dryer. Free wi-fi The pool is shared with the holiday inn next door
Stayed at this hotel at the end of June, hotel was perfect for our big family the 2 bd 2 bath suite felt like a mini apartment. Breakfast was great.  Staff was friendly and helpful.

For famiys visiting Disneyland,you just can't go past the 2bedroom suites.Our room had a king bed and the other had 2 doubles.Large living area,good kitchen,3TVs,cable,and free Wi FI.The pool is salt water and super clean.This hotel goes the extra yard for it's guests.No request was a problem.Do yourself a favor and choose this hotel when visiting Disneyland

We stayed at this hotel for 1 week for our family Disneyland vacation.  The suites are roomy and well stocked.  We picked this hotel over a hotel that is within walking distance of the resort.  We took the shuttle bus to DL, this was a painful exercise everyday with long waits on both sides.  The breakfast was edible and not bad for being free.  The pool and area was clean and not too busy.  The major knock was the overall cleanliness, the rooms weren't bad but the halls and main area were pretty bad.  My preference would be to stay closer to the park, within walking distance.

Summary Heading: Excellent hotel for a family stay
Summary: This is a greate Staybridge Suites for a family stay, conveniently located and well maintained. Stayed there just one night, but will certainly return if visiting LA again.

From the moment we arrived the customer service was fantastic and friendly.  All our Disney passes and ART passes were ready.  They organised transport to the Angel's game and got us there right on time (we were running really late).  Room was lovely, clean with quite new fittings(room 518).  Kitchen had everything we needed and laundry facilities were free. Internet and parking was also free. Breakfast was a good start to the day.  Staff told us where we could see Disney fireworks from inside the hotel (if we came home early) and were happy to help send our mail for us and swap pins with the kids.  Transport to and from Staybridge to Disney was reliable and only took about 7 - 10 minutes.  Accommodation and passes booked through Disney Travel Company.  Disney part of our

Summary Heading: Enjoyed every minute of our stay"
Summary: This hotel is fabulous if your looking for something affordable, clean, and friendly.  As an added bonus, you'll enjoy the friendly autmosphere, the hot breakfast and plenty of it. The activitiy work out room, free laundry mat if needed, and the awesome heated pool.  We stayed in a two room suite for 6 days and loved it and my 2 dogs loved it too as well as our 4 children.  If I get the chance to go up there again, I will not go with anyone else, the price is reasonable in comparison with others and the rooms are nice considering it is a renovated hotel, everything looks clean, neat and new!!! I recommend you try it out, I know you won't regret it.  We have stayed at other "big name hotels" and have received such poor service from them besides the whole bunch of money we've

Summary Heading: Very family friendly place! Love it!
Summary: Was very impressed with  the hotel: clean, friendly, loved the breakfast. Close to everything- shuttle or walk to Dysneyland.  Can say only good things about it.  A lot of space in the room.

Stayed here for four nights on a Disney trip. We booked AAA rates, bought AAA disney tickets which included free parking. We did not use the shuttle, we drove and used the free parking for the Toy story lot. Absolutely no complaints about the hotel. Clean and very quiet considering the number of kids there. We never used the pool, was too cold while we were there. The free breakfast was nicer than most, certainly better than HIE's - loved the waffle maker, and took advantage of the midweek hotdogs one evening. Bed was super comfy. Great value, I imagine because it's not the easiest trek to Disneyland. Would definitely stay here again, especially if planning to spend three or more days in Disneyland/California Adventure.

Summary Heading: Great hotel, suited what we needed.
Summary: A slightly older hotel but clean rooms and  lovely pool area.Is quite a distance to any shops restaurants if you dont have a car. Utilized the Anaheim shuttle to get to Disneyland which is very convenient. Overall a good clean hotel with good service. Great having a seperate bedroom from the living room as we were travelling with a 6 year old.

We recently stayed here in May 2011 on a visit to Disneyland. We stayed in a 2 bedroom suite, which also had a full kitchen and was comfortable. The continental breakfast was good. They had typically scrambled eggs, sausages, boiled eggs, bread, bagels, waffles, fruits and variety of juices (orange, apple ..). It is very close commute to Disneyland. We really enjoyed our stay there and will stay again. They also had daily housekeeping which was good.

Summary Heading: Wonderful place to stay, a great hotel with nice amenities.
Summary: We arrived early and the front desk staff took care of our bags, and also had our groceries delivered to our room.  Jumped on the ART bus to Disneyland with only one stop before and after our bus stop, very easy, runs every 20 min.  Swimming pool was nice and warm, nice to have BBQ available to use.

Summary Heading: Very impressed with the Staybridge....great service,great breakfast,excellent overall!!
Summary: My family and I enjoyed our stay at the staybridge. It started out rocky, with our room rate having been quoted as one amount at reservation and then being told that our room rate at reservation was not correct. The Operations Manager at the time was great, he gave us the family suite at a discounted rate anyways and from that point on...our stay was excellent!!! They offered complimentary bbq,beer and wine and we loved it! We saved money on dinner and breakfast. Our rooms were full of space for a family as big as mine and the rooms were clean. We were close to Disneyland minus the crowd. Overall, it is an excellent Hotel...we will be back definitely and highly recommend it for families headed to Disneyland or any of the parks. :)

we had 2 bed suite in april 2011 & was impressed with facilities for price.  Very comfortable rooms (although a little dated! but clean) and kitchen had everything you would need apart from kettle! Reception staff very helpful & friendly and breakfast not bad for the cost of rooms (although did get a bit 'samey' after a week, but lot cheaper & more convenient than breakfasting outside of hotel!) very quick drive to disneyland but wouldn't have fancied the walk (especially coming home!) overall a good stay & would recommend and stay there again if you want decent comfortable base for touring

After a disastrous rental hire which we left as it was so dirty it was great to walk into our Suite at the Staybridge, clean and nicely decorated, well equipped and just what we needed. The reception staff were all very helpful and welcoming.  Facilities at the Suites are great. There is a free breakfast together with evening snacks during some weekday evenings.  Washing facilities available.  Swimming pool area very pleasant. I will never bother to look for a house in the Anaheim area again would always recommend the Staybridge.

Summary Heading: HORRIBLE!!! I HAVE OVER 100 BITES!! NEVER EVER AGAIN!!!
Summary: I will be posting pics ASAP of the horrendous bites I have all over my arms, chest and back!  Staybrige please keep your free hamburgers and free breakfast ..... please  just give your guests a clean bug free room!!!! We stayed at this hotel while visiting Dinseyland. Room 518.  The hotel lobby, pool etc were fine for a medium grade hotel. The room was very worn and tired. This was our first impression of the property. While getting settled in the room my Sister and I both agreed the room could have been cleaner. She owns a cleaning company so she does have high standards, but this was pretty obvious stuff. Dusty lampshades, the interior doors near the handles and trim were defintely not clean, stuff like that. Because we were traveling with children, we had anitbacterial wipes
Great staff, great morning breakfast, great pool and spa.  A very enjoyable stay.  Free high speed internet, free coffee throughout day.

We stayed here for 3 nights April 14th and I was pleasantly surprised.  The 2 bedroom suite was like a small apartment and had all the comforts of home(fridge, plates, etc).  The hotel says the only do a cleaning Mon-Fri but our room was cleaned everyday.  The free breakfast was pretty good despite other reviews, the waffles and fruit were really good and FREE!  The only bad thing was the mattresses were kind of hard but it's not home so oh well.  The most important thing was it was clean.  The ART rides you to disney, the walk is too far, but crowded.

Summary Heading: Good family hotel for the Disneyland area
Summary: We've just returned from a stay at this hotel during our spring break week and were quite satisfied with the hotel.   We were a group of 6 and found that the 2 bedroom suite worked just fine.  Adults got the K room and the 4 kids split between the 2 doubles and the sofabed.  The rooms and facilities were clean, the breakfast offered enough options to meet everyone's needs and the location was reasonably convenient to Disney.    Despite the hotel being pretty full, we had a quiet night sleep, we were able to find seats during breakfast and our girls were able to use the pool.  The front desk staff was friendly and helpful with recommendations for dinner in the area.   This isn't a luxury hotel but quite comfortable for a mid-range suite hotel.

We were going to stay at the Candlewood Suites (see my review- only stayed one night) and I called and got us a room here instead for the rest of our LA trip (4 nights). We got the AAA rate and weird thing was- it was less $ last minute than it was a couple weeks ago. But that's not a complaint.  The staff here are grea, friendly, and happy. Yes, very busy at certain hours- but when there are 4 or 5 families trying to check in at once with 10 kids running around, what can you do? The staff, I think, do a great job.  The breakfast buffet is adaquate for a "free meal". There is variety, but it's the same variety everyday. Yet, when you figure breakfast for 2 adults is going to cost you around $20 elsewhere, we'll take that same variety and know we'll have a good lunch somewhere

This hotel was listed as 4star - and experience of other Intercontinental hotels encouraged us to book this hotel - how disappointing - reception was staffed by one poor overworked woman who was checking people in, answering the phone, dealing with customers and serving in the shop - quite a feat for one solitary person!!  The room was adequate although we had to request pillows for the put-up bed and had to remake the bed every day.  The rooms were serviced minimally every day (called 'Light Touch'!) - and linen changed every seven days - the internal corridors were not hoovered during our stay - as for the breakfast - the same food every morning - served on plastic plates with plastic cutlery and plastic cups - not really four star.  The location was nowhere near alternative

We had the pleasure of staying at Staybridge in March this resort is definetly for families of all ages. The rooms were clean and comfortable,the girls on the front desk were very helpful and friendly. It wa located a short shuttle trip to Disneyland.I will be recommending this resort to all my friends it was value for money and the overall feel of this place is Family Orientated.

Staybridge is one of my favourite hotel brands in US. The room sizes with full kitchen is perfect for families and everything is very clean and comfortable. The staff is always helpful and happy to serve you and the buffet breakfast, always included in the price, is wonderful and with plenty of options. They also offer free snacks and drinks during happy hours on some weekdays. The pool is very nice, although I didn´t go in, and they even offer free wireless internet on the rooms and 2 desktops just in front of the check-in counter. I recommend and would stay here again happily. I couldn´t be more pleased!

Summary Heading: Great 2 bedroom suites but the free breakfast was not worth it
Summary: My family and I  just returned from a 1 week stay at the Staybridge Suites.  (kids ages 10, 13, 15)   I am a travel agent and tend to do quite a bit of research before deciding on hotels.  I read all the reviews on Trip Advisor and even though they were mixed decided to book Staybridge.  The main factor in my decision was the excellent set up the 2 bedroom suites have for my families needs.  I knew I was booking a 3 star and didn't have high expectations.  When you are in Disneyland, you spend very little time in your room except to sleep so having 2 bedrooms was the most important factor for us.  The suite had 1 king bed with separate bathroom and the other bedroom had 2 double beds and bathroom, family room with pullout , kitchen with full size fridge, dishwasher, sink,

Summary Heading: Hotel was best part of our trip!
Summary: You will love this hotel!  Our party consisted of two adults, three teenagers, one toddler.  We had plenty of room.  The room itself had fridge, stove top, dishwasher (so convenient) two bathrooms....man, we were in heaven!  Free breakfast buffet every morning (eggs, sausage or bacon, waffles, toast, cereal, muffins.....)was great and sure appreciated as it saved us a ton of money.  In the evenings there was free snacks, beer, wine, sodas, hotdogs, bbq, nachos!  The laundry facility had free washer and dryer service.  Pool stayed open til 11:00p.m.!  The front desk staff couldn't have been nicer or more helpful.  We all enjoyed our stay here and will definitely be back.

Summary Heading: Served it purpose, but not fantastic.
Summary: The hotel is located a 10-15 minutes bus ride from Disneyland - but the bus picks you up and drops you off right at the hotel.  Pretty clean, but needs some work.  Free Breakfast buffet was convenient, but got a little boring after a while, same items everyday and they shut it down right at closing time.  We always grabbed some extra fruit (only ever served banana's and oranges) to take to the park with us.  Pools and hottub were great, but shared with the hotel next door and we often had to ask for towels from the front desk.  Free laundry was great, but it was busy.  Front desk staff where helpful and friendly.  They could spend more time cleaning outside around the lounge area - always cigarette butts on the ground, but a nice place to relax and read under the palm trees!

Great accomodations for my family of six.  Suite was clean, spacious, no smells, room temperatures were consistent.  All the amenities for a family or an extended stay.  Breakfast was very good.  Scrambled eggs, bacon, waffles, and fruit; not just danish and coffee.  Staff was friendly.  Two elevators.  I was pleasantly surprised with the value.   I would definitely stay there again.

From the moment of check in until check out our stay was excellent! The service provided was friendly and fast and the employees really showed that we mattered to them. Two ladies at the front desk (Jessica and Brittany B) went far and above expectations to make our stay wonderful. Thank you, ladies! The suite was perfect for our large family. The hotel was clean and quiet. The breakfast was first rate.  I will definately use this establishment next time I visit the area.

Staybridge Suites turned out to be a GREAT hotel for our family of five plus my grandparents. The breakfast and the evening reception were both GREAT, and the rooms were spacious enough for the seven enough. I only wish it was closer to the parks, but hey, I have an annual pass, so free parking anyway.

We stayed here Jan 7-9 for a short weekend trip. We are priority club members and used a free night stay with no problems. Our room was ready early (around 11 AM) which made us very happy. Free wi-fi, parking, and hot breakfast is hard to find at the hotels near Disney. Usually you get two out of three, or just a breakfast that has cold items. Parking was always easy to find, usually right in front. Free wi-fi was very very easy to access and also available downstairs if you didn't bring your own computer.  The breakfast buffet included eggs, bacon or sausage, fruit, yogurt, hard boiled eggs, bakery breads (like coffee cake, pound cake, mini muffins), oatmeal, cereal, make your own waffles, bagels, and toast. There were also a variety of drink choices including skim, 1% and 2%

My two adult daughters and grandson have just returned from 16 Days 22nd Dec thru to 7th January at the staybridge suites in Anaheim, the rooms were gauranteed to be fully cleaned after 7 days, on day 10 I had to demand our room have fresh sheets,and to be cleaned, I informed them I wouldnt even sleep that long in my own home in the same sheets... The cleaners turned up most mornings at 8am and we had to send them away 'due to still being in bed, and then we never saw them again, until returning at the end of the day and calling front desk asking for towels, etc to be changed... The place is very grubby, the Laundry is free but grubby, the hall was never hoovered outside our room or in our  room the 16 days we were there, we noticed everyday the same bits on the carpets, the

Summary Heading: Great value spot for a family trip to Disneyland
Summary: We stayed here after an earlier trip to Anaheim at another hotel which was very disappointing; this hotel was a breath of fresh air by comparison.  Whilst this is not a five star resort, our two bedroom apartment was terrific for our family of 6 to base ourselves for a week at Disneyland.   The service was always excellent and the breakfast was a good solid start to the day with good selection of choices. Although it was sometimes quite crowded and getting a table could be a challenge.  This hotel is not walking distance to Disneyland you either need to drive or take a shuttle but we liked being a little further away from the hustle & bustle of Disneyland.  We would definitely stay here again, it was perfect for us.

My husband and I decided to take our family to an early Christmas at Disneyland.  We have a special needs child who is tube fed so we had to have a kitchen area.  Staybridge was the best one we could find that provided this.        At first I was impressed with the service we were receiving.  Jessica at the front desk was probably the most polite and friendly front desk agent I have ever come across, and that is no small number.  When we got into the room, it was nice enough.  The bedrooms were nice, but the sitting room/kitchen area could have been a little nicer, but they worked, so no real complaints other than aesthetics.  The beds were actually VERY comfortable. That impressed me the most, I believe.     The first night we did go to the dining area for the complimentary
We stayed in a 2 bedroom suite with our daughter, her husband and the 2 grandchildren.  The room was excellent and served all our purposes perfectly.  The continental breakfast was very good.

The great: No Parties next door, no kids screaming in the hallway, no noisy late or early commotions. Very reasonable rates. Quiet, Quiet, Quiet.  The good: Breakfast was good, rooms were nice, fairly clean, nice people, easy shuttle  The bad: Lots of kids so plan on being patient with them in the breakfast area  The ugly: Two very busy little elevators that service all floors, maids use them too

Summary Heading: Perfect for family of two active small children
Summary: Visited CA and this was one of the highlights. I was afraid because I had read some less than favorable reviews, but I really enjoyed our stay. Spent 4 nights and the staff was nice, helpful. Breakfast every morning for free.... and even though the choices are not many, it worked out great. Laundromat service for FREE... we got a crib, in good shape, clean. plenty of room for a 3 year old and 1 year old to run, watch tv and play. I would definitely go back

We stayed at the Staybridge Suites for 3 nights for our trip to Disneyland. I had scoured the internet to try and find the best place for us to stay. After reading several reviews about this hotel we decided to give it a try. We have stayed at 2 other hotels on our other Disneyland trips (we go about twice a year) but after weighing the pros and cons decided to give this one a try. Mainly based on the fact  that we could get a suite for a reasonable price.  We will more than likely stay at this hotel again on our future visits.  Pros ~ *Studios or Suites available for a good value. *Full Kitchens with a microwave, stove top, dishwasher, full size frig, toaster and coffee maker. Also has cups, plates, pots/pans, cooking utensils, etc. All looked fairly new. *Hot breakfast every

Summary Heading: dad with 19yr old teenage daughter from cornwall uk
Summary: chose this hotel from the virgin holidays websight it was at the top of their list as it was the most economical one in the anahiem area  and it was a suite, lot of good reviews on trip advisor ,  made the right choice,  economy flight and  less expensive  hotel meant more money for tours  theme parks and  spending, for starters  there was a plentiful choice for breakfast  and coffee always on  tap anytime ,  saved plenty,free washers and driers in laundry always available  , two computers in  reception with free internet access my daughter was on these every day. and if like me you arnt very successful using your room phone they were only to willing to phone from  reception for me great help. all the reception  staff were  polite and helpful .anyway i had a bad back  from the

Summary Heading: Clean and honest - mailed me my laptop when I left it there!
Summary: Great place if traveling with teens. We went down for Blizzcon, a gaming conference, held at the convention center. Might not have stayed there if just with my husband, but the King suite had a room for us, a room for the kids and a fold out couch for a friend. Included was a big, all you can eat breakfast! Not fancy but perfect for teenage boys! They were able to walk to and from the convention center (1 mile) and there was also a shuttle although we didn't use this. While they were  at the convention dad and I ran around (Laguna, Santa Monica) and had a ball.  I accidentally left my laptop and they were so nice - mailed it (at my expense of course) fedex the next day. also very clean, no signs of bedbugs.

Summary Heading: I love this hotel! I was first worried...
Summary: I love this hotel! I was first worried about the location because it is quite a few blocks from Disneyland park, but there was a shuttle bus that came by every 10-20 minutes, and it was only a 5 minute bus ride to the park gates. The bonus was that these shuttle buses also took routes that would take you down the streets that many of the nearby restaurants were located on, and there was even one that now goes to the Block at Orange- the nearby mall! Very cool!! The hotel always had plenty of parking available for our rental car.  This hotel was always very clean, and quiet. I loved the rooms. We went with another couple, and the two bedroom suite had the bedrooms on opposite ends of the suite, so there was no disturbing one another. I'd definately stay here again!!

Summary Heading: Single Mom Trip to Disneyland with 3 kids
Summary: We love the Staybridge Suites...this was my sixth time staying there.  This trip included myself (young 30s single mom) and my three daughters ages 12, 9, and 9 months.  We chose a 2 bedroom suite for this trip.  The rooms are clean and spacious -- love having an actual kitchen in the room.  Free breakfast makes the hotel a great deal.  I ordered groceries from albertsons.com to be delivered on the day of our arrival and the hotel staff took care of putting them in our room for us while we were at the park.  The pool was clean and nice.  Used the ART shuttle system to get to/from Disneyland (this hotel is not within what I would consider a reasonable walking distance).  The lines to get on the shuttle get rather long some mornings...and you may at busy times of the year find

We just returned home from our stay there.  We absolutely loved this hotel.  We had a 2 bedroom family suite for our 7 kids and us.  Our bedroom had a king size bed with our own bathroom.  The living room had a couch that folded out into a bed and the other bedroom had 2 full size beds.  Each room had a tv.  The kitchen had a stove top, microwave, full size fridge, and dishwasher.   There were dishes, pans, utinsels, etc...  Everything we needed for our week long stay. The breakfasts were fantastic.  The pool was warm and fun.  The hot tub was hot and relaxing.  The elevators were fast even though there were only two, you never have to wait very long.  We didn't have anything about the hotel we did not like.  It is even close to Disneyland and we drove our own vehicle in every

Very reasonable rates and great location for Disneyland.  Shuttle to Disneyland only $2/child for a 3-day ticket and $10/adult.  Buy your Disneyland Tickets on-site.  The 3-day Park-Hopper Passes are $189 per adult...and we were pleasantly surprised that the hotel had a deal for 2 extra days for free...5-days for $189 for adults is unheard of!  An excellent hot breakfast comes with the room for free for all members of the party.  Try the Waffles!  One side of the hotel faces the interstate.  We were on the other side and heard no noise at all...so you might want to request that side.

Summary Heading: Stay here for one thing - to rest your head - be prepared for alot of families
Summary: We visited SS in April 10. We found it very ordinary. It was clean but the hotel felt like it was "Stuck in the 90's" It needs a renovation desperately. It's right next to a freeway so its noisy in the morning. Security was poor - seriously who puts security warning tags in the room and doesnt provide a safe? We found ourselves stuffing our valuables behind TV's etc as we didnt trust a room with no safe. The toilet overflowed and flooded the bathroom - when the service guy came he unblocked it and left us to clean up with a few towels and no mop or offer to get a cleaner - eww! But was still bold enough to ask for a tip - needless to say he didnt get one! The breakfast buffet was free but was ordinary. Be prepared for a median front desk staff of age about 16. There are millions

Summary Heading: spacious suites, and free breakfast add up to a great place to stay!
Summary: On arrival we were greeted by friendly reception staff, they gave us a map of the local area and helpful details on the hotel.  Our suite was two beds/two baths with a lounge and kitchen area, very spacious and the two rooms were both off the lounge area, this made it very private.  The buffet breakfast was a bit of a free for all with many guests loading up their plates for free and taking back to their rooms, but food was adequate and the area was clean.  Pool area was basic but again clean, we only used it once.  Ideally situated for all Disney stuff and Garden Walk shopping Mall was only minutes away with great eating places and some nice shops.  All in all we were very happy with the Staybridge Suites.  :)

This hotel is okay, not great, but not terrible either.  It is a decent, clean hotel with some amenities.  It was a much lower budget place than I, personally expected.  The hotel grounds were nice and the pool looked nice and clean.  The outdoor seating area was also nice.  The hotel staff always had coffee made and it was available 24/7 which was nice.  There was not enough parking for my liking and the spaces were VERY narrow.  Be prepared for some dings on your car doors .  As far as the rooms are concerned they were pretty nice, but much smaller than we anticipated.  We got a one bedroom suite and it was waaaaaayyy smaller than we thought it would be.  The beds and pillows were comfy though so we got pretty good sleep.  The housekeeping left a lot to be desired.  They only

Booked a 5 night Disneyland Package through GetAwayToday.com.  Traveled with extended family so we got two 1 bedroom unit.  Even thought this was a 1 bedroom suite, units were very very small.  Overall, we enjoyed our stay.  The staff is very friendly and helpful.  We enjoyed the morning breakfast buffet which included pastries, fruit, cereal, waffles, bacon and scrambled eggs.  Loved having the full-size refrigerator.  We were able to save a bundle at DL by bringing in our own sandwiches, snacks, and water.  We loved the pool area....lots of lounge chairs, tables with umbrellas....nice sized heated pool and a large hot tub.  It is, in my opion, too far to walk especially with small children.  We opted to use the ART system and were very disappointed.  We bought tickets for the

Summary Heading: A nice but average place to stay
Summary: The Staybridge is a pleasantish place to stay, and is close enough to Disney to walk (ignore the previous reviewer).  We stayed in a studio suite for 2 weeks care of Virgin Holidays. The suite itself was fine but initially the sheets provided for the baby's cot were yellow, and the sheets on the pull out bed were also stained. We did complain and these were replaced the next day.  It took a couple of days for the message to get through to housekeeping that there were 4 of us in the suite and therefore we needed 4 towels!  The room was clean, and there is regular housekeeping. The hotel has free internet, a limited gym (broken cyling machine), laundry and free breakfast. The breakfast is serviceable but very dull after a week (the hot food alternates between beef sausage and

The hotel was clean overall and the staff was pleasant for the most part. The room I had was clean, and on the 4th floor, and overall was a good value. The hotel is too far for walking to the Disney parks however the ART bus does stop next door at the Holiday Inn which shares the same property and parking lot as this hotel does.  For the rate I paid ($75 per night) the hotel was a good value and I would return to this hotel in the future when in the area.

Summary Heading: We will absolutely go back to Staybridge Suites
Summary: My husband and I took our two daughters (10 and 12) to Disneyland for a week in May.  We were very very pleased with our accomodations.  We had two separate bedrooms each with their own full bathroom; the girls each had their own queen size bed, and we had a king size bed.  All very comfortable, and it was quiet.  Plus a comfortable living room, kitchen, and convenient desk area (the free wireless was an extra plus!).  The Anaheim Resort Transit stopped right at the hotel every 20  minutes, and was extremely convenient and inexpensive to use all week to get to the Resort.  The free breakfast was a big bonus, as it saved us money and time.  All in all, an excellent value.

There are some good reasons that this hotel consistently ranks high in the reviews. For the price of a single room at our usual hotel we got a suite with two bedrooms, two bathrooms, a sofa bed in the main room, and a fully stocked kitchen. There was free parking, free internet, a hot breakfast every day and a happy hour three evenings. There is coffee in the lobby all day.
