There are indoor and outdoor lounge areas, and a picnic area with barbeque. There is a full restaurant that is shared with (and located in) the adjoining Holiday Inn. The swimming pool is also shared, but it was not crowded.  The property was clean and quiet, and the staff was courteous, helpful and attentive. We were on the patio side of the building, which was very quiet. Some friends who were on the

Summary Heading: Loved our stay, would stay there again
Summary: My husband, Dad, 2 year daughter and I stayed there when we visited Disneyland last Fall and we loved it. It was recommended from another family member, so we decided to stay there. The location is kind of tricky, and we got lost more than once, but that was just a minor problem. The room was clean, roomy and extremely convenient. The free breakfast was awesome and a great perk! Waffles, eggs, sausage/bacon, cereal, fruits, pasteries, coffee/tea/juice---way more than just your average "continental" breakfast. My daughter was only 20 months at the time of our trip and she got car sick driving from LA to Anaheim, and so she "got sick" all over her car seat. The gentleman was able to find us a room even though we technically weren't supposed to check in until later on, so we were

Summary Heading: Great valu and base for theme park visits
Summary: Stayed for four nights at the Staybridge Suites for touring a few of the area theme parks. Turned out to be a great base for our trip. Check-in was a breeze and staff was very friendly. Within 15 minutes of arriving, they were having the Wednesday night happy hour. We quickly unpacked and went down and had hot dogs, chips and quite a few beers. It was a nice to have a drink and unwind after the drive to Anaheim.  Stayed in room 216 – a one bedroom king suite. Room was spacious and had just about every amenity you could need. Everything was clean and the shower had good pressure. True as other reviews have pointed out that a few things are banged up, but nothing outrageous and considering the families with multiple kids at this place, I’m surprised that it’s not in worse shape.

Lovely hotel, very clean.  Good room but wish I had gone for the King Size One Room suite (which we booked in Vegas), queen still spacious and bigger than a normal hotel room.  Lovely heated outdoor swimming pool which we could use after a full day out and about.  Superb breakfast with a lot of choice, although not always enough tables for everyone - would be better in summer when outside tables could be used.  Small gym.  Laundry room with 4 washers and dryers but also were well used so may have to wait for a machine to become free.  Pleasant staff.

Because we were travelling with our family and extended family, we wanted a hotel that had suites. We were apprehensive as the price was lower than most, but tripadvisor reviews were positive, so we took the plunge.  Upon our arrival we were happy to see how new and clean the hotel looked. Our rooms were fantastic - nicely decorated and very clean.   We chose the two bedroom suite which included one room with a king size bed and ensuite, another room with two queen size beds and an ensuite, and a pull-out couch in the sitting area. Also included was a kitchenette complete with apartment sized refrigerator, dishwasher, microwave, table and chairs for four, and all of the dishes, etc required to prepare a meal.  Each morning we were treated to a large spread for breakfast

We stayed at the Staybridge Suites from 2/12 through 2/19/2010.  We are a family of 7, with kids ranging from 5-15.  We had a two bedroom suite, which includes one bedroom with a king bed, another bedroom with two queen beds, and a connecting living room/kitchen with a sofa bed.  Four kids shared the two queens, with the oldest son on the sleeper sofa.  I originally wanted to find a "good deal" on a 4 star hotel near Anaheim via Priceline.  There was only one 4 star hotel in Anaheim, and our Priceline bid was not accepted before it was sold out.  There were other 4 star hotels in Newport Beach that we were considering, and then I found the Staybridge Suites.  I don't believe Staybridge is part of the Priceline family - but that's fine.  We paid approximately $140 per night for

Clean, newer suites hotel for $117!  Got a one-bedroom suite for my family of seven - incl. 2 teenagers and three under 5 years old.  Great all-you-can-eat breakfast.  Very large heated pool.  Very helpful staff.  Took a van taxi to Disneyland to save time and waiting.  Get a room away from freeway if you are sensitive to the noise.  Have already recommended this place to friends.  Terrific value!

Nice hotel, clean room.  Nice to have a full size fridge and mini stove plus a microwave.  Free continental breakfast, with plenty of hot food (pretty good fare) and they also had a free happy hour on tues - sat nights.  overall a very good experience.
Our first family vacation is going perfectly thanks to the friendly staff and the inroom kitchen is helping us save a few bucks on meals. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

By far our family’s favorite hotel! Amenities we love: cooked self serve breakfast, full kitchen, clean easy to use grills, large clean heated pool, free basketballs, free movie rentals, free parking, free wireless, and short walk to Anaheim Resort Transit (ART). We have plenty of room in a 2bd 2ba room for 2 adults and 4 teens. King bed in master, 2 doubles in 2nd bedroom and a sofa bed in living room. The staff was good to our children and really made them feel special! We had friendly good mornings and good evenings every time we passed the front desk. For us there aren’t any negatives, but you should be aware that the Disneyland Park is about a 5 minute drive and that the kitchens do not have ovens.
Stayed with 7 teenage girls. The breakfast was great and the accomodations were fine!

We booked through the Disney website. Its a part of the friends and neighbors plan. My family and I stayed in their 2 bedroom suite.For the price it was great. From John Wayne airport to there took about 30 minutes, but the bus takes people to other hotels first. You are the last ones dropped off and the first ones picked up on the way back so allow for extra time back when needing to get to the airport. We arrived earlier than check in and they stored our luggage. The desk people were quite nice and polite.  I thought the breakfast buffet was pretty good. Theres 4 waffle makers, toast , pastrys, cereal bar, sodas, coffee, juices, etc. I think it was a pretty good spread. And hey it was free! While I was there the food never ran out, if anything I always noticed people refilling

We stayed at Staybridge for 7 nights with a 10 year old child.  We had no complaints at all.  The one bedroom suite was very spacious and well equipped.  The hotel featured a free breakfast buffett each morning with a very good selection of hot and cold items.  They also featured snacks and free beer and wine on Tuesday-Thursday evenings from 5:00 - 7:00 PM.  Free laundry, free parking and free internet also made for a very good value for the rate.

Summary Heading: Great Value, friendly staff, would stay again
Summary: We stayed here for two weeks over Christmas and New Year and were very happy with the hotel. Staff were friendly. Free Breakfast, parking and wireless internet were great - although the breakfast did get a bit samey after a while! Rooms were clean; service was good. Seemed very safe round and about. Location was great to get around. We didn't use the kitchen facilities (which were a bit basic anyway). Pool was good. We were very happy and would stay at Staybridge again.

Staybridge Suites is a great place to stay when traveling to Disneyland! The rooms were very comfortable and spacious, the breakfast, though packed, was very filling and extensive, parking was great, and staff was helpful! My only complaint about this property was the location. It wasn't the closest to Disneyland, so we had to park. Parking can be a pain when it is busy, so make sure you get there early. Overall, a great stay!  *The pictures are taken with a cell phone camera--ignore the blurriness & bad lighting.*

Summary Heading: Added great value and comfort to our trip
Summary: My husband and I took 9 family members to Disneyland over Thanksgiving break.  It was our 3rd time staying at the Staybridge Suites in Aneheim.  Because of our large group we chose to eat our main meal at the hotel.  The hotels BBQ area and kitchen equipment in the room made this possible with a little prep time which I did before our trip.  The free breakfast each morning got us going each day.  Believe it or not we didn't spend more than $150 for food for 11 people for a 4 day/night stay at Disneyland.  Our room was clean, extremely comfortable beds (which you so appreciate after a long day at Disneyland), and staff was helpful.  I would strongly recommed the Staybridge for those traveling with a large or small group.  Our group included 6 adults, 1 teenager and 4 children.

Summary Heading: Fellow reviewers, you got me this time! BELIEVE the one bad review.
Summary: Seriously folks, how did this hotel get ranked so highly on this site?  While it is not impossible to find, you WILL make a few wrong turns to find the property to begin with.  A strange u turn off of 5 onto a delightfully inconvenient one way street leads you to Staybridge Suites.  By all "meeting our needs" standards, we should have been thrilled by our 2 bedroom suite with kitchenette, and TWO bathrooms, but because everything is worn out, banged up and halfway, I really didn't care for it.  I found it kind of miserable and depressing to return to.  We didn't even venture to the pool, which is fine, I'm  sure it would have been a disappointment as well.  For the price paid, the quality of the bedding, the tacky decor and furniture, the worn out faded carpet, the lackluster

As Priority Club Members, we stay in a lot of hotels, and we were impressed with the level of service and value received at this property.  The hotel is located directly off I-5 about a 5 minute drive to the Disneyland resort. It would be a little far to walk but not impossible. The hotel grounds are clean, large and beautifully maintained. A large Mickey-shaped pool and large Mickey-shaped hot tub are shared by Staybridge Suites and the adjacent Holiday Inn. The suite was a fairly standard Staybridge Suite but it had a large built-in microwave and a dishwasher, which is great for families using the hotel as a home base during a vacation. The complimentary breakfast is not a basic hotel complimentary breakfast; it is a hot breakfast. Every day, an egg dish and meat dish were

Really great hotel, we had a two room suite with Mom and Dad, the Grandparents (my In-laws), and my two 10mo twin boys. The hotel was clean, quiet, and the staff was great! They use real cribs (rather than play-yards like most hotels). The free breakfast was good, although they could use more tables for it, and the timing if you want to make the park at opening is a bit off on weekends, but not bad. The ART bus is at the Holiday inn, which is part of the same "compound" (They're sister hotels) About a 50 Yard Walk, there is also a scheduled Disneyland Express stop here. Really you can go to this hotel directly from SNA or LAX and skip the rental car. We had a rental car, but ended up using ART everyday. (About 20-30 mins per ride, which is a lot faster than driving, parking,

Summary Heading: Felt like staying with family - great free breakfast -  brilliant staff
Summary: Stayed as 3 families 6 children 11-17. plenty to do for all gym, computers, pool and jacuzzi.  Staff extremely helpful always on hand for advice.Thanks Jessica, Alexis & Juan? Great facilities able to unwind as our British clocks meant we would slow down early evening so we would return to hotel with our drinks and a takeaway and relax in the dining area, children would do their own thing in the safe surroundings. Lots of local places to eat and takeaways. Some takeaways deliver free but watch as they change their prices from the brochures! Met Snow White on the Thursday evening brilliant!! as we didn't have time to fit Disney in it was great to catch up with the news on the dwarves and have a sing a long with Snow White. Great breakfast didn't use facilities in room much, free

We stayed at this hotel after recommendations from our travel agent who was familiar with the area.   Since we were staying for over a week, we wanted a hotel room big enough that we didn't feel like we were falling over each other.  With two boys, it was great as they had there own room, own beds & own bathroom.  We also had a comfortable bed with a bathroom.  A small kitchen area which we didn't use because we weren't in the room long enough.  The full size fridge & microwave came in handy too. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone coming to Disneyland with kids.  Great breakfast in the morning, although for us closed a little early as we like to sleep in a little.  The only small complaint I have is the location of the hotel, it is absolutely not within walking

Staff here were very friendly and helpful. The breakfast was great, having 3 boys its great to fll them up in the morning. The pool was great after a day at Disneyland or in LA. This place is great for families wantinh a place just out of the hustle and but nice and clsoe to all.
We would recommend this hotel for anyone visiting disneyland.

Summary Heading: Great value and the Happiest Place on Earth.
Summary: I recently traveled with 7 family members to the Happiest Place on Earth, they ranged in age from 2 to 62.  This hotel was a great find.  The rooms were clean, spacious and the full use kitchen was great.  They even had laundry facilities free of charge, you just had to provide the detergent.  If you stay here, don't pass up the continental breakfast buffet its delicious.

Summary Heading: Great location in the thick of it all
Summary: This hotel was very close to Disney and to a lot of restaurants.  We got a two bedroom suite for a great price.  Everything was very clean.

What a great hotel!  We found the hotel to be warm and friendly, classy and exactly what we needed for a 10-day stay.  We did get a fantastic deal and expected to have the worst room in the hotel but it was great.  Maybe smaller than the other rooms but we found the space more than adequate for the four of us.  Having a kitchen was wonderful and we caught a taxi to Walmart (great shopping centre) and stocked up on groceries.  Easy to get to Disneyland by the shuttle bus and taxis aren't that expensive to go to the shopping centres.  We also found Westfields a great place to shop & eat.  We had free breakfast every morning, free use of internet, free local calls & the pool was very relaxing.  There's also a free gym and free laundry for guests.   A wonderful holiday was had by

We recently got back from a family trip to disneyland. This hotel was great for what we needed.   We had my husband and myself, our son and his girlfriend (both 18) and my daughter's family (their a young couple with a two year old.  We had a great time and are talking about when we can go back again.    We enjoyed our stay at the Staybridge and it had just enough room for all of us. Plus, having the kitchen area was great with the two year old.  Also, loved the breakfast each morning.  And even though we were told there would be no maid service on the weekend our room still got cleaned.  I was surprised however by no conditioner or lotion in the rooms.   There is a little store downstairs that I did buy some conditioner at.   The shuttle service isn't that great also, but thats

From the very beginning, this hotel was great.  We stayed at the Anaheim La Quinta the night before because we got in a day early and had a free night voucher.  We went to staybridge at 9:00 a.m. to see what it was like because the La Quinta was disgusting and we were worried that all the area hotels might be that way.  Not only was the staybridge clean but they let us check in at 9:00.  The one bedroom suite was great for two adults and one child.  The rooms were very clean.  The staff went above and beyond to help.  I asked for directions to various things three or four times.  If they didn't have them already printed, they went online and printed directions for me without asking.  The shuttle to Disney is close.  Lots of activities and restaurants within a five minute drive.

Summary Heading: Great Suite Hotel for Families Visiting Disneyland
Summary: We would really recommend this suite hotel for families with kids. Over all, we found that this place had tons of benefits and the price was fairly reasonable for what you get.   The set up of the suite is really nice- two bedrooms, each with it's own bathroom. The decor probably isn't the most up-dated, but it's certainly pleasant, very clean, and not run down at all. There are two beds in the kids' room. The kitchen is fully equipped, with a full size fridge, small stove, dishwasher, and microwave oven. The pool was nice sized, and is shared with the next-door Holiday Inn, but was never crowded. In the mornings, there is a really nice breakfast buffet available with a lot of different hot and cold items. The staff were very helpful and caring. One woman at the front desk

We stayed in a 2 bedroom, 2 bathroom suite on the second floor of this hotel. Rooms were very comfortable, fairly quiet and clean. The breakfast was good. There is a small "convenience" store attached to the lobby registration which sell basic snacks and small items such as toiletries, postcards and souvenirs. Staff was friendly. The pool area looked nice but we didn't take advantage of it. We had 5 in our group, 2 adults and 3 teenagers so there was lots of room for everyone. It was nice that there were TV's in every room also. The kitchen area looked great but we did not use it. I would recommend this hotel. The only downfall would be that it isn't really close to Disney parks and so there isn't alot of restaurants around the area.

Summary Heading: A great hotel for the price
Summary: We stayed here for 7 nights which was booked through Virgin holidays,  We had a double 1 bed suite on the third floor.  The room was lovely and clean and away from the lift area, so was also nice and quite.  The receiption staff were extremely helpful, breakfast was excellent and the pool area lovely and clean, with lots of sunbeds available..  The hotel is very close to the I5, but we didn't hear any traffic noise.  Great location for getting around and about.  Visitied Disney 3 days, LA/Hollywood, Warner Brothers and the beaches,

Summary Heading: Excellent choice just wish it were a bit closer
Summary: I was in town for a convention at the Anaheim convention center in late August.  Upon arrival the front desk person was very friendly and courteous.  We arrived very early (1230p check in is posted at 4), so weren't sure if it was possible to check in yet but she checked anyway.  Unfortunately it was not, however she did inform me that because of my platinum Priority Club status they had upgraded us to a larger room.  My friend and I decided to walk down to the Garden Walk which was about 10-15 mins or so away.  The walk is pretty easy and probably pretty safe to do during the day, however I wouldn't recommend it to anyone with families or traveling alone at night.  We arrived back at the hotel around 330p and were given our room keys for the 3 night stay.  Wow.  Lots of room in

We stayed here for 5 days when we took  a vacation to Disneyland.  The rooms were clean and large with full sized kitchens.  The hotel breakfast area is large and their breakfasts are very nice.  They offer an evening meal one day a week and evening "snack" 2 other nights.   I would definatly stay here again.  The pool is shared with the neighboring hotel, but is large and was never crowded.

Summary Heading: Great Place to Stay Close to Disney
Summary: This was a great place to stay!  It is one of Disney's Good Neighbor Hotels.  It is right next door to Holiday Inn and we shared the shuttle bus stop to Disney.  It's more economical to buy a one day pass than one way tickets for the shuttle.  Seemed to be a long wait to and from the park though.    The room was very spacious.  The first night, we had a queen studio and the second night we had a two bedroom, two bath.  I found the kitchenette to be very nice, especially when you have leftovers from the restaurants.  We ate at Bubba Gump's Shrimp (very good!) and P.F. Chang's.  The breakfast was very nice with eggs, bacon, sausage, cereals, fruit, pastries, yogurt, etc.  We did not use the pool, but it looked very nice!

We decided to take a trip to Disneyland, last minute. We live in Vegas. I called 2 days before, got a room, at a great price, just like that !  We have stayed at Staybridge now 9 times. Every time is a great experience !  We always have a room with a nice view, check in has always been easy, (even letting us check in early ! ), and the crowning glory for us has always been the FREE Buffet Breakfast ! With 3 sons in tow, ages 16, 14, and 9, having this available to us has been a god send ! Boys eat A LOT !!!  :)  We love the pool, and the hot tub, it is always relaxing. The rooms are clean, and stocked with towels. Any time we have ever called the front desk to ask for anything, they have been there to help. This is now the ONLY Hotel we will stay at ! Like I said, WE LOVE THIS

Summary Heading: Close to Disney, free breakfast and laundry
Summary: Good hotel for traveling families visiting the Anaheim (Disney) area.  Rooms not large, kids must sleep on pull-out sofa.  Is a mini-kitchen in the room that is nice.  Daily complementary breakfasts are very good, however breakfast starts at 7:30 on weekends ... Disney opens at 8:00 - don't understand why they start so late.  Biggest perk is free use of washers and dryers in the fitness center, very nice.  Be warned that the local bus service that stops at the hotel is very inconsistent, we waited 30-45 minutes for buses to and from Disney.  Also no WIFI.

Summary Heading: Big Room, very close to Disney
Summary: This is a nice hotel locate very close to Disney Resort. There is a large car park, free laundry, free interent access in the business centre, a nice swimming pool area, a free gym AND free breakfast...  Breakfast consists of two hot items (normally Scrambled Eggs and Bacon), Waffles, Fruit, Bread, Cereal.  The room we were given was very big, it had a large kitchen/dining area, a living area (sofa and TV), a seperate bedroom and a large bathroom.  Very  pleasent stay, would stay here for Disney again however it was quite a long way from other LA attractions (Universal/Hollywood etc)

I cashed in some priority reward points to spend 3 nights here.  Given that it was free, we felt lucky to be at a relatively nice hotel reasonably close to Disneyland.  I'm used to staying at Holiday Inn Express for business, and while it's far from a luxury chain, I always feel as if I've gotten more than I paid for when I stay.  This was our first stay outside of the park at Disneyland (normally Disneyland Hotel or Paradise Pier) and I did not expect the same level of "specialness."  I did think it would be similar to Holiday Inn Express.     In contrast to Holiday Inn Express, I found this hotel disappointing.  The breakfast was nothing special, in my opinion, and that surprised me given the positive reviews on this site.  The bacon was very thin and fatty, the eggs were

My family and I stayed at Staybridge Suites for three nights while taking a family trip to Disneyland and we were very happy with our overall stay. The breakfast every morning was perfect for our family with kids ages 8, 7 and 5. The kids made good use of the nice pool area as the pool was heated. My wife and I enjoyed the free beverages(beer/wine) from 5:30 to 7:30 Tuesday thru Thursday evenings.  We caught the shuttle to Disneyland every morning without having to wait too long. We needed some extra blankets and towels and the service was great as we got them right away. We had a King suite with a sofa bed and the room was clean and the King bed was very comfortable. The living room has a tv with a DVD/VCR and the kids were able to watch movies that we brought with us while my

Summary Heading: Decent room, just hope you don't need any service.
Summary: My husband and I stayed at the hotel during our vacation to Disneyland and California Adventure.  Positives about the hotel: nice breakfast each morning including 2 hot options, cereal, bagels, waffles and a variety of beverages which helped to get our morning off to a nice start.  The shuttle stop for Disneyland is in the same parking lot as the hotel.  Sundowner events midweek are a nice treat; nice to enjoy a free beer after a long day at Disneyland before retreating to the room.  Negatives about the hotel: if you need extra assistance be prepared to ask repeatedly and then wait.  Our bathtub was clogged I asked for it to be cleared 3 times before someone came up to take care of it.  While the shuttle stop to Disneyland is centrally located, be prepared to wait for the

Summary Heading: What a great place to relax after busy days at Disneyland
Summary: We stayed at the Staybridge for one week while playing at Disneyland.  Our family of 6 (kids 7,9,12,13)  had a one bedroom suite.  The in-room amenities were great... a large refridgerator with freezer and ice maker, microwave, two burners AND a dish washer made it easy to save some money and have meals in our room.  Pots, pans and dishes were all available in the ample cupboard space where we could store our own food as well.  The free laundry was a big help, no stinky socks in with clean clothes on the way home!  The buffet breakfast every morning was not elaborate, but was just enough to satisfy 6 different appetites.  There were eggs every day, and alternating bacon or sauage, as well as cereal, toast, some fruit, and of course, make your own waffles... Every Wednesday night

Summary Heading: No Non Smoking Rooms, Bad Customer Service
Summary: I have allergies and specifically requested a non smoking room, which I was guaranteed. However, this guarantee was not followed through.  Besides the smell of smoke in our room from the previous occupant, hotel management said there was nothing they could do about the smoke in our room from the neighbors because they were guaranteed a smoking room.  Well, I was guaranteed a non smoking room.  The smoke in the hallway was so bad it you couldn't see halfway down it. The couch in our room had holes in the cushions from a discarded cigarette.  I saw signs all over the floor that designated it as a non smoking floor. I had a migrane the entire time from the smoke.  The hotel staff were not accomodating and unfriendly.  I would not stay here again.  Location: The neighborhood was not

Summary Heading: Hotel comes up short on cleanliness and friendliness.
Summary: Hotel location is not very convenient - far from shopping, groceries, and Disneyland. However, a shuttle bus comes 'regularly' for access to main Anaheim areas. When we arrived at night, after a very long journey, the reception was rude and unfriendly. The kids went straight to bed, but the next morning I discovered the sheets on their bed were DIRTY!!! No apology was made. Also there was a horrible stain on the carpet near the entrance to our room. The positives of this hotel are an excellent complimentary breakfast, free laundry, nice pool, and kitchenette.

We stayed here for our 3 day trip to Disneyland.  The two-bedroom suite was just what we needed for five of us (3 adults, 2 young children).  The best part of all was that even with tons of other families staying there during spring break, we didn't hear a thing in our rooms.  Full kitchen is a plus!    Tried out the pool which was a little chilly and, unfortunately, we were asked to vacate after they found a little package in the pool.  Never saw it drained so I'm hoping they shocked the heck out of it for the next guests. No chance to use the gym or game room.  The breakfast each morning was nice.  Again, with a ton of families there, the hotel always had enough eats to go around.  The location is a little off the beaten path so we just drove to Disneyland each day.  I think

Summary Heading: Be willing to make your own beds.
Summary: A nice atmosphere in and outside the hotel, with the added benefit of a free laundry. The free hot breakfast every morning was nice!! Getting towels was a joke..we were 5 and constantly got towels for 3, and most of the time we had to ask for them. Our beds would be unmade late into the afternoon (5 P.M.) Usually had to call for our beds to be done. I gave up and made them myself. If you stay for several days they do not vacuum. They "make beds & give out towels" if you're lucky. I put our trash in the hallway one night, there was so much and they hadn't taken it.

We stayed at this hotel on 3/30 & 31, 2009 and we thought it was great.  There were six of us, two adults, two teens, and two kids. We had the one room suite and it was perfectly fine. It was priced better than the regular hotels in the area and although it's a little bit of a ways from Disneyland the shuttle is well priced and pretty reliable. And if you miss your bus, there's usually a limo man out in front of the Holiday Inn next door looking to make a quick 10 bucks to give you a ride. The kids loved that! The breakfast is free and well stocked. It really helped us out with four kids. The Kitchen came in handy for us to keep drinks and lunch stuff. I just thought it was the best deal for a clean place. It's truly great for families. I had no problems. We will stay again next

Management is the WORST!  They charged me $584 for uncancelled reservations, even though I did cancel them.  They refused to reverse the charge and referred me to national Guest Relations.  The national office said they would call the hotel to discuss it, and the hotel would get back to me within 48 hours (which is their policy).  Nothing happened within 48 hours. . . . So I call Guest Relations back and tell them I never heard back, and they said they would contact the hotel again.  Nothing. . . .  So I call Guest Relations a third time and they said the hotel is standing by their decision, but sorry that they didn't get back to you.  So now I have to fight it out with the hotel through the credit card company.     I'm obviously not the only one who has experienced the lack of

Check-in was fast and there were luggage trolleys available for us to cart our stuff upstairs. The suite was clean and attractive. However, the "full" kitchen doesn't include an oven. Just a stove top and microwave. Our television, refrigerator and dishwasher were all on the fritz. However, maintenance was at our door within minutes of notifying the front desk and fixed everything.   The staff were all friendly and efficient.  There are only 3 washers and 3 dryers in the hotel so expect a wait if you want to do a load of laundry in the evenings. I put my laundry in one morning meaning to dry it and collect if before leaving for Disney but forgot it and it wasn't there when I went back for it in the evening. Finally located it next day. Housekeeping had placed it (wet) in a bag

The Hotel has a good breakfast. Complete including fruits, yogurts, juices, egg, bacon, toast, pancakes ... The location is very nice and I enjoyed the stay. The room is complete, with refrigerator and microwave. Perfect to stay with child or even a couple.  There are some Shopping Malls nearby.  The staffs are very nice people.   There's an inconvenience : if you go to Universal Hollywood you will take more than 1,5 hour because LA has a huge traffic. So if you intend to visit Universal Holywood Park be prepared to make a trip from Anaheim to LA.

We came and stayed for a week. It started out fine with very few people at the beginning of the week, but there was a Cheerleader competition over the last weeked so it got crazy busy during the breakfast buffet with no place to sit and the food staff not being able to keep up. Overall the hotel worked out just fine though and would recommend it. The catch... The Anahiem transit was a whole other story though. Again, at the beginning of the week it was OK and we caught the bus within 1/2 hr each time. Starting Wednesday though, some groups had arrived for the competition and at the end of the day they were trying to get on the same bus as everyone with small children. There was not enough room by half so many had to wait 1/2 hour for the next run. Note to those who bring groups

We have stayed at this hotel several time, and this may be our last.  We stayed in a two bedroom suite and that worked out great.  We were there with my parents, my two kids and my husband and myself.  It was very nice having a full kitchen so we could make our lunches to take to Disneyland.  One night we even made dinner in the room.  That saved us a bundle not having to eat at the park for all of our meals.  Before we left to go on our trip, I noticed that the price of our room went down by almost $50 a night.  When I contacted the hotel, the did not want to do a price adjustment.  After several calls to them (because they never called me back), they finally said they would give me 1/2 of the difference.  I thought that was fine, but they were not very nice about it.  The

If you're looking for a good solid family hotel, a bit away from the hustle and bustle, but still close enough to see the fireworks, this is a good hotel.  Nice big pool, friendly staff, kitchens in the rooms, and a good "budget hotel' breakfast.  You'll need to drive to Disneyland or sign up for the low cost shuttle.  Make sure you go to a larger supermarket before you get there, if your cooking, as there are no close by markets.  The nearest one is quite scary, with no real food, quite dirty, and mostly empty with a beer focus.  Ask for a high room on the side away from the freeway, with a view of the fireworks.  We would stay again.  Good value if you book ahead, and prepay.

Summary Heading: Very helpful staff and a great breakfast buffet
Summary: I searched for the best priced hotel near Disneyland that had a shuttle and a separate room for my two kids so everyone could get a good night sleep.  We found an amazing deal for a one bedroom suite at $115 a night, which included a breakfast buffet with everything you can think of, even make your own waffles!    The staff was very helpful and even called Disneyland for me to check about rollercoaster closures and firework cancellations due to rain.  The Holiday Inn next door is where you pick up the shuttle for Disneyland costing $3 per adult and $1 per kid (includes the ride back).  We, however, ran into a limo driver while we were waiting for the shuttle who offered to drive us there for $10 so we gave our kids a special treat.  The bed was comfortable - although my daughter

Summary Heading: Family friendly, room had kitchen and large bathroom
Summary: Showed up on a Wednesday and told they were having free beer and wine with thier free BBQ dinner. Also, the room was pretty good. I don't generally write reviews, but they deserve it. I think this is my new hotel of choice in the Anaheim (disneyland) area.  * Great central air unit (you choose the temp instant change) * Large Bathroom  * Kitchen was so handy for preparing bottles for our baby * Apartment feel (Seperate bedroom and living room w/ TV's) * Pool and Jacuzzi's * 24 hour snack shop (kinda expensive) * games for kids at the check in desk (connect 4, monopoly, etc) That should sum it up. Have a fun trip.

Summary Heading: Great Experience at the Staybridge Suites, Anaheim!
Summary: I reserved our hotel room at the Staybridge Suites via the hotel chain's (800) number as I was redeeming some Priority Club points for one of the days of our stay.  Without any prompting, the person taking my reservation suggested that I ask for an upgraded room on checking in.  We were going to be there for two nights while visiting Disneyland.  On the afternoon of the first day, I left the family at Disneyland to check in early enough to see if I could get an upgraded room.  Sure enough, the staff found me a one-bedroom suite to substitute for our Queen studio suite (at the same rate).  When I called for extra blankets, towels, and sheets, they arrive within 10 minutes.  The room itself was well appointed with a Queen bed, a Queen sofa/sleeper, a full kitchen, a full-sized

Summary Heading: OK so long as you don't have a problem..
Summary: Just returned from our trip in which we spent 8 nights at the Staybridge Suites.   The staff are friendly and accommodating through the check procedure and we used room service once which was quick and efficient.   There were 4 of us, two young children, my wife and me.  The room was a good size and we found it fine for what we wanted.   The hotel is a quick drive into Disney but you are certainly not walking there.   The breakfasts provided where great, although unless the hotel is really quiet getting a table is problem.  There seem ratio of 1 seat to 4 guests so be prepared to push and shove to get seated, don’t be polite or you’ll stand there all day!  If you have a problem you are on your own.  When I checked it I made sure that the person checking me knew I wanted to use

Summary Heading: meh...  not bad, but a little far
Summary: I booked our trip to Disneyland through the disneyland.com website (thus its own travel agency).  It was implied that this hotel was close to the resort (it is not).  Similar to a Residence In,, the Staybridge hotel is not quite as upscale.  The room is self-sufficient enough (medium-sized fridge), a two-burner electric stove, a dishwasher and microwave.  The breakfast is okay - but after 2 days of the same institutional food (probably Sysco) I started to reminisce about college.    The very nice aspect of this hotel is the free laundry (detergent is $1 for a load) - which has industrial dryers (awesome).    This hotel is as close as you can get to Interstate 5 - so the hum of the highway is constant white-noise.  Unfortunately by morning rush-hour, this becomes quite annoying.

Summary Heading: Best Hotel Near Disneyland for Families
Summary: Best place to stay for families! We stay here every year the week between Christmas and New Year. It is myself, my partner and our four children, ranging now from 11 to 14. There is always plenty of room and lots of space to put clothes, we pack ALOT!  We always get the 2bdrm, 2bath suite and have stayed there with my in laws as well... making it 8 people! It was perfect size, we were never under each others feet. There are a lot of amenities, breakfast, evening snacks, and if you like to cook on vacation, there is full kitchen in the room. the art bus to Disneyland is a bit tedious at times, but after staying at the hotels withing walking distance a few times, the staybridge is worth the extra 10 minutes to the park. Rooms have always been clean, quiete, any problems that have

Stayed here for 4 nights while visiting Anaheim.  Hotel room was great had a fantastic kitchen with large fride and dishwasher and microwave - everything you need if you want to cook and be selfsufficient.  Also had bbqs outside that were available for use if required. Complimentary breakfast that ran for 3 hours was huge and such a great array of choices!  Also the complimentary drinks and nibbles and hotdogs and burgers at night were great - gave the guests a chance to mingle and exchange stories of their day. Free internet acces was great and also the free use of washing machines and driers was much appreciated after some time travelling and "washing as you go". I will be back here if I ever return to Anaheim ps disneyland about 20 min walk but buses leave frequently from

We spent 6 nights at Staybridge Anaheim in late September. Being myself, partner and my two stepchildren, boys of 11 & 13. We had a two bedroom suite, which was great, in regards to space and privacy for us. This property is very family orientated, and that is particularly obvious each morning at breakfast, with families filling the breakfast area, at peak times its a little hard to find a table.  Which is fine as we were on a family holiday, but if holidaying without children I do no think I'd choose to stay here. We had no issues at all and would stay again. The pool was nice, the service good, the room clean, the room service good, reception helpful though under staffed at times. It has a small basketball court, so between the pool and this the boys were occupied whilst we

We booked 3 nights at the Staybridge suites through the Holiday Inn website and had a 1 bedroom suite. We were on the third floor and the room was well appointed and had plenty of space to spread out. It was great having a small kitchen with fridge and microwave, it even had a dishwasher.  The complementary buffet breakfast had a great selection including 2 hot dishes each day.  We also enjoyed the complementary beer and wine on the Wednesday night. The hotel also has a free laundry room with 4 washers and 4 dryers which was great.  We also made use of the pool.  Even though this is shared with the Holiday Inn there was plenty of room and loungers.  Although Staybridge Suites isn't within walking distance to Disney this didn't worry us as we took the car each day and Staybridge

I took my family of me, my husband and our three children around north america and while on that trip we went to disneyland! We needed somewhere that was close to disneyland and the website of Staybridge Suites said it was - sadly when we got there we found it was a 10 minute bus ride to disneyland. On the bright side breakfast was complimentary and had a good selection. It did not have a pool  but there is one at the hotel right next door which is owned by the same people who own Staybridge Suites. Overall it was a good place to have our  first four nights because we were not all in the same room which was helpful for giving everyone a good nights sleep after a 12 hour plane ride! I would would recomend it to families because you get complimentary breakfast and there are

My Travel Agent booked me into another hotel originally but when I saw the reviews here and saw that I could book here as part of my package I was very pleased and looking forward to my stay.   We stayed 6 nights and I was not disappointed. The reception staff was really helpful and responded cheerfully to any questions I had and also to those of my children. They put me in a downstairs suite with easy access to the pool when they saw that I was lugging 4 suitcases and traveling on my own with 3 children.   On the 1st night we went to the little kiosk adjoining reception  and found they had just the right amount of snack variety there to please my restaurant weary children (we were in our 4th week traveling) . A chicken pot pie, a cup of noodles,2 micorwave pizza snacks and a

We booked the Staybridge suites through the Holiday Inn website for $102 for 3 nights  in late August.  The front desk clerk gave us a complimentary upgrade to a one bedroom suite for being priority club members.  We had room 706 and we could watch the Disney fireworks everynight.  There is a nice large pool shared with the Holiday Inn next door.   The hotel also has a free laundry room (4 washers, 4 dryers) which was great.  There are free computers to use right off of the breakfast room.  And they offer free parking.  I ordered room service for my son a couple of nights.  The service was prompt and efficient.  They don't have kids meals on the room service menu but when I called room service and asked they brought a kids menu to my room within a few minutes.  The food was ok

Nicely located, the hotel was holding a BBQ on our arrival night (Wednesday). Nice pool and basketball court (bring your own ball, though).  Our room had a 'full kitchen' : stovetop, fridge/freezer, dishwasher, cutlery, plates, pots, etc. which was very conveninent.  Buffet breakfast  was good and plentiful. Make-your-own-waffles was very popular, and besides the classics (donuts, cereal, etc.), they had scrambled eggs and sausages.

I work in a travel agents and after showing one of my customers a recent review of this hotel I felt that I just had to write my own.    My family and I stayed at this hotel for the first two weeks in August,2008 and it was fully booked. Yes, there were loads of people around at breakfast and the odd spillage is inevitable but we never had to wait more than a couple of minutes to get a table, we even sat outside somedays in the garden which was very nice. There were some very rude, loud, obnoxious people who came down to breakfast at 9.30am (closing time) and demanded that they should be allowed to get their breakfast and then complained when the staff were unable to re-stock the items. The breakfast was very good and if you get bored of the same stuff every day (waffles,

Summary Heading: The Best family Hotel. Excellent, Excellent.
Summary: The location and the staff were amazing and as for the rooms and service, fanastic. We booked a one bedroom suite and it felt like a apartment. Full size kitcken, lounge area and separate bathroom. each morning there was a full buffett breakfast with so many choices. They do happy hours on couple of nights, free beer, wine and soft drinks and also a free Bar B Que night. Talk about saving the family money. I would not stay anywhere else.

I loved every bit of the Staybridge suites! Its great for going to disneyland because theres a shuttle bus to it every 20 minutes. You can also book your disneyland tickets at reception. There is a small shop for essentials. Beds VERY comfortable!! Pool great! I would stay there again!

Summary Heading: The worst hotel we have ever stayed at!  Dont believe what you read here!!
Summary: Please do not read all the great reviews for this place.  My family and I are still at the hotel finishing our 4 day visit to Disneyland and cannot wait to leave this horrible hotel!  We stayed because of all the wonderful reviews on this site.  Either they are all liers or they do not expect much from a hotel because nothing is good here.  Let me list the pros and cons:  pro: close to the Disney park, free breakfast daily  cons: the breakfast sucks and you have to fight the entire hotel for every bite.  They just run in, cut you off in line and good luck getting anything.  We have had to make our own beds every single day of our stay, reuse wet towels and use our own bags for trashbags and take it out too.  We call daily and they practically call us liers for calling and

Summary Heading: Good place to stay for Disney
Summary: This is your typical Staybridge Suite - generous well equipped accommodation.  The pool area (which is shared with the next door Holiday Inn - which was never a problem) was very nice with a good hot tub and pool bar,    Tea and coffee is available free all day in the hotel.  The American Brasserie next door was a good place to unwind - we ate there once and had a drink or two most nights before wandering to find a restaurant.  The breakfast is fine - not our sort of thing - it's a real bun fight with people jostling each other to get at the food.  As a result it can be a mess with kids dropping food and syrup all over the hotel as they take stuff back upstairs.    This isn't the hotels fault - it's the guests.  Some people were stripping the breakfast to take food and drinks

This hotel was to say "super" the reception staff where so welcoming . The suites where superb everything and more the place was spotlesss and even the washing machines and dryers where good. The breakfast was excellent the boys ate and ate and are now profeshional waffel makers.mmmmmmmmm. and the choice was fantastic the fruit and pastries.Would have no hesitation of going back great value for money and gets a 10/10.

Our stay was a family reunion.  The bedroom setup was great, and two bathrooms.  We were able to sleep 7 of us comfortably.  The breakfast was great.  There was something to eat for everyone.  The laundry was free which was a plus from trying to collect enought quarters for the washer and dryer.  Room service was offered from the place next door for those tired travelers.  Pool was great.  Hotel clean and well kept.  I would stay there again.

Summary Heading: Going to stay there for the second time
Summary: I thought this hotel was amazing.  We just booked our second trip to Disneyland and staying at the Staybridge was one of our stipulations!!!  Basically we booked our holiday around the time that we could get a room there, thats how much we enjoyed our stay.  The staff was great, informative and helpful.  The rooms were cleaned everyday and a nice little note was always left by the cleaning lady.   I made sure I left one for her the day we checked out and I hope that she got it.  I guess it all depends on the time of year that you go as far as how busy it is.  But one would think that Christmas time would be super busy but as far as the hotel and pool area goes it may have been booked solid but the noise and pool area were never that bad.  After a long day at

My husband and I stayed at the Staybridge Suites in June 2008. We had a one bedroom suite with a king sized bed and bath in one room and a room with another tv and sofa and chairs (etc.) and kitchen in the other.  Extremely comfortable bed and very quiet.  We were facing the basketball courts.  The free breakfast every morning was wonderful.  Waffles-pastries-bagels-eggs-etc.  Everything you need.  The people at the front desk were wonderful too.  Friendly and helpful.  Ryan was extra special-very informative and out going-a great asset to the hotel.  We took the bus to Disney 3 days in a row-the only way to go-much cheaper and quicker than driving own car.  Free parking at the hotel. Only bad experience-the restaurant next door-The American Brassiere-awful awful food-and we

Summary Heading: Overall Good Value for a Family Stay
Summary: We stayed at the Staybridge Suites with our two boys aged 6 and 8 for 6 nights for Disney visit. I cottoned onto them as I had stayed at other Staybridge Suites when travelling for business and thought it would be great for kids.   We arrived late and were greeted by a  friendly receptionist. Once in the room my first impression was that it was small (it was a one bedroom suite). My priority was to check email as I run my own business in Australia. I plugged in and it didnt work. Went down to reception for replacement cable and was told they were all out and maybe tomorrow someone would checkout and return a Cat5 cable. I opted for business centre and got my emails there - no drama. A little more concern or care would have been nice.  Breakfast was ordinary. Got Internet sorted

We had stayed at a Staybridge Suites in Rancho Bernardo last year and liked the hotel and its many amenities.  When our 11-year old granddaughter made her first solo trip this year, we decided to book a two-bedroom suite at the Anaheim resort for a week.  We toured Disneyland, California Adventure, Knott's Berry Farm, Soak City, Hollywood, and Catalina, and the hotel was close to everything.      We were favorably impressed with nearly all aspects of the hotel.  The suite had a living area, kitchen (with dish washer and detergent!), two bedrooms, two bathrooms, and three televisions.  The beds were very comfortable.  There were many free services, including a good breakfast buffet (with different breads, cereals, make your own waffles, fruit, eggs, and either bacon or sausage),

We booked a 5 day "whirlwind" trip to the Anaheim area about a week ago through Funjet.  It was the first really big trip we had taken as a family (myself, my husband, and his 3 kids, ages 15, 14, and 10), so price and value were major considerations.  I love Disneyland, and was aware that the attractions portion of our trip  would be monetarily epic, so we sought a hotel that wouldn't completely break the bank.    I was apprehensive at first, due to some of the negative reviews on Tripadvisor about the Staybridge, but it turns out I shouldn't have been!  This was an extremely decent place.  The rooms were large, clean, and attractive.  The suite that we booked had two bedrooms and two bathrooms, which was an absolute must for traveling with 3 kids.  It also had a full kitchen,

We couldn't have been happier!  6 of us stayed in a suite which included a full kitchen (with dishwasher, microwave, full sized fridge, and stove top). The large secluded grounds and garden for kids to play outside off of the street front also includes a basketball court where my kids met many new friends. The pool area is clean and close, and 24hr free laundry service was incredibly useful when we were coming in late from trips to Disney and shows in the area. Some reviews complained about the fact that the transit system and restaurant are next door, but it's really just across the parking lot and very convenient. The free breakfast was phenomenal with lots of fresh fruits, hot choices, and something for everyone. We appreciated the "light touch" cleaning service, as we're

Summary Heading: Nice place to stay to visit DL
Summary: We have stayed there for "mom & Kids disney fun" trip.  I took my 5-yr-old daughter and my friend took her 6-yr-old daughter and 10-months-old boy.  We stayed in their 2-bedroom suite, and loved it.  Our children loved it, too.  They visited each other's bedrooms, tried to make it like a sleep over, took eachother's care as if they were living together.  It was PERFECT!!  It comes with nice kitchen/dining area and small living room space.  They even provide the direct line phone number so that our husbands could call us without going through the front desk.    Stayed there for 4 nights.  Absolutely loved it.  Will stay there again!

great place to stay      (the good) clean nice room comfy bed great free breakfast cant beat free things like waffle,bacon,eggs,milk,juice,coffee,lots of other things. place to sit and eat breakfast , trust me thats a plus you dont get at to many places bar-b-q outside free of charge free parking they leave high chairs in the dinning area so if you have a child that needs one you can bring it to your room to use.   ( the bad) too far from disney to walk pool is shared with hotel next door big pool but still shared no b-balls to loan out for court free way outside in front had room on that side but I did not here though  this is a decent hotel to stay at and breakfast is a money  saver for the  whole  familey I would stay again.  for $150

We arrived early...8:30 am...thought we would just drop off our luggage, but they let us check in!!  Very nice.  Front desk staff was great, very friendly and helpful.  Loved all the extras about this hotel.  Breakfast was wonderful, huge variety so everyone was full and happy before heading to the park.  Came back for the hotels BBQ night, it felt like a big treat to get a free dinner!  Rooms were clean and comfortable, we got clean towels and beds made everyday but wish the floor would have been vacuumed at least once.  They may have done so if we had asked for it...  The free washers and dryers were really nice when you could use them, they were usually full!  We rode the ART shuttle to and from the park everyday which required a little waiting around but wasn't a big deal.

Summary Heading: A well worn property but they do what they can.
Summary: We stayed here for five nights at the end of March and it was a decent stay but had it's share of problems.  First off, as far as it being a family friendly place, I have to disagree with that observation somewhat at least on the weekdays.  Staybridge  offers free beer and wine during their evening reception and you'd be amazed at how many people (mostly men) make sure they're back at the hotel in the late afternoon to take advantage of this freebie.  They begin drinking as soon as it starts and continue all the way through the free happy hours.  Towards the end of this free dispensement of liquor the area resembles a sports bar with obviously drunk guests roaming throughout the lounge and spewing all of the vulgarities that go along with that type of scene.  Not exactly my

Stayed for two weeks in March. Nice hotel, very large rooms, kitchen facilities a bonus. This place is well managed, everything was as it should be. Public areas clean and well presented, staff efficient and helpful when approached. Rooms cleaned every day and a big clean once a week, cleaning staff were unobtrusive and efficient. Restaurant (in the adjoining Holiday inn) has good bar and restaurant, pool table. Breakfast was big on quantity but in keeping with local tradition was quantity over substance, but more than acceptable. Pool area was good but can get busy. You will need a car ( free big car park) but the bus is cheap and good goes all around the tourist bits for $3 a day. Top shopping, The Block @ Orange, top day, the beaches. Top tip, SoCAL resident card holders get

My family had a great time at this hotel. We stayed for 5 nights and overall were very pleased.  The good things about the hotel include - family friendly, amazingly large breakfast with great variety of items, full kitchen in the room with pots, pans, plates, cups, etc., nice size outside pool and jacuzzi, close to theme parks (with a shuttle stop right nearby), well kept up rooms, free laundry room for guests to use, free light snacks and drinks a few nights per week, including hamburgers and hot dogs one night.  A few things that weren't so great include - rooms are a bit cramped (we had 8 people in the two bedroom suite and it was a bit crowded and if you have anyone other than little children on the sofa bed, forget about it), sound proofing was poor (we heard people on

Recently stayed for 6 nights at this hotel.  Front desk staff was very helpful and pleasant to deal with.  As others have mentioned, this hotel is somewhat out of the way from shopping and the theme parks, but the ART shuttle makes it easy to get to and from Disney.  Although the shuttle is supposed to run every 20 minutes, there are times when it is closer to 30-40 minutes between runs.  Breakfast choices are the same every day, but the food quality is good.  Did not have a chance to use the pool or jacuzzi, but they looked very nice.  Overall, of the 3 hotels that I have stayed at in this area, I would rank this #1 and can recommend it.  I would return here again in the future.

I had the pleasure of staying at Staybridge suites in anaheim recently when I took my son to Disneyland.  Once I arrived I realized that my check in wasn't until 4pm and I had arrived at 2:30pm. A very friendly host named Reyna accommadated me and my family anyway with a early check in. My reservation was for a studio suite. To my surprise when I got to the room it was equipped with a queen size bed, a queen pull out sofa, full size fridge, range, dishwasher, and sink. All the cabinents were stocked with dishes and the drawers with utensil. the room had a full size coffee maker and mircowave. The room was immaculate and the spacious. This hotel has a free continental breakfast every morning from 6:30am to 9:30am. (which is good if you are a traveler on a budget!) They have

Great place to stay.  you really need to have a car though as it's out of the main area of Disney etc.  Very good breakfast although the hot food was the same every day but good food, nonetheless.  Free laundry was a bonus as there were 5 of us and stayed for a week.  Only downside really was the room cleaning which was only done a few times during the week -would have preferred every day. On the whole though, a good hotel with friendly staff.

We stayed here for 7 nights the first week of March and overall, we were very pleased.  The complimentary breakfast was a huge plus, lots of variety and very courteous staff who kept everything well stocked.  We never had any trouble getting a table for breakfast.  Our suite was nice and clean and we appreciated having a separate bedroom from our teenage son.  We had one small issue with the showerhead and it was quickly replaced the same day with a brand new one...very impressed.  We did not utilize the kitchen too much, mostly because of our own busy schedule, but it was was stocked with all the utensils, pots and dishes you would need to prepare and serve a meal.      The pool was adequate but my husband was disappointed by the luke warm temp of the hot tub.  Having free

Ok...we actually stayed in the staybridge over the Christmas holiday.  Many of the staff may remember us as the family who were carted to the hospital in the middle of the night by ambulance.  There was a nice little virus we caught that sort of infringed on our vacation together.  Through this all, the Staybridge was a wonderful, hospitable home away from home over Christmas.    The rooms were terrific, the food was better then we could probably get anywhere for a breakfast buffet.  I know there are a lot of people who wrote otherwise, but I think there expecations a little far stretched.  The shuttle to Disneyland was always on time, with the exception of Christmas Eve and Day...there were a little longer waits and large greyhounds called in for those days.  But ya

Room was good, but location average if you didn't have a car. We walked for 40mins with 3 kids on first night to find some food (after being told it was just up the road). Hotel staff were pleasant and helpful during the day, but the night staff are the opposite. Pool is ok, but spa/hot tub is small considering it is shared between this hotel and Holiday Inn. Breakfast was a major disappointment. If you can manage to find a table - very small dining area for the size of the hotel and they provide polystyrene/plastic plates. We have stayed elsewhere in Anaheim and very disappointed we chose this hotel - will not be returning.

My family and I (2 adults, 2 kids) stayed here at the end of January. The 2 bedroom suite exceeded our expectations with 2 bedrooms, 3 TV's, 2 bathrooms and a great kitchen facility. The staff were all friendly and helpful. Breakfast every morning was awesome as were the free drinks and snacks during the week. Only minor downside is it isn't within walking distance to Disneyland etc, however the ART system worked well for us. Kids enjoyed the basketball court and pool. We made use of the computer room and free guest laundry. All in all highly recommended!

Comfortable, clean,  family friendly hotel.  Although on business, I did not feel out of place.  Recommend a car as this hotel is not right in the touristy area of Anaheim/Disney.  Although near the highway, I never encountered any noise.  The added evening drinks/food offered a few days a week is a nice touch.  Also a short distance from the stadium.  I would definately return.

Summary Heading: About as good as it gets for the area
Summary: We have stayed all over in the Anaheim area and this is one of the better places we have stayed. The rooms are big and we prefer the apartment style suites.   We had the two bedroom/two bath.   Everything was well equipped but could have been cleaner.   I am not really fond of the light housekeeping and none at all except by special request on the weekend.   I think there is none at all on Sundays.   There were stains from spills on the walls. The pool and hot tub area is huge and very nice with showers and bathrooms, shared with the holiday inn but was not busy while we were there. Food is fine.   They were a little late getting it out each time.   Nothing until I think 730 on the weekends which doesn't work out with park opening. Lots of parking and easy drive to the park.

WE stayed for 7 nights at the Staybridge Suites in november.  It was our first overseas trip and provided a terrific first experience.  The room was quite large and it was great to have a seperate room for the kids.  The kitchenette was useful, although not really suitable for cooking, but great for getting lunch ready to take out etc.  We always seemed to be back for the day when housekeeping came around and so chose not have it done.  When it was done however it was to high standard.  One very minor thing was that there wasn't really anywhere to get rid of nappies.  It was a bit annoying if you wanted to stay in the room for breakfast or something, otherwise you were suposed to leave them in the room to be cleaned by housekeeping.  Anyway good stay, a little far from

Summary Heading: Decent Hotel at Affordable Price and Near Disney
Summary: My family of four stayed at the Staybridge during our recent visit to Disneyland for the Thanksgiving weekend. Let me start by saying  if you expect five star service, you won't get it. (What do you expect for about $150/night? Four Seasons? The Ritz?)  Now that I have reset your expectation, let me tell you why I think Staybridge is worth the value. First, it is in close proximity (appr. 1- 1 1/2 miles away from Disney proper) to the Disney theme parks. Second, it's easy entry/exit of major freeways. Third, the lobby, hallways and the room are up to date and pleasant. The suite (we reserved a one-bedroom) was adequate for a family of four. It comes with a small kitchen, living area and a separate sleeping and bathroom quarters. Fourth, the room well is insulated from outside

This will be a little long.....but worth the read...  My mother and I traveled to CA for my nieces graduation from June 13-17th. Before we booked I read tons of reviews on hotels. This one didnt have the greatest reviews, yet it had a lot to offer so we chose Staybridge. I included a link with pics for a more positive look at the hotel.  ARRIVAL - Rented a car and parking was not a problem and also FREE (my brother stayed at another hotel where they had to pay per hour for parking). Which meant we also had to pay if we visited his hotel. Check in was easy. Room wasnt ready but they locked our luggage up until our room was ready. In the mean time we hung out at the pool.   ROOM - We had a standard one full/queen w pull out couch room. They had the most comfortable beds with

Our party of 8 recently stayed at the Staybridge.  Our main reason for choosing this hotel was having a separate bedroom to put our children to bed in at night, so that the adults could still stay up and visit.  Upon reserving this room, I had stressed the importance of being nearby the room of the other family we were travelling with.  Their son was babysitting and needed to go back and forth between our two rooms.  Their room was on the 2nd floor and we were on the 4th floor.   Our stay was 12 days long and Front Desk staff were totally unsympathetic and refused to move as to a different room when one became available. Overall, our stay was o.k.  Our room size wasn't large but it was comfortable for 2 adults and 2 children.  There was some staining on the bedroom door that

We booked this hotel along with our others, through UA.   It was a 5 night stop-over stay as we were then travelling onto Hawiia for 20 nights then onto San Francisco for another 5 nights.  I was very impressed with the Hotel, staff and the size of the suites. I must admit i thought they would be very small, proberbly as this was my first visit to LA. So i was in for a nice suprise.  We were there when the oscars were taking place, so the hotel was fully booked, yet still felt very comfatable and roomy, not overcrowed at all.  Our suite was lovely and clean but i must  have to say the  Kitchen area could have been a little cleaner and a cooker would have helped. When i mentioned at reception that the kictchen area was a little grubby , they were very happy to sort it and also

I stayed here for a few days while on business.  Nice hotel, but it's definitely geared towards guests going to Disneyland, not business travelers.  They do provide free internet access, which is always appreciated.  The rooms are very comfortable and well maintained.  One of my pet peeves about many hotels in this class is the stiff pillows they usually provide, but Staybridge got this one right.  They had very comfortable pillows, and if you like the feel of feather, they stocked a couple of these in the closet.  Also, the towels and linens provided were nicer than most 3 star hotels I've stayed in.  Since this hotel is geared toward longer term guests, they only do a light cleaning every day (towels, trash, bed) and a deep cleaning once a week.  Not really an issue for me,

stayed at the staybridge suites 11th august to the 25th august what a great hotel this is please ignore all the negative reports as they are simpy not true complimentry breakfast was superb to set you on your way to the theme parks etc bistro right next door for evening meals staff friendly and cannot do enough for you would happily stay here again

Summary Heading: A Real Home Away From Home
Summary: My Family and I (two kids ages 14 and 18) stayed 8/22/07 to 8/27/07.  This was  a last minute change as we were supposed to go to the Cancun area.  We booked an entire package with Jet Blue and it turned out to be very nice.  We love this hotel chain as it truly gives you a feeling of home.  We had the two bedroom suite, one bedroom had two beds and the other had a King.  Both had their own bathrooms as well.  We had 3 TVs and an almost full kitchen (no oven).  There is a dining area and a living room with a pull-out sleeper (which we didn't need).  This is the second Staybridge we have stayed in and I think it is a great setup for  a large group.  Two separate couples could even stay in this one room as they have private bathrooms.  Anaheim houses Disney, of course and we spend

I usually stay here when I have business in the area and it's a great hotel, convenient to the freeway and the staff is usually friendly and helpful.  The rooms are large and the breakfast buffet is great!  You are surrounded by happy little Disney kids which is pretty fun also.  Parking can be iffy but I can always find a spot somewhere and last time I parked right in front.  Great rates, staff, breakfast and location means I'll be back every time and may bring my family also some day!

What a great stay!  I hate to let the secret out of the bag (unless the price stays so reasonable and the waffles stay tasty!)  The only problems we had was that we are "cold sleepers" (70 degrees or colder) and the AC "froze."  They gladly handled it but it was a little wet on the floor as it defrosted so we had to have a "blower/dryer" all the next day before going to bed.  Also, we booked through an agent and had some confusion with our confirmation numbers (seems the hotel and its reservation office assign DIFFERENT CONF #'s when you book???  I would suggest booking with the national reservations--you have to--, then calling the actual hotel a few days later to make certain they have you booked; though it was their error, management did nothing to help us stay for the entire

This was a great place to stay.  There was even free laundry!  The rooms were comfortable and clean.  The beds were nice as well.  There were three rooms, with one main room and two bedrooms on either side.  Each bedroom had a nice bathroom.  The kitchenette and living room area were amply large.  One highlight was the free breakfast.  The waffles every morning were a huge hit.  There was tons of food and most people took some up to their room refrigerators for a late snack.  On Tuesdays-Thursdays they have afternoon happy hour with free drinks and snacks.  The pool was nice with towels available.  This is a bit of a drive to Disney but parking at Disney is $11 and you can leave a return with no extra fee.  This was great.

We stayed at the Staybridge for 8 days in June '07 Mom, Dad & 2 teenagers.  It was great.  Staff was friendly & helpful, the included breakfast was very good, free use of laundry facilities was helpful, we purchased Disney Park-Hooper tickets @ the hotel front desk, pool area was spotless, beds were comfortable, and the hotel itself was very clean.  I think what we liked best was the location.  It's just a couple of miles from Disney, Anaheim Stadium is a couple of miles; Los Angeles is a 45 minute drive; San Diego is  approx. 90 min. drive (depending on traffic).  Yes, we would definitely stay at this hotel again.

We just got back from a four night stay at the Staybridge.  We had a wonderful time.  The staff was very helpful.  We checked in very early with the intent to leave our luggage and head to Disneyland since we figured we would not be able to get a room until later in the afternoon.  I'm not sure what their policy is but, because they did not have the one bedroom suite that I had booked on the internet available at that time they upgraded us to a two bedroom suite at no additional cost.  Very clean and very nice.  Two double beds in one bedroom and a large king size in the other each with their own bathroom.  Had a full kitchen and small living room with sofa sleeper and three tv's total.  Never heard anyone else except for the pool area when we had the windows open.  You can also

We booked two suites for two families of four.  We were very pleased with the spaciousness of the rooms.  The beds are in a separate bedroom and each suite had a separate living area and kitchen.  We found the full-size refrigerator to be helpful for water/soda, snacks, etc.  The breakfast was also very good each morning.  The breakfast includes hot items (eggs, bacon or sausage), waffles, dougnuts, muffins, bagels, english muffins, and toast.  The breakfast can be somewhat crowded, so just bring your patience :).    We actually found the hotel staff to be very helpful and accomodating.  They were very friendly when we checked in and gave us good advice on shopping and restaurants.  They also made sure that our two rooms were next to each other.  The kids enjoyed the pool and

This hotel was mostly as advertised in the reviews. The room was decent, the free breakfast was relatively good, the pool and hot tub were also nice. Overall, a good experience. I would stay here again. I have several children, and this property accommodated quite nicely. However, we did stay in the Homewood Suites last year, which is a little less expensive and is a similar concept, and I would rate that hotel a little better than this one.  The staff was not friendly as other persons have mentioned. I passed this information on to my travel agent, who said they would pass it on the hotel. They initially put me in a smoking room, where I had specifically requested a non-smoking room, and they acted almost offended when I asked them to switch the room for me. They front desk

We stayed at the Staybridge last week, for 5 nights.  We stayed in a 2 bedroom suite, which slept 3 adults and 2 kids.    The property was very nice and well-maintained.  Each suite has it's own kitchen, which makes eating with kids much easier.  Each suite also has it's own living area, and a bedroom area, separated by a door.  We liked the layout, but found it to be cramped ~ this was partly due to our insane amount of luggage, but also the large pieces of furniture in the room itself.  The beds themselves were very comfortable ~ I slept better at the Staybridge than I do in my own bed!  One of the perks that should be mentioned is the awesome free breakfast.  This is not your typical donut and orange juice continental breakfast.  Each day it was a hot breakfast buffet, with

Just returned from 8 nights at the Staybridge in Anaheim on Manchester.  We had a one bedroom suite - other family had a two bedroom.  Everything was absolutely great.  Clean rooms, friendly staff - good service, pool and hot tub lovely and clean.  Breakfasts (included) were great - what more could you ask for than a full breakfast before heading out for the day - each morning offered different hot items - sausage, bacon, eggs, pancakes, and always waffles, plus ample fruit - watermelon,  green melon, apples, bananas - toast, bagels, cream cheese, juices, coffee, etc.  If anything was running low, in  no time, it was replenished.  Afternoon receptions - Tues, Wed, Thurs (included) were a plus.  Travelling with very young grandchildren, we were often back at the hotel

I was impressed with the StayBridge. Wonderful breakfast in the morning and reception in the afternoon. On Wednesday night they had a free BBQ with hamburgers and hot dogs.  We used the ART shuttle and didn't have any problems. Never waited more than 10 minutes for a bus to come and was always able to get on.  The only issue was don't count on the hide-a-bed as a place to sleep. Was very uncomfortable and didn't sleep well at all. Other wise the other beds in the room were great! I would definitely stay here again and recommend it to others!

Summary Heading: ART Shuttle System to Disneyland Bad Experience
Summary: We stayed here last week for our Disneyland vacation. Although we did enjoy our room, I was very disappointed with the Art shuttle system that was supposed to offer shuttles to Disneyland every 20 minutes. The 2 days we used the system, the bus was full twice (we had to wait for the next bus) and what made it really bad is the time we waited over an hour for a shuttle to return us to the hotel. It was 7:30pm and we had been waiting with our 3 and 1 year old after a long day at Disney. A bus came only to tell us we couldn't board because he was going to break. I was very upset. Next time we will stay somewhere walking distance to Disneyland.  They can also use additonal help restocking the breakfast. The one man they have runs himself ragged and we had to wait a long time for our

I have stayed at this location twice in the past.  I am a faithful "Staybridge Suites" fan and try to book rooms there whenever possible.  I usually travel for business and enjoy their standard suites for a little touch of home.  This trip was for a quick vacation in a two bedroom suite with the family and the in-law's.  The size is adequate and are able to have an enjoyable stay without stepping on each others toes.    I would recommend that if you drive to this hotel and are going to Disneyland to go ahead and drive and park in the Disneyland "Mickey & Friends" parking garage.  There is a shuttle to/from the hotel that many packages include vouchers for, but from numerous experiences, I avoid the shuttle at all costs.  First - you never know if there will be enough room on the

Summary Heading: Our stay was not even close to acceptable
Summary: We had booked a 2 bedroom suite for 5 adults and 1 child through a AAA Disney package.  We arrived at this hotel at 11pm on a Thursday night and was informed that they did not have a 2 bedroom suite available on 1 1bedroom suite with a hide a bed sofa.  They advised that we would be moved the following day to a 2 bedroom suite.  After getting into the room, we realized that the sofa was not a hide a bed.  Called the front desk who advised us that it was a hide a bed and they would send someone up to assist us with it.  We waited another 30 minutes for security to come up and check the sofa. He confirmed that it was not a hide a bed, but stated nothing else was available.  The front desk stated we would have to have one person sleep on the floor for the one night.  The next day,

We stayed at the Staybridge from Feb. 9 -16, 2007 in a 2 bedroom suite. The room was clean, a good size and everything we wanted to come 'home' to.
