The hotel was more on the upscale side as it had nice furniture, is newer, clean and we were very impressed with it.  The staff was friendly and helpful. The pool area was clean, lots of room, and had a tropical feeling to it. The breakfast was good as well (it always had scrambled eggs, a meat - bacon or sausage, waffles, tons of fruit, muffins, baking, cereal, toast, 4 kinds of juices, 3 kinds of coffee) The hotel was close to Disneyland, we took the ART shuttle and it was approx a 7 minute shuttle ride. The hotel is close to the outdoor mall at The Block of Orange, where my daughter and I loved to shop!! We ate a few meals at the

Nice clean hotel with friendly staff. We were happy with our room which was a nice size for the three of us. The room was nice and clean and the complimentary breakfast each morning was very nice. The staff was very helpful and the shuttle was convenient to get to Disney. We would definately stay here again.

Summary Heading: Great Hotel! Family Oriented and cost efficient
Summary: I really liked this hotel. It was affordable, convenient to Disneyland (2-3 blocks) Took us 20 minutes to walk there, or about 3-5 minutes to drive.  The hotel was reasonably clean and well looked after.   The free Breakfast was great, not like others "continental" breakfasts. They served fresh waffles, eggs, toast, cereal, fresh fruit, or anything you want really. We had 3 kids with us and they LOVED it, especially being able to make their own waffles.  The staff were friendly. They didn't ask us over and over again if we need anything and were available if we needed assistance.   I would defanatly recommend this hotel for anyone with kids and a budget. We're very happy with our stay here.

We stayed for 11 nights, tried to move hotels after 3. Staff were not interested in us - never asked how our stay was or how our time was.  Rooms were OK, blanket and couch had rips in them. Dishes were thrown in the dishwasher, and did not always come out clean. Swimming pool is shared with hotel next door! and the dinners they promote on Tue, Wed and Thur are small nibbles. Dont bother with those Location is 10 minute drive to Disneyland - not minutes as they advertise - would be suitable if you have a rental car - otherwise better to stay in town! No restaurants in walking distance, or shops next time I would choose not to stay at Staybridge

we had a 2BR/2BA unit shared with two families.  worked perfectly for us.  staff was very friendly, no problems.  amazed to see that the laundromat room was free!  also loved the breakfast and especially the waffle makers, although the eggs were a little runny.  free internet access was wired only, glad i brought my own wireless router.  plenty of free parking.  only downside was peculiar rules for maid service.  wish they would at least empty trash every day.

Summary Heading: What a great place to come "home" to.................
Summary: We stayed in a 2 bedroom suite for a week. It was myself and my three boys ages 4,5 & 6, as well as my parents.  Let me just say that this was a fantastic place to come back to after a long,tiring day at Disneyland. (We had 3 day parkhoppers) Just like it was a fantastic place to wake up to. The breakfast buffet was great.(a little bit crazy at times but with all of that happy "disney"energy radiating off of people, you don't seem to mind.) The waffle makers are a nice touch. The suite was designed so that we could really spread out and not be stepping on each others toes. The full size kitchen came in handy and was just one of many amenities that made this stay as close to home as possible. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.  Only one tiny annoyance: having to battle 12

Summary Heading: Great family-friendly hotel close to Disneyland
Summary: We stayed 2 nights in a 2BR suite, and it was perfect for our group, which consisted of two families (with 3 kids) and our mother.  We picked this hotel because we could get everyone into one suite, and because of its proximity to Disneyland.  The hotel was clean, friendly, and had everything we needed.  The swimming pool was great to soak in after a long day at Disney, and the kids had fun playing hoops on the basketball court.  The complimentary breakfast was great, with fresh fruit, hot sausages, make-your-own waffles, yogurt, bagels, etc.  Everything you could ever need.  We also discovered that use of their laundry facilities were free -- all you had to do was purchase detergent from their little convenience room for $1 (dryer sheets, 2/pkg, were also $1).  The convenience

We just got back from staying 7 nights at this property.  This is our second time there.  It has a good pool, clean rooms and a breakfast that includes a couple of hot items( I just wish they would get rid of all the plastic plates and utensils).The kids especially like the waffles.  It is too far away from Disneyland/California adventure to walk, but we just hop the bus that comes every 20-25 minutes (buy passes for bus at front desk).  It was no problem getting extra towels if needed, and we did as we are a family of 5. Disneyland is busy in the summer, so we would either go over to Ca. adventure for a break  ( and a glass of wine) or come back to the hotel for swim/nap and then go back in the evening.  It is an absolute must to buy your Disney Park Hopper passes on line

Never stayed at one but was pleasantly surprised.  Stayed with my family: wife, and 3 kids in a 2 room suite.    Good breakfast. Clean rooms. Very quiet.   Comfortable beds. Free Internet. Free Laundry.  Staff was friendly.  Had a small problem with a light which took 2 calls to get maintenance.   Will look for Staybridge in other locations to stay at.

Stayed 6 nights in 2br suite.  Clean, comfy room w/kitchen and three televisions, vcr, dvd player.  Pool area and hot tub were wonderful and tropical.  Staff was fine, breakfast was well stocked and fine.  Close to disneyland and fwy.  Highly recommend this hotel for families.  All the comforts of home.  24 hour coffee in breakfast room was great.

Summary Heading: Loved it, will only consider staybridge in other US destinations
Summary: After careful consideration, cancelled a booking at another L.A. hotel and booked this instead.  How grateful was I that I did that.  Staybridge from the moment you enter the lobby and check in to the time you check out, makes you feel that you are in an above average hotel.  The suites are wonderful.  Our kitchenette was well stocked with all the essentials so that you could prepare a meal if you so wished.  The dishwasher was a god send and the equipment all in tip top condition.  The beds were comfy, the furnishings very good, well above average and the bathroom was more than adequate.  However, I do have a few niggles, it would have been nice if the coffee for the machine had of been supplied each day, and not just the arrival day, in your room.  Buying it from the

My family and I chose this hotel so we could all stay in a 2 room suite. We were planning on visiting Disneyland for my sons 4th birthday. We had a long day at the park and came back to the hotel where our keys never wanted to work for our room. We had to have them reset at least 5 times.   We were getting rteady to leave our room for dinner where we had more family from San Diego meeting us. When we went to open the door from the inside it was jammed. We called down for someone to help us out of our oom and they send the maintenece guy up. 52 MINUTES LATER he finnaly brakes down the door and we get out. I understand mechanical problems happen, but did a manager come to apologize or get us a new room? NO!!!!! We went down ourslves and had to request a new room since the door was

I stayed at the Staybridge Suites Anaheim with my family (husband and 1 year old son) and parents June 24-29th, 2006. We booked a studio for my parents and a 1 bedroom king suite for my husband and I. The rooms were very clean and very nice. When I called asking for adjoining rooms we were told that there are none in the hotel. I asked for rooms near each other and even though they were 96% booked they got us rooms right down the hall from one another. I choose the hotel because we needed a seperate sleeping area for our son who will not go back to sleep if he wakes up and sees us. He slept in the 'living room' area and my husband and I in the bedroom, it worked wonderfully!  Some of the nice features of the hotel were a DVD and VCR in every room, at the front desk they have a

My husband and I travelled from Australia with our 2 daughters aged 6 and 9 years  to visit Disneyland.  We stayed for 4 nights at The Staybridge hotel.  After our long flight it was wonderful to be able to check into such a comfortable hotel.  We were greeted at reception by a friendly staff member but would of appreciated a simple orientation to the layout of the hotel.   We booked a 1 bedroom unit that had a kitchen and sofa bed in the loungeroom.  Room very spacious and lots of storage room for clothes. Room also quiet and private.  Kitchen perfect for travelling with children. Free breakfast every morning is a great bargain.  Lots of different food to chose from. I loved the free laundry which  many other hotels during our travel didn't have or there was no  laundromat

My family of 6 stayed at Staybridge Suites for Memorial Day weekend.  We  had a 2 bed/2 bath suite.  It was perfect!  We requested an early arrival.  Got that without a problem.  The room was HUGE and certainly worth the price.  We had to wait 30 minutes for the shuttle to arrive; there was already people on it so they could only fit some of the people waiting.  The driver made a call and within 10 minutes another shuttle arrived.  As you can imagine Memorial Day Weekend...It was crowded.  The shuttle back to the hotel was waiting when we were ready to leave.  The FREE breakfast was delicious!  Had everything you could want.  Our room was "light" cleaned.  What that means, I don't know because the housekeeping staff did a wonderful job cleaning up.  The swimming pool was

We stayed at the  Staybridge for 8 days.  We were asked to move to a different room after just one night. It ruined one day of our vacation, having to pack up all our things and transfer to a different room. Also, after requesting they change the method of my payment, and gi ving a new credit card, they used the old one anyway.  This caused me much trouble.  The place is very nice,the breakfast was very good,and it is overall very clean.  just not very well organized.  I will not go back, because of the financial mess they caused me.

Summary Heading: very nice, friendly and clean suites. ideal for families
Summary: Stayed here for 5 nights as a stop over to Hawaii. Found the staff very friendly and the 2 bedroom suites lovely and clean apart from the toaster was dirty. Everything else was very noice and believe me, i normall only stay in 5 * + hotels! The breakfast was good with different selection every morning, more then enough to keep the kids happy and of course the free laundrette was a wonderful bonus! The only downful is that it is still quite a distnace from Disney, not as clsoe as travel agent stated. Ideal, comfatble and very clean and friendly place. Ideal for Families

I stayed at the Staybridge April 28-April 30, 2006.  Was a little worried after reading some of the reviews.  But went along with a friend suggestion to stay at the Staybridge.  Was she right, the room was great (306) when we arrived at 9am we were greeted by a friendly front desk.  Once in our room we opened the window and found the fire works show could be seen, big treat for the kids (age 7 & 4).  The best was the fact the room had a bedroom.  I get up at 5am and my family could sleep, while I could read the paper, provided by the hotel, and drink some coffee.  If you travel during the weekend be advised the free breakfast begins at 0730, this did not work for us when going to Disneyland on Saturday, park opened at 0800.  It work wonderfully on Sunday when we went to

I too read the review and felt that I knew what to expect. Unfortunatly I guess I did. While I can't say there was anything really wrong or terrible, I have to say that this hotel was not what it was cracked out to be. At checkin I too was let down to know that my requests were not met. The kitchen was not consitatly stocked. We had 4 plates, 2 cups, 6 forks ect. Our family of 6 raided to breakfast bar to get enough utensils. Our room was very loud due to the fact that the front desk turns on the tv in the main area begining at 6 am. We could hear everything. Every morning of our 6 day stay, I had to call the front desk to request the volume be turned down. Light housekeeping was just that. having 4 children with crumbs and all it would have been nice to have a vaccumm once or

Summary Heading: Not as good as it once was
Summary: This was our third stay at this hotel in as many years. The first two time were great experiances. This last time was for 14 nights. At heckin the lady was on the rude side, did nothing to accomodate our request for a specific floor. Once we got to the room, we discovered the temperature could not be adjusted due to a broken thermostat, we asked to be moved and were told the hotel was full but it could be fixed in the morning. It was never repaired.  The remote for the second TV was missing and after 5 requests for a replacment we gave up - never did get one.  The pluses are the pool is nice and the rooms do have a well equiped kitchen area. I would recommend looking alsewhere.

Summary Heading: We'll definitely return to the Staybridge!
Summary: Our family stayed at the Staybridge Suites in Anaheim for 4 nights the first week in March, 2006.  After reading a few reviews on this site regarding the Staybridge, I felt I was forewarned and kept a lookout for any problems.  I'm pleased to report that in my estimation, it's really a great place to stay. There were 10 of us, using a 2 bedroom and a 1 bedroom suite.  I asked the 8 adults if they had any complaints. None did.  We all thought the breakfast was very good.  The variety great, with eggs, bacon, waffles, English muffins, bagels with cream cheese and jam, 4 cereals, various sweet rolls, fresh fruit, and most any beverage you might want.  Even on Saturday, when there was a long line into the buffet, the food was well stocked and plentiful and the line moved quickly.

My family and I just returned from a 4 night stay at the Staybridge Anaheim.  Although overall it was a decent hotel, they could do a few things to improve.  When we first arrived and got to our room we noticed broken glass on the floor of the kitchen area, and also into the "living" area of the room.  I picked up the larger pieces but was more concerned about the small shards, not wanting anyone to step on them barefooted, especially my young children.  My mother noticed that the armoire in the living area had a broken drawer pull which was just hanging there.  We called down to the front desk to have someone vacuum up the glass.  They were very agreeable and housekeeping came up shortly thereafter.  At that time my mother asked if someone could fix the dresser and she said she

Summary Heading: A great choice for families in Anaheim
Summary: We were really happy with our week at the Staybridge Suites.   When we first checked in we were allocated the wrong type of room (our travel agents fault) but they were very good about giving us a room that would sleep us all.  Our room was very quiet as we asked for one away from the freeway. Breakfast was busy, but pretty good, especially the "make-your-own-waffles".  It was nice to have free access to the internet so we could check our e-mails, and the free laundry facilities were great.  The kitchen facilities were adequate for cooking a basic meal and eveything in the room worked. The sofa bed would not have been much good for adults, but we had no complaint from the kids about it.  The pool and spa were also surprisingly nice. Even though they were shared with the Holiday

Just returned from a one week stay at the Staybride. October 26 - November 2. Check-in was prompt and courteous. A room  deposit of $50.00 cash or credit card was required.  Our rooms, one bedroom suites included two double beds and a pull-out sofa bed. The beds were comforable and room temperature was easily adjusted for personal comfort by adjusting the heat/cooling settings on the wall thermostat. The  kitchen area was equipped with everything needed for meal preperation. We received daily tidy and towel service.   We appreciated the barbecue put on by staff our first evening, after a travel day from Alberta.  Breakfast offerd multi self serve food choices from 6.30-9.30 am.  Included were fruit and yogart, srambled eggs, waffles, four different dry cereals and instant oats;

We have stayed here many times, not because we love it but because the rooms are big and they allow pets.  The breakfast is not great but better than most hotels.  The housekeeping staff kept taking our big towels and did not leave new ones, so we ended up using hand towels for a couple of days until we could get the hotel to give us new ones.  Most of the staff was pretty rude, except the guy at the counter when we checked in at about 1 in the morning.

We booked the 2 bedroom suite. When you walk in, there was the kitchen area with a full size refrigerator, dishwasher, microwave, sink, 2 burners, some pots and pans and there was silverware, dishes and cups/mugs. There is also a table with 4 chairs. Then, within the same area is the family room area with a pull out sofa sleeper, a tv with a dvd and vcr player. Each bedroom had it's own tv as well, but the dvd and vcr player is only in the family room area.  There were 2 bedrooms: 1 had a king size bed with it's own closet, and bathroom. I thought there was plenty on storage. The second bedroom had 2 double beds, a closet and it's own bathroom. You can close off the bedrooms from the family room/kitchen area. The family room/kitchen area is in the center of the room with each

We had an excellent stay at the Staybridge. It was nice to have a suite for the kids when coming home from the Disney parks. The rooms were great, staff all friendly and helpful. We especially appreciated the happy hour from 5-7pm, we could have beer,wine or pop and usually a snack. One night the staff even cooked hot dogs and hamburgers for the guests. We highly recommend.

It's amazing to read the varied reviews here, as we have had two wonderful stays here in the last three years (2003, 2005).  The Breakfast Buffet is very good for the family, with more variety here than at other Staybridge Suites where we have stayed.  Having read reviews prior to booking our second stay here, I was on the alert to the problems people had with getting into their rooms on schedule, trays left in the halls, a rude staff, etc..  Well, we had a terrific stay.  I asked for a room up high. overlooking the pool, hoping for a Disney fireworks view...we had the perfect room for that!  My dealings with the hotel staff were first rate: friendly and responsive people.  Yes, we saw some trays on the floor outside rooms for the length of a day, but I just walked past those!
We loved the pool and the breakfast! We didn't like all the stains on the floor, the blood on the sheets, and the broken sofa bed.

This hotel would be good if you do not care about a view (faces the freeway) and just basically need a place to sleep. Good for families because of the free breakfast and small kitchen. Nothing fancy here, but pretty good for the money. Have a car though, because there really is not much within walking distance.

ok. This is the 2nd time we stayed at this Hotel. We arrived at 12:30pm, and were told the room was not ready.. check in is at 3:00pm. That's ok we say, we will go do Disneyland for a while, and come back later. We showed back up at 7:30 pm and , STILL NOT READY !!!!!  We are a family of 5 boys and my hubby and I..... we were tired and just wanted to get our things in the room and relax. The attitude of the front desk was very "whatever",..... I was livid. Close to 8:00pm, when they FINALLY  got the room done, the front desk asked me for my credit card....... WHY, I asked... the room is PRE-PAID for 9 DAYS !!!!  For "incidentals", he says.HUH??????????  He wanted to put a "hold" of  $ 140.00 on my card. NO, I DON'T THINK SO.......... I'm at Disneyland... and I am gonna hold

Summary Heading: Expect to clean up after yourself
Summary: We just came back from Disneyland and we stayed at the Staybridge Suites.  I was leary about the mix reviews before and this is what we found:  Overall the property was clean and tidy.  The staff was generally helpful.  Here is a general description...Staybridge is a newer building and shares the property with Holiday Inn next door.  The pool/yard is very nice with a hot tub and lots of trees.  It is gated.  There is no shops/restaurants close by as the property is somewhat secluded.  It is nice if you have a car and want less traffic.  It is not walking distance to DL although if you want to walk for a good 45 mins, I'm sure you'll get there.  They do offer a complimentary breakfast each morning until 9:30am and consists of plenty of bread, bagels, muffins, danishes, fresh

We booked  2 rooms at the Staybridge. We arrived at 7:00pm and were told that our room was not  clean, we reminded them that check-in time  was  3:00pm.  It took 30 minutes to  get to our room.  They have  what is  called "light housekeeping" change linens and  towels, on one  day our  room was not  cleaned until 6:00pm.  In one of your  rooms they  did not leave towels, we called and towels were  delived, 4 towels for  6  people?? Dirty linen was  on the  floor in halls  for  hours at a  time.  The breakfast buffet was horrible, food on the  floor, no  clean up, and a basket with a  handwritten note, "Tips".   When I reminded the  desk clerk  there was a  100% satifactory promise, she  stated  she  didnt know  what I was  talking about.  Look  elsewhere.

Summary Heading: Loved the Staybridge Suites Anaheim - Resort Area
Summary: Stayed here 4/7-4/10/2005, all of us (grandparents, daughter, son-in-law, grandchildren ages 8 & 12) loved this hotel. We stayed on the 7th floor and had a two bedroom suite that overlooked the pool. The complimentary breakfast was wonderful, the shuttle to and from Disneyland for $3 per day per adult was well worth the money, the outdoor spa by the pool was my favorite place after a long day at Disney.  The kids also enjoyed the basketball court. We all agree, next visit to Disneyland, we'll stay at Staybridge Suites.   Tripadviser was a great help in our selection of a hotel.

Stayed at this hotel in February in two 1 bedroom suites (10 people total)and had no complaints, everything was very clean the living room and bedroom had their own tvs so everyone could enjoy their own private time. The pool was great! and the hot tub was a great size. There were kids always playing basket ball tennis and stuff to keep them busy.The breakfast in the morning was very filling with waffles, yogurt, fresh fruit, cereal. scrammbledeggs, bacon, juice coffee everything..... it was very satisfying. They even had pre printed directions from the hotel to all major attractions.... very helpful. Would highly recommend this hotel.... keep in mind that this hotel shares the pool with the Holiday Inn located next door so in the summer months it may get a little crowded. The

Summary Heading: Affordable apartment-like hotel perfect for families
Summary: This was our 2nd stay at the Staybridge Suites in just over a year, so we knew what to expect. Last year we made do with a one bedroom suite, but none of our three kids would share a bed so one of them ended up sleeping on the floor.  This year we opted for a two bedroom suite with two bathrooms.  This time we had plenty of space with beds for everyone (and having the two bathrooms was nice).  A very comfortable apartment-like accomodation made for a restful place to recharge our batteries after a busy day at Disneyland.  The three TVs in the suite meant no fighting over what to watch! The kitchen was adequately stocked with dishes, utensils, bowls and pots, etc.  A coffee maker, toaster, microwave, dishwasher, full refrigerator, stove top (no oven), and a table and chairs (for

JUST got back from So. Cal....stayed at two different hotels....this and a Disney Hotel. We stayed at Staybridge for 4 nights. Here is what we found:  Check-in and check-out:  Front desk people weren't terribly impressive...sorry. I produced documents showing our quoted rate, and was still questioned. It wasn't a HUGE thing, but was a little frustrating. Luckily, it was the worst thing that happened.  Room: We had the King/Sleeper Sofa room. Clean and comfortable (with the exception of the incredibly uncomfortable sleeper sofa...as most are). The room was large enough for a few family members to drop by and visit. It was GREAT to have a kitchen....we spent a total of about $50 on food from Sat-Wed morning, for a family of four! Kept the meals easy so it wasn't too much work.

Summary Heading: Wonderful place for a family to stay.
Summary: Our family of 6 and our Neighbors family of 7 stayed at the Staybridge Feb 27 to Mar 5, 2005.  What a wonderful place to stay.  Great hot breakfast every morning with comfortable beds everynight.  We caught the ART shuttle every morning with a 5 minute ride to the Park.  We highly recommend this hotel.

We stayed in this Hotel for four nights on Feb 01, 2005.  Overall the Hotel was clean, had nice grounds and a beautiful pool. Each morning started off with an amazing buffet with hot and cold breakfast items to choose from. There was a lot of variety to chose from, cottage cheese and fresh fruit for those who wanted something light, to waffels and eggs for those who like something a little more hearty.   We were travelling with 3 children under the age of 5 and always felt welcome by staff and patrons of the Hotel. The free laundry was a bonus but you do have to bring your own detergent and dryer sheets (which you can buy at the store in the Hotel). The pool and Hot tub were the nicest part of the Hotel with palm trees surrounding the area and lots of sun chairs and towels

Common areas were not always clean--food trays stayed in the halls for days. Front desk staff often unfriendly, unresponsive. The restaurant at the adjoining Holiday Inn was horrible, both the food and the service. Look elsewhere.

My family and I checked into the Staybridge on a Wednesday afternoon.  When we arrived at the hotel after travelling for 8 hours we were informed that the restaurant wasn't open.  But to our delight there was a yummy Del Taco around the corner, past the freeway off ramp and mobile home park.   That night when we returned from Disneyland we tried the restaurant.  If you like a lot of fat and grease you are in for a real treat.  The hotel itself is ok.  The staff are polite and the rooms are clean.  But, if you are not a person who eats at fast food restaurants or if you enjoy things like fruits and vegetables then don't stay there.  Needless to say we moved to another hotel the next day.

We were very pleased with this hotel.  The rooms were clean and it was great to have a suite after a long day at Disneyland.  The only thing that I would rate below average would be the sofa bed in the living area.  It was not full sized, and only usable by small children.  The breakfast was good but not fancy.  There was always plenty of food.  And choices to please anyone.  A good choice and we certainly would return on our next trip.  Or recommend to anyone  (especially families).

My family stayed at the Staybidge from Nov 1 - Nov 5.   I never got the Internet connection on my laptop to work with the wall jack.  Even after complaing to the front desk several times, it didn't work.  However, on my last day I connected the PC to the box on top of the TV and voila..... Too little too late though..  The breakfasts were great... The hot food varied each day along with the meat. (french toast/pancakes/eggs and bacon/sausage links).  There was always bread/bagels/english muffins to toast, and muffins/danishes/donuts.  There was also instant oatmeal packets, and several different Kellogs Cereals to choose from along with apples and bananas.  They had peanut butter and a selection of jellies to put on the toast.  The property was well kept, and the kitchen in the

Stayed here for 5 nights. The hotel is a 3 star, at best. I booked here because they have 2 BR kitchen suites that are very convenient to have when you are travelling with kids. The rooms are also reasonably priced for the space. Negatives: Carpet has several stains in room and in hallways - needs a good cleaning. Our bathtub had black markings all over, seems to be permanent. The housekeeping during the week is called "light". They make the bed, change towels and take out garbage. No clean sheets all week and you clean your own kitchen area / dishwasher. We wanted to check-in at 1pm, but they wouldn't allow anyone to checkin until after 3pm. I asked if this was because our room wasn't clean yet and they said that there wasn't any room assigned yet! Just policy to have everyone

Our family of 6,  stayed 7 nights and our Hotel room and service was great.  Wonderful breakfast with many choices, even at the last minute.  Kids loved the pool and basketball court.  The kitchen facility made the trip so nice and easy.  Rooms were always clean after our long day at the parks. This Hotel has so many extras.  Great  room setup and great Hotel.  Highly recommended and will definately stay again.

I can't even tell you how great the service was, we stayed 2 nights sept 4th thru the 6th, and we got there real early, like at 9am so they gave us our room, it was real clean and spacious and the breakfast was great we had eggs and sausage with toast and fruit, juice or milk, and then they had all kinds of donuts and different cereals, we stayed in the residence inn and marriott's before, but i think that styabridge suites beats them by service, I would recommend this place to anyone, and for sure were staying here next time.

Summary Heading: Stop Looking! This is the best deal!
Summary: Stop Looking for a Hotel! This is by far the best value, and a great facility. I researched our "Out West Trip" for 3 months. I checked out almost every hotel in a 5 block radius of Disneyland, and this is as GREAT as it gets.We stayed here 2 nites at the start of our trip,(went to AZ and NV 5 days) and then 2 days at end.  Staff was friendly and helpful, rooms are clean and large {2 bdrm} and breakfast plentiful (eggs, bacon/sausage/can.bacon{meat changes} cereals, fresh fruits,yogurt, bagel,pastry,toast,cottage cheese, etc. Pool and Jacuzzi are nice if you have time and free laundry a great benefit. The I-5 runs in front of the hotel (but no noise thankfully) and makes navigating easy. 3rd staybridge we've stayed in and loved every one.(Disney Tip from a WDW addict) Buy

We were there for 4 nights in June 2004.  The 2 bedroom suites are really nice and comfortable!  No problems with plumbing or housekeeping. In fact, the housekeeping was excellent (and cleanliness is really important to me - bathrooms were always clean and nice...good/thick towels,  soft beige/gold color theme.  Liked the sink and vanity area right outside of the tub/shower & toilet area, and adjacent the bedroom.  The 2 private bedrooms with their own bathrooms are seperated by a small living room for extra space (nice to have when you're with kids), and a great kitchen/dining area for eating in!  Von's grocery store is around the block and up the road...not far, real convenient.  Laundry room was busy with only four washers and four dryers-but it's free.  Nice to have free
We stayed at Staybridge for 4 nights at the end of May 2004 it was GREAT.........The food was good and the staff was very nice.......

Extended family from different states rented three 2-bedroom suites May 13-18, 2004 at the Staybridge Suites in Anaheim.  Earlier negative reviews almost made us move our reservations.  We are very glad we didn't.  We found the suites to be a wonderful family gathering spot.    The facilities were very well kept, the rooms exceeded expectations.  One bedroom contained a king-size bed with a full bathroom and TV.  The other bedroom contained two full-size beds with a full bathroom and TV.  The living area had a full-size hideabed with a TV.  The kitchen had a full-size refrigerator, microwave, stove top and dishwasher with all the dishes, pots and pans.  We found staff to be friendly and had absolutely no problems and there were 16 of us including 2 small babies.  The cribs were

I really enjoyed the rooms and locations of this hotel...it is great for families...but the service and attitude of the staff in this hotel is horrible.  We checked in over christmas holiday with our extended family.  We had requested months early that the rooms be joined or on the same floor.  When we checked in we had our rooms spread out the hotel on many different floors...not one of us were on the same floor.  The staff offered no apology...just said they are busy.  When we had billing problems...all that was offered was that we could leave the hotel if we are not happy.  I have never run into a staff like this hotel has...with such an uncaring staff.

We've stayed at the Staybridge twice, (once in June '02 and again for Christmas '03). We absolutely love the place. It is SO family oriented and the staff is very friendly and helpful. We are going down to Disneyland again this August and wouldn't consider staying anywhere else.

We just spent a week at the Staybridge and couldn't find a single thing to complain about! The hotel staff were always friendly and helpful. The breakfasts were tasty, hot and plentiful. The staff were always refilling things as soon as they ran out. The free breakfasts, dinner on Wednesdays and free laundry saved us a ton of money. We had a two bedroom suite and there was plenty of room for the six of us. You can ride the bus to the grocery or Target to stock up on stuff. The kitchen was completely adequate to cook full meals. I would definately stay there again, and wouldn't hesitate to recommend it to family and friends!

We just returned from Anaheim April 19. The Staybridge is a great place for families. We went with 3 teenagers. Got a one bedroom suite with 2 double beds and a fold-out couch. Had lots of room. Full kitchen with hotplate (no oven). Fridge and dishwasher worked well. They supplied detergent. We shopped for food at Von's which is a regular grocery store about a $7 cab ride away. Ate breakfast at the buffet. Wasn't absolutely fantastic, but perfectly adequate. Fair bit of variety. Kids can eat at separate times. Took lunches to Disneyland in pack. Food very expensive (and crappy) in Disneyland/California/Universal Studios.  Fair amount of storage space in room. Bathroom access through bedroom and good, but sink outside bathroom. Lots of seating room.  Large, perfect temperature

Summary Heading: We would gladly stay there again
Summary: The Staybridge Suites came as part of our travel package -- our agent said they'd never had a complaint. I felt good about it until I read some of the Trip Advisor reviews. Then I got a little nervous because they were pretty mixed. Yet, I'm happy to report my concerns were unfounded. We were pleasantly surprised. We can't think of a single negative thing to say. We had a great time and would gladly go there again. Our room was very clean, comfortable, and attractively decorated. It was awesome to get up in the morning and have breakfast right there and ready, (a great bonus with young children). I admit the food wasn't 5 star quality, but there was a ton of it and it tasted fine. It saved us time and money.

Summary Heading: A very nice place to stay.
Summary: We stayed a week at the Staybridge Suites and found it to be a very nice place to stay,yes the rooms are small but everything else was very good.

Summary Heading: Worst Anaheim hotel I've stayed in
Summary: Absolutely the worst hotel stay I've had in the area. Front desk staff was curt and rude. Manager insisted that the relative who was dropping us off at the hotel was actually stayin with us and we were lying about the number of people in the room. Should have left then. Room was okay.  Sofabed not only wasn't comfy, it wasn't clean. The blanket had crusty stuff that looked like vomit on it. Complained to the front desk, after almost an hour the dropped off a new blanket but didn't take the old one away, and didn't change the sheets on the sofabed which obviously weren't changed from the last guests. There was no cold water in the room - only hot steamy water from the cold water tap. Breakfast was barely edible - couldn't tell the difference between the mini pancakes and the mini

My husband and I took our three children on a "trip of a lifetime". We saved up for 4 years to go to Disneyland for two weeks. We went thru every brochure on hotels you can find and decided to stay at this one. WHAT A HORRIBLE MISTAKE! This was the worst hotel I've ever stayed at. The hotel itself wasn't so bad but the service was incredibley awful that after a week we moved to another hotel. We wasted a full day of our trip to move...so that should tell you something! We never had enough towels and were told they didn't have enough staff to bring us more. When we first came we were told our room wasn't ready (even though I called about 4 times before leaving to say we'd need early check-in) and they didn't offer to put our luggage anywhere for us nor did they offer to help

I personally thought this was a great hotel. The pool was great for the kids and the hot tub was great for the adults. The pool was heated to the perfect temperature. The rooms were spacious and very clean. The pull out bed from the sofa is not intended for adults but works great for the kids. The breakfasts are not 4 star material but still I did not pay for a 4 star breakfast. We arrived a day earlier than planned, and the management was very accomadating in getting us a room. All my requests were met quickly and efficiently from the front desk. It was great having the washing machines available to use during the day near the pool. Great place to stay!!

We read all the reveiws of Staybridge Suites before our trip and are sad to say that we agreed with all of them. We loved the full kitchen and it was very helpful when dealing with small children, however the refrigerator leaked several cups of water all over our food every day.  The TV in the main room was not working well. We reported this to the fornt desk but no one ever came to fix it. The fold away sofa in the living area was so horrible I was embarassed that my brother who came for a few days had to sleep on it. He ended up sleeping on the floor with some blankets. The 24 hour conveince store is little more than a place to buy some candy. I called in advance to ask them about food and the front desk staff compared the convience store to a 7-11- this is definately not

Summary Heading: This hotel is the best in the Disneyland Area!
Summary: We stayed st the Staybrdige suites in August 2003 and had a wonderful experience. The 2 bedroom suite was clean, comfortable and the morning breakfasts were more than just "continental". Every day was different and the staff was friendly and helpful. Free washer and dryer usage was a big plus, but there were a lot of people using it so get up early or do it late. The amenities were nice - cabana bar, hot tub swimming pool, gas grill for use by hotel guests for free, basketball court (small) - and hopsitality nights on Tues/Wed/Thur. I will stay again and again. Spent lots of nights in not so nice places - this is a great hotel.

Summary Heading: Okay if you like a $300 breakfast
Summary: In 2002, we went to Anaheim twice, once in April and once in September. The first trip, we stayed at the STBS, and the second at the West Coast Anaheim. I thought the Staybridge Suites was a beautiful hotel, the pool was amazing, our room (a two bedroom suite) was spacious and the full kitchen was a definite bonus. As well, the breakfast served each morning was a treat, we could eat before we caught the tram to Disneyland. However: The service, literally was so terrible, I would not even think of setting foot in that hotel. At check in, we were told our room was not ready. That's not a problem, but that's all we were told. The agent never offered us a time it would be available, and she never told us where we could sit and wait. We had to take our own luggage to the bell storage

We stayed at  Staybridge Sept. 2002. The rooms are spacious. The separate bedroom for parents gave us just the right amount of privacy. The pool area was beautiful, I just wish it was heated. The free breakfast was delicious and different every day. The room had a fridge and microwave, making meals convienent. We can't wait to stay here again!

we stayed at staybridge 2/03, the room was small, but had all the ammenities as well as a full kitchen including dishwasher, silverware, and a full size microwave and refrigerator. the staff was very friendly, and the enitre hotel was very clean, and kept up. The pool is large, there is a small basketball court , and fitness room.  the room was quiet enough to other guests, and outside traffic.  the negatives were that the front door locks are so low that my 2 1/2 year old was able to open the door without any problem, therefore our sleep was always interrupted to make sure he was sleeping, and not near the door.  the worst part of the hotel is the sleeping arrangements, there is a very small, hard queen bed(smallest queen Ive ever seen), and a very hard queen sofa sleeper to
